Hebrew: וַיִּפְשַׁ֤ע מוֹאָב֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַחֲרֵ֖י מ֥וֹת אַחְאָֽב׃
Translated: After Ahab’s death, Moab rebelled against Israel.
Transliteration: vayifesha mvoav veyisherael acharey mvot acheav

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֨ל אֲחַזְיָ֜ה בְּעַ֣ד הַשְּׂבָכָ֗ה בַּעֲלִיָּת֛וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּשֹׁמְר֖וֹן וַיָּ֑חַל וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מַלְאָכִ֗ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ לְכ֣וּ דִרְשׁ֗וּ בְּבַ֤עַל זְבוּב֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י עֶקְר֔וֹן אִם־אֶחְיֶ֖ה מֵחֳלִ֥י זֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahaziah fell through the lattice in his upper chamber at Samaria and was injured. So he sent messengers, whom he instructed: “Go inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, whether I shall recover from this injury.”
Transliteration: vayifol achazeyah vead hashevakhah vaaliyatvo asher veshomervon vayachal vayishelach maleakhiym vayomer alehem lekhu direshu vevaal zevuv elohey ekervon im-echeyeh mecholiy zeh {s}

Hebrew: וּמַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה דִּבֶּר֙ אֶל־אֵלִיָּ֣ה הַתִּשְׁבִּ֔י ק֣וּם עֲלֵ֔ה לִקְרַ֖את מַלְאֲכֵ֣י מֶֽלֶךְ־שֹׁמְר֑וֹן וְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם הֲֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־אֱלֹהִים֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתֶּם֙ הֹֽלְכִ֔ים לִדְרֹ֕שׁ בְּבַ֥עַל זְב֖וּב אֱלֹהֵ֥י עֶקְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: But an angel of G<small>OD</small> said to Elijah the Tishbite, “Go and confront the messengers of the king of Samaria and say to them, ‘Is there no God in Israel that you go to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron?
Transliteration: umaleakhe yehovah diver el-eliyah hatisheviy kum aleh likerat maleakhey melekhe-shomervon vedaver alehem hamiveliy eyn-Elohim veyisherael atem holekhiym liderosh vevaal zevuv elohey ekervon

Hebrew: וְלָכֵן֙ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הַמִּטָּ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־עָלִ֥יתָ שָּׁ֛ם לֹא־תֵרֵ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נָּה כִּ֣י מ֣וֹת תָּמ֑וּת וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אֵלִיָּֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: You shall not rise from the bed you are lying on, but you shall die.’” And Elijah went.
Transliteration: velakhen khoh-amar yehovah hamitah asher-aliyta sham lo-tered mimenah khiy mvot tamut vayelekhe eliyah

Hebrew: וַיָּשׁ֥וּבוּ הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים אֵלָ֑יו וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מַה־זֶּ֥ה שַׁבְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: The messengers returned to Ahaziah; and he asked, “Why have you come back?”
Transliteration: vayashuvu hamaleakhiym elayv vayomer aleyhem mah-zeh shavetem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֜יו אִ֣ישׁ ׀ עָלָ֣ה לִקְרָאתֵ֗נוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֵ֘ינוּ֮ לְכ֣וּ שׁ֘וּבוּ֮ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֣ח אֶתְכֶם֒ וְדִבַּרְתֶּ֣ם אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־אֱלֹהִים֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתָּ֣ה שֹׁלֵ֔חַ לִדְרֹ֕שׁ בְּבַ֥עַל זְב֖וּב אֱלֹהֵ֣י עֶקְר֑וֹן לָ֠כֵ֠ן הַמִּטָּ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־עָלִ֥יתָ שָּׁ֛ם לֹא־תֵרֵ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נָּה כִּי־מ֥וֹת תָּמֽוּת׃
Translated: They answered him, “A man came toward us and said to us, ‘Go back to the king who sent you, and say to him: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>: Is there no God in Israel that you must send to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? Assuredly, you shall not rise from the bed you are lying on, but shall die.’”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv iysh alah likeratenu vayomer eleynu lekhu shuvu el-hamelekhe asher-shalach etekhem vedivaretem elayv khoh amar yehovah hamiveliy eyn-Elohim veyisherael atah sholecha liderosh vevaal zevuv elohey ekervon lakhen hamitah asher-aliyta sham lo-tered mimenah khiy-mvot tamut

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם מֶ֚ה מִשְׁפַּ֣ט הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָלָ֖ה לִקְרַאתְכֶ֑ם וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: “What sort of man was it,” he asked them, “who came toward you and said these things to you?”
Transliteration: vayedaver alehem meh mishefat haiysh asher alah likeratekhem vayedaver aleykhem et-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו אִ֚ישׁ בַּ֣עַל שֵׂעָ֔ר וְאֵז֥וֹר ע֖וֹר אָז֣וּר בְּמׇתְנָ֑יו וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֵלִיָּ֥ה הַתִּשְׁבִּ֖י הֽוּא׃
Translated: “A hairy man,” they replied, “with a leather belt tied around his waist.” “That’s Elijah the Tishbite!” he said.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv iysh vaal shear veezvor vor azur vemׇtenayv vayomar eliyah hatisheviy hu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֵלָ֛יו שַׂר־חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑יו וַיַּ֣עַל אֵלָ֗יו וְהִנֵּה֙ יֹשֵׁב֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֔ר וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו אִ֚ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דִּבֶּ֖ר רֵֽדָה׃
Translated: Then he sent to him a captain of fifty with his fifty men. He climbed up to him, and found him sitting at the top of a hill. “Agent of God,” he said to him, “by order of the king, come down!”
Transliteration: vayishelach elayv shar-chamishiym vachamishayv vayaal elayv vehineh yoshev al-rosh hahar vayedaver elayv iysh haElohim hamelekhe diver redah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנֶ֣ה אֵלִיָּ֗הוּ וַיְדַבֵּר֮ אֶל־שַׂ֣ר הַחֲמִשִּׁים֒ וְאִם־אִ֤ישׁ אֱלֹהִים֙ אָ֔נִי תֵּ֤רֶד אֵשׁ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְתֹאכַ֥ל אֹתְךָ֖ וְאֶת־חֲמִשֶּׁ֑יךָ וַתֵּ֤רֶד אֵשׁ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַתֹּ֥אכַל אֹת֖וֹ וְאֶת־חֲמִשָּֽׁיו׃
Translated: Elijah replied to the captain of the fifty, “If I am an agent of God, let fire come down from heaven and consume you with your fifty men!” And fire came down from heaven and consumed him and his fifty men.
Transliteration: vayaaneh eliyahu vayedaver el-shar hachamishiym veim-iysh Elohim aniy tered esh min-hashamayiim vetokhal otekha veet-chamisheykha vatered esh min-hashamayiim vatokhal otvo veet-chamishayv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜שׇׁב וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֵלָ֛יו שַׂר־חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַחֵ֖ר וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑יו וַיַּ֙עַן֙ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו אִ֚ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מְהֵרָ֥ה רֵֽדָה׃
Translated: The king then sent to him another captain with his fifty men; and he addressed him as follows: “Agent of God, by order of the king, come down at once!”
Transliteration: vayashׇv vayishelach elayv shar-chamishiym acher vachamishayv vayaan vayedaver elayv iysh haElohim khoh-amar hamelekhe meherah redah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן אֵלִיָּה֮ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶם֒ אִם־אִ֤ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים֙ אָ֔נִי תֵּ֤רֶד אֵשׁ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְתֹאכַ֥ל אֹתְךָ֖ וְאֶת־חֲמִשֶּׁ֑יךָ וַתֵּ֤רֶד אֵשׁ־אֱלֹהִים֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַתֹּ֥אכַל אֹת֖וֹ וְאֶת־חֲמִשָּֽׁיו׃
Translated: But Elijah answered him, “If I am an agent of God, let fire come down from heaven and consume you with your fifty men!” And fire of God came down from heaven and consumed him and his fifty men.
Transliteration: vayaan eliyah vayedaver aleyhem im-iysh haElohim aniy tered esh min-hashamayiim vetokhal otekha veet-chamisheykha vatered esh-Elohim min-hashamayiim vatokhal otvo veet-chamishayv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֗שׇׁב וַיִּשְׁלַ֛ח שַׂר־חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שְׁלִשִׁ֖ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑יו וַיַּ֡עַל וַיָּבֹא֩ שַׂר־הַחֲמִשִּׁ֨ים הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י וַיִּכְרַ֥ע עַל־בִּרְכָּ֣יו ׀ לְנֶ֣גֶד אֵלִיָּ֗הוּ וַיִּתְחַנֵּ֤ן אֵלָיו֙ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו אִ֚ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים תִּיקַר־נָ֣א נַפְשִׁ֗י וְנֶ֨פֶשׁ עֲבָדֶ֥יךָֽ אֵ֛לֶּה חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then he sent a third captain of fifty with his fifty men. The third captain of fifty climbed to the top, knelt before Elijah, and implored him, saying, “Oh, agent of God, please have regard for my life and the lives of these fifty servants of yours!
Transliteration: vayashׇv vayishelach shar-chamishiym shelishiym vachamishayv vayaal vayavo shar-hachamishiym hasheliyshiy vayikhera al-virekhayv leneged eliyahu vayitechanen elayv vayedaver elayv iysh haElohim tiykar-na nafeshiy venefesh avadeykha eleh chamishiym veeyneykha

Hebrew: הִ֠נֵּ֠ה יָ֤רְדָה אֵשׁ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַ֠תֹּ֠אכַל אֶת־שְׁנֵ֞י שָׂרֵ֧י הַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְאֶת־חֲמִשֵּׁיהֶ֑ם וְעַתָּ֕ה תִּיקַ֥ר נַפְשִׁ֖י בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Already fire has come from heaven and consumed the first two captains of fifty and their men; I beg you, have regard for my life!”
Transliteration: hineh yaredah esh min-hashamayiim vatokhal et-sheney sharey hachamishiym harishoniym veet-chamisheyhem veatah tiykar nafeshiy veeyneykha {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֞ר מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ רֵ֣ד אוֹת֔וֹ אַל־תִּירָ֖א מִפָּנָ֑יו וַיָּ֛קׇם וַיֵּ֥רֶד אוֹת֖וֹ אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then the angel of G<small>OD</small> said to Elijah, “Go down with him, do not be afraid of him.” So he rose and went down with him to the king.
Transliteration: vayedaver maleakhe yehovah el-eliyahu red votvo al-tiyra mifanayv vayakׇm vayered votvo el-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֵלָ֜יו כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה יַ֜עַן אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֣חְתָּ מַלְאָכִים֮ לִדְרֹשׁ֮ בְּבַ֣עַל זְבוּב֮ אֱלֹהֵ֣י עֶקְרוֹן֒ הֲֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־אֱלֹהִים֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִדְרֹ֖שׁ בִּדְבָר֑וֹ לָ֠כֵ֠ן הַמִּטָּ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־עָלִ֥יתָ שָּׁ֛ם לֹא־תֵרֵ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נָּה כִּי־מ֥וֹת תָּמֽוּת׃
Translated: He said to him, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Because you sent messengers to inquire of Baal-zebub the god of Ekron—as if there were no God in Israel whose word you could seek—assuredly, you shall not rise from the bed that you are lying on; but you shall die.”
Transliteration: vayedaver elayv khoh-amar yehovah yaan asher-shalacheta maleakhiym liderosh vevaal zevuv elohey ekervon hamiveliy eyn-Elohim veyisherael liderosh videvarvo lakhen hamitah asher-aliyta sham lo-tered mimenah khiy-mvot tamut

Hebrew:
וַיָּ֜מׇת כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֣ר אֵלִיָּ֗הוּ וַיִּמְלֹ֤ךְ יְהוֹרָם֙ תַּחְתָּ֔יו {פ}
בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שְׁתַּ֔יִם לִיהוֹרָ֥ם בֶּן־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה כִּ֛י לֹא־הָ֥יָה ל֖וֹ בֵּֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: And [Ahaziah] died, according to the word of G<small>OD</small> that Elijah had spoken. Jehoram succeeded him as king, in the second year of King Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat of Judah, for he had no son.
Transliteration:
vayamׇt khidevar yehovah asher-diver eliyahu vayimelokhe yehvoram tachetayv {f}
vishenat shetayiim liyhvoram ven-yehvoshafat melekhe yehudah khiy lo-hayah lvo ven {s}

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י אֲחַזְיָ֖הוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣מָּה כְתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The other events of Ahaziah’s reign [and] his actions are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey achazeyahu asher ashah halvo-hemah khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּהַעֲל֤וֹת יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ בַּֽסְעָרָ֖ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ אֵלִיָּ֛הוּ וֶאֱלִישָׁ֖ע מִן־הַגִּלְגָּֽל׃
Translated: When G<small>OD</small> was about to take Elijah up to heaven in a whirlwind, Elijah and Elisha had set out from Gilgal.
Transliteration: vayehiy vehaalvot yehovah et-eliyahu vasearah hashamayiim vayelekhe eliyahu veeliysha min-hagilegal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אֵלִיָּ֨הוּ אֶל־אֱלִישָׁ֜ע שֵֽׁב־נָ֣א פֹ֗ה כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ שְׁלָחַ֣נִי עַד־בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֔ע חַי־יְהֹוָ֥ה וְחֵֽי־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ אִם־אֶעֶזְבֶ֑ךָּ וַיֵּרְד֖וּ בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: Elijah said to Elisha, “Stay here, for G<small>OD</small> has sent me on to Bethel.” “As G<small>OD</small> lives and as you live,” said Elisha, “I will not leave you.” So they went down to Bethel.
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu el-eliysha shev-na foh khiy yehovah shelachaniy ad-veyt-el vayomer eliysha chay-yehovah vechey-nafeshekha im-eezevekha vayeredu veyt-el

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֨וּ בְנֵי־הַנְּבִיאִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־בֵּֽית־אֵל֮ אֶל־אֱלִישָׁע֒ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו הֲיָדַ֕עְתָּ כִּ֣י הַיּ֗וֹם יְהֹוָ֛ה לֹקֵ֥חַ אֶת־אֲדֹנֶ֖יךָ מֵעַ֣ל רֹאשֶׁ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֛אמֶר גַּם־אֲנִ֥י יָדַ֖עְתִּי הֶחֱשֽׁוּ׃
Translated: Disciples of the prophets at Bethel came out to Elisha and said to him, “Do you know that G<small>OD</small> will take your master away from you today?” He replied, “I know it, too; be silent.”
Transliteration: vayetseu veney-haneviyiym asher-veyt-el el-eliysha vayomeru elayv hayadaeta khiy hayyvom yehovah lokecha et-adoneykha meal roshekha vayomer gam-aniy yadaetiy hecheshu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ל֨וֹ אֵלִיָּ֜הוּ אֱלִישָׁ֣ע ׀ שֵֽׁב־נָ֣א פֹ֗ה כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ שְׁלָחַ֣נִי יְרִיח֔וֹ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר חַי־יְהֹוָ֥ה וְחֵֽי־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ אִם־אֶעֶזְבֶ֑ךָּ וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ יְרִיחֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then Elijah said to him, “Elisha, stay here, for G<small>OD</small> has sent me on to Jericho.” “As G<small>OD</small> lives and as you live,” said Elisha, “I will not leave you.” So they went on to Jericho.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo eliyahu eliysha shev-na foh khiy yehovah shelachaniy yeriychvo vayomer chay-yehovah vechey-nafeshekha im-eezevekha vayavou yeriychvo

Hebrew: וַיִּגְּשׁ֨וּ בְנֵי־הַנְּבִיאִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־בִּֽירִיחוֹ֮ אֶל־אֱלִישָׁע֒ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו הֲיָדַ֕עְתָּ כִּ֣י הַיּ֗וֹם יְהֹוָ֛ה לֹקֵ֥חַ אֶת־אֲדֹנֶ֖יךָ מֵעַ֣ל רֹאשֶׁ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֛אמֶר גַּם־אֲנִ֥י יָדַ֖עְתִּי הֶחֱשֽׁוּ׃
Translated: The disciples of the prophets who were at Jericho came over to Elisha and said to him, “Do you know that G<small>OD</small> will take your master away from you today?” He replied, “I know it, too; be silent.”
Transliteration: vayigeshu veney-haneviyiym asher-viyriychvo el-eliysha vayomeru elayv hayadaeta khiy hayyvom yehovah lokecha et-adoneykha meal roshekha vayomer gam-aniy yadaetiy hecheshu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ל֨וֹ אֵלִיָּ֜הוּ שֵֽׁב־נָ֣א פֹ֗ה כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ שְׁלָחַ֣נִי הַיַּרְדֵּ֔נָה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר חַי־יְהֹוָ֥ה וְחֵֽי־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ אִם־אֶעֶזְבֶ֑ךָּ וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Elijah said to him, “Stay here, for G<small>OD</small> has sent me on to the Jordan.” “As G<small>OD</small> lives and as you live, I will not leave you,” he said, and the two of them went on.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo eliyahu shev-na foh khiy yehovah shelachaniy hayaredenah vayomer chay-yehovah vechey-nafeshekha im-eezevekha vayelekhu sheneyhem

Hebrew: וַחֲמִשִּׁ֨ים אִ֜ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֤י הַנְּבִיאִים֙ הָֽלְכ֔וּ וַיַּעַמְד֥וּ מִנֶּ֖גֶד מֵרָח֑וֹק וּשְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם עָמְד֥וּ עַל־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Fifty of the disciples of the prophets followed and stood by at a distance as the two of them stopped at the Jordan.
Transliteration: vachamishiym iysh miveney haneviyiym halekhu vayaamedu mineged merachvok usheneyhem amedu al-hayareden

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ אֵלִיָּ֨הוּ אֶת־אַדַּרְתּ֤וֹ וַיִּגְלֹם֙ וַיַּכֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַמַּ֔יִם וַיֵּחָצ֖וּ הֵ֣נָּה וָהֵ֑נָּה וַיַּעַבְר֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם בֶּחָרָבָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Elijah took his mantle and, rolling it up, he struck the water; it divided to the right and left, so that the two of them crossed over on dry land.
Transliteration: vayikach eliyahu et-adaretvo vayigelom vayakheh et-hamayiim vayechatsu henah vahenah vayaaveru sheneyhem vecharavah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כְעׇבְרָ֗ם וְאֵ֨לִיָּ֜הוּ אָמַ֤ר אֶל־אֱלִישָׁע֙ שְׁאַל֙ מָ֣ה אֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּ֔ךְ בְּטֶ֖רֶם אֶלָּקַ֣ח מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֔ע וִ֥יהִי נָ֛א פִּֽי־שְׁנַ֥יִם בְּרוּחֲךָ֖ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: As they were crossing, Elijah said to Elisha, “Tell me, what can I do for you before I am taken from you?” Elisha answered, “Let a double portion of your spirit pass on to me.”
Transliteration: vayehiy kheׇveram veeliyahu amar el-eliysha sheal mah eesheh-lakhe veterem elakach meimakhe vayomer eliysha viyhiy na fiy-shenayiim veruchakha elay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִקְשִׁ֣יתָ לִשְׁא֑וֹל אִם־תִּרְאֶ֨ה אֹתִ֜י לֻקָּ֤ח מֵֽאִתָּךְ֙ יְהִי־לְךָ֣ כֵ֔ן וְאִם־אַ֖יִן לֹ֥א יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: “You have asked a difficult thing,” he said. “If you see me as I am being taken from you, this will be granted to you; if not, it will not.”
Transliteration: vayomer hikeshiyta lishevol im-tireeh otiy lukach meitakhe yehiy-lekha khen veim-ayiin lo yiheyeh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י הֵ֣מָּה הֹלְכִ֤ים הָלוֹךְ֙ וְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהִנֵּ֤ה רֶֽכֶב־אֵשׁ֙ וְס֣וּסֵי אֵ֔שׁ וַיַּפְרִ֖דוּ בֵּ֣ין שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּ֙עַל֙ אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ בַּֽסְעָרָ֖ה הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: As they kept on walking and talking, a fiery chariot with fiery horses suddenly appeared and separated one from the other; and Elijah went up to heaven in a whirlwind.
Transliteration: vayehiy hemah holekhiym halvokhe vedaver vehineh rekhev-esh vesusey esh vayaferidu veyn sheneyhem vayaal eliyahu vasearah hashamayiim

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁ֣ע רֹאֶ֗ה וְה֤וּא מְצַעֵק֙ אָבִ֣י ׀ אָבִ֗י רֶ֤כֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וּפָ֣רָשָׁ֔יו וְלֹ֥א רָאָ֖הוּ ע֑וֹד וַֽיַּחֲזֵק֙ בִּבְגָדָ֔יו וַיִּקְרָעֵ֖ם לִשְׁנַ֥יִם קְרָעִֽים׃
Translated: Elisha saw it, and he cried out, “Oh, father, father! Israel’s chariots and riders!” When he could no longer see him, he grasped his garments and rent them in two.
Transliteration: veeliysha roeh vehu metsaek aviy aviy rekhev yisherael ufarashayv velo raahu vod vayachazek vivegadayv vayikeraem lishenayiim keraiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙רֶם֙ אֶת־אַדֶּ֣רֶת אֵלִיָּ֔הוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָפְלָ֖ה מֵעָלָ֑יו וַיָּ֥שׇׁב וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: He picked up Elijah’s mantle, which had dropped from him; and he went back and stood on the bank of the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayarem et-aderet eliyahu asher nafelah mealayv vayashׇv vayaamod al-shefat hayareden

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ אֶת־אַדֶּ֨רֶת אֵלִיָּ֜הוּ אֲשֶׁר־נָפְלָ֤ה מֵֽעָלָיו֙ וַיַּכֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַמַּ֔יִם וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אַיֵּ֕ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֵלִיָּ֑הוּ אַף־ה֣וּא ׀ וַיַּכֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַמַּ֗יִם וַיֵּֽחָצוּ֙ הֵ֣נָּה וָהֵ֔נָּה וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ר אֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: Taking the mantle that had dropped from Elijah, he struck the water and said, “Where is the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Elijah?” As he too struck the water, it parted to the right and to the left, and Elisha crossed over.
Transliteration: vayikach et-aderet eliyahu asher-nafelah mealayv vayakheh et-hamayiim vayomar ayeh yehovah elohey eliyahu af-hu vayakheh et-hamayiim vayechatsu henah vahenah vayaavor eliysha

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאֻ֨הוּ בְנֵי־הַנְּבִיאִ֤ים אֲשֶׁר־בִּֽירִיחוֹ֙ מִנֶּ֔גֶד וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ נָ֛חָה ר֥וּחַ אֵלִיָּ֖הוּ עַל־אֱלִישָׁ֑ע וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ לִקְרָאת֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֖וֹ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: When the disciples of the prophets at Jericho saw him from a distance, they exclaimed, “The spirit of Elijah has settled on Elisha!” And they went to meet him and bowed low before him to the ground.
Transliteration: vayireuhu veney-haneviyiym asher-viyriychvo mineged vayomeru nachah rucha eliyahu al-eliysha vayavou likeratvo vayishetachavu-lvo aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֡יו הִנֵּה־נָ֣א יֵֽשׁ־אֶת־עֲבָדֶ֩יךָ֩ חֲמִשִּׁ֨ים אֲנָשִׁ֜ים בְּנֵי־חַ֗יִל יֵ֣לְכוּ נָא֮ וִיבַקְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־אֲדֹנֶ֒יךָ֒ פֶּן־נְשָׂאוֹ֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּשְׁלִכֵ֙הוּ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד הֶהָרִ֔ים א֖וֹ בְּאַחַ֣ת (הגיאות) [הַגֵּיאָי֑וֹת] וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹ֥א תִשְׁלָֽחוּ׃
Translated: They said to him, “Your servants have fifty able men with them. Let them go and look for your master; perhaps the spirit of G<small>OD</small> has carried him off and cast him upon some mountain or into some valley.” “Do not send them,” he replied.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv hineh-na eish-et-avadeykha chamishiym anashiym veney-chayiil eilekhu na viyvakeshu et-adoneykha fen-neshavo rucha yehovah vayashelikhehu veachad hehariym vo veachat (hgyvt) [hageyayvot] vayomer lo tishelachu

Hebrew: וַיִּפְצְרוּ־ב֥וֹ עַד־בֹּ֖שׁ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁלָ֑חוּ וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ וַיְבַקְשׁ֥וּ שְׁלֹשָֽׁה־יָמִ֖ים וְלֹ֥א מְצָאֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: But they kept pressing him for a long time, until he said, “Send them.” So they sent out fifty men, who searched for three days but did not find him.
Transliteration: vayifetseru-vvo ad-vosh vayomer shelachu vayishelechu chamishiym iysh vayevakeshu sheloshah-yamiym velo metsauhu

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ אֵלָ֔יו וְה֖וּא יֹשֵׁ֣ב בִּירִיח֑וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם הֲלֹֽא־אָמַ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם אַל־תֵּלֵֽכוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: They came back to him while he was still in Jericho; and he said to them, “I told you not to go.”
Transliteration: vayashuvu elayv vehu yoshev viyriychvo vayomer alehem halo-amaretiy aleykhem al-telekhu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הָעִיר֙ אֶל־אֱלִישָׁ֔ע הִנֵּה־נָ֞א מוֹשַׁ֤ב הָעִיר֙ ט֔וֹב כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲדֹנִ֖י רֹאֶ֑ה וְהַמַּ֥יִם רָעִ֖ים וְהָאָ֥רֶץ מְשַׁכָּֽלֶת׃
Translated: The leaders of the town said to Elisha, “Look, the town is a pleasant place to live in, as my lord can see; but the water is bad and the land causes bereavement.”
Transliteration: vayomeru aneshey haiyr el-eliysha hineh-na mvoshav haiyr tvov khaasher adoniy roeh vehamayiim raiym vehaarets meshakhalet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר קְחוּ־לִי֙ צְלֹחִ֣ית חֲדָשָׁ֔ה וְשִׂ֥ימוּ שָׁ֖ם מֶ֑לַח וַיִּקְח֖וּ אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: He responded, “Bring me a new dish and put salt in it.” They brought it to him;
Transliteration: vayomer kechu-liy tselochiyt chadashah veshiymu sham melach vayikechu elayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ אֶל־מוֹצָ֣א הַמַּ֔יִם וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ־שָׁ֖ם מֶ֑לַח וַיֹּ֜אמֶר כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה רִפִּ֙אתִי֙ לַמַּ֣יִם הָאֵ֔לֶּה לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה מִשָּׁ֛ם ע֖וֹד מָ֥וֶת וּמְשַׁכָּֽלֶת׃
Translated: he went to the spring and threw salt into it. And he said, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I heal this water; no longer shall death and bereavement come from it!”
Transliteration: vayetse el-mvotsa hamayiim vayashelekhe-sham melach vayomer khoh-amar yehovah rifitiy lamayiim haeleh lo-yiheyeh misham vod mavet umeshakhalet

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָפ֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּדְבַ֥ר אֱלִישָׁ֖ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: The water has remained wholesome to this day, in accordance with the word spoken by Elisha.
Transliteration: vayerafu hamayiim ad hayyvom hazeh khidevar eliysha asher diver {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מִשָּׁ֖ם בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְה֣וּא ׀ עֹלֶ֣ה בַדֶּ֗רֶךְ וּנְעָרִ֤ים קְטַנִּים֙ יָצְא֣וּ מִן־הָעִ֔יר וַיִּתְקַלְּסוּ־בוֹ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ עֲלֵ֥ה קֵרֵ֖חַ עֲלֵ֥ה קֵרֵֽחַ׃
Translated: From there he went up to Bethel. As he was going up the road, some little boys came out of the town and jeered at him, saying, “Go away, baldhead! Go away, baldhead!”
Transliteration: vayaal misham veyt-el vehu oleh vaderekhe uneariym ketaniym yatseu min-haiyr vayitekalesu-vvo vayomeru lvo aleh kerecha aleh kerecha

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤פֶן אַֽחֲרָיו֙ וַיִּרְאֵ֔ם וַֽיְקַלְלֵ֖ם בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתֵּצֶ֜אנָה שְׁתַּ֤יִם דֻּבִּים֙ מִן־הַיַּ֔עַר וַתְּבַקַּ֣עְנָה מֵהֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנֵ֖י יְלָדִֽים׃
Translated: He turned around and looked at them and cursed them in the name of G<small>OD</small>. Thereupon, two she-bears came out of the woods and mangled forty-two of the children.
Transliteration: vayifen acharayv vayireem vayekalelem veshem yehovah vatetsenah shetayiim duviym min-hayaar vatevakaenah mehem arevaiym usheney yeladiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֖ם אֶל־הַ֣ר הַכַּרְמֶ֑ל וּמִשָּׁ֖ם שָׁ֥ב שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: He went on from there to Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria.
Transliteration: vayelekhe misham el-har hakharemel umisham shav shomervon {f}

Hebrew: וִיהוֹרָ֣ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֗ב מָלַ֤ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁמֹנֶ֣ה עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה לִיהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoram son of Ahab became king of Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of King Jehoshaphat of Judah; and he reigned twelve years.
Transliteration: viyhvoram ven-acheav malakhe al-yisherael veshomervon vishenat shemoneh eshereh liyhvoshafat melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe sheteym-eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשֶׂ֤ה הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה רַ֕ק לֹ֥א כְאָבִ֖יו וּכְאִמּ֑וֹ וַיָּ֙סַר֙ אֶת־מַצְּבַ֣ת הַבַּ֔עַל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, yet not like his father and mother, for he removed the pillars of Baal that his father had made.
Transliteration: vayaasheh hara veeyney yehovah rak lo kheaviyv ukheimvo vayasar et-matsevat havaal asher ashah aviyv

Hebrew: רַ֠ק בְּחַטֹּ֞אות יָרׇבְעָ֧ם בֶּן־נְבָ֛ט אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱטִ֥יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל דָּבֵ֑ק לֹא־סָ֖ר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: However, he clung to the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat caused Israel to commit; he did not depart from them.
Transliteration: rak vechatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher-hechetiy et-yisherael davek lo-sar mimenah {f}

Hebrew: וּמֵישַׁ֥ע מֶלֶךְ־מוֹאָ֖ב הָיָ֣ה נֹקֵ֑ד וְהֵשִׁ֤יב לְמֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאָה־אֶ֣לֶף כָּרִ֔ים וּמֵ֥אָה אֶ֖לֶף אֵילִ֥ים צָֽמֶר׃
Translated: Now King Mesha of Moab was a sheep breeder; and he used to pay as tribute to the king of Israel a hundred thousand lambs and the wool of a hundred thousand rams.
Transliteration: umeysha melekhe-mvoav hayah noked veheshiyv lemelekhe-yisherael meah-elef khariym umeah elef eyliym tsamer

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י כְּמ֣וֹת אַחְאָ֑ב וַיִּפְשַׁ֥ע מֶלֶךְ־מוֹאָ֖ב בְּמֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But when Ahab died, the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy khemvot acheav vayifesha melekhe-mvoav vemelekhe yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֞א הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ יְהוֹרָ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא מִשֹּׁמְר֑וֹן וַיִּפְקֹ֖ד אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So King Jehoram promptly set out from Samaria and mustered all Israel.
Transliteration: vayetse hamelekhe yehvoram vayyvom hahu mishomervon vayifekod et-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֡לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ אֶל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֨ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר מֶ֤לֶךְ מוֹאָב֙ פָּשַׁ֣ע בִּ֔י הֲתֵלֵ֥ךְ אִתִּ֛י אֶל־מוֹאָ֖ב לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽעֱלֶ֔ה כָּמ֧וֹנִי כָמ֛וֹךָ כְּעַמִּ֥י כְעַמֶּ֖ךָ כְּסוּסַ֥י כְּסוּסֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: At the same time, he sent this message to King Jehoshaphat of Judah: “The king of Moab has rebelled against me; will you come with me to make war on Moab?” He replied, “I will go. I will do what you do: my troops shall be your troops, my horses shall be your horses.”
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayishelach el-yehvoshafat melekhe-yehudah lemor melekhe mvoav fasha viy hatelekhe itiy el-mvoav lamilechamah vayomer eeleh khamvoniy khamvokha kheamiy kheamekha khesusay khesuseykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֵי־זֶ֥ה הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ נַעֲלֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר דֶּ֖רֶךְ מִדְבַּ֥ר אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: And he asked, “Which route shall we take?” [Jehoram] replied, “The road through the wilderness of Edom.”
Transliteration: vayomer ey-zeh haderekhe naaleh vayomer derekhe midevar edvom

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩לֶךְ֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל וּמֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ וּמֶ֣לֶךְ אֱד֔וֹם וַיָּסֹ֕בּוּ דֶּ֖רֶךְ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְלֹא־הָיָ֨ה מַ֧יִם לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֛ה וְלַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So the king of Israel, the king of Judah, and the king of Edom set out, and they marched for seven days until they rounded [the tip of the Dead Sea]; and there was no water left for the army or for the animals that were with them.
Transliteration: vayelekhe melekhe yisherael umelekhe-yehudah umelekhe edvom vayasovu derekhe shiveat yamiym velo-hayah mayiim lamachaneh velavehemah asher verageleyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲהָ֕הּ כִּי־קָרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֗ה לִשְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה לָתֵ֥ת אוֹתָ֖ם בְּיַד־מוֹאָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: “Alas!” cried the king of Israel. “G<small>OD</small> has brought these three kings together only to deliver them into the hands of Moab.”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe yisherael ahah khiy-kara yehovah lisheloshet hamelakhiym haeleh latet votam veyad-mvoav {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט הַאֵ֨ין פֹּ֤ה נָבִיא֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וְנִדְרְשָׁ֥ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵאוֹת֑וֹ וַ֠יַּ֠עַן אֶחָ֞ד מֵעַבְדֵ֤י מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר פֹּ֚ה אֱלִישָׁ֣ע בֶּן־שָׁפָ֔ט אֲשֶׁר־יָ֥צַק מַ֖יִם עַל־יְדֵ֥י אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: But Jehoshaphat said, “Isn’t there a prophet of G<small>OD</small> here, through whom we may inquire of G<small>OD</small> ?” One of the courtiers of the king of Israel spoke up and said, “Elisha son of Shaphat, who poured water on the hands of Elijah, is here.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshafat haeyn foh naviy layhovah venidereshah et-yehovah mevotvo vayaan echad meavedey melekhe-yisherael vayomer foh eliysha ven-shafat asher-yatsak mayiim al-yedey eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט יֵ֥שׁ אוֹת֖וֹ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּרְד֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו מֶ֧לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט וּמֶ֥לֶךְ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: “The word of G<small>OD</small> is with him,” said Jehoshaphat. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshafat eish votvo devar-yehovah vayeredu elayv melekhe yisherael viyhvoshafat umelekhe edvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֜ע אֶל־מֶ֤לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מַה־לִּ֣י וָלָ֔ךְ לֵ֚ךְ אֶל־נְבִיאֵ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ וְאֶל־נְבִיאֵ֖י אִמֶּ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַ֗ל כִּֽי־קָרָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ לִשְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה לָתֵ֥ת אוֹתָ֖ם בְּיַד־מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: Elisha said to the king of Israel, “What have you to do with me? Go to your father’s prophets or your mother’s prophets.” But the king of Israel said, “Don’t [say that], for G<small>OD</small> has brought these three kings together only to deliver them into the hands of Moab.”
Transliteration: vayomer eliysha el-melekhe yisherael mah-liy valakhe lekhe el-neviyey aviykha veel-neviyey imekha vayomer lvo melekhe yisherael al khiy-kara yehovah lisheloshet hamelakhiym haeleh latet votam veyad-mvoav

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֗ע חַי־יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָמַ֣דְתִּי לְפָנָ֔יו כִּ֗י לוּלֵ֛י פְּנֵ֛י יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה אֲנִ֣י נֹשֵׂ֑א אִם־אַבִּ֥יט אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְאִם־אֶרְאֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: “As G<small>OD</small> of Hosts lives, whom I serve,” Elisha answered, “were it not that I respect King Jehoshaphat of Judah, I wouldn’t look at you or notice you.
Transliteration: vayomer eliysha chay-yehovah tsevavot asher amadetiy lefanayv khiy luley feney yehvoshafat melekhe-yehudah aniy noshe im-aviyt eleykha veim-ereekha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה קְחוּ־לִ֣י מְנַגֵּ֑ן וְהָיָה֙ כְּנַגֵּ֣ן הַֽמְנַגֵּ֔ן וַתְּהִ֥י עָלָ֖יו יַד־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Now then, get me a musician.”
As the musician played, GOD’s hand came upon him,
Transliteration: veatah kechu-liy menagen vehayah khenagen hamenagen vatehiy alayv yad-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה עָשֹׂ֛ה הַנַּ֥חַל הַזֶּ֖ה גֵּבִ֥ים <small>׀</small> גֵּבִֽים׃
Translated: and he said, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: This wadi shall be full of pools.
Transliteration: vayomer khoh amar yehovah ashoh hanachal hazeh geviym <small></small> geviym

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹא־תִרְא֥וּ ר֙וּחַ֙ וְלֹא־תִרְא֣וּ גֶ֔שֶׁם וְהַנַּ֥חַל הַה֖וּא יִמָּ֣לֵא מָ֑יִם וּשְׁתִיתֶ֛ם אַתֶּ֥ם וּמִקְנֵיכֶ֖ם וּֽבְהֶמְתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: For thus said G<small>OD</small>: You shall see no wind, you shall see no rain, and yet the wadi shall be filled with water; and you and your cattle and your pack animals shall drink.
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar yehovah lo-tireu rucha velo-tireu geshem vehanachal hahu yimale mayiim ushetiytem atem umikeneykhem uvehemetekhem

Hebrew: וְנָקַ֥ל זֹ֖את בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְנָתַ֥ן אֶת־מוֹאָ֖ב בְּיֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translated: And this is but a slight thing in G<small>OD</small>’s sight, for Moab will also be delivered into your hands.
Transliteration: venakal zot veeyney yehovah venatan et-mvoav veyedekhem

Hebrew: וְהִכִּיתֶ֞ם כׇּל־עִ֤יר מִבְצָר֙ וְכׇל־עִ֣יר מִבְח֔וֹר וְכׇל־עֵ֥ץ טוֹב֙ תַּפִּ֔ילוּ וְכׇל־מַעְיְנֵי־מַ֖יִם תִּסְתֹּ֑מוּ וְכֹל֙ הַחֶלְקָ֣ה הַטּוֹבָ֔ה תַּכְאִ֖בוּ בָּאֲבָנִֽים׃
Translated: You shall conquer every fortified town and every splendid city; you shall fell every good tree and stop up all wells of water; and every fertile field you shall ruin with stones.”
Transliteration: vehikhiytem khׇl-iyr mivetsar vekhׇl-iyr mivechvor vekhׇl-ets tvov tafiylu vekhׇl-maeyeney-mayiim tisetomu vekhol hachelekah hatvovah takheivu vaavaniym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ כַּעֲל֣וֹת הַמִּנְחָ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־מַ֥יִם בָּאִ֖ים מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ אֱד֑וֹם וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֶת־הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: And in the morning, when it was time to present the grain offering, water suddenly came from the direction of Edom and the land was covered by the water.
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker khaalvot haminechah vehineh-mayiim vaiym miderekhe edvom vatimale haarets et-hamayiim

Hebrew: וְכׇל־מוֹאָב֙ שָֽׁמְע֔וּ כִּי־עָל֥וּ הַמְּלָכִ֖ים לְהִלָּ֣חֶם בָּ֑ם וַיִּצָּעֲק֗וּ מִכֹּ֨ל חֹגֵ֤ר חֲגֹרָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וַיַּעַמְד֖וּ עַֽל־הַגְּבֽוּל׃
Translated: Meanwhile, all the Moabites had heard that the kings were advancing to make war on them; every man old enough to bear arms rallied, and they stationed themselves at the border.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-mvoav shameu khiy-alu hamelakhiym lehilachem vam vayitsaaku mikhol choger chagorah vamaelah vayaamedu al-hagevul

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ זָרְחָ֣ה עַל־הַמָּ֑יִם וַיִּרְא֨וּ מוֹאָ֥ב מִנֶּ֛גֶד אֶת־הַמַּ֖יִם אֲדֻמִּ֥ים כַּדָּֽם׃
Translated: Next morning, when they rose, the sun was shining over the water, and from the distance the water appeared to the Moabites as red as blood.
Transliteration: vayashekhiymu vavoker vehashemesh zarechah al-hamayiim vayireu mvoav mineged et-hamayiim adumiym khadam

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ דָּ֣ם זֶ֔ה הׇחֳרֵ֤ב נֶֽחֶרְבוּ֙ הַמְּלָכִ֔ים וַיַּכּ֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְעַתָּ֥ה לַשָּׁלָ֖ל מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: “That’s blood!” they said. “The kings must have fought among themselves and killed each other. Now to the spoil, Moab!”
Transliteration: vayomeru dam zeh hׇchorev necherevu hamelakhiym vayakhu iysh et-reehu veatah lashalal mvoav

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֘אוּ֮ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיָּקֻ֤מוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיַּכּ֣וּ אֶת־מוֹאָ֔ב וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם (ויבו) [וַיַּ֨כּוּ־]בָ֔הּ וְהַכּ֖וֹת אֶת־מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: They entered the Israelite camp, and the Israelites arose and attacked the Moabites, who fled before them. They advanced, constantly attacking the Moabites,
Transliteration: vayavou el-machaneh yisherael vayakumu yisherael vayakhu et-mvoav vayanusu mifeneyhem (vyvv) [vayakhu-]vah vehakhvot et-mvoav

Hebrew: וְהֶעָרִ֣ים יַהֲרֹ֡סוּ וְכׇל־חֶלְקָ֣ה ט֠וֹבָ֠ה יַשְׁלִ֨יכוּ אִישׁ־אַבְנ֜וֹ וּמִלְא֗וּהָ וְכׇל־מַעְיַן־מַ֤יִם יִסְתֹּ֙מוּ֙ וְכׇל־עֵֽץ־ט֣וֹב יַפִּ֔ילוּ עַד־הִשְׁאִ֧יר אֲבָנֶ֛יהָ בַּקִּ֖יר חֲרָ֑שֶׂת וַיָּסֹ֥בּוּ הַקַּלָּעִ֖ים וַיַּכּֽוּהָ׃
Translated: and they destroyed the towns. They each threw a stone into every fertile field, so that it was covered over; and they stopped up every spring and felled every fruit tree. Only the walls of Kir-hareseth were left, and then the slingers surrounded it and attacked it.
Transliteration: veheariym yaharosu vekhׇl-chelekah tvovah yasheliykhu iysh-avenvo umileuha vekhׇl-maeyan-mayiim yisetomu vekhׇl-ets-tvov yafiylu ad-hisheiyr avaneyha vakiyr charashet vayasovu hakalaiym vayakhuha

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֔ב כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֣ח א֠וֹת֠וֹ שְׁבַע־מֵא֨וֹת אִ֜ישׁ שֹׁ֣לֵֽף חֶ֗רֶב לְהַבְקִ֛יעַ אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ אֱד֖וֹם וְלֹ֥א יָכֹֽלוּ׃
Translated: Seeing that the battle was going against him, the king of Moab led an attempt of seven hundred swordsmen to break a way through to the king of Edom; but they failed.
Transliteration: vayare melekhe mvoav khiy-chazak mimenu hamilechamah vayikach votvo sheva-mevot iysh sholef cherev lehavekiya el-melekhe edvom velo yakholu

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ אֶת־בְּנ֨וֹ הַבְּכ֜וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יִמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֗יו וַיַּעֲלֵ֤הוּ עֹלָה֙ עַל־הַ֣חֹמָ֔ה וַיְהִ֥י קֶצֶף־גָּד֖וֹל עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵעָלָ֔יו וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ לָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: So he took his first-born son, who was to succeed him as king, and offered him up on the wall as a burnt offering. A great wrath came upon Israel, so they withdrew from him and went back to [their own] land.
Transliteration: vayikach et-venvo havekhvor asher-yimelokhe tachetayv vayaalehu olah al-hachomah vayehiy ketsef-gadvol al-yisherael vayiseu mealayv vayashuvu laarets {f}

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֣ה אַחַ֣ת מִנְּשֵׁ֣י בְנֵֽי־הַ֠נְּבִיאִ֠ים צָעֲקָ֨ה אֶל־אֱלִישָׁ֜ע לֵאמֹ֗ר עַבְדְּךָ֤ אִישִׁי֙ מֵ֔ת וְאַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ כִּ֣י עַבְדְּךָ֔ הָיָ֥ה יָרֵ֖א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהַ֨נֹּשֶׁ֔ה בָּ֗א לָקַ֜חַת אֶת־שְׁנֵ֧י יְלָדַ֛י ל֖וֹ לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: A certain woman, the wife of one of the disciples of the prophets, cried out to Elisha: “Your servant my husband is dead, and you know how your servant revered G<small>OD</small>. And now a creditor is coming to seize my two children as slaves.”
Transliteration: veishah achat mineshey veney-haneviyiym tsaakah el-eliysha lemor avedekha iyshiy met veatah yadaeta khiy avedekha hayah yare et-yehovah vehanosheh va lakachat et-sheney yeladay lvo laavadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלֶ֤יהָ אֱלִישָׁע֙ מָ֣ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לָּ֔ךְ הַגִּ֣ידִי לִ֔י מַה־יֶּשׁ־[לָ֖ךְ] (לכי) בַּבָּ֑יִת וַתֹּ֗אמֶר אֵ֣ין לְשִׁפְחָתְךָ֥ כֹל֙ בַּבַּ֔יִת כִּ֖י אִם־אָס֥וּךְ שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: Elisha said to her, “What can I do for you? Tell me, what have you in the house?” She replied, “Your maidservant has nothing at all in the house, except a jug of oil.”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha eliysha mah eesheh-lakhe hagiydiy liy mah-yesh-[lakhe] (lkhy) vavayiit vatomer eyn leshifechatekha khol vavayiit khiy im-asukhe shamen

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְכִ֨י שַׁאֲלִי־לָ֤ךְ כֵּלִים֙ מִן־הַח֔וּץ מֵאֵ֖ת כׇּל־[שְׁכֵנָ֑יִךְ] (שכנכי) כֵּלִ֥ים רֵקִ֖ים אַל־תַּמְעִֽיטִי׃
Translated: “Go,” he said, “and borrow vessels outside, from all your neighbors, empty vessels, as many as you can.
Transliteration: vayomer lekhiy shaaliy-lakhe kheliym min-hachuts meet khׇl-[shekhenayiikhe] (shkhnkhy) kheliym rekiym al-tameiytiy

Hebrew: וּבָ֗את וְסָגַ֤רְתְּ הַדֶּ֙לֶת֙ בַּעֲדֵ֣ךְ וּבְעַד־בָּנַ֔יִךְ וְיָצַ֕קְתְּ עַ֥ל כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְהַמָּלֵ֖א תַּסִּֽיעִי׃
Translated: Then go in and shut the door behind you and your children, and pour [oil] into all those vessels, removing each one as it is filled.”
Transliteration: uvat vesagarete hadelet vaadekhe uvead-vanayiikhe veyatsakete al khׇl-hakheliym haeleh vehamale tasiyiy

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ מֵֽאִתּ֔וֹ וַתִּסְגֹּ֣ר הַדֶּ֔לֶת בַּעֲדָ֖הּ וּבְעַ֣ד בָּנֶ֑יהָ הֵ֛ם מַגִּישִׁ֥ים אֵלֶ֖יהָ וְהִ֥יא (מיצקת) [מוֹצָֽקֶת]׃
Translated: She went away and shut the door behind her and her children. They kept bringing [vessels] to her and she kept pouring.
Transliteration: vatelekhe meitvo vatisegor hadelet vaadah uvead vaneyha hem magiyshiym eleyha vehiy (mytskt) [mvotsaket]

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּמְלֹ֣את הַכֵּלִ֗ים וַתֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־בְּנָהּ֙ הַגִּ֨ישָׁה אֵלַ֥י עוֹד֙ כֶּ֔לִי וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֔יהָ אֵ֥ין ע֖וֹד כֶּ֑לִי וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד הַשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: When the vessels were full, she said to her son, “Bring me another vessel.” He answered her, “There are no more vessels”; and the oil stopped.
Transliteration: vayehiy khimelot hakheliym vatomer el-venah hagiyshah elay vod kheliy vayomer eleyha eyn vod kheliy vayaamod hashamen

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֗א וַתַּגֵּד֙ לְאִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְכִי֙ מִכְרִ֣י אֶת־הַשֶּׁ֔מֶן וְשַׁלְּמִ֖י אֶת־[נִשְׁיֵ֑ךְ] (נשיכי) וְאַ֣תְּ (בניכי) [וּבָנַ֔יִךְ] תִּֽחְיִ֖י בַּנּוֹתָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: She came and told the agent of God, and he said, “Go sell the oil and pay your debt, and you and your children can live on the rest.”
Transliteration: vatavo vataged leiysh haElohim vayomer lekhiy mikheriy et-hashemen veshalemiy et-[nisheeikhe] (nshykhy) veate (vnykhy) [uvanayiikhe] ticheyiy vanvotar {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י הַיּ֜וֹם וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ר אֱלִישָׁ֣ע אֶל־שׁוּנֵ֗ם וְשָׁם֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וַתַּחֲזֶק־בּ֖וֹ לֶאֱכׇל־לָ֑חֶם וַֽיְהִי֙ מִדֵּ֣י עׇבְר֔וֹ יָסֻ֥ר שָׁ֖מָּה לֶאֱכׇל־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: One day Elisha visited Shunem. A wealthy woman lived there, and she urged him to have a meal; and whenever he passed by, he would stop there for a meal.
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom vayaavor eliysha el-shunem vesham ishah gedvolah vatachazek-vvo leekhׇl-lachem vayehiy midey ׇvervo yasur shamah leekhׇl-lachem

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אִישָׁ֔הּ הִנֵּה־נָ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ אֱלֹהִ֖ים קָד֣וֹשׁ ה֑וּא עֹבֵ֥ר עָלֵ֖ינוּ תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: Once she said to her husband, “I am sure it is a holy agent of God who comes this way regularly.
Transliteration: vatomer el-iyshah hineh-na yadaetiy khiy iysh Elohim kadvosh hu over aleynu tamiyd

Hebrew: נַעֲשֶׂה־נָּ֤א עֲלִיַּת־קִיר֙ קְטַנָּ֔ה וְנָשִׂ֨ים ל֥וֹ שָׁ֛ם מִטָּ֥ה וְשֻׁלְחָ֖ן וְכִסֵּ֣א וּמְנוֹרָ֑ה וְהָיָ֛ה בְּבֹא֥וֹ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ יָס֥וּר שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Let us make a small enclosed upper chamber and place a bed, a table, a chair, and a lampstand there for him, so that he can stop there whenever he comes to us.”
Transliteration: naasheh-na aliyat-kiyr ketanah venashiym lvo sham mitah veshulechan vekhise umenvorah vehayah vevovo eleynu yasur shamah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם וַיָּ֣בֹא שָׁ֑מָּה וַיָּ֥סַר אֶל־הָעֲלִיָּ֖ה וַיִּשְׁכַּב־שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: One day he came there; he retired to the upper chamber and lay down there.
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom vayavo shamah vayasar el-haaliyah vayishekhav-shamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־גֵּיחֲזִ֣י נַעֲר֔וֹ קְרָ֖א לַשּׁוּנַמִּ֣ית הַזֹּ֑את וַיִּ֨קְרָא־לָ֔הּ וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: He said to his servant Gehazi, “Call that Shunammite.” He called her, and she stood before him.
Transliteration: vayomer el-geychaziy naarvo kera lashunamiyt hazot vayikera-lah vataamod lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ אֱמׇר־נָ֣א אֵלֶ֘יהָ֮ הִנֵּ֣ה חָרַ֣דְתְּ <small>׀</small> אֵלֵ֘ינוּ֮ אֶת־כׇּל־הַחֲרָדָ֣ה הַזֹּאת֒ מֶ֚ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָ֔ךְ הֲיֵ֤שׁ לְדַבֶּר־לָךְ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ א֖וֹ אֶל־שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֑א וַתֹּ֕אמֶר בְּת֥וֹךְ עַמִּ֖י אָנֹכִ֥י יֹשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated: He said to him, “Tell her, ‘You have gone to all this trouble for us. What can we do for you? Can we speak in your behalf to the king or to the army commander?’” She replied, “I live among my own people.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo emׇr-na eleyha hineh charadete <small></small> eleynu et-khׇl-hacharadah hazot meh laashvot lakhe haeish ledaver-lakhe el-hamelekhe vo el-shar hatsava vatomer vetvokhe amiy anokhiy yoshavet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר וּמֶ֖ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָ֑הּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר גֵּיחֲזִ֗י אֲבָ֛ל בֵּ֥ן אֵֽין־לָ֖הּ וְאִישָׁ֥הּ זָקֵֽן׃
Translated: “What then can be done for her?” he asked. “The fact is,” said Gehazi, “she has no son, and her husband is old.”
Transliteration: vayomer umeh laashvot lah vayomer geychaziy aval ven eyn-lah veiyshah zaken

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר קְרָא־לָ֑הּ וַיִּ֨קְרָא־לָ֔הּ וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד בַּפָּֽתַח׃
Translated: “Call her,” he said. He called her, and she stood in the doorway.
Transliteration: vayomer kera-lah vayikera-lah vataamod vafatach

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לַמּוֹעֵ֤ד הַזֶּה֙ כָּעֵ֣ת חַיָּ֔ה (אתי) [אַ֖תְּ] חֹבֶ֣קֶת בֵּ֑ן וַתֹּ֗אמֶר אַל־אֲדֹנִי֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אַל־תְּכַזֵּ֖ב בְּשִׁפְחָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And Elisha said, “At this season next year, you will be embracing a son.” She replied, “Please, my lord, agent of God, do not delude your maidservant.”
Transliteration: vayomer lamvoed hazeh khaet chayah (ty) [ate] choveket ven vatomer al-adoniy iysh haElohim al-tekhazev veshifechatekha

Hebrew: וַתַּ֥הַר הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן לַמּוֹעֵ֤ד הַזֶּה֙ כָּעֵ֣ת חַיָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יהָ אֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: The woman conceived and bore a son at the same season the following year, as Elisha had assured her.
Transliteration: vatahar haishah vateled ven lamvoed hazeh khaet chayah asher-diver eleyha eliysha

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֖ל הַיָּ֑לֶד וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וַיֵּצֵ֥א אֶל־אָבִ֖יו אֶל־הַקֹּצְרִֽים׃
Translated: The child grew up. One day, he went out to his father among the reapers.
Transliteration: vayigedal hayaled vayehiy hayyvom vayetse el-aviyv el-hakotseriym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֶל־אָבִ֖יו רֹאשִׁ֣י <small>׀</small> רֹאשִׁ֑י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר שָׂאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: [Suddenly] he cried to his father, “Oh, my head, my head!” He said to a servant, “Carry him to his mother.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-aviyv roshiy <small></small> roshiy vayomer el-hanaar shaehu el-imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨שָּׂאֵ֔הוּ וַיְבִיאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־אִמּ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב עַל־בִּרְכֶּ֛יהָ עַד־הַֽצׇּהֳרַ֖יִם וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: He picked him up and brought him to his mother. And the child sat on her lap until noon; and he died.
Transliteration: vayishaehu vayeviyehu el-imvo vayeshev al-virekheyha ad-hatsׇhorayiim vayamot

Hebrew: וַתַּ֙עַל֙ וַתַּשְׁכִּבֵ֔הוּ עַל־מִטַּ֖ת אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתִּסְגֹּ֥ר בַּעֲד֖וֹ וַתֵּצֵֽא׃
Translated: She took him up and laid him on the bed of the agent of God, and left him and closed the door.
Transliteration: vataal vatashekhivehu al-mitat iysh haElohim vatisegor vaadvo vatetse

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָא֮ אֶל־אִישָׁהּ֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר שִׁלְחָ֨ה נָ֥א לִי֙ אֶחָ֣ד מִן־הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְאַחַ֖ת הָאֲתֹנ֑וֹת וְאָר֛וּצָה עַד־אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וְאָשֽׁוּבָה׃
Translated: Then she called to her husband: “Please, send me one of the servants and one of the jennies, so I can hurry to the agent of God and back.”
Transliteration: vatikera el-iyshah vatomer shilechah na liy echad min-haneariym veachat haatonvot vearutsah ad-iysh haElohim veashuvah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מַ֠דּ֠וּעַ (אתי) [אַ֣תְּ] (הלכתי) [הֹלֶ֤כֶת] אֵלָיו֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹא־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וְלֹ֣א שַׁבָּ֑ת וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: But he said, “Why are you going to him today? It is neither new moon nor sabbath.” She answered, “It’s all right.”
Transliteration: vayomer madua (ty) [ate] (hlkhty) [holekhet] elayv hayyvom lo-chodesh velo shavat vatomer shalvom

Hebrew: וַֽתַּחֲבֹשׁ֙ הָאָת֔וֹן וַתֹּ֥אמֶר אֶֽל־נַעֲרָ֖הּ נְהַ֣ג וָלֵ֑ךְ אַל־תַּעֲצׇר־לִ֣י לִרְכֹּ֔ב כִּ֖י אִם־אָמַ֥רְתִּי לָֽךְ׃
Translated: She had the jenny saddled, and said to her servant, “Urge it on; see that I don’t slow down unless I tell you.”
Transliteration: vatachavosh haatvon vatomer el-naarah nehag valekhe al-taatsׇr-liy lirekhov khiy im-amaretiy lakhe

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶךְ וַתָּבֹ֛א אֶל־אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־הַ֣ר הַכַּרְמֶ֑ל וַ֠יְהִ֠י כִּרְא֨וֹת אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֤ים אֹתָהּ֙ מִנֶּ֔גֶד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־גֵּיחֲזִ֣י נַעֲר֔וֹ הִנֵּ֖ה הַשּׁוּנַמִּ֥ית הַלָּֽז׃
Translated: She went on until she came to the agent of God on Mount Carmel. When the agent of God saw her from afar, he said to his servant Gehazi, “There is that Shunammite.
Transliteration: vatelekhe vatavo el-iysh haElohim el-har hakharemel vayehiy khirevot iysh-haElohim otah mineged vayomer el-geychaziy naarvo hineh hashunamiyt halaz

Hebrew: עַתָּה֮ רֽוּץ־נָ֣א לִקְרָאתָהּ֒ וֶאֱמׇר־לָ֗הּ הֲשָׁל֥וֹם לָ֛ךְ הֲשָׁל֥וֹם לְאִישֵׁ֖ךְ הֲשָׁל֣וֹם לַיָּ֑לֶד וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Go, hurry toward her and ask her, ‘How are you? How is your husband? How is the child?’” “We are well,” she replied.
Transliteration: atah ruts-na likeratah veemׇr-lah hashalvom lakhe hashalvom leiyshekhe hashalvom layaled vatomer shalvom

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֞א אֶל־אִ֤ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־הָהָ֔ר וַֽתַּחֲזֵ֖ק בְּרַגְלָ֑יו וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ גֵּיחֲזִ֜י לְהׇדְפָ֗הּ וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אִ֨ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֤ים הַרְפֵּה־לָהּ֙ כִּֽי־נַפְשָׁ֣הּ מָֽרָה־לָ֔הּ וַֽיהֹוָה֙ הֶעְלִ֣ים מִמֶּ֔נִּי וְלֹ֥א הִגִּ֖יד לִֽי׃
Translated: But when she came up to the agent of God on the mountain, she clasped his feet. Gehazi stepped forward to push her away; but the agent of God said, “Let her alone, for she is in bitter distress; and G<small>OD</small> has hidden it from me and has not told me.”
Transliteration: vatavo el-iysh haElohim el-hahar vatachazek veragelayv vayigash geychaziy lehׇdefah vayomer iysh haElohim harefeh-lah khiy-nafeshah marah-lah vayhovah heeliym mimeniy velo higiyd liy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר הֲשָׁאַ֥לְתִּי בֵ֖ן מֵאֵ֣ת אֲדֹנִ֑י הֲלֹ֣א אָמַ֔רְתִּי לֹ֥א תַשְׁלֶ֖ה אֹתִֽי׃
Translated: Then she said, “Did I ask my lord for a son? Didn’t I say: ‘Don’t mislead me’?”
Transliteration: vatomer hashaaletiy ven meet adoniy halo amaretiy lo tasheleh otiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לְגֵיחֲזִ֜י חֲגֹ֣ר מׇתְנֶ֗יךָ וְקַ֨ח מִשְׁעַנְתִּ֣י בְיָדְךָ֮ וָלֵךְ֒ כִּי־תִמְצָ֥א אִישׁ֙ לֹ֣א תְבָרְכֶ֔נּוּ וְכִֽי־יְבָרֶכְךָ֥ אִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א תַעֲנֶ֑נּוּ וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ מִשְׁעַנְתִּ֖י עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַנָּֽעַר׃
Translated: He said to Gehazi, “Tie up your skirts, take my staff in your hand, and go. If you meet anyone, do not greet him; and if anyone greets you, do not answer him. And place my staff on the face of the boy.”
Transliteration: vayomer legeychaziy chagor mׇteneykha vekach misheanetiy veyadekha valekhe khiy-timetsa iysh lo tevarekhenu vekhiy-yevarekhekha iysh lo taanenu veshameta misheanetiy al-feney hanaar

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵ֣ם הַנַּ֔עַר חַי־יְהֹוָ֥ה וְחֵֽי־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ אִם־אֶעֶזְבֶ֑ךָּ וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אַחֲרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: But the boy’s mother said, “As G<small>OD</small> lives and as you live, I will not leave you!” So he arose and followed her.
Transliteration: vatomer em hanaar chay-yehovah vechey-nafeshekha im-eezevekha vayakׇm vayelekhe achareyha

Hebrew: וְגֵחֲזִ֞י עָבַ֣ר לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם וַיָּ֤שֶׂם אֶת־הַמִּשְׁעֶ֙נֶת֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַנַּ֔עַר וְאֵ֥ין ק֖וֹל וְאֵ֣ין קָ֑שֶׁב וַיָּ֤שׇׁב לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַיַּגֶּד־ל֣וֹ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א הֵקִ֖יץ הַנָּֽעַר׃
Translated: Gehazi had gone on before them and had placed the staff on the boy’s face; but there was no sound or response. He turned back to meet him and told him, “The boy has not awakened.”
Transliteration: vegechaziy avar lifeneyhem vayashem et-hamisheenet al-feney hanaar veeyn kvol veeyn kashev vayashׇv likeratvo vayaged-lvo lemor lo hekiyts hanaar

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֱלִישָׁ֖ע הַבָּ֑יְתָה וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַנַּ֙עַר֙ מֵ֔ת מֻשְׁכָּ֖ב עַל־מִטָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Elisha came into the house, and there was the boy, laid out dead on his couch.
Transliteration: vayavo eliysha havayetah vehineh hanaar met mushekhav al-mitatvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕א וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר הַדֶּ֖לֶת בְּעַ֣ד שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He went in, shut the door behind the two of them, and prayed to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayavo vayisegor hadelet vead sheneyhem vayitefalel el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַל וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עַל־הַיֶּ֗לֶד וַיָּ֩שֶׂם֩ פִּ֨יו עַל־פִּ֜יו וְעֵינָ֤יו עַל־עֵינָיו֙ וְכַפָּ֣יו עַל־כַּפָּ֔ו וַיִּגְהַ֖ר עָלָ֑יו וַיָּ֖חׇם בְּשַׂ֥ר הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translated: Then he mounted [the bed] and placed himself over the child. He put his mouth on its mouth, his eyes on its eyes, and his hands on its hands, as he bent over it. And the body of the child became warm.
Transliteration: vayaal vayishekhav al-hayeled vayashem fiyv al-fiyv veeynayv al-eynayv vekhafayv al-khafav vayigehar alayv vayachׇm veshar hayaled

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜שׇׁב וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ בַּבַּ֗יִת אַחַ֥ת הֵ֙נָּה֙ וְאַחַ֣ת הֵ֔נָּה וַיַּ֖עַל וַיִּגְהַ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וַיְזוֹרֵ֤ר הַנַּ֙עַר֙ עַד־שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֔ים וַיִּפְקַ֥ח הַנַּ֖עַר אֶת־עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: He stepped down, walked once up and down the room, then mounted and bent over him. Thereupon, the boy sneezed seven times, and the boy opened his eyes.
Transliteration: vayashׇv vayelekhe vavayiit achat henah veachat henah vayaal vayigehar alayv vayezvorer hanaar ad-sheva feamiym vayifekach hanaar et-eynayv

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א אֶל־גֵּיחֲזִ֗י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ קְרָא֙ אֶל־הַשֻּׁנַמִּ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את וַיִּקְרָאֶ֖הָ וַתָּבֹ֣א אֵלָ֑יו וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שְׂאִ֥י בְנֵֽךְ׃
Translated: [Elisha] called Gehazi and said, “Call the Shunammite,” and he called her. When she came to him, he said, “Pick up your son.”
Transliteration: vayikera el-geychaziy vayomer kera el-hashunamiyt hazot vayikeraeha vatavo elayv vayomer sheiy venekhe

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹא֙ וַתִּפֹּ֣ל עַל־רַגְלָ֔יו וַתִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ אָ֑רְצָה וַתִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־בְּנָ֖הּ וַתֵּצֵֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: She came and fell at his feet and bowed low to the ground; then she picked up her son and left.
Transliteration: vatavo vatifol al-ragelayv vatishetachu aretsah vatisha et-venah vatetse {f}

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁ֞ע שָׁ֤ב הַגִּלְגָּ֙לָה֙ וְהָרָעָ֣ב בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּבְנֵי֙ הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים יֹשְׁבִ֖ים לְפָנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְנַעֲר֗וֹ שְׁפֹת֙ הַסִּ֣יר הַגְּדוֹלָ֔ה וּבַשֵּׁ֥ל נָזִ֖יד לִבְנֵ֥י הַנְּבִיאִֽים׃
Translated: Elisha returned to Gilgal. There was a famine in the land, and the disciples of the prophets were sitting before him. He said to his servant, “Set the large pot [on the fire] and cook a stew for the disciples of the prophets.”
Transliteration: veeliysha shav hagilegalah veharaav vaarets uveney haneviyiym yosheviym lefanayv vayomer lenaarvo shefot hasiyr hagedvolah uvashel naziyd liveney haneviyiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א אֶחָ֣ד אֶל־הַשָּׂדֶה֮ לְלַקֵּ֣ט אֹרֹת֒ וַיִּמְצָא֙ גֶּ֣פֶן שָׂדֶ֔ה וַיְלַקֵּ֥ט מִמֶּ֛נּוּ פַּקֻּעֹ֥ת שָׂדֶ֖ה מְלֹ֣א בִגְד֑וֹ וַיָּבֹ֗א וַיְפַלַּ֛ח אֶל־סִ֥יר הַנָּזִ֖יד כִּי־לֹ֥א יָדָֽעוּ׃
Translated: So one of them went out into the fields to gather sprouts. He came across a wild vine and picked from it wild gourds, as many as his garment would hold. Then he came back and sliced them into the pot of stew, for they did not know [what they were];
Transliteration: vayetse echad el-hashadeh lelaket orot vayimetsa gefen shadeh vayelaket mimenu fakuot shadeh melo vigedvo vayavo vayefalach el-siyr hanaziyd khiy-lo yadau

Hebrew: וַיִּֽצְק֥וּ לַאֲנָשִׁ֖ים לֶאֱכ֑וֹל וַ֠יְהִ֠י כְּאׇכְלָ֨ם מֵהַנָּזִ֜יד וְהֵ֣מָּה צָעָ֗קוּ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ מָ֤וֶת בַּסִּיר֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יָכְל֖וּ לֶאֱכֹֽל׃
Translated: and they served it for those present to eat. While they were still eating of the stew, they began to cry out: “O agent of God, there is death in the pot!” And they could not eat it.
Transliteration: vayitseku laanashiym leekhvol vayehiy kheׇkhelam mehanaziyd vehemah tsaaku vayomeru mavet vasiyr iysh haElohim velo yakhelu leekhol

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ וּקְחוּ־קֶ֔מַח וַיַּשְׁלֵ֖ךְ אֶל־הַסִּ֑יר וַיֹּ֗אמֶר צַ֤ק לָעָם֙ וְיֹאכֵ֔לוּ וְלֹ֥א הָיָ֛ה דָּבָ֥ר רָ֖ע בַּסִּֽיר׃ {ס}
Translated: “Fetch some flour,” [Elisha] said. He threw it into the pot and said, “Serve it to the people and let them eat.” And there was no longer anything harmful in the pot.
Transliteration: vayomer ukechu-kemach vayashelekhe el-hasiyr vayomer tsak laam veyokhelu velo hayah davar ra vasiyr {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ בָּ֜א מִבַּ֣עַל שָׁלִ֗שָׁה וַיָּבֵא֩ לְאִ֨ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים לֶ֤חֶם בִּכּוּרִים֙ עֶשְׂרִֽים־לֶ֣חֶם שְׂעֹרִ֔ים וְכַרְמֶ֖ל בְּצִקְלֹנ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר תֵּ֥ן לָעָ֖ם וְיֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: A man came from Baal-shalishah and he brought the agent of God some bread of the first reaping—twenty loaves of barley bread, and some fresh grain in his sack. And [Elisha] said, “Give it to the people and let them eat.”
Transliteration: veiysh va mivaal shalishah vayave leiysh haElohim lechem vikhuriym esheriym-lechem sheoriym vekharemel vetsikelonvo vayomer ten laam veyokhelu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מְשָׁ֣רְת֔וֹ מָ֚ה אֶתֵּ֣ן זֶ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י מֵ֣אָה אִ֑ישׁ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר תֵּ֤ן לָעָם֙ וְיֹאכֵ֔לוּ כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אָכֹ֥ל וְהוֹתֵֽר׃
Translated: His attendant replied, “How can I set this before a hundred people?” But he said, “Give it to the people and let them eat. For thus said G<small>OD</small>: They shall eat and have some left over.”
Transliteration: vayomer mesharetvo mah eten zeh lifeney meah iysh vayomer ten laam veyokhelu khiy khoh amar yehovah akhol vehvoter

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן לִפְנֵיהֶ֛ם וַיֹּאכְל֥וּ וַיּוֹתִ֖רוּ כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So he set it before them; and when they had eaten, they had some left over, as G<small>OD</small> had said.
Transliteration: vayiten lifeneyhem vayokhelu vayyvotiru khidevar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וְ֠נַעֲמָ֠ן שַׂר־צְבָ֨א מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֜ם הָיָ֣ה אִישׁ֩ גָּד֨וֹל לִפְנֵ֤י אֲדֹנָיו֙ וּנְשֻׂ֣א פָנִ֔ים כִּי־ב֛וֹ נָתַן־יְהֹוָ֥ה תְּשׁוּעָ֖ה לַאֲרָ֑ם וְהָאִ֗ישׁ הָיָ֛ה גִּבּ֥וֹר חַ֖יִל מְצֹרָֽע׃
Translated: Naaman, commander of the army of the king of Aram, was an important man to his lord and high in his favor, for through him G<small>OD</small> had granted victory to Aram. But the man, though a great warrior, was a leper.
Transliteration: venaaman shar-tseva melekhe-aram hayah iysh gadvol lifeney adonayv uneshu faniym khiy-vvo natan-yehovah teshuah laaram vehaiysh hayah givvor chayiil metsora

Hebrew: וַֽאֲרָם֙ יָצְא֣וּ גְדוּדִ֔ים וַיִּשְׁבּ֛וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נַעֲרָ֣ה קְטַנָּ֑ה וַתְּהִ֕י לִפְנֵ֖י אֵ֥שֶׁת נַעֲמָֽן׃
Translated: Once, when the Arameans were out raiding, they carried off a young girl from the land of Israel, and she became an attendant to Naaman’s wife.
Transliteration: vaaram yatseu gedudiym vayishevu meerets yisherael naarah ketanah vatehiy lifeney eshet naaman

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־גְּבִרְתָּ֔הּ אַחֲלֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י לִפְנֵ֥י הַנָּבִ֖יא אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן אָ֛ז יֶאֱסֹ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ מִצָּרַעְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: She said to her mistress, “I wish Master could come before the prophet in Samaria; he would cure him of his leprosy.”
Transliteration: vatomer el-geviretah achaley adoniy lifeney hanaviy asher veshomervon az yeesof otvo mitsaraetvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕א וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לַאדֹנָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר כָּזֹ֤את וְכָזֹאת֙ דִּבְּרָ֣ה הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵאֶ֥רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: [Naaman] went and told his lord just what the girl from the land of Israel had said.
Transliteration: vayavo vayaged ladonayv lemor khazot vekhazot diverah hanaarah asher meerets yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲרָם֙ לֶךְ־בֹּ֔א וְאֶשְׁלְחָ֥ה סֵ֖פֶר אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֩לֶךְ֩ וַיִּקַּ֨ח בְּיָד֜וֹ עֶ֣שֶׂר כִּכְּרֵי־כֶ֗סֶף וְשֵׁ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ זָהָ֔ב וְעֶ֖שֶׂר חֲלִיפ֥וֹת בְּגָדִֽים׃
Translated:
And the king of Aram said, “Go to the king of Israel, and I will send along a letter.”
He set out, taking with him ten talents of silver, six thousand shekels of gold, and ten changes of clothing.
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-aram lekhe-vo veeshelechah sefer el-melekhe yisherael vayelekhe vayikach veyadvo esher khikherey-khesef vesheshet alafiym zahav veesher chaliyfvot vegadiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֣א הַסֵּ֔פֶר אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר וְעַתָּ֗ה כְּב֨וֹא הַסֵּ֤פֶר הַזֶּה֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ הִנֵּ֨ה שָׁלַ֤חְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־נַעֲמָ֣ן עַבְדִּ֔י וַאֲסַפְתּ֖וֹ מִצָּרַעְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He brought the letter to the king of Israel. It read: “Now, when this letter reaches you, know that I have sent my courtier Naaman to you, that you may cure him of his leprosy.”
Transliteration: vayave hasefer el-melekhe yisherael lemor veatah khevvo hasefer hazeh eleykha hineh shalachetiy eleykha et-naaman avediy vaasafetvo mitsaraetvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כִּקְרֹא֩ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־הַסֵּ֜פֶר וַיִּקְרַ֣ע בְּגָדָ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַאֱלֹהִ֥ים אָ֙נִי֙ לְהָמִ֣ית וּֽלְהַחֲי֔וֹת כִּי־זֶה֙ שֹׁלֵ֣חַ אֵלַ֔י לֶאֱסֹ֥ף אִ֖ישׁ מִצָּרַעְתּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י אַךְ־דְּעוּ־נָא֙ וּרְא֔וּ כִּֽי־מִתְאַנֶּ֥ה ה֖וּא לִֽי׃
Translated: When the king of Israel read the letter, he rent his clothes and cried, “Am I God, to deal death or give life, that this fellow writes to me to cure a man of leprosy? Just see for yourselves that he is seeking a pretext against me!”
Transliteration: vayehiy khikero melekhe-yisherael et-hasefer vayikera vegadayv vayomer haElohim aniy lehamiyt ulehachayvot khiy-zeh sholecha elay leesof iysh mitsaraetvo khiy akhe-deu-na ureu khiy-miteaneh hu liy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ ׀ אֱלִישָׁ֣ע אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים כִּֽי־קָרַ֤ע מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָ֥מָּה קָרַ֖עְתָּ בְּגָדֶ֑יךָ יָבֹא־נָ֣א אֵלַ֔י וְיֵדַ֕ע כִּ֛י יֵ֥שׁ נָבִ֖יא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When Elisha, the agent of God, heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes, he sent a message to the king: “Why have you rent your clothes? Let him come to me, and he will learn that there is a prophet in Israel.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa eliysha iysh-haElohim khiy-kara melekhe-yisherael et-vegadayv vayishelach el-hamelekhe lemor lamah karaeta vegadeykha yavo-na elay veeida khiy eish naviy veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א נַעֲמָ֖ן בְּסוּסָ֣ו וּבְרִכְבּ֑וֹ וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד פֶּֽתַח־הַבַּ֖יִת לֶאֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: So Naaman came with his horses and chariots and halted at the door of Elisha’s house.
Transliteration: vayavo naaman vesusav uverikhevvo vayaamod fetach-havayiit leeliysha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֵלָ֛יו אֱלִישָׁ֖ע מַלְאָ֣ךְ לֵאמֹ֑ר הָל֗וֹךְ וְרָחַצְתָּ֤ שֶֽׁבַע־פְּעָמִים֙ בַּיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וְיָשֹׁ֧ב בְּשָׂרְךָ֛ לְךָ֖ וּטְהָֽר׃
Translated: Elisha sent a messenger to say to him, “Go and bathe seven times in the Jordan, and your flesh shall be restored and you shall be pure.”
Transliteration: vayishelach elayv eliysha maleakhe lemor halvokhe verachatseta sheva-feamiym vayareden veyashov vesharekha lekha utehar

Hebrew: וַיִּקְצֹ֥ף נַעֲמָ֖ן וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ הִנֵּ֨ה אָמַ֜רְתִּי אֵלַ֣י ׀ יֵצֵ֣א יָצ֗וֹא וְעָמַד֙ וְקָרָא֙ בְּשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו וְהֵנִ֥יף יָד֛וֹ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם וְאָסַ֥ף הַמְּצֹרָֽע׃
Translated: But Naaman was angered and walked away. “I thought,” he said, “he would surely come out to me, and would stand and invoke the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God by name, and would wave his hand toward the spot, and cure the affected part.
Transliteration: vayiketsof naaman vayelakhe vayomer hineh amaretiy elay eitse yatsvo veamad vekara veshem-yehovah elohayv veheniyf yadvo el-hamakvom veasaf hametsora

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֡א טוֹב֩ (אבנה) [אֲמָנָ֨ה] וּפַרְפַּ֜ר נַהֲר֣וֹת דַּמֶּ֗שֶׂק מִכֹּל֙ מֵימֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֲלֹֽא־אֶרְחַ֥ץ בָּהֶ֖ם וְטָהָ֑רְתִּי וַיִּ֖פֶן וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בְּחֵמָֽה׃
Translated: Are not the Amanah and the Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? I could bathe in them and be pure!” And he stalked off in a rage.
Transliteration: halo tvov (vnh) [amanah] ufarefar naharvot dameshek mikhol meymey yisherael halo-erechats vahem vetaharetiy vayifen vayelekhe vechemah

Hebrew: וַיִּגְּשׁ֣וּ עֲבָדָיו֮ וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ אֵלָיו֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אָבִי֙ דָּבָ֣ר גָּד֗וֹל הַנָּבִ֛יא דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ הֲל֣וֹא תַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְאַ֛ף כִּי־אָמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ רְחַ֥ץ וּטְהָֽר׃
Translated: But his servants came forward and spoke to him. “Sir,” they said, “if the prophet told you to do something difficult, would you not do it? How much more when he has only said to you, ‘Bathe and be pure.’”
Transliteration: vayigeshu avadayv vayedaveru elayv vayomeru aviy davar gadvol hanaviy diver eleykha halvo taasheh veaf khiy-amar eleykha rechats utehar

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗רֶד וַיִּטְבֹּ֤ל בַּיַּרְדֵּן֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֔ים כִּדְבַ֖ר אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיָּ֣שׇׁב בְּשָׂר֗וֹ כִּבְשַׂ֛ר נַ֥עַר קָטֹ֖ן וַיִּטְהָֽר׃
Translated: So he went down and immersed himself in the Jordan seven times, as the agent of God had bidden; and his flesh became like a little child’s, and he was pure.
Transliteration: vayered vayitevol vayareden sheva feamiym khidevar iysh haElohim vayashׇv vesharvo khiveshar naar katon vayitehar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ אֶל־אִ֨ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים ה֣וּא וְכׇֽל־מַחֲנֵ֗הוּ וַיָּבֹא֮ וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד לְפָנָיו֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּה־נָ֤א יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין אֱלֹהִים֙ בְּכׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֖י אִם־בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְעַתָּ֛ה קַח־נָ֥א בְרָכָ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ת עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Returning with his entire retinue to the agent of God, he stood before him and exclaimed, “Now I know that there is no God in the whole world except in Israel! So please accept a gift from your servant.”
Transliteration: vayashׇv el-iysh haElohim hu vekhׇl-machanehu vayavo vayaamod lefanayv vayomer hineh-na yadaetiy khiy eyn Elohim vekhׇl-haarets khiy im-veyisherael veatah kach-na verakhah meet avedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר חַי־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־עָמַ֥דְתִּי לְפָנָ֖יו אִם־אֶקָּ֑ח וַיִּפְצַר־בּ֥וֹ לָקַ֖חַת וַיְמָאֵֽן׃
Translated: But he replied, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, whom I serve, I will not accept anything.” He pressed him to accept, but he refused.
Transliteration: vayomer chay-yehovah asher-amadetiy lefanayv im-ekach vayifetsar-vvo lakachat vayemaen

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ נַעֲמָן֒ וָלֹ֕א יֻתַּן־נָ֣א לְעַבְדְּךָ֔ מַשָּׂ֥א צֶמֶד־פְּרָדִ֖ים אֲדָמָ֑ה כִּ֡י לֽוֹא־יַעֲשֶׂה֩ ע֨וֹד עַבְדְּךָ֜ עֹלָ֤ה וָזֶ֙בַח֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים כִּ֖י אִם־לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And Naaman said, “Then at least let your servant be given two mule-loads of earth; for your servant will never again offer up burnt offering or sacrifice to any god, except G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer naaman valo yutan-na leavedekha masha tsemed-feradiym adamah khiy lvo-yaasheh vod avedekha olah vazevach lelohiym acheriym khiy im-layhovah

Hebrew: לַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה יִסְלַ֥ח יְהֹוָ֖ה לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ בְּב֣וֹא אֲדֹנִ֣י בֵית־רִמּוֹן֩ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֨ת שָׁ֜מָּה וְה֣וּא ׀ נִשְׁעָ֣ן עַל־יָדִ֗י וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֵ֙יתִי֙ בֵּ֣ית רִמֹּ֔ן בְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָ֙תִי֙ בֵּ֣ית רִמֹּ֔ן יִסְלַח־(נא)־יְהֹוָ֥ה לְעַבְדְּךָ֖ בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But may G<small>OD</small> pardon your servant for this: When my master enters the temple of Rimmon to bow low in worship there, and he is leaning on my arm so that I must bow low in the temple of Rimmon—when I bow low in the temple of Rimmon, may G<small>OD</small> pardon your servant in this.”
Transliteration: ladavar hazeh yiselach yehovah leavedekha vevvo adoniy veyt-rimvon lehishetachavot shamah vehu nishean al-yadiy vehishetachaveytiy veyt rimon vehishetachavayatiy veyt rimon yiselach-(n)-yehovah leavedekha vadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ לֵ֣ךְ לְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מֵאִתּ֖וֹ כִּבְרַת־אָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
And he said to him, “Go in peace.”
When he had gone some distance from him,
Transliteration: vayomer lvo lekhe leshalvom vayelekhe meitvo khiverat-arets {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר גֵּיחֲזִ֗י נַ֘עַר֮ אֱלִישָׁ֣ע אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִים֒ הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ חָשַׂ֣ךְ אֲדֹנִ֗י אֶֽת־נַעֲמָ֤ן הָאֲרַמִּי֙ הַזֶּ֔ה מִקַּ֥חַת מִיָּד֖וֹ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֑יא חַי־יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־אִם־רַ֣צְתִּי אַחֲרָ֔יו וְלָקַחְתִּ֥י מֵאִתּ֖וֹ מְאֽוּמָה׃
Translated: Gehazi, the attendant of Elisha the agent of God, thought: “My master has let that Aramean Naaman off without accepting what he brought! As G<small>OD</small> lives, I will run after him and get something from him.”
Transliteration: vayomer geychaziy naar eliysha iysh-haElohim hineh chashakhe adoniy et-naaman haaramiy hazeh mikachat miyadvo et asher-heviy chay-yehovah khiy-im-ratsetiy acharayv velakachetiy meitvo meumah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדֹּ֥ף גֵּיחֲזִ֖י אַחֲרֵ֣י נַעֲמָ֑ן וַיִּרְאֶ֤ה נַֽעֲמָן֙ רָ֣ץ אַחֲרָ֔יו וַיִּפֹּ֞ל מֵעַ֧ל הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֛ה לִקְרָאת֖וֹ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הֲשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: So Gehazi hurried after Naaman. When Naaman saw someone running after him, he alighted from his chariot to meet him and said, “Is all well?”
Transliteration: vayiredof geychaziy acharey naaman vayireeh naaman rats acharayv vayifol meal hamerekhavah likeratvo vayomer hashalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ שָׁל֗וֹם אֲדֹנִי֮ שְׁלָחַ֣נִי לֵאמֹר֒ הִנֵּ֣ה עַתָּ֡ה זֶ֠ה בָּ֣אוּ אֵלַ֧י שְׁנֵֽי־נְעָרִ֛ים מֵהַ֥ר אֶפְרַ֖יִם מִבְּנֵ֣י הַנְּבִיאִ֑ים תְּנָה־נָּ֤א לָהֶם֙ כִּכַּר־כֶּ֔סֶף וּשְׁתֵּ֖י חֲלִפ֥וֹת בְּגָדִֽים׃
Translated: “All is well,” he replied. “My master has sent me to say: Two youths, disciples of the prophets, have just come to me from the hill country of Ephraim. Please give them a talent of silver and two changes of clothing.”
Transliteration: vayomer shalvom adoniy shelachaniy lemor hineh atah zeh vau elay sheney-neariym mehar eferayiim miveney haneviyiym tenah-na lahem khikhar-khesef ushetey chalifvot vegadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר נַעֲמָ֔ן הוֹאֵ֖ל קַ֣ח כִּכָּרָ֑יִם וַיִּפְרׇץ־בּ֗וֹ וַיָּ֩צַר֩ כִּכְּרַ֨יִם כֶּ֜סֶף בִּשְׁנֵ֣י חֲרִטִ֗ים וּשְׁתֵּי֙ חֲלִפ֣וֹת בְּגָדִ֔ים וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֣י נְעָרָ֔יו וַיִּשְׂא֖וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Naaman said, “Please take two talents.” He urged him, and he wrapped the two talents of silver in two bags and gave them, along with two changes of clothes, to two of his servants, who carried them ahead of him.
Transliteration: vayomer naaman hvoel kach khikharayiim vayiferׇts-vvo vayatsar khikherayiim khesef visheney charitiym ushetey chalifvot vegadiym vayiten el-sheney nearayv vayisheu lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־הָעֹ֔פֶל וַיִּקַּ֥ח מִיָּדָ֖ם וַיִּפְקֹ֣ד בַּבָּ֑יִת וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַיֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: When [Gehazi] arrived at the citadel, he took [the things] from them and deposited them in the house. Then he dismissed the men and they went their way.
Transliteration: vayavo el-haofel vayikach miyadam vayifekod vavayiit vayeshalach et-haanashiym vayelekhu

Hebrew: וְהוּא־בָא֙ וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֱלִישָׁ֔ע (מאן) [מֵאַ֖יִן] גֵּחֲזִ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹא־הָלַ֥ךְ עַבְדְּךָ֖ אָ֥נֶה וָאָֽנָה׃
Translated: He entered and stood before his master; and Elisha said to him, “Where have you been, Gehazi?” He replied, “Your servant has not gone anywhere.”
Transliteration: vehu-va vayaamod el-adonayv vayomer elayv eliysha (mn) [meayiin] gechaziy vayomer lo-halakhe avedekha aneh vaanah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ לֹֽא־לִבִּ֣י הָלַ֔ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר הָפַךְ־אִ֛ישׁ מֵעַ֥ל מֶרְכַּבְתּ֖וֹ לִקְרָאתֶ֑ךָ הַעֵ֞ת לָקַ֤חַת אֶת־הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ וְלָקַ֣חַת בְּגָדִ֔ים וְזֵיתִ֤ים וּכְרָמִים֙ וְצֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר וַעֲבָדִ֖ים וּשְׁפָחֽוֹת׃
Translated: Then [Elisha] said to him, “Did not my spirit go along when the man got down from his chariot to meet you? Is this a time to take money in order to buy clothing and olive groves and vineyards, sheep and oxen, and male and female slaves?
Transliteration: vayomer elayv lo-liviy halakhe khaasher hafakhe-iysh meal merekhavetvo likeratekha haet lakachat et-hakhesef velakachat vegadiym vezeytiym ukheramiym vetson uvakar vaavadiym ushefachvot

Hebrew: וְצָרַ֤עַת נַֽעֲמָן֙ תִּֽדְבַּק־בְּךָ֔ וּֽבְזַרְעֲךָ֖ לְעוֹלָ֑ם וַיֵּצֵ֥א מִלְּפָנָ֖יו מְצֹרָ֥ע כַּשָּֽׁלֶג׃
Translated: Surely, the leprosy of Naaman shall cling to you and to your descendants forever.” And as [Gehazi] left his presence, he was snow-white with leprosy.
Transliteration: vetsaraat naaman tidevak-vekha uvezareakha levolam vayetse milefanayv metsora khashaleg

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ בְנֵֽי־הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים אֶל־אֱלִישָׁ֑ע הִנֵּה־נָ֣א הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנַ֜חְנוּ יֹשְׁבִ֥ים שָׁ֛ם לְפָנֶ֖יךָ צַ֥ר מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The disciples of the prophets said to Elisha, “See, the place where we live under your direction is too cramped for us.
Transliteration: vayomeru veney-haneviyiym el-eliysha hineh-na hamakvom asher anachenu yosheviym sham lefaneykha tsar mimenu

Hebrew: נֵלְכָה־נָּ֣א עַד־הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן וְנִקְחָ֤ה מִשָּׁם֙ אִ֚ישׁ קוֹרָ֣ה אֶחָ֔ת וְנַעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֥נוּ שָׁ֛ם מָק֖וֹם לָשֶׁ֣בֶת שָׁ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: Let us go to the Jordan, and let us each get a log there and build quarters there for ourselves to live in.” “Do so,” he replied.
Transliteration: nelekhah-na ad-hayareden venikechah misham iysh kvorah echat venaasheh-lanu sham makvom lashevet sham vayomer lekhu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד ה֥וֹאֶל נָ֖א וְלֵ֣ךְ אֶת־עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲנִ֥י אֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Then one of them said, “Will you please come along with your servants?” “Yes, I will come,” he said;
Transliteration: vayomer haechad hvoel na velekhe et-avadeykha vayomer aniy elekhe

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אִתָּ֑ם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔נָה וַֽיִּגְזְר֖וּ הָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: and he accompanied them. So they went to the Jordan and cut timber.
Transliteration: vayelekhe itam vayavou hayaredenah vayigezeru haetsiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הָֽאֶחָד֙ מַפִּ֣יל הַקּוֹרָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַבַּרְזֶ֖ל נָפַ֣ל אֶל־הַמָּ֑יִם וַיִּצְעַ֥ק וַיֹּ֛אמֶר אֲהָ֥הּ אֲדֹנִ֖י וְה֥וּא שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: As one of them was felling a trunk, the iron ax head fell into the water. And he cried aloud, “Alas, master, it was a borrowed one!”
Transliteration: vayehiy haechad mafiyl hakvorah veet-havarezel nafal el-hamayiim vayitseak vayomer ahah adoniy vehu shaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אָ֣נָה נָפָ֑ל וַיַּרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ אֶת־הַמָּק֔וֹם וַיִּקְצׇב־עֵץ֙ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ־שָׁ֔מָּה וַיָּ֖צֶף הַבַּרְזֶֽל׃
Translated: “Where did it fall?” asked the agent of God. He showed him the spot; and he cut off a stick and threw it in, and he made the ax head float.
Transliteration: vayomer iysh-haElohim anah nafal vayareehu et-hamakvom vayiketsׇv-ets vayashelekhe-shamah vayatsef havarezel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הָ֣רֶם לָ֑ךְ וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח יָד֖וֹ וַיִּקָּחֵֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: “Pick it up,” he said; so he reached out and took it.
Transliteration: vayomer harem lakhe vayishelach yadvo vayikachehu {f}

Hebrew: וּמֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם הָיָ֥ה נִלְחָ֖ם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּוָּעַץ֙ אֶל־עֲבָדָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶל־מְק֛וֹם פְּלֹנִ֥י אַלְמֹנִ֖י תַּחֲנֹתִֽי׃
Translated: While the king of Aram was waging war against Israel, he took counsel with his officers and said, “I will encamp in such and such a place.”
Transliteration: umelekhe aram hayah nilecham veyisherael vayivaats el-avadayv lemor el-mekvom feloniy alemoniy tachanotiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים אֶל־מֶ֤לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִשָּׁ֕מֶר מֵעֲבֹ֖ר הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּי־שָׁ֖ם אֲרָ֥ם נְחִתִּֽים׃
Translated: But the agent of God sent word to the king of Israel, “Take care not to pass through that place, for the Arameans are encamped there.”
Transliteration: vayishelach iysh haElohim el-melekhe yisherael lemor hishamer meavor hamakvom hazeh khiy-sham aram nechitiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶֽל־הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַר־ל֧וֹ אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים וְהִזְהִירֹ֖ה וְנִשְׁמַ֣ר שָׁ֑ם לֹ֥א אַחַ֖ת וְלֹ֥א שְׁתָּֽיִם׃
Translated: So the king of Israel sent word to the place of which the agent of God had told him. Time and again he alerted such a place and took precautions there.
Transliteration: vayishelach melekhe yisherael el-hamakvom asher amar-lvo iysh-haElohim vehizehiyroh venishemar sham lo achat velo shetayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּסָּעֵר֙ לֵ֣ב מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֔ם עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶל־עֲבָדָיו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם הֲלוֹא֙ תַּגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֔י מִ֥י מִשֶּׁלָּ֖נוּ אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Greatly agitated about this matter, the king of Aram summoned his officers and said to them, “Tell me! Who of us is on the side of the king of Israel?”
Transliteration: vayisaer lev melekhe-aram al-hadavar hazeh vayikera el-avadayv vayomer aleyhem halvo tagiydu liy miy mishelanu el-melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַחַ֣ד מֵעֲבָדָ֔יו ל֖וֹא אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּֽי־אֱלִישָׁ֤ע הַנָּבִיא֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יַגִּיד֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶ֨ת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּ֖ר בַּחֲדַ֥ר מִשְׁכָּבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “No one, my lord king,” said one of the officers. “Elisha, that prophet in Israel, tells the king of Israel the very words you speak in your bedroom.”
Transliteration: vayomer achad meavadayv lvo adoniy hamelekhe khiy-eliysha hanaviy asher veyisherael yagiyd lemelekhe yisherael et-hadevariym asher tedaver vachadar mishekhavekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְכ֤וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֵיכֹ֣ה ה֔וּא וְאֶשְׁלַ֖ח וְאֶקָּחֵ֑הוּ וַיֻּגַּד־ל֥וֹ לֵאמֹ֖ר הִנֵּ֥ה בְדֹתָֽן׃
Translated: “Go find out where he is,” he said, “so that I can have him seized.” It was reported to him that [Elisha] was in Dothan;
Transliteration: vayomer lekhu ureu eykhoh hu veeshelach veekachehu vayugad-lvo lemor hineh vedotan

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח־שָׁ֛מָּה סוּסִ֥ים וְרֶ֖כֶב וְחַ֣יִל כָּבֵ֑ד וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ לַ֔יְלָה וַיַּקִּ֖פוּ עַל־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: so he sent horses and chariots there and a strong force. They arrived at night and encircled the town.
Transliteration: vayishelach-shamah susiym verekhev vechayiil khaved vayavou layelah vayakifu al-haiyr

Hebrew: וַ֠יַּשְׁכֵּ֠ם מְשָׁרֵ֨ת אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים֮ לָקוּם֒ וַיֵּצֵ֕א וְהִנֵּה־חַ֛יִל סוֹבֵ֥ב אֶת־הָעִ֖יר וְס֣וּס וָרָ֑כֶב וַיֹּ֨אמֶר נַעֲר֥וֹ אֵלָ֛יו אֲהָ֥הּ אֲדֹנִ֖י אֵיכָ֥ה נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: When the attendant of the agent of God rose early and went outside, he saw a force, with horses and chariots, surrounding the town. “Alas, master, what shall we do?” his servant asked him.
Transliteration: vayashekhem mesharet iysh haElohim lakum vayetse vehineh-chayiil svovev et-haiyr vesus varakhev vayomer naarvo elayv ahah adoniy eykhah naasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תִּירָ֑א כִּ֤י רַבִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֔נוּ מֵאֲשֶׁ֖ר אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: “Have no fear,” he replied. “There are more on our side than on theirs.”
Transliteration: vayomer al-tiyra khiy raviym asher itanu measher votam

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֤ל אֱלִישָׁע֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר יְהֹוָ֕ה פְּקַח־נָ֥א אֶת־עֵינָ֖יו וְיִרְאֶ֑ה וַיִּפְקַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־עֵינֵ֣י הַנַּ֔עַר וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֨ה הָהָ֜ר מָלֵ֨א סוּסִ֥ים וְרֶ֛כֶב אֵ֖שׁ סְבִיבֹ֥ת אֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: Then Elisha prayed: “E<small>TERNAL</small> One, open his eyes and let him see.” And G<small>OD</small> opened the servant’s eyes and he saw the hills all around Elisha covered with horses and chariots of fire.
Transliteration: vayitefalel eliysha vayomar yehovah fekach-na et-eynayv veyireeh vayifekach yehovah et-eyney hanaar vayare vehineh hahar male susiym verekhev esh seviyvot eliysha

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְדוּ֮ אֵלָיו֒ וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֨ל אֱלִישָׁ֤ע אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר הַךְ־נָ֥א אֶת־הַגּוֹי־הַזֶּ֖ה בַּסַּנְוֵרִ֑ים וַיַּכֵּ֥ם בַּסַּנְוֵרִ֖ים כִּדְבַ֥ר אֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: [The Arameans] came down against him, and Elisha prayed to G<small>OD</small>: “Please strike this people with a blinding light.” And they were struck with a blinding light, as Elisha had asked.
Transliteration: vayeredu elayv vayitefalel eliysha el-yehovah vayomar hakhe-na et-hagvoy-hazeh vasaneveriym vayakhem vasaneveriym khidevar eliysha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם אֱלִישָׁ֗ע לֹ֣א זֶ֣ה הַדֶּ֘רֶךְ֮ וְלֹ֣א זֹ֣ה הָעִיר֒ לְכ֣וּ אַחֲרַ֔י וְאוֹלִ֣יכָה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶל־הָאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תְּבַקֵּשׁ֑וּן וַיֹּ֥לֶךְ אוֹתָ֖ם שֹׁמְרֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: Elisha said to them, “This is not the road, and that is not the town; follow me, and I will lead you to the man you want.” And he led them to Samaria.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem eliysha lo zeh haderekhe velo zoh haiyr lekhu acharay vevoliykhah etekhem el-haiysh asher tevakeshun vayolekhe votam shomervonah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֮ כְּבֹאָ֣ם שֹׁמְרוֹן֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֔ע יְהֹוָ֕ה פְּקַ֥ח אֶת־עֵֽינֵי־אֵ֖לֶּה וְיִרְא֑וּ וַיִּפְקַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־עֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּרְא֕וּ וְהִנֵּ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: When they entered Samaria, Elisha said, “O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, open the eyes of these men so that they may see.” G<small>OD</small> opened their eyes and they saw that they were inside Samaria.
Transliteration: vayehiy khevoam shomervon vayomer eliysha yehovah fekach et-eyney-eleh veyireu vayifekach yehovah et-eyneyhem vayireu vehineh vetvokhe shomervon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־אֱלִישָׁ֔ע כִּרְאֹת֖וֹ אוֹתָ֑ם הַאַכֶּ֥ה אַכֶּ֖ה אָבִֽי׃
Translated: When the king of Israel saw them, he said to Elisha, “Father, shall I strike them down?”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-yisherael el-eliysha khireotvo votam haakheh akheh aviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א תַכֶּ֔ה הַאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁבִ֛יתָ בְּחַרְבְּךָ֥ וּֽבְקַשְׁתְּךָ֖ אַתָּ֣ה מַכֶּ֑ה שִׂים֩ לֶ֨חֶם וָמַ֜יִם לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם וְיֹֽאכְלוּ֙ וְיִשְׁתּ֔וּ וְיֵלְכ֖וּ אֶל־אֲדֹנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: “No, do not,” he replied. “Did you take them captive with your sword and bow that you would strike them down? Rather, set food and drink before them, and let them eat and drink and return to their master.”
Transliteration: vayomer lo takheh haasher shaviyta vecharevekha uvekashetekha atah makheh shiym lechem vamayiim lifeneyhem veyokhelu veyishetu veeilekhu el-adoneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֶ֨ה לָהֶ֜ם כֵּרָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֗ה וַיֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ וַיִּשְׁתּ֔וּ וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֔ם וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אֶל־אֲדֹֽנֵיהֶ֑ם וְלֹא־יָ֤סְפוּ עוֹד֙ גְּדוּדֵ֣י אֲרָ֔ם לָב֖וֹא בְּאֶ֥רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: So he prepared a lavish feast for them and, after they had eaten and drunk, he let them go, and they returned to their master. And the Aramean bands stopped invading the land of Israel.
Transliteration: vayikhereh lahem kherah gedvolah vayokhelu vayishetu vayeshalechem vayelekhu el-adoneyhem velo-yasefu vod gedudey aram lavvo veerets yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיִּקְבֹּ֛ץ בֶּן־הֲדַ֥ד מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֖ם אֶת־כׇּל־מַחֲנֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֕עַל וַיָּ֖צַר עַל־שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: Sometime later, King Ben-hadad of Aram mustered his entire army and marched upon Samaria and besieged it.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayikevots ven-hadad melekhe-aram et-khׇl-machanehu vayaal vayatsar al-shomervon

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י רָעָ֤ב גָּדוֹל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וְהִנֵּ֖ה צָרִ֣ים עָלֶ֑יהָ עַ֣ד הֱי֤וֹת רֹאשׁ־חֲמוֹר֙ בִּשְׁמֹנִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף וְרֹ֛בַע הַקַּ֥ב (חרי) [דִּב־]יוֹנִ֖ים בַּחֲמִשָּׁה־כָֽסֶף׃
Translated: There was a great famine in Samaria, and the siege continued until a donkey’s head sold for eighty [shekels] of silver and a quarter of a kab of doves’ dung for five shekels.
Transliteration: vayehiy raav gadvol veshomervon vehineh tsariym aleyha ad heyvot rosh-chamvor vishemoniym khesef verova hakav (chry) [div-]yvoniym vachamishah-khasef

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עֹבֵ֖ר עַל־הַחֹמָ֑ה וְאִשָּׁ֗ה צָעֲקָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הוֹשִׁ֖יעָה אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Once, when the king of Israel was walking on the city wall, a woman cried out to him: “Help me, Your Majesty!”
Transliteration: vayehiy melekhe yisherael over al-hachomah veishah tsaakah elayv lemor hvoshiyah adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַל־יוֹשִׁעֵ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵאַ֖יִן אוֹשִׁיעֵ֑ךְ הֲמִן־הַגֹּ֖רֶן א֥וֹ מִן־הַיָּֽקֶב׃
Translated: “Don’t [ask me],” he replied. “Let G<small>OD</small> help you! Where could I get help for you, from the threshing floor or from the winepress?
Transliteration: vayomer al-yvoshiekhe yehovah meayiin voshiyekhe hamin-hagoren vo min-hayakev

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר־לָ֥הּ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מַה־לָּ֑ךְ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר הָאִשָּׁ֨ה הַזֹּ֜את אָמְרָ֣ה אֵלַ֗י תְּנִ֤י אֶת־בְּנֵךְ֙ וְנֹאכְלֶ֣נּוּ הַיּ֔וֹם וְאֶת־בְּנִ֖י נֹאכַ֥ל מָחָֽר׃
Translated: But what troubles you?” the king asked her. The woman answered, “That woman said to me, ‘Give up your son and we will eat him today; and tomorrow we’ll eat my son.’
Transliteration: vayomer-lah hamelekhe mah-lakhe vatomer haishah hazot amerah elay teniy et-venekhe venokhelenu hayyvom veet-veniy nokhal machar

Hebrew: וַנְּבַשֵּׁ֥ל אֶת־בְּנִ֖י וַנֹּאכְלֵ֑הוּ וָאֹמַ֨ר אֵלֶ֜יהָ בַּיּ֣וֹם הָאַחֵ֗ר תְּנִ֤י אֶת־בְּנֵךְ֙ וְנֹ֣אכְלֶ֔נּוּ וַתַּחְבִּ֖א אֶת־בְּנָֽהּ׃
Translated: So we cooked my son and we ate him. The next day I said to her, ‘Give up your son and let’s eat him’; but she hid her son.”
Transliteration: vanevashel et-veniy vanokhelehu vaomar eleyha vayyvom haacher teniy et-venekhe venokhelenu vatachevi et-venah
