Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֤י הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ וַיִּקְרַ֣ע אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְה֖וּא עֹבֵ֣ר עַל־הַחֹמָ֑ה וַיַּ֣רְא הָעָ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַשַּׂ֛ק עַל־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ מִבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: When the king heard what the woman said, he rent his clothes; and as he walked along the wall, the people could see that he was wearing sackcloth underneath.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa hamelekhe et-diverey haishah vayikera et-vegadayv vehu over al-hachomah vayare haam vehineh hashak al-vesharvo mivayiit

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כֹּֽה־יַעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְכֹ֣ה יוֹסִ֑ף אִֽם־יַעֲמֹ֞ד רֹ֣אשׁ אֱלִישָׁ֧ע בֶּן־שָׁפָ֛ט עָלָ֖יו הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: He said, “Thus and more may God do to me if the head of Elisha son of Shaphat remains on his shoulders today.”
Transliteration: vayomer khoh-yaasheh-liy Elohim vekhoh yvosif im-yaamod rosh eliysha ven-shafat alayv hayyvom

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁע֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּבֵית֔וֹ וְהַזְּקֵנִ֖ים יֹשְׁבִ֣ים אִתּ֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אִ֜ישׁ מִלְּפָנָ֗יו בְּטֶ֣רֶם יָבֹא֩ הַמַּלְאָ֨ךְ אֵלָ֜יו וְה֣וּא ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֗ים הַרְּאִיתֶם֙ כִּֽי־שָׁלַ֞ח בֶּן־הַֽמְרַצֵּ֤חַ הַזֶּה֙ לְהָסִ֣יר אֶת־רֹאשִׁ֔י רְא֣וּ ׀ כְּבֹ֣א הַמַּלְאָ֗ךְ סִגְר֤וּ הַדֶּ֙לֶת֙ וּלְחַצְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בַּדֶּ֔לֶת הֲל֗וֹא ק֛וֹל רַגְלֵ֥י אֲדֹנָ֖יו אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: Now Elisha was sitting at home and the elders were sitting with him. The king had sent one of his men ahead; but before that messenger arrived, Elisha said to the elders, “Do you see—that murderer has sent someone to cut off my head! Watch when the messenger comes, and shut the door and hold the door fast against him. No doubt the sound of his master’s footsteps will follow.”
Transliteration: veeliysha yoshev veveytvo vehazekeniym yosheviym itvo vayishelach iysh milefanayv veterem yavo hamaleakhe elayv vehu amar el-hazekeniym hareiytem khiy-shalach ven-hameratsecha hazeh lehasiyr et-roshiy reu khevo hamaleakhe sigeru hadelet ulechatsetem otvo vadelet halvo kvol rageley adonayv acharayv

Hebrew: עוֹדֶ֙נּוּ֙ מְדַבֵּ֣ר עִמָּ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַמַּלְאָ֖ךְ יֹרֵ֣ד אֵלָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּה־זֹ֤את הָרָעָה֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה מָה־אוֹחִ֥יל לַיהֹוָ֖ה עֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated: While he was still talking to them, the messenger came to him and said, “This calamity is from G<small>OD</small>. What more can I hope for from G<small>OD</small> ?”
Transliteration: vodenu medaver imam vehineh hamaleakhe yored elayv vayomer hineh-zot haraah meet yehovah mah-vochiyl layhovah vod {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֔ע שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה כָּעֵ֤ת ׀ מָחָר֙ סְאָה־סֹ֣לֶת בְּשֶׁ֗קֶל וְסָאתַ֧יִם שְׂעֹרִ֛ים בְּשֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשַׁ֥עַר שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: And Elisha replied, “Hear the word of GOD. Thus said GOD: This time tomorrow, a seah of choice flour shall sell for a shekel at the gate of Samaria, and two seahs of barley for a shekel.”
Transliteration: vayomer eliysha shimeu devar-yehovah khoh amar yehovah khaet machar seah-solet veshekel vesatayiim sheoriym veshekel veshaar shomervon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן הַשָּׁלִ֡ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־לַמֶּ֩לֶךְ֩ נִשְׁעָ֨ן עַל־יָד֜וֹ אֶת־אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ הִנֵּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה עֹשֶׂ֤ה אֲרֻבּוֹת֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֔יִם הֲיִֽהְיֶ֖ה הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנְּכָ֤ה רֹאֶה֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ וּמִשָּׁ֖ם לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The aide on whose arm the king was leaning spoke up and said to the agent of God, “Even if G<small>OD</small> were to make windows in the sky, could this come to pass?” And he retorted, “You shall see it with your own eyes, but you shall not eat of it.”
Transliteration: vayaan hashaliysh asher-lamelekhe nishean al-yadvo et-iysh haElohim vayomar hineh yehovah osheh aruvvot vashamayiim hayiheyeh hadavar hazeh vayomer hinekhah roeh veeyneykha umisham lo tokhel {f}

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעָ֧ה אֲנָשִׁ֛ים הָי֥וּ מְצֹרָעִ֖ים פֶּ֣תַח הַשָּׁ֑עַר וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֔הוּ מָ֗ה אֲנַ֛חְנוּ יֹשְׁבִ֥ים פֹּ֖ה עַד־מָֽתְנוּ׃
Translated: There were four men, lepers, outside the gate. They said to one another, “Why should we sit here waiting for death?
Transliteration: vearevaah anashiym hayu metsoraiym fetach hashaar vayomeru iysh el-reehu mah anachenu yosheviym foh ad-matenu

Hebrew: אִם־אָמַ֩רְנוּ֩ נָב֨וֹא הָעִ֜יר וְהָרָעָ֤ב בָּעִיר֙ וָמַ֣תְנוּ שָׁ֔ם וְאִם־יָשַׁ֥בְנוּ פֹ֖ה וָמָ֑תְנוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה לְכוּ֙ וְנִפְּלָה֙ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה אֲרָ֔ם אִם־יְחַיֻּ֣נוּ נִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְאִם־יְמִיתֻ֖נוּ וָמָֽתְנוּ׃
Translated: If we decide to go into the town, what with the famine in the town, we shall die there; and if we just sit here, still we die. Come, let us desert to the Aramean camp. If they let us live, we shall live; and if they put us to death, we shall but die.”
Transliteration: im-amarenu navvo haiyr veharaav vaiyr vamatenu sham veim-yashavenu foh vamatenu veatah lekhu venifelah el-machaneh aram im-yechayunu nicheyeh veim-yemiytunu vamatenu

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֣מוּ בַנֶּ֔שֶׁף לָב֖וֹא אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה אֲרָ֑ם וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ עַד־קְצֵה֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה אֲרָ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵֽין־שָׁ֖ם אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: They set out at twilight for the Aramean camp; but when they came to the edge of the Aramean camp, there was no one there.
Transliteration: vayakumu vaneshef lavvo el-machaneh aram vayavou ad-ketseh machaneh aram vehineh eyn-sham iysh

Hebrew: וַאדֹנָ֞י הִשְׁמִ֣יעַ ׀ אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֣ה אֲרָ֗ם ק֥וֹל רֶ֙כֶב֙ ק֣וֹל ס֔וּס ק֖וֹל חַ֣יִל גָּד֑וֹל וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֗יו הִנֵּ֣ה שָֽׂכַר־עָלֵ֩ינוּ֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־מַלְכֵ֧י הַחִתִּ֛ים וְאֶת־מַלְכֵ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם לָב֥וֹא עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: For [God] had caused the Aramean camp to hear a sound of chariots, a sound of horses—the din of a huge army. They said to one another, “The king of Israel must have hired the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Mizraim to attack us!”
Transliteration: vadonay hishemiya et-machaneh aram kvol rekhev kvol sus kvol chayiil gadvol vayomeru iysh el-achiyv hineh shakhar-aleynu melekhe yisherael et-malekhey hachitiym veet-malekhey mitserayiim lavvo aleynu

Hebrew: וַיָּק֘וּמוּ֮ וַיָּנ֣וּסוּ בַנֶּ֒שֶׁף֒ וַיַּעַזְב֣וּ אֶת־אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־סֽוּסֵיהֶם֙ וְאֶת־חֲמֹ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁר־הִ֑יא וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ אֶל־נַפְשָֽׁם׃
Translated: And they fled headlong in the twilight, abandoning their tents and horses and donkeys—the [entire] camp just as it was—as they fled for their lives.
Transliteration: vayakumu vayanusu vaneshef vayaazevu et-ׇholeyhem veet-suseyhem veet-chamoreyhem hamachaneh khaasher-hiy vayanusu el-nafesham

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֩אוּ֩ הַֽמְצֹרָעִ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה עַד־קְצֵ֣ה הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אֶל־אֹ֤הֶל אֶחָד֙ וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׁתּ֔וּ וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ מִשָּׁ֗ם כֶּ֤סֶף וְזָהָב֙ וּבְגָדִ֔ים וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ וַיַּטְמִ֑נוּ וַיָּשֻׁ֗בוּ וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל אַחֵ֔ר וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ מִשָּׁ֔ם וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ וַיַּטְמִֽנוּ׃
Translated: When those lepers came to the edge of the camp, they went into one of the tents and ate and drank; then they carried off silver and gold and clothing from there and buried it. They came back and went into another tent, and they carried off what was there and buried it.
Transliteration: vayavou hametsoraiym haeleh ad-ketseh hamachaneh vayavou el-ohel echad vayokhelu vayishetu vayisheu misham khesef vezahav uvegadiym vayelekhu vayateminu vayashuvu vayavou el-ohel acher vayisheu misham vayelekhu vayateminu

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ לֹא־כֵ֣ן ׀ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ עֹשִׂ֗ים הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ יוֹם־בְּשֹׂרָ֣ה ה֔וּא וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ מַחְשִׁ֗ים וְחִכִּ֛ינוּ עַד־א֥וֹר הַבֹּ֖קֶר וּמְצָאָ֣נוּ עָו֑וֹן וְעַתָּה֙ לְכ֣וּ וְנָבֹ֔אָה וְנַגִּ֖ידָה בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then they said to one another, “We are not doing right. This is a day of good news, and we are keeping silent! If we wait until the light of morning, we shall incur guilt. Come, let us go and inform the king’s palace.”
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh el-reehu lo-khen anachenu oshiym hayyvom hazeh yvom-veshorah hu vaanachenu macheshiym vechikhiynu ad-vor havoker umetsaanu avvon veatah lekhu venavoah venagiydah veyt hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ וַֽיִּקְרְאוּ֮ אֶל־שֹׁעֵ֣ר הָעִיר֒ וַיַּגִּ֤ידוּ לָהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֚אנוּ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה אֲרָ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֧ה אֵֽין־שָׁ֛ם אִ֖ישׁ וְק֣וֹל אָדָ֑ם כִּ֣י אִם־הַסּ֤וּס אָסוּר֙ וְהַחֲמ֣וֹר אָס֔וּר וְאֹהָלִ֖ים כַּאֲשֶׁר־הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: They went and called out to the gatekeepers of the city and told them, “We have been to the Aramean camp. There is not a soul there, nor any human sound; but the horses are tethered and the donkeys are tethered and the tents are undisturbed.”
Transliteration: vayavou vayikereu el-shoer haiyr vayagiydu lahem lemor vanu el-machaneh aram vehineh eyn-sham iysh vekvol adam khiy im-hasus asur vehachamvor asur veohaliym khaasher-hemah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֖א הַשֹּׁעֲרִ֑ים וַיַּגִּ֕ידוּ בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ פְּנִֽימָה׃
Translated: The gatekeepers called out, and the news was passed on into the king’s palace.
Transliteration: vayikera hashoariym vayagiydu veyt hamelekhe feniymah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לַ֗יְלָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדָ֔יו אַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א לָכֶ֔ם אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שׂוּ לָ֖נוּ אֲרָ֑ם יָדְע֞וּ כִּֽי־רְעֵבִ֣ים אֲנַ֗חְנוּ וַיֵּֽצְא֤וּ מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֙ לְהֵחָבֵ֤ה (בהשדה) [בַשָּׂדֶה֙] לֵאמֹ֔ר כִּֽי־יֵצְא֤וּ מִן־הָעִיר֙ וְנִתְפְּשֵׂ֣ם חַיִּ֔ים וְאֶל־הָעִ֖יר נָבֹֽא׃
Translated: The king rose in the night and said to his courtiers, “I will tell you what the Arameans have done to us. They know that we are starving, so they have gone out of camp and hidden in the fields, thinking: When they come out of the town, we will take them alive and get into the town.”
Transliteration: vayakׇm hamelekhe layelah vayomer el-avadayv agiydah-na lakhem et asher-ashu lanu aram yadeu khiy-reeviym anachenu vayetseu min-hamachaneh lehechaveh (vhshdh) [vashadeh] lemor khiy-eitseu min-haiyr venitefeshem chayiym veel-haiyr navo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ אֶחָ֨ד מֵעֲבָדָ֜יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר וְיִקְחוּ־נָ֞א חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה מִן־הַסּוּסִים֮ הַֽנִּשְׁאָרִים֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁאֲרוּ־בָהּ֒ הִנָּ֗ם כְּכׇל־[הֲמ֤וֹן] (ההמון) יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁאֲרוּ־בָ֔הּ הִנָּ֕ם כְּכׇל־הֲמ֥וֹן יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־תָּ֑מּוּ וְנִשְׁלְחָ֖ה וְנִרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: But one of the courtiers spoke up, “Let a few of the remaining horses that are still here be taken—they are like those that are left here of the whole multitude of Israel, out of the whole multitude of Israel that have perished—and let us send and find out.”
Transliteration: vayaan echad meavadayv vayomer veyikechu-na chamishah min-hasusiym hanisheariym asher nishearu-vah hinam khekhׇl-[hamvon] (hhmvn) yisherael asher nishearu-vah hinam khekhׇl-hamvon yisherael asher-tamu venishelechah venireeh

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֕וּ שְׁנֵ֖י רֶ֣כֶב סוּסִ֑ים וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אַחֲרֵ֧י מַֽחֲנֵה־אֲרָ֛ם לֵאמֹ֖ר לְכ֥וּ וּרְאֽוּ׃
Translated: They took two teams of horses and the king sent them after the Aramean army, saying, “Go and find out.”
Transliteration: vayikechu sheney rekhev susiym vayishelach hamelekhe acharey machaneh-aram lemor lekhu ureu

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֣וּ אַחֲרֵיהֶם֮ עַד־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ וְהִנֵּ֣ה כׇל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ מְלֵאָ֤ה בְגָדִים֙ וְכֵלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־הִשְׁלִ֥יכוּ אֲרָ֖ם (בהחפזם) [בְּחׇפְזָ֑ם] וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים וַיַּגִּ֖דוּ לַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: They followed them as far as the Jordan, and found the entire road full of clothing and gear that the Arameans had thrown away in their haste; and the messengers returned and told the king.
Transliteration: vayelekhu achareyhem ad-hayareden vehineh khׇl-haderekhe meleah vegadiym vekheliym asher-hisheliykhu aram (vhchfzm) [vechׇfezam] vayashuvu hamaleakhiym vayagidu lamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א הָעָ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֕זּוּ אֵ֖ת מַחֲנֵ֣ה אֲרָ֑ם וַיְהִ֨י סְאָה־סֹ֜לֶת בְּשֶׁ֗קֶל וְסָאתַ֧יִם שְׂעֹרִ֛ים בְּשֶׁ֖קֶל כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The people then went out and plundered the Aramean camp. So a seah of choice flour sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel—as GOD had spoken.
Transliteration: vayetse haam vayavozu et machaneh aram vayehiy seah-solet veshekel vesatayiim sheoriym veshekel khidevar yehovah

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֩לֶךְ֩ הִפְקִ֨יד אֶת־הַשָּׁלִ֜ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁעָ֤ן עַל־יָדוֹ֙ עַל־הַשַּׁ֔עַר וַיִּרְמְסֻ֧הוּ הָעָ֛ם בַּשַּׁ֖עַר וַיָּמֹ֑ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּבֶּר֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּרֶ֥דֶת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: Now the king had put the aide on whose arm he leaned in charge of the gate; and he was trampled to death in the gate by the people—just as the agent of God had spoken, as he had spoken when the king came down to him.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe hifekiyd et-hashaliysh asher-nishean al-yadvo al-hashaar vayiremesuhu haam vashaar vayamot khaasher diver iysh haElohim asher diver veredet hamelekhe elayv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּדַבֵּר֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֑ר סָאתַ֨יִם שְׂעֹרִ֜ים בְּשֶׁ֗קֶל וּֽסְאָה־סֹ֙לֶת֙ בְּשֶׁ֔קֶל יִֽהְיֶה֙ כָּעֵ֣ת מָחָ֔ר בְּשַׁ֖עַר שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: For when the agent of God said to the king, “This time tomorrow two seahs of barley shall sell at the gate of Samaria for a shekel, and a seah of choice flour for a shekel,”
Transliteration: vayehiy khedaver iysh haElohim el-hamelekhe lemor satayiim sheoriym veshekel useah-solet veshekel yiheyeh khaet machar veshaar shomervon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן הַשָּׁלִ֜ישׁ אֶת־אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ וְהִנֵּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה עֹשֶׂ֤ה אֲרֻבּוֹת֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֔יִם הֲיִֽהְיֶ֖ה כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנְּךָ֤ רֹאֶה֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ וּמִשָּׁ֖ם לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: the aide answered the agent of God and said, “Even if G<small>OD</small> made windows in the sky, could this come to pass?” And he retorted, “You shall see it with your own eyes, but you shall not eat of it.”
Transliteration: vayaan hashaliysh et-iysh haElohim vayomar vehineh yehovah osheh aruvvot vashamayiim hayiheyeh khadavar hazeh vayomer hinekha roeh veeyneykha umisham lo tokhel

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֖וֹ כֵּ֑ן וַיִּרְמְס֨וּ אֹת֥וֹ הָעָ֛ם בַּשַּׁ֖עַר וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: That is exactly what happened to him: The people trampled him to death in the gate.
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo khen vayiremesu otvo haam vashaar vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁ֡ע דִּבֶּ֣ר אֶל־הָאִשָּׁה֩ אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱיָ֨ה אֶת־בְּנָ֜הּ לֵאמֹ֗ר ק֤וּמִי וּלְכִי֙ (אתי) [אַ֣תְּ] וּבֵיתֵ֔ךְ וְג֖וּרִי בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּג֑וּרִי כִּֽי־קָרָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ לָרָעָ֔ב וְגַם־בָּ֥א אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Elisha had said to the woman whose son he revived, “Leave immediately with your family and go sojourn somewhere else; for G<small>OD</small> has decreed a seven-year famine upon the land, and it has already begun.”
Transliteration: veeliysha diver el-haishah asher-hecheyah et-venah lemor kumiy ulekhiy (ty) [ate] uveytekhe veguriy vaasher taguriy khiy-kara yehovah laraav vegam-va el-haarets sheva shaniym

Hebrew: וַתָּ֙קׇם֙ הָאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתַּ֕עַשׂ כִּדְבַ֖ר אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתֵּ֤לֶךְ הִיא֙ וּבֵיתָ֔הּ וַתָּ֥גׇר בְּאֶרֶץ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: The woman had done as the agent of God had spoken; she left with her family and sojourned in the land of the Philistines for seven years.
Transliteration: vatakׇm haishah vataash khidevar iysh haElohim vatelekhe hiy uveytah vatagׇr veerets-felishetiym sheva shaniym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקְצֵה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וַתָּ֥שׇׁב הָאִשָּׁ֖ה מֵאֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַתֵּצֵא֙ לִצְעֹ֣ק אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֶל־בֵּיתָ֖הּ וְאֶל־שָׂדָֽהּ׃
Translated: At the end of the seven years, the woman returned from the land of the Philistines and went to the king to complain about her house and farm.
Transliteration: vayehiy miketseh sheva shaniym vatashׇv haishah meerets felishetiym vatetse litseok el-hamelekhe el-veytah veel-shadah

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֗לֶךְ מְדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־גֵּ֣חֲזִ֔י נַ֥עַר אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר סַפְּרָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַגְּדֹל֖וֹת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה אֱלִישָֽׁע׃ {ס}
Translated: Now the king was talking to Gehazi, the servant of the agent of God, and he said, “Tell me all the wonderful things that Elisha has done.”
Transliteration: vehamelekhe medaver el-gechaziy naar iysh-haElohim lemor saferah-na liy et khׇl-hagedolvot asher-ashah eliysha {s}

Hebrew: וַ֠יְהִ֠י ה֥וּא מְסַפֵּ֣ר לַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱיָ֣ה אֶת־הַמֵּת֒ וְהִנֵּ֨ה הָאִשָּׁ֜ה אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱיָ֤ה אֶת־בְּנָהּ֙ צֹעֶ֣קֶת אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַל־בֵּיתָ֖הּ וְעַל־שָׂדָ֑הּ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר גֵּֽחֲזִי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ זֹ֚את הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְזֶה־בְּנָ֖הּ אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱיָ֥ה אֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: While he was telling the king how [Elisha] had revived a dead person, in came the woman whose son he had revived, complaining to the king about her house and farm. “My lord king,” said Gehazi, “this is the woman and this is her son whom Elisha revived.”
Transliteration: vayehiy hu mesafer lamelekhe et asher-hecheyah et-hamet vehineh haishah asher-hecheyah et-venah tsoeket el-hamelekhe al-veytah veal-shadah vayomer gechaziy adoniy hamelekhe zot haishah vezeh-venah asher-hecheyah eliysha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֥ל הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ לָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַתְּסַפֶּר־ל֑וֹ וַיִּתֶּן־לָ֣הּ הַמֶּ֩לֶךְ֩ סָרִ֨יס אֶחָ֜ד לֵאמֹ֗ר הָשֵׁ֤יב אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָהּ֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־תְּבוּאֹ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה מִיּ֛וֹם עׇזְבָ֥הֿ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־עָֽתָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: The king questioned the woman, and she told him [the story]; so the king assigned a eunuch to her and instructed him: “Restore all her property, and all the revenue from her farm from the time she left the country until now.”
Transliteration: vayisheal hamelekhe laishah vatesafer-lvo vayiten-lah hamelekhe sariys echad lemor hasheyv et-khׇl-asher-lah veet khׇl-tevuot hashadeh miyyvom ׇzevahֿ et-haarets vead-atah {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א אֱלִישָׁע֙ דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וּבֶן־הֲדַ֥ד מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֖ם חֹלֶ֑ה וַיֻּגַּד־ל֣וֹ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֛א אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: Elisha arrived in Damascus at a time when King Ben-hadad of Aram was ill. The king was told, “The agent of God is on his way here,”
Transliteration: vayavo eliysha dameshek uven-hadad melekhe-aram choleh vayugad-lvo lemor va iysh haElohim ad-henah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶל־חֲזָהאֵ֗ל קַ֤ח בְּיָדְךָ֙ מִנְחָ֔ה וְלֵ֕ךְ לִקְרַ֖את אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֨ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֤ה מֵאוֹתוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַאֶחְיֶ֖ה מֵחֳלִ֥י זֶֽה׃
Translated: and he said to Hazael, “Take a gift with you and go meet the agent of God, and through him inquire of G<small>OD</small>: Will I recover from this illness?”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-chazahel kach veyadekha minechah velekhe likerat iysh haElohim vedarasheta et-yehovah mevotvo lemor haecheyeh mecholiy zeh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ חֲזָאֵל֮ לִקְרָאתוֹ֒ וַיִּקַּ֨ח מִנְחָ֤ה בְיָדוֹ֙ וְכׇל־ט֣וּב דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק מַשָּׂ֖א אַרְבָּעִ֣ים גָּמָ֑ל וַיָּבֹא֙ וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד לְפָנָ֔יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בִּנְךָ֨ בֶן־הֲדַ֤ד מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲרָם֙ שְׁלָחַ֤נִי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַאֶחְיֶ֖ה מֵחֳלִ֥י זֶֽה׃
Translated: Hazael went to meet him, taking with him as a gift forty camel-loads of all the bounty of Damascus. He came and stood before him and said, “Your son, King Ben-hadad of Aram, has sent me to you to ask: Will I recover from this illness?”
Transliteration: vayelekhe chazael likeratvo vayikach minechah veyadvo vekhׇl-tuv dameshek masha arevaiym gamal vayavo vayaamod lefanayv vayomer vinekha ven-hadad melekhe-aram shelachaniy eleykha lemor haecheyeh mecholiy zeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֱלִישָׁ֔ע לֵ֥ךְ אֱמׇר־[ל֖וֹ] (לא) חָיֹ֣ה תִֽחְיֶ֑ה וְהִרְאַ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּי־מ֥וֹת יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Elisha said to him, “Go and say to him, ‘You will recover.’ However, G<small>OD</small> has revealed to me that he will die.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv eliysha lekhe emׇr-[lvo] (l) chayoh ticheyeh vehireaniy yehovah khiy-mvot yamut

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֥ד אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו וַיָּ֣שֶׂם עַד־בֹּ֑שׁ וַיֵּ֖בְךְּ אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The agent of God kept his face expressionless for a long time; and then he wept.
Transliteration: vayaamed et-fanayv vayashem ad-vosh vayevekhe iysh haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חֲזָאֵ֔ל מַדּ֖וּעַ אֲדֹנִ֣י בֹכֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֡אמֶר כִּֽי־יָדַ֡עְתִּי אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂה֩ לִבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל רָעָ֗ה מִבְצְרֵיהֶ֞ם תְּשַׁלַּ֤ח בָּאֵשׁ֙ וּבַחֻֽרֵיהֶם֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב תַּהֲרֹ֔ג וְעֹלְלֵיהֶ֣ם תְּרַטֵּ֔שׁ וְהָרֹתֵיהֶ֖ם תְּבַקֵּֽעַ׃
Translated: “Why does my lord weep?” asked Hazael. “Because I know,” he replied, “what harm you will do to the Israelite people: you will set their fortresses on fire, put their young men to the sword, dash their little ones in pieces, and rip open their pregnant women.”
Transliteration: vayomer chazael madua adoniy vokheh vayomer khiy-yadaetiy et asher-taasheh liveney yisherael raah mivetsereyhem teshalach vaesh uvachureyhem vacherev taharog veoleleyhem teratesh veharoteyhem tevakea

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חֲזָהאֵ֔ל כִּ֣י מָ֤ה עַבְדְּךָ֙ הַכֶּ֔לֶב כִּ֣י יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה הַדָּבָ֥ר הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֔ע הִרְאַ֧נִי יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹתְךָ֖ מֶ֥לֶךְ עַל־אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: “But how,” asked Hazael, “can your servant, who is a mere dog, perform such a mighty deed?” Elisha replied, “G<small>OD</small> has shown me a vision of you as king of Aram.”
Transliteration: vayomer chazahel khiy mah avedekha hakhelev khiy yaasheh hadavar hagadvol hazeh vayomer eliysha hireaniy yehovah otekha melekhe al-aram

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ ׀ מֵאֵ֣ת אֱלִישָׁ֗ע וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ מָה־אָמַ֥ר לְךָ֖ אֱלִישָׁ֑ע וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָ֥מַר לִ֖י חָיֹ֥ה תִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: He left Elisha and returned to his master, who asked him, “What did Elisha say to you?” He replied, “He told me that you would recover.”
Transliteration: vayelekhe meet eliysha vayavo el-adonayv vayomer lvo mah-amar lekha eliysha vayomer amar liy chayoh ticheyeh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֗ת וַיִּקַּ֤ח הַמַּכְבֵּר֙ וַיִּטְבֹּ֣ל בַּמַּ֔יִם וַיִּפְרֹ֥שׂ עַל־פָּנָ֖יו וַיָּמֹ֑ת וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ חֲזָהאֵ֖ל תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: The next day, [Hazael] took a piece of netting, dipped it in water, and spread it over his face. So [Ben-hadad] died, and Hazael succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayikach hamakhever vayitevol vamayiim vayiferosh al-fanayv vayamot vayimelokhe chazahel tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַ֣ת חָמֵ֗שׁ לְיוֹרָ֤ם בֶּן־אַחְאָב֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָלַ֛ךְ יְהוֹרָ֥ם בֶּן־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the fifth year of King Joram son of Ahab of Israel—Jehoshaphat had been king of Judah—Joram son of King Jehoshaphat of Judah became king.
Transliteration: uvishenat chamesh leyvoram ven-acheav melekhe yisherael viyhvoshafat melekhe yehudah malakhe yehvoram ven-yehvoshafat melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֛יִם שָׁנָ֖ה הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׁמֹנֶ֣ה (שנה) [שָׁנִ֔ים] מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years.
Transliteration: ven-sheloshiym ushetayiim shanah hayah vemׇlekhvo ushemoneh (shnh) [shaniym] malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֜לֶךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֔ב כִּ֚י בַּת־אַחְאָ֔ב הָ֥יְתָה לּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He followed the practices of the kings of Israel—whatever the House of Ahab did, for he had married a daughter of Ahab—and he did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vederekhe malekhey yisherael khaasher ashu veyt acheav khiy vat-acheav hayetah lvo leishah vayaash hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אָבָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְהַשְׁחִ֣ית אֶת־יְהוּדָ֔ה לְמַ֖עַן דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדּ֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַר־ל֗וֹ לָתֵ֨ת ל֥וֹ נִ֛יר לְבָנָ֖יו כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: However, G<small>OD</small> refrained from destroying Judah, for the sake of God’s servant David, in accordance with God’s promise to maintain a lamp for his descendants for all time.
Transliteration: velo-avah yehovah lehashechiyt et-yehudah lemaan david avedvo khaasher amar-lvo latet lvo niyr levanayv khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: בְּיָמָיו֙ פָּשַׁ֣ע אֱד֔וֹם מִתַּ֖חַת יַד־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיַּמְלִ֥כוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: During his reign, the Edomites rebelled against Judah’s rule and set up a king of their own.
Transliteration: veyamayv fasha edvom mitachat yad-yehudah vayamelikhu aleyhem melekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר יוֹרָם֙ צָעִ֔ירָה וְכׇל־הָרֶ֖כֶב עִמּ֑וֹ וַֽיְהִי־ה֞וּא קָ֣ם לַ֗יְלָה וַיַּכֶּ֨ה אֶת־אֱד֜וֹם הַסֹּבֵ֤יב אֵלָיו֙ וְאֵת֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב וַיָּ֥נׇס הָעָ֖ם לְאֹהָלָֽיו׃
Translated: Joram crossed over to Zair with all his chariotry. He arose by night and attacked the Edomites, who were surrounding him and the chariot commanders; but his troops fled to their homes.
Transliteration: vayaavor yvoram tsaiyrah vekhׇl-harekhev imvo vayehiy-hu kam layelah vayakheh et-edvom hasoveyv elayv veet sharey harekhev vayanׇs haam leohalayv

Hebrew: וַיִּפְשַׁ֣ע אֱד֗וֹם מִתַּ֙חַת֙ יַד־יְהוּדָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה אָ֛ז תִּפְשַׁ֥ע לִבְנָ֖ה בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽיא׃
Translated: Thus Edom fell away from Judah, as is still the case. Libnah likewise fell away at that time.
Transliteration: vayifesha edvom mitachat yad-yehudah ad hayyvom hazeh az tifesha livenah vaet hahiy

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יוֹרָ֖ם וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Joram’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yvoram vekhׇl-asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יוֹרָם֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲחַזְיָ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Joram rested with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David; his son Ahaziah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yvoram im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr david vayimelokhe achazeyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לְיוֹרָ֥ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֖ב מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מָלַ֛ךְ אֲחַזְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹרָ֖ם מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the twelfth year of King Joram son of Ahab of Israel, Ahaziah son of Joram became king of Judah.
Transliteration: vishenat sheteym-eshereh shanah leyvoram ven-acheav melekhe yisherael malakhe achazeyahu ven-yehvoram melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וּשְׁתַּ֤יִם שָׁנָה֙ אֲחַזְיָ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְשָׁנָ֣ה אַחַ֔ת מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֤ם אִמּוֹ֙ עֲתַלְיָ֔הוּ בַּת־עׇמְרִ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem one year; his mother’s name was Athaliah daughter of King Omri of Israel.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym ushetayiim shanah achazeyahu vemׇlekhvo veshanah achat malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo ataleyahu vat-ׇmeriy melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּדֶ֙רֶךְ֙ בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֔ב וַיַּ֧עַשׂ הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּבֵ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב כִּ֛י חֲתַ֥ן בֵּית־אַחְאָ֖ב הֽוּא׃
Translated: He walked in the ways of the House of Ahab and did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, like the House of Ahab, for he was related by marriage to the House of Ahab.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vederekhe veyt acheav vayaash hara veeyney yehovah kheveyt acheav khiy chatan veyt-acheav hu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־יוֹרָ֣ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֗ב לַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה עִם־חֲזָאֵ֥ל מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֖ם בְּרָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיַּכּ֥וּ אֲרַמִּ֖ים אֶת־יוֹרָֽם׃
Translated: He marched with Joram son of Ahab to battle against King Hazael of Aram at Ramoth-gilead, but the Arameans wounded Joram.
Transliteration: vayelekhe et-yvoram ven-acheav lamilechamah im-chazael melekhe-aram veramot gilead vayakhu aramiym et-yvoram

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ יוֹרָ֨ם הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לְהִתְרַפֵּ֣א בְיִזְרְעֶ֗אל מִן־הַמַּכִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַכֻּ֤הוּ אֲרַמִּים֙ בָּרָמָ֔ה בְּהִלָּ֣חֲמ֔וֹ אֶת־חֲזָהאֵ֖ל מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֑ם וַאֲחַזְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹרָ֜ם מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה יָרַ֡ד לִרְא֞וֹת אֶת־יוֹרָ֧ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֛ב בְּיִזְרְעֶ֖אל כִּי־חֹלֶ֥ה הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: King Joram retired to Jezreel to recover from the wounds that the Arameans had inflicted upon him at Ramah, when he fought against King Hazael of Aram. And King Ahaziah son of Joram of Judah went down to Jezreel to visit Joram son of Ahab while he was ill.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yvoram hamelekhe lehiterafe veyizereel min-hamakhiym asher yakhuhu aramiym varamah vehilachamvo et-chazahel melekhe aram vaachazeyahu ven-yehvoram melekhe yehudah yarad lirevot et-yvoram ven-acheav veyizereel khiy-choleh hu {f}

Hebrew: וֶֽאֱלִישָׁע֙ הַנָּבִ֔יא קָרָ֕א לְאַחַ֖ד מִבְּנֵ֣י הַנְּבִיאִ֑ים וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֜וֹ חֲגֹ֣ר מׇתְנֶ֗יךָ וְ֠קַ֠ח פַּ֣ךְ הַשֶּׁ֤מֶן הַזֶּה֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ וְלֵ֖ךְ רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: Then the prophet Elisha summoned one of the disciples of the prophets and said to him, “Tie up your skirts, and take along this flask of oil, and go to Ramoth-gilead.
Transliteration: veeliysha hanaviy kara leachad miveney haneviyiym vayomer lvo chagor mׇteneykha vekach fakhe hashemen hazeh veyadekha velekhe ramot gilead

Hebrew: וּבָ֖אתָ־שָּׁ֑מָּה וּרְאֵה־שָׁ֠ם יֵה֨וּא בֶן־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֜ט בֶּן־נִמְשִׁ֗י וּבָ֙אתָ֙ וַהֲקֵֽמֹתוֹ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ אֶחָ֔יו וְהֵבֵיאתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ חֶ֥דֶר בְּחָֽדֶר׃
Translated: When you arrive there, go and see Jehu son of Jehoshaphat son of Nimshi; get him to leave his comrades, and take him into an inner room.
Transliteration: uvata-shamah ureeh-sham eihu ven-yehvoshafat ven-nimeshiy uvata vahakemotvo mitvokhe echayv veheveyta otvo cheder vechader

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ פַךְ־הַשֶּׁ֙מֶן֙ וְיָצַקְתָּ֣ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה מְשַׁחְתִּ֥יךָ לְמֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּפָתַחְתָּ֥ הַדֶּ֛לֶת וְנַ֖סְתָּה וְלֹ֥א תְחַכֶּֽה׃
Translated: Then take the flask of oil and pour some on his head, and say, ‘Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I anoint you king over Israel.’ Then open the door and flee without delay.”
Transliteration: velakacheta fakhe-hashemen veyatsaketa al-roshvo veamareta khoh-amar yehovah meshachetiykha lemelekhe el-yisherael ufatacheta hadelet venasetah velo techakheh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ הַנַּ֛עַר הַנַּ֥עַר הַנָּבִ֖יא רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: The young man, the servant of the prophet, went to Ramoth-gilead.
Transliteration: vayelekhe hanaar hanaar hanaviy ramot gilead

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗א וְהִנֵּ֨ה שָׂרֵ֤י הַחַ֙יִל֙ יֹֽשְׁבִ֔ים וַיֹּ֕אמֶר דָּבָ֥ר לִ֛י אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַשָּׂ֑ר וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יֵהוּא֙ אֶל־מִ֣י מִכֻּלָּ֔נוּ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלֶ֥יךָ הַשָּֽׂר׃
Translated: When he arrived, the army commanders were sitting together. He said, “Commander, I have a message for you.” “For which one of us?” Jehu asked. He answered, “For you, commander.”
Transliteration: vayavo vehineh sharey hachayiil yosheviym vayomer davar liy eleykha hashar vayomer eihu el-miy mikhulanu vayomer eleykha hashar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ וַיָּבֹ֣א הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיִּצֹ֥ק הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן אֶל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מְשַׁחְתִּ֧יךָ לְמֶ֛לֶךְ אֶל־עַ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So [Jehu] arose and went inside; and [the disciple] poured the oil on his head, and said to him, “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I anoint you king over the people of G<small>OD</small>, over Israel.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayavo havayetah vayitsok hashemen el-roshvo vayomer lvo khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael meshachetiykha lemelekhe el-am yehovah el-yisherael

Hebrew: וְהִ֨כִּיתָ֔ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אַחְאָ֖ב אֲדֹנֶ֑יךָ וְנִקַּמְתִּ֞י דְּמֵ֣י ׀ עֲבָדַ֣י הַנְּבִיאִ֗ים וּדְמֵ֛י כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מִיַּ֥ד אִיזָֽבֶל׃
Translated: You shall strike down the House of Ahab your master; thus will I avenge on Jezebel the blood of My servants the prophets, and the blood of the other servants of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehikhiytah et-veyt acheav adoneykha venikametiy demey avaday haneviyiym udemey khׇl-avedey yehovah miyad iyzavel

Hebrew: וְאָבַ֖ד כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י לְאַחְאָב֙ מַשְׁתִּ֣ין בְּקִ֔יר וְעָצ֥וּר וְעָז֖וּב בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The whole House of Ahab shall perish, and I will cut off every male belonging to Ahab, bond and free in Israel.
Transliteration: veavad khׇl-veyt acheav vehikheratiy leacheav mashetiyn vekiyr veatsur veazuv veyisherael

Hebrew: וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֔ב כְּבֵ֖ית יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֑ט וּכְבֵ֖ית בַּעְשָׁ֥א בֶן־אֲחִיָּֽה׃
Translated: I will make the House of Ahab like the House of Jeroboam son of Nebat, and like the House of Baasha son of Ahijah.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-veyt acheav kheveyt yarׇveam ven-nevat ukheveyt vaesha ven-achiyah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אִיזֶ֜בֶל יֹאכְל֧וּ הַכְּלָבִ֛ים בְּחֵ֥לֶק יִזְרְעֶ֖אל וְאֵ֣ין קֹבֵ֑ר וַיִּפְתַּ֥ח הַדֶּ֖לֶת וַיָּנֹֽס׃
Translated: The dogs shall devour Jezebel in the field of Jezreel, with none to bury her.” Then he opened the door and fled.
Transliteration: veet-iyzevel yokhelu hakhelaviym vechelek yizereel veeyn kover vayifetach hadelet vayanos

Hebrew: וְיֵה֗וּא יָצָא֙ אֶל־עַבְדֵ֣י אֲדֹנָ֔יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הֲשָׁל֔וֹם מַדּ֛וּעַ בָּֽא־הַמְשֻׁגָּ֥ע הַזֶּ֖ה אֵלֶ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֛ם יְדַעְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־הָאִ֖ישׁ וְאֶת־שִׂיחֽוֹ׃
Translated: Jehu went out to the other officers of his master, and they asked him, “Is all well? What did that madman come to you for?” He said to them, “You know the man and his ranting!”
Transliteration: veeihu yatsa el-avedey adonayv vayomer lvo hashalvom madua va-hameshuga hazeh eleykha vayomer aleyhem atem yedaetem et-haiysh veet-shiychvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ שֶׁ֔קֶר הַגֶּד־נָ֖א לָ֑נוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כָּזֹ֤את וְכָזֹאת֙ אָמַ֤ר אֵלַי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה מְשַׁחְתִּ֥יךָ לְמֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “You’re lying,” they said. “Tell us [the truth].” Then he replied, “Thus and thus he said: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I anoint you king over Israel!”
Transliteration: vayomeru sheker haged-na lanu vayomer khazot vekhazot amar elay lemor khoh amar yehovah meshachetiykha lemelekhe el-yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽיְמַהֲר֗וּ וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ בִּגְד֔וֹ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ תַחְתָּ֖יו אֶל־גֶּ֣רֶם הַֽמַּעֲל֑וֹת וַֽיִּתְקְעוּ֙ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֔ר וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ מָלַ֥ךְ יֵהֽוּא׃
Translated: Quickly each man took his cloak and placed it under him, on the top step. They sounded the horn and proclaimed, “Jehu is king!”
Transliteration: vayemaharu vayikechu iysh vigedvo vayashiymu tachetayv el-gerem hamaalvot vayitekeu vashvofar vayomeru malakhe eihu

Hebrew: וַיִּתְקַשֵּׁ֗ר יֵה֛וּא בֶּן־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־נִמְשִׁ֖י אֶל־יוֹרָ֑ם וְיוֹרָם֩ הָיָ֨ה שֹׁמֵ֜ר בְּרָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֗ד ה֚וּא וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִפְּנֵ֖י חֲזָאֵ֥ל מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָֽם׃
Translated:
Thus Jehu son of Jehoshaphat son of Nimshi conspired against Joram.
Joram and all Israel had been defending Ramoth-gilead against King Hazael of Aram,
Transliteration: vayitekasher eihu ven-yehvoshafat ven-nimeshiy el-yvoram veyvoram hayah shomer veramot gilead hu vekhׇl-yisherael mifeney chazael melekhe-aram

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ יְהוֹרָ֨ם הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לְהִתְרַפֵּ֣א בְיִזְרְעֶ֗אל מִן־הַמַּכִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַכֻּ֣הוּ אֲרַמִּ֔ים בְּהִלָּ֣חֲמ֔וֹ אֶת־חֲזָאֵ֖ל מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֑ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יֵהוּא֙ אִם־יֵ֣שׁ נַפְשְׁכֶ֔ם אַל־יֵצֵ֤א פָלִיט֙ מִן־הָעִ֔יר לָלֶ֖כֶת (לגיד) [לְהַגִּ֥יד] בְּיִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated:
but King Joram had gone back to Jezreel to recover from the wounds that the Arameans had inflicted on him in his battle with King Hazael of Aram.
Jehu said, “If such is your wish, allow no one to slip out of the town to go and report this in Jezreel.”
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoram hamelekhe lehiterafe veyizereel min-hamakhiym asher yakhuhu aramiym vehilachamvo et-chazael melekhe aram vayomer eihu im-eish nafeshekhem al-eitse faliyt min-haiyr lalekhet (lgyd) [lehagiyd] veyizereel

Hebrew: וַיִּרְכַּ֤ב יֵהוּא֙ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ יִזְרְעֶ֔אלָה כִּ֥י יוֹרָ֖ם שֹׁכֵ֣ב שָׁ֑מָּה וַֽאֲחַזְיָה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה יָרַ֖ד לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־יוֹרָֽם׃
Translated: Then Jehu mounted his chariot and drove to Jezreel; for Joram was lying ill there, and King Ahaziah of Judah had gone down to visit Joram.
Transliteration: vayirekhav eihu vayelekhe yizereelah khiy yvoram shokhev shamah vaachazeyah melekhe yehudah yarad lirevot et-yvoram

Hebrew: וְהַצֹּפֶה֩ עֹמֵ֨ד עַֽל־הַמִּגְדָּ֜ל בְּיִזְרְעֶ֗אל וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־שִׁפְעַ֤ת יֵהוּא֙ בְּבֹא֔וֹ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁפְעַ֖ת אֲנִ֣י רֹאֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוֹרָ֗ם קַ֥ח רַכָּ֛ב וּֽשְׁלַ֥ח לִקְרָאתָ֖ם וְיֹאמַ֥ר הֲשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: The lookout was stationed on the tower in Jezreel, and he saw the troop of Jehu as he approached. He called out, “I see a troop!” Joram said, “Dispatch a horseman to meet them and let him ask: Is all well?”
Transliteration: vehatsofeh omed al-hamigedal veyizereel vayare et-shifeat eihu vevovo vayomer shifeat aniy roeh vayomer yehvoram kach rakhav ushelach likeratam veyomar hashalvom

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩לֶךְ֩ רֹכֵ֨ב הַסּ֜וּס לִקְרָאת֗וֹ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הֲשָׁל֔וֹם וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יֵה֛וּא מַה־לְּךָ֥ וּלְשָׁל֖וֹם סֹ֣ב אֶֽל־אַחֲרָ֑י וַיַּגֵּ֤ד הַצֹּפֶה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּא־הַמַּלְאָ֥ךְ עַד־הֵ֖ם וְלֹא־שָֽׁב׃
Translated: The horseman went to meet him, and he said, “The king inquires: Is all well?” Jehu replied, “What concern of yours is it whether all is well? Fall in behind me.” The lookout reported: “The messenger has reached them, but has not turned back.”
Transliteration: vayelekhe rokhev hasus likeratvo vayomer khoh-amar hamelekhe hashalvom vayomer eihu mah-lekha uleshalvom sov el-acharay vayaged hatsofeh lemor va-hamaleakhe ad-hem velo-shav

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח רֹכֵ֣ב סוּס֮ שֵׁנִי֒ וַיָּבֹ֣א אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֛אמֶר כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ שָׁל֑וֹם וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יֵה֛וּא מַה־לְּךָ֥ וּלְשָׁל֖וֹם סֹ֥ב אֶֽל־אַחֲרָֽי׃
Translated: So he sent out a second horseman. He came to them and said, “Thus says the king: Is all well?” Jehu answered, “What concern of yours is it whether all is well? Fall in behind me.”
Transliteration: vayishelach rokhev sus sheniy vayavo alehem vayomer khoh-amar hamelekhe shalvom vayomer eihu mah-lekha uleshalvom sov el-acharay

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד הַצֹּפֶה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֥א עַד־אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹא־שָׁ֑ב וְהַמִּנְהָ֗ג כְּמִנְהַג֙ יֵה֣וּא בֶן־נִמְשִׁ֔י כִּ֥י בְשִׁגָּע֖וֹן יִנְהָֽג׃
Translated: And the lookout reported, “The messenger has reached them, but has not turned back. And it looks like the driving of Jehu son of Nimshi, who drives wildly.”
Transliteration: vayaged hatsofeh lemor va ad-aleyhem velo-shav vehaminehag kheminehag eihu ven-nimeshiy khiy veshigavon yinehag

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוֹרָם֙ אֱסֹ֔ר וַיֶּאְסֹ֖ר רִכְבּ֑וֹ וַיֵּצֵ֣א יְהוֹרָ֣ם מֶֽלֶךְ־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל וַאֲחַזְיָ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה אִ֣ישׁ בְּרִכְבּ֗וֹ וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ לִקְרַ֣את יֵה֔וּא וַיִּ֨מְצָאֻ֔הוּ בְּחֶלְקַ֖ת נָב֥וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִֽי׃
Translated: Joram ordered, “Hitch up [the chariot]!” They hitched up his chariot; and King Joram of Israel and King Ahaziah of Judah went out, each in his own chariot, to meet Jehu. They met him at the field of Naboth the Jezreelite.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoram esor vayeesor rikhevvo vayetse yehvoram melekhe-yisherael vaachazeyahu melekhe-yehudah iysh verikhevvo vayetseu likerat eihu vayimetsauhu vechelekat navvot hayizereeliy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּרְא֤וֹת יְהוֹרָם֙ אֶת־יֵה֔וּא וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הֲשָׁל֣וֹם יֵה֑וּא וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מָ֣ה הַשָּׁל֔וֹם עַד־זְנוּנֵ֞י אִיזֶ֧בֶל אִמְּךָ֛ וּכְשָׁפֶ֖יהָ הָרַבִּֽים׃
Translated: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, “Is all well, Jehu?” But Jehu replied, “How can all be well as long as your mother Jezebel carries on her countless whoredoms and sorceries?”
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot yehvoram et-eihu vayomer hashalvom eihu vayomer mah hashalvom ad-zenuney iyzevel imekha ukheshafeyha haraviym

Hebrew: וַיַּהֲפֹ֧ךְ יְהוֹרָ֛ם יָדָ֖יו וַיָּנֹ֑ס וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֶל־אֲחַזְיָ֖הוּ מִרְמָ֥ה אֲחַזְיָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Joram turned his horses around and fled, crying out to Ahaziah, “Treason, Ahaziah!”
Transliteration: vayahafokhe yehvoram yadayv vayanos vayomer el-achazeyahu miremah achazeyah

Hebrew: וְיֵה֞וּא מִלֵּ֧א יָד֣וֹ בַקֶּ֗שֶׁת וַיַּ֤ךְ אֶת־יְהוֹרָם֙ בֵּ֣ין זְרֹעָ֔יו וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַחֵ֖צִי מִלִּבּ֑וֹ וַיִּכְרַ֖ע בְּרִכְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Jehu drew his bow and hit Joram between the shoulders, so that the arrow pierced his heart; and he collapsed in his chariot.
Transliteration: veeihu mile yadvo vakeshet vayakhe et-yehvoram veyn zeroayv vayetse hachetsiy milivvo vayikhera verikhevvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֶל־בִּדְקַר֙ שָׁלִשֹׁ֔ה שָׂ֚א הַשְׁלִכֵ֔הוּ בְּחֶלְקַ֕ת שְׂדֵ֖ה נָב֣וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֑י כִּֽי־זְכֹ֞ר אֲנִ֣י וָאַ֗תָּה אֵ֣ת רֹכְבִ֤ים צְמָדִים֙ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אַחְאָ֣ב אָבִ֔יו וַֽיהֹוָה֙ נָשָׂ֣א עָלָ֔יו אֶת־הַמַּשָּׂ֖א הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Jehu thereupon ordered his officer Bidkar, “Pick him up and throw him into the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. Remember how you and I were riding side by side behind his father Ahab, when G<small>OD</small> made this pronouncement about him:
Transliteration: vayomer el-videkar shalishoh sha hashelikhehu vechelekat shedeh navvot hayizereeliy khiy-zekhor aniy vaatah et rokheviym tsemadiym acharey acheav aviyv vayhovah nasha alayv et-hamasha hazeh

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֡א אֶת־דְּמֵ֣י נָבוֹת֩ וְאֶת־דְּמֵ֨י בָנָ֜יו רָאִ֤יתִֽי אֶ֙מֶשׁ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֥י לְךָ֛ בַּחֶלְקָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעַתָּ֗ה שָׂ֧א הַשְׁלִכֵ֛הוּ בַּחֶלְקָ֖ה כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: ‘I swear, I have taken note of the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons yesterday—declares G<small>OD</small>. And I will requite you in this plot—declares G<small>OD</small>.’ So pick him up and throw him unto the plot in accordance with the word of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: im-lo et-demey navvot veet-demey vanayv raiytiy emesh neum-yehovah veshilametiy lekha vachelekah hazot neum-yehovah veatah sha hashelikhehu vachelekah khidevar yehovah

Hebrew: וַאֲחַזְיָ֤ה מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ רָאָ֔ה וַיָּ֕נׇס דֶּ֖רֶךְ בֵּ֣ית הַגָּ֑ן וַיִּרְדֹּ֨ף אַחֲרָ֜יו יֵה֗וּא וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר גַּם־אֹת֞וֹ הַכֻּ֣הוּ אֶל־הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֗ה בְּמַֽעֲלֵה־גוּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶֽת־יִבְלְעָ֔ם וַיָּ֥נׇס מְגִדּ֖וֹ וַיָּ֥מׇת שָֽׁם׃
Translated: On seeing this, King Ahaziah of Judah fled along the road to Beth-haggan. Jehu pursued him and said, “Shoot him down too!” [And they shot him] in his chariot at the ascent of Gur, which is near Ibleam. He fled to Megiddo and died there.
Transliteration: vaachazeyah melekhe-yehudah raah vayanׇs derekhe veyt hagan vayiredof acharayv eihu vayomer gam-otvo hakhuhu el-hamerekhavah vemaaleh-gur asher et-yiveleam vayanׇs megidvo vayamׇt sham

Hebrew: וַיַּרְכִּ֧בוּ אֹת֛וֹ עֲבָדָ֖יו יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ְמָה וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֹת֧וֹ בִקְבֻרָת֛וֹ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֥יר דָּוִֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: His servants conveyed him in a chariot to Jerusalem, and they buried him in his grave with his ancestors, in the City of David.
Transliteration: vayarekhivu otvo avadayv yerushala͏emah vayikeveru otvo vikevuratvo im-avotayv veiyr david {f}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַת֙ אַחַ֣ת עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לְיוֹרָ֖ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֑ב מָלַ֥ךְ אֲחַזְיָ֖ה עַל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: (Ahaziah had become king over Judah in the eleventh year of Joram son of Ahab.)
Transliteration: uvishenat achat eshereh shanah leyvoram ven-acheav malakhe achazeyah al-yehudah

Hebrew: וַיָּב֥וֹא יֵה֖וּא יִזְרְעֶ֑אלָה וְאִיזֶ֣בֶל שָֽׁמְעָ֗ה וַתָּ֨שֶׂם בַּפּ֤וּךְ עֵינֶ֙יהָ֙ וַתֵּ֣יטֶב אֶת־רֹאשָׁ֔הּ וַתַּשְׁקֵ֖ף בְּעַ֥ד הַחַלּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Jehu went on to Jezreel. When Jezebel heard of it, she painted her eyes with kohl and dressed her hair, and she looked out of the window.
Transliteration: vayavvo eihu yizereelah veiyzevel shameah vatashem vafukhe eyneyha vateytev et-roshah vatashekef vead hachalvon

Hebrew: וְיֵה֖וּא בָּ֣א בַשָּׁ֑עַר וַתֹּ֣אמֶר הֲשָׁל֔וֹם זִמְרִ֖י הֹרֵ֥ג אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated: As Jehu entered the gate, she called out, “Is all well, Zimri, murderer of your master?”
Transliteration: veeihu va vashaar vatomer hashalvom zimeriy horeg adonayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֤א פָנָיו֙ אֶל־הַ֣חַלּ֔וֹן וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י אִתִּ֖י מִ֑י וַיַּשְׁקִ֣יפוּ אֵלָ֔יו שְׁנַ֥יִם שְׁלֹשָׁ֖ה סָרִיסִֽים׃
Translated: He looked up toward the window and said, “Who is on my side, who?” And two or three eunuchs leaned out toward him.
Transliteration: vayisha fanayv el-hachalvon vayomer miy itiy miy vayashekiyfu elayv shenayiim sheloshah sariysiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר (שמטהו) [שִׁמְט֖וּהָ] וַֽיִּשְׁמְט֑וּהָ וַיִּ֨ז מִדָּמָ֧הּ אֶל־הַקִּ֛יר וְאֶל־הַסּוּסִ֖ים וַֽיִּרְמְסֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: “Throw her down,” he said. They threw her down; and her blood spattered on the wall and on the horses, and they trampled her.
Transliteration: vayomer (shmthv) [shimetuha] vayishemetuha vayiz midamah el-hakiyr veel-hasusiym vayiremesenah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖א וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֑שְׁתְּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר פִּקְדוּ־נָ֞א אֶת־הָאֲרוּרָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ וְקִבְר֔וּהָ כִּ֥י בַת־מֶ֖לֶךְ הִֽיא׃
Translated: Then he went inside and ate and drank. And he said, “Attend to that cursed woman and bury her, for she was a king’s daughter.”
Transliteration: vayavo vayokhal vayeshete vayomer fikedu-na et-haarurah hazot vekiveruha khiy vat-melekhe hiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ לְקׇבְרָ֑הּ וְלֹא־מָ֣צְאוּ בָ֗הּ כִּ֧י אִם־הַגֻּלְגֹּ֛לֶת וְהָרַגְלַ֖יִם וְכַפּ֥וֹת הַיָּדָֽיִם׃
Translated: So they went to bury her; but all they found of her were the skull, the feet, and the hands.
Transliteration: vayelekhu lekׇverah velo-matseu vah khiy im-hagulegolet veharagelayiim vekhafvot hayadayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁבוּ֮ וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ לוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֣ה ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֗ר בְּיַד־עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֵלִיָּ֥הוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר בְּחֵ֣לֶק יִזְרְעֶ֔אל יֹאכְל֥וּ הַכְּלָבִ֖ים אֶת־בְּשַׂ֥ר אִיזָֽבֶל׃
Translated: They came back and reported to him; and he said, “It is just as G<small>OD</small> spoke through Elijah the Tishbite—God’s servant: The dogs shall devour the flesh of Jezebel in the field of Jezreel;
Transliteration: vayashuvu vayagiydu lvo vayomer devar-yehovah hu asher diver veyad-avedvo eliyahu hatisheviy lemor vechelek yizereel yokhelu hakhelaviym et-veshar iyzavel

Hebrew: (והית) [וְֽהָיְתָ֞ה] נִבְלַ֣ת אִיזֶ֗בֶל כְּדֹ֛מֶן עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה בְּחֵ֣לֶק יִזְרְעֶ֑אל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יֹאמְר֖וּ זֹ֥את אִיזָֽבֶל׃ {ס}
Translated: and the carcass of Jezebel shall be like dung on the ground, in the field of Jezreel, so that none will be able to say: ‘This was Jezebel.’”
Transliteration: (vhyt) [vehayetah] nivelat iyzevel khedomen al-feney hashadeh vechelek yizereel asher lo-yomeru zot iyzavel {s}

Hebrew: וּלְאַחְאָ֛ב שִׁבְעִ֥ים בָּנִ֖ים בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן וַיִּכְתֹּב֩ יֵה֨וּא סְפָרִ֜ים וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח שֹׁמְר֗וֹן אֶל־שָׂרֵ֤י יִזְרְעֶאל֙ הַזְּקֵנִ֔ים וְאֶל־הָאֹמְנִ֥ים אַחְאָ֖ב לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Ahab had seventy descendants in Samaria. Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria, to the elders and officials of Jezreel and to the guardians of [the children] of Ahab, as follows:
Transliteration: uleacheav shiveiym vaniym veshomervon vayikhetov eihu sefariym vayishelach shomervon el-sharey yizereel hazekeniym veel-haomeniym acheav lemor

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כְּבֹ֨א הַסֵּ֤פֶר הַזֶּה֙ אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְאִתְּכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֑ם וְאִתְּכֶם֙ הָרֶ֣כֶב וְהַסּוּסִ֔ים וְעִ֥יר מִבְצָ֖ר וְהַנָּֽשֶׁק׃
Translated: “Now, when this letter reaches you—since your master’s sons are with you and you also have chariots and horses, and a fortified city and weapons—
Transliteration: veatah khevo hasefer hazeh aleykhem veitekhem veney adoneykhem veitekhem harekhev vehasusiym veiyr mivetsar vehanashek

Hebrew: וּרְאִיתֶ֞ם הַטּ֤וֹב וְהַיָּשָׁר֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֔ם וְשַׂמְתֶּ֖ם עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א אָבִ֑יו וְהִֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ עַל־בֵּ֥ית אֲדֹנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: select the best and the most suitable of your master’s sons and set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.”
Transliteration: ureiytem hatvov vehayashar miveney adoneykhem veshametem al-khise aviyv vehilachamu al-veyt adoneykhem

Hebrew: וַיִּֽרְאוּ֙ מְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ הִנֵּה֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הַמְּלָכִ֔ים לֹ֥א עָמְד֖וּ לְפָנָ֑יו וְאֵ֖יךְ נַעֲמֹ֥ד אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: But they were overcome by fear, for they thought, “If the two kings could not stand up to him, how can we?”
Transliteration: vayireu meod meod vayomeru hineh sheney hamelakhiym lo amedu lefanayv veeykhe naamod anachenu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַבַּ֣יִת וַאֲשֶׁ֪ר עַל־הָעִ֟יר וְהַזְּקֵנִים֩ וְהָאֹמְנִ֨ים אֶל־יֵה֤וּא <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֙ עֲבָדֶ֣יךָֽ אֲנַ֔חְנוּ וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֵלֵ֖ינוּ נַעֲשֶׂ֑ה לֹא־נַמְלִ֣ךְ אִ֔ישׁ הַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ עֲשֵֽׂה׃
Translated: The steward of the palace and the governor of the city and the elders and the guardians sent this message to Jehu: “We are your subjects, and we shall do whatever you tell us to. We shall not proclaim anyone king; do whatever you like.”
Transliteration: vayishelach asher-al-havayiit vaasher al-haiyr vehazekeniym vehaomeniym el-eihu <small></small> lemor avadeykha anachenu vekhol asher-tomar eleynu naasheh lo-namelikhe iysh hatvov veeyneykha asheh

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב אֲלֵיהֶם֩ סֵ֨פֶר ׀ שֵׁנִ֜ית לֵאמֹ֗ר אִם־לִ֨י אַתֶּ֜ם וּלְקֹלִ֣י ׀ אַתֶּ֣ם שֹׁמְעִ֗ים קְחוּ֙ אֶת־רָאשֵׁי֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵי־אֲדֹֽנֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֹ֧אוּ אֵלַ֛י כָּעֵ֥ת מָחָ֖ר יִזְרְעֶ֑אלָה וּבְנֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ שִׁבְעִ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ אֶת־גְּדֹלֵ֥י הָעִ֖יר מְגַדְּלִ֥ים אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: He wrote them a second time: “If you are on my side and are ready to obey me, take the heads of the attendants of your master’s sons and come to me in Jezreel tomorrow at this time.” Now the princes, seventy in number, were with the notables of the town, who were rearing them.
Transliteration: vayikhetov aleyhem sefer sheniyt lemor im-liy atem ulekoliy atem shomeiym kechu et-rashey aneshey veney-adoneykhem uvou elay khaet machar yizereelah uveney hamelekhe shiveiym iysh et-gedoley haiyr megadeliym votam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּבֹ֤א הַסֵּ֙פֶר֙ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַֽיִּשְׁחֲט֖וּ שִׁבְעִ֣ים אִ֑ישׁ וַיָּשִׂ֤ימוּ אֶת־רָֽאשֵׁיהֶם֙ בַּדּוּדִ֔ים וַיִּשְׁלְח֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו יִזְרְעֶֽאלָה׃
Translated: But when the letter reached them, they took the princes and slaughtered all seventy of them; they put their heads in baskets and sent them to him in Jezreel.
Transliteration: vayehiy khevo hasefer aleyhem vayikechu et-veney hamelekhe vayishechatu shiveiym iysh vayashiymu et-rasheyhem vadudiym vayishelechu elayv yizereelah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הַמַּלְאָךְ֙ וַיַּגֶּד־ל֣וֹ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֵבִ֖יאוּ רָאשֵׁ֣י בְנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שִׂ֣ימוּ אֹתָ֞ם שְׁנֵ֧י צִבֻּרִ֛ים פֶּ֥תַח הַשַּׁ֖עַר עַד־הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: A messenger came and reported to him: “They have brought the heads of the princes.” He said, “Pile them up in two heaps at the entrance of the gate before morning.”
Transliteration: vayavo hamaleakhe vayaged-lvo lemor heviyu rashey veney-hamelekhe vayomer shiymu otam sheney tsivuriym fetach hashaar ad-havoker

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַיֵּצֵ֣א וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֔ד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם צַדִּקִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם הִנֵּ֨ה אֲנִ֜י קָשַׁ֤רְתִּי עַל־אֲדֹנִי֙ וָאֶהְרְגֵ֔הוּ וּמִ֥י הִכָּ֖ה אֶת־כׇּל־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: In the morning he went out and stood there; and he said to all the people, “Are you blameless? True, I conspired against my master and killed him; but who struck down all of these?
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vayetse vayaamod vayomer el-khׇl-haam tsadikiym atem hineh aniy kasharetiy al-adoniy vaeheregehu umiy hikhah et-khׇl-eleh

Hebrew: דְּע֣וּ אֵפ֗וֹא כִּי֩ לֹ֨א יִפֹּ֜ל מִדְּבַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אַ֔רְצָה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב וַיהֹוָ֣ה עָשָׂ֔ה אֵ֚ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַ֖ד עַבְדּ֥וֹ אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Know, then, that nothing that G<small>OD</small> has spoken concerning the House of Ahab shall remain unfulfilled, for G<small>OD</small> has done what was announced through Elijah—God’s servant.”
Transliteration: deu efvo khiy lo yifol midevar yehovah aretsah asher-diver yehovah al-veyt acheav vayhovah ashah et asher diver veyad avedvo eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ יֵה֗וּא אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֤ים לְבֵית־אַחְאָב֙ בְּיִזְרְעֶ֔אל וְכׇל־גְּדֹלָ֖יו וּמְיֻדָּעָ֣יו וְכֹהֲנָ֑יו עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִֽיד׃
Translated: And Jehu struck down all that were left of the House of Ahab in Jezreel—and all his notables, intimates, and priests—till he left him no survivor.
Transliteration: vayakhe eihu et khׇl-hanisheariym leveyt-acheav veyizereel vekhׇl-gedolayv umeyudaayv vekhohanayv ad-viletiy hisheiyr-lvo shariyd

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ וַיָּבֹ֔א וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ שֹׁמְר֑וֹן ה֛וּא בֵּֽית־עֵ֥קֶד הָרֹעִ֖ים בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: He then set out for Samaria. On the way, when he was at Beth-eked of the shepherds,
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayavo vayelekhe shomervon hu veyt-eked haroiym vadarekhe

Hebrew: וְיֵה֗וּא מָצָא֙ אֶת־אֲחֵי֙ אֲחַזְיָ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִ֣י אַתֶּ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אֲחֵ֤י אֲחַזְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֲנַ֔חְנוּ וַנֵּ֛רֶד לִשְׁל֥וֹם בְּנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וּבְנֵ֥י הַגְּבִירָֽה׃
Translated: Jehu came upon the kinsmen of King Ahaziah of Judah. “Who are you?” he asked. They replied, “We are the kinsmen of Ahaziah, and we have come to pay our respects to the sons of the king and the sons of the queen mother.”
Transliteration: veeihu matsa et-achey achazeyahu melekhe-yehudah vayomer miy atem vayomeru achey achazeyahu anachenu vanered lishelvom veney-hamelekhe uveney hageviyrah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ תִּפְשׂ֣וּם חַיִּ֔ים וַֽיִּתְפְּשׂ֖וּם חַיִּ֑ים וַיִּשְׁחָט֞וּם אֶל־בּ֣וֹר בֵּֽית־עֵ֗קֶד אַרְבָּעִ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וְלֹא־הִשְׁאִ֥יר אִ֖ישׁ מֵהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: “Take them alive!” he said. They took them alive and then slaughtered them at the pit of Beth-eked, forty-two of them; he did not spare a single one.
Transliteration: vayomer tifeshum chayiym vayitefeshum chayiym vayishechatum el-vvor veyt-eked arevaiym ushenayiim iysh velo-hisheiyr iysh mehem {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֡ם וַיִּמְצָ֣א אֶת־יְהוֹנָדָב֩ בֶּן־רֵכָ֨ב לִקְרָאת֜וֹ וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֗הוּ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו הֲיֵ֧שׁ אֶת־לְבָבְךָ֣ יָשָׁ֗ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר לְבָבִי֙ עִם־לְבָבֶ֔ךָ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹנָדָ֥ב יֵ֛שׁ וָיֵ֖שׁ תְּנָ֣ה אֶת־יָדֶ֑ךָ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן יָד֔וֹ וַיַּעֲלֵ֥הוּ אֵלָ֖יו אֶל־הַמֶּרְכָּבָֽה׃
Translated: He went on from there, and he met Jehonadab son of Rechab coming toward him. He greeted him and said to him, “Are you as wholehearted with me as I am with you?” “I am,” Jehonadab replied. “If so,” [said Jehu,] “give me your hand.” He gave him his hand and [Jehu] helped him into the chariot.
Transliteration: vayelekhe misham vayimetsa et-yehvonadav ven-rekhav likeratvo vayevarekhehu vayomer elayv haeish et-levavekha yashar khaasher levaviy im-levavekha vayomer yehvonadav eish vaeish tenah et-yadekha vayiten yadvo vayaalehu elayv el-hamerekhavah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְכָ֣ה אִתִּ֔י וּרְאֵ֖ה בְּקִנְאָתִ֣י לַיהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּרְכִּ֥בוּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּרִכְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Come with me,” he said, “and see my zeal for G<small>OD</small>.” And he was taken along in the chariot.
Transliteration: vayomer lekhah itiy ureeh vekineatiy layhovah vayarekhivu otvo verikhevvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ שֹׁמְר֔וֹן וַ֠יַּ֠ךְ אֶת־כׇּל־הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֧ים לְאַחְאָ֛ב בְּשֹׁמְר֖וֹן עַד־הִשְׁמִד֑וֹ כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר אֶל־אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Arriving in Samaria, [Jehu] struck down all the survivors of [the House of] Ahab in Samaria, until he wiped it out, fulfilling the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken to Elijah.
Transliteration: vayavo shomervon vayakhe et-khׇl-hanisheariym leacheav veshomervon ad-hishemidvo khidevar yehovah asher diver el-eliyahu {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֤ץ יֵהוּא֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַחְאָ֕ב עָבַ֥ד אֶת־הַבַּ֖עַל מְעָ֑ט יֵה֖וּא יַעַבְדֶ֥נּוּ הַרְבֵּֽה׃
Translated: Jehu assembled all the people and said to them, “Ahab served Baal little; Jehu shall serve him much!
Transliteration: vayikevots eihu et-khׇl-haam vayomer alehem acheav avad et-havaal meat eihu yaavedenu hareveh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה כׇל־נְבִיאֵ֣י הַבַּ֡עַל כׇּל־עֹבְדָ֣יו וְכׇל־כֹּהֲנָיו֩ קִרְא֨וּ אֵלַ֜י אִ֣ישׁ אַל־יִפָּקֵ֗ד כִּי֩ זֶ֨בַח גָּד֥וֹל לִי֙ לַבַּ֔עַל כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יִפָּקֵ֖ד לֹ֣א יִֽחְיֶ֑ה וְיֵהוּא֙ עָשָׂ֣ה בְעׇקְבָּ֔ה לְמַ֥עַן הַאֲבִ֖יד אֶת־עֹבְדֵ֥י הַבָּֽעַל׃
Translated: Therefore, summon to me all the prophets of Baal, all his worshipers, and all his priests: don’t let a single one fail to come, for I am going to hold a great sacrifice for Baal. Whoever fails to come shall forfeit his life.” Jehu was acting with guile in order to exterminate the worshipers of Baal.
Transliteration: veatah khׇl-neviyey havaal khׇl-ovedayv vekhׇl-khohanayv kireu elay iysh al-yifaked khiy zevach gadvol liy lavaal khol asher-yifaked lo yicheyeh veeihu ashah veׇkevah lemaan haaviyd et-ovedey havaal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יֵה֗וּא קַדְּשׁ֧וּ עֲצָרָ֛ה לַבַּ֖עַל וַיִּקְרָֽאוּ׃
Translated: Jehu gave orders to convoke a solemn assembly for Baal, and one was proclaimed.
Transliteration: vayomer eihu kadeshu atsarah lavaal vayikerau

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יֵהוּא֙ בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כׇּל־עֹבְדֵ֣י הַבַּ֔עַל וְלֹא־נִשְׁאַ֥ר אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־בָ֑א וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית הַבַּ֔עַל וַיִּמָּלֵ֥א בֵית־הַבַּ֖עַל פֶּ֥ה לָפֶֽה׃
Translated: Jehu sent word throughout Israel, and all the worshipers of Baal came, not one remained behind. They came into the temple of Baal, and the temple of Baal was filled from end to end.
Transliteration: vayishelach eihu vekhׇl-yisherael vayavou khׇl-ovedey havaal velo-nishear iysh asher lo-va vayavou veyt havaal vayimale veyt-havaal feh lafeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־הַמֶּלְתָּחָ֔ה הוֹצֵ֣א לְב֔וּשׁ לְכֹ֖ל עֹבְדֵ֣י הַבָּ֑עַל וַיֹּצֵ֥א לָהֶ֖ם הַמַּלְבּֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: He said to the wardrobe manager, “Bring out the vestments for all the worshipers of Baal”; and he brought vestments out for them.
Transliteration: vayomer laasher al-hameletachah hvotse levush lekhol ovedey havaal vayotse lahem hamalevush

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א יֵה֛וּא וִיהוֹנָדָ֥ב בֶּן־רֵכָ֖ב בֵּ֣ית הַבָּ֑עַל וַיֹּ֜אמֶר לְעֹבְדֵ֣י הַבַּ֗עַל חַפְּשׂ֤וּ וּרְאוּ֙ פֶּן־יֶשׁ־פֹּ֤ה עִמָּכֶם֙ מֵעַבְדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י אִם־עֹבְדֵ֥י הַבַּ֖עַל לְבַדָּֽם׃
Translated: Then Jehu and Jehonadab son of Rechab came into the temple of Baal, and they said to the worshipers of Baal, “Search and make sure that there are no worshipers of G<small>OD</small> among you, but only worshipers of Baal.”
Transliteration: vayavo eihu viyhvonadav ven-rekhav veyt havaal vayomer leovedey havaal chafeshu ureu fen-yesh-foh imakhem meavedey yehovah khiy im-ovedey havaal levadam

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת זְבָחִ֣ים וְעֹל֑וֹת וְיֵה֞וּא שָֽׂם־ל֤וֹ בַחוּץ֙ שְׁמֹנִ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הָאִ֤ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִמָּלֵט֙ מִן־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ מֵבִ֣יא עַל־יְדֵיכֶ֔ם נַפְשׁ֖וֹ תַּ֥חַת נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: So they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. But Jehu had stationed eighty of his men outside and had said, “Whoever permits the escape of a single one of those whom I commit to your charge shall forfeit life for life.”
Transliteration: vayavou laashvot zevachiym veolvot veeihu sham-lvo vachuts shemoniym iysh vayomer haiysh asher-yimalet min-haanashiym asher aniy meviy al-yedeykhem nafeshvo tachat nafeshvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כְּכַלֹּת֣וֹ ׀ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הָעֹלָ֗ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יֵ֠ה֠וּא לָרָצִ֨ים וְלַשָּׁלִשִׁ֜ים בֹּ֤אוּ הַכּוּם֙ אִ֣ישׁ אַל־יֵצֵ֔א וַיַּכּ֖וּם לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיַּשְׁלִ֗כוּ הָרָצִים֙ וְהַשָּׁ֣לִשִׁ֔ים וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ עַד־עִ֥יר בֵּית־הַבָּֽעַל׃
Translated: When Jehu had finished presenting the burnt offering, he said to the guards and to the officers, “Come in and strike them down; don’t let a single one get away!” The guards and the officers struck them down with the sword and left them lying where they were; then they proceeded to the interior of the temple of Baal.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalotvo laashvot haolah vayomer eihu laratsiym velashalishiym vou hakhum iysh al-eitse vayakhum lefiy-charev vayashelikhu haratsiym vehashalishiym vayelekhu ad-iyr veyt-havaal

Hebrew: וַיֹּצִ֛אוּ אֶת־מַצְּב֥וֹת בֵּית־הַבַּ֖עַל וַֽיִּשְׂרְפֽוּהָ׃
Translated: They brought out the pillars of the temple of Baal and burned them.
Transliteration: vayotsiu et-matsevvot veyt-havaal vayisherefuha

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּצ֔וּ אֵ֖ת מַצְּבַ֣ת הַבָּ֑עַל וַֽיִּתְּצוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית הַבַּ֔עַל וַיְשִׂמֻ֥הוּ (למחראות) [לְמֽוֹצָא֖וֹת] עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: They destroyed the pillar of Baal, and they tore down the temple of Baal and turned it into latrines, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vayitetsu et matsevat havaal vayitetsu et-veyt havaal vayeshimuhu (lmchrvt) [lemvotsavot] ad-hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁמֵ֥ד יֵה֛וּא אֶת־הַבַּ֖עַל מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus Jehu eradicated the Baal from Israel.
Transliteration: vayashemed eihu et-havaal miyisherael

Hebrew: רַ֠ק חֲטָאֵ֞י יָרׇבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־נְבָט֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶחֱטִ֣יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹא־סָ֥ר יֵה֖וּא מֵאַֽחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם עֶגְלֵי֙ הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּדָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: However, Jehu did not turn away from the sinful objects by which Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to sin, namely, the golden calves at Bethel and at Dan.
Transliteration: rak chataey yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael lo-sar eihu meachareyhem egeley hazahav asher veyt-el vaasher vedan {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־יֵה֗וּא יַ֤עַן אֲשֶׁר־הֱטִיבֹ֙תָ֙ לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת הַיָּשָׁר֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י כְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּלְבָבִ֔י עָשִׂ֖יתָ לְבֵ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב בְּנֵ֣י רְבִעִ֔ים יֵשְׁב֥וּ לְךָ֖ עַל־כִּסֵּ֥א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Jehu, “Because you have acted well and done what was pleasing to Me, having carried out all that I desired upon the House of Ahab, four generations of your descendants shall occupy the throne of Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-eihu yaan asher-hetiyvota laashvot hayashar veeynay khekhol asher vilevaviy ashiyta leveyt acheav veney reviiym eishevu lekha al-khise yisherael

Hebrew: וְיֵה֗וּא לֹ֥א שָׁמַ֛ר לָלֶ֛כֶת בְּתֽוֹרַת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּכׇל־לְבָב֑וֹ לֹ֣א סָ֗ר מֵעַל֙ חַטֹּ֣אות יָרׇבְעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But Jehu was not careful to follow the Teaching of G<small>OD</small>, the God of Israel, with all his heart; he did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam had caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: veeihu lo shamar lalekhet vetvorat-yehovah elohey-yisherael vekhׇl-levavvo lo sar meal chatovt yarׇveam asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם הֵחֵ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה לְקַצּ֖וֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּכֵּ֥ם חֲזָאֵ֖ל בְּכׇל־גְּב֥וּל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: In those days G<small>OD</small> began to reduce Israel; and Hazael harassed them throughout the territory of Israel
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem hechel yehovah lekatsvot veyisherael vayakhem chazael vekhׇl-gevul yisherael

Hebrew: מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִזְרַ֣ח הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֔ד הַגָּדִ֥י וְהָראוּבֵנִ֖י וְהַֽמְנַשִּׁ֑י מֵֽעֲרֹעֵר֙ אֲשֶׁר־עַל־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹ֔ן וְהַגִּלְעָ֖ד וְהַבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated: east of the Jordan, all the land of Gilead—the Gadites, the Reubenites, and the Manassites—from Aroer, by the Wadi Arnon, up to Gilead and Bashan.
Transliteration: min-hayareden mizerach hashemesh et khׇl-erets hagilead hagadiy veharuveniy vehamenashiy mearoer asher-al-nachal arenon vehagilead vehavashan

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יֵה֛וּא וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה וְכׇל־גְּבוּרָת֑וֹ הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Jehu’s reign, and all his actions, and all his exploits, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey eihu vekhׇl-asher ashah vekhׇl-gevuratvo halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יֵהוּא֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹאָחָ֥ז בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Jehu rested with his ancestors and he was buried in Samaria; he was succeeded as king by his son Jehoahaz.
Transliteration: vayishekhav eihu im-avotayv vayikeveru otvo veshomervon vayimelokhe yehvoachaz venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וְהַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָלַ֤ךְ יֵהוּא֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עֶשְׂרִֽים־וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: Jehu reigned over Israel for twenty-eight years in Samaria.
Transliteration: vehayamiym asher malakhe eihu al-yisherael esheriym-ushemoneh shanah veshomervon {f}

Hebrew: וַֽעֲתַלְיָה֙ אֵ֣ם אֲחַזְיָ֔הוּ (וראתה) [רָאֲתָ֖ה] כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת בְּנָ֑הּ וַתָּ֙קׇם֙ וַתְּאַבֵּ֔ד אֵ֖ת כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע הַמַּמְלָכָֽה׃
Translated: When Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, learned that her son was dead, she promptly killed off all who were of royal stock.
Transliteration: vaataleyah em achazeyahu (vrth) [raatah] khiy met venah vatakׇm vateaved et khׇl-zera hamamelakhah

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח יְהוֹשֶׁ֣בַע בַּת־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ־י֠וֹרָ֠ם אֲח֨וֹת אֲחַזְיָ֜הוּ אֶת־יוֹאָ֣שׁ בֶּן־אֲחַזְיָ֗ה וַתִּגְנֹ֤ב אֹתוֹ֙ מִתּ֤וֹךְ בְּנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ (הממותתים) [הַמּ֣וּמָתִ֔ים] אֹת֥וֹ וְאֶת־מֵינִקְתּ֖וֹ בַּחֲדַ֣ר הַמִּטּ֑וֹת וַיַּסְתִּ֧רוּ אֹת֛וֹ מִפְּנֵ֥י עֲתַלְיָ֖הוּ וְלֹ֥א הוּמָֽת׃
Translated: But Jehosheba, daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah, secretly took Ahaziah’s son Joash away from among the princes who were being slain, and [put] him and his nurse in a bedroom. And they kept him hidden from Athaliah so that he was not put to death.
Transliteration: vatikach yehvosheva vat-hamelekhe-yvoram achvot achazeyahu et-yvoash ven-achazeyah vatigenov otvo mitvokhe veney-hamelekhe (hmmvttym) [hamumatiym] otvo veet-meyniketvo vachadar hamitvot vayasetiru otvo mifeney ataleyahu velo humat

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י אִתָּהּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה מִתְחַבֵּ֖א שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וַעֲתַלְיָ֖ה מֹלֶ֥כֶת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: He stayed with her for six years, hidden in the House of G<small>OD</small>, while Athaliah reigned over the land.
Transliteration: vayehiy itah veyt yehovah mitechave shesh shaniym vaataleyah molekhet al-haarets {f}

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַ֠שְּׁבִיעִ֠ית שָׁלַ֨ח יְהוֹיָדָ֜ע וַיִּקַּ֣ח ׀ אֶת־שָׂרֵ֣י (המאיות) [הַמֵּא֗וֹת] לַכָּרִי֙ וְלָ֣רָצִ֔ים וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֛ם אֵלָ֖יו בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּכְרֹת֩ לָהֶ֨ם בְּרִ֜ית וַיַּשְׁבַּ֤ע אֹתָם֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּ֥רְא אֹתָ֖ם אֶת־בֶּן־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: In the seventh year, Jehoiada sent for the chiefs of the hundreds of the Carites and of the guards, and had them come to him in the House of G<small>OD</small>. He made a pact with them, exacting an oath from them in the House of G<small>OD</small>, and he showed them the king’s son.
Transliteration: uvashanah hasheviyiyt shalach yehvoyada vayikach et-sharey (hmyvt) [hamevot] lakhariy velaratsiym vayave otam elayv veyt yehovah vayikherot lahem veriyt vayasheva otam veveyt yehovah vayare otam et-ven-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְצַוֵּ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר זֶ֥ה הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשׂ֑וּן הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֤ית מִכֶּם֙ בָּאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת וְשֹׁ֣מְרֵ֔י מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: He instructed them: “This is what you must do: One-third of those who are on duty for the week shall maintain guard over the royal palace;
Transliteration: vayetsavem lemor zeh hadavar asher taashun hashelishiyt mikhem vaey hashavat veshomerey mishemeret veyt hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁית֙ בְּשַׁ֣עַר ס֔וּר וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁ֥ית בַּשַּׁ֖עַר אַחַ֣ר הָרָצִ֑ים וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֛ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת הַבַּ֖יִת מַסָּֽח׃
Translated: another third shall be [stationed] at the Sur Gate; and the other third shall be at the gate behind the guards; you shall keep guard over the House on every side.
Transliteration: vehashelishiyt veshaar sur vehashelishiyt vashaar achar haratsiym ushemaretem et-mishemeret havayiit masach

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֤י הַיָּדוֹת֙ בָּכֶ֔ם כֹּ֖ל יֹצְאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וְשָׁ֥מְר֛וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The two divisions of yours who are off duty this week shall keep guard over the House of G<small>OD</small> for the protection of the king.
Transliteration: ushetey hayadvot vakhem khol yotseey hashavat veshameru et-mishemeret veyt-yehovah el-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהִקַּפְתֶּ֨ם עַל־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ סָבִ֗יב אִ֚ישׁ וְכֵלָ֣יו בְּיָד֔וֹ וְהַבָּ֥א אֶל־הַשְּׂדֵר֖וֹת יוּמָ֑ת וִֽהְי֥וּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּצֵאת֥וֹ וּבְבֹאֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall surround the king on every side, with your arms at the ready; and whoever breaks through the ranks shall be killed. Stay close to the king in his comings and goings.”
Transliteration: vehikafetem al-hamelekhe saviyv iysh vekhelayv veyadvo vehava el-hashedervot yumat viheyu et-hamelekhe vetsetvo uvevovo

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֞וּ שָׂרֵ֣י (המאיות) [הַמֵּא֗וֹת] כְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּה֮ יְהוֹיָדָ֣ע הַכֹּהֵן֒ וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אֲנָשָׁ֔יו בָּאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת עִ֖ם יֹצְאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־יְהוֹיָדָ֥ע הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: The chiefs of hundreds did just as Jehoiada ordered: Each took his men—those who were on duty that week and those who were off duty that week—and they presented themselves to Jehoiada the priest.
Transliteration: vayaashu sharey (hmyvt) [hamevot] khekhol asher-tsivah yehvoyada hakhohen vayikechu iysh et-anashayv vaey hashavat im yotseey hashavat vayavou el-yehvoyada hakhohen

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֜ן לְשָׂרֵ֣י (המאיות) [הַמֵּא֗וֹת] אֶֽת־הַחֲנִית֙ וְאֶת־הַשְּׁלָטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priest gave the chiefs of hundreds King David’s spears and quivers that were kept in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayiten hakhohen lesharey (hmyvt) [hamevot] et-hachaniyt veet-hashelatiym asher lamelekhe david asher veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעַמְד֨וּ הָרָצִ֜ים אִ֣ישׁ ׀ וְכֵלָ֣יו בְּיָד֗וֹ מִכֶּ֨תֶף הַבַּ֤יִת הַיְמָנִית֙ עַד־כֶּ֤תֶף הַבַּ֙יִת֙ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֔ית לַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ וְלַבָּ֑יִת עַל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: The guards, with their arms at the ready, stationed themselves—from the south end of the House to the north end of the House, at the altar and the House—to guard the king on every side.
Transliteration: vayaamedu haratsiym iysh vekhelayv veyadvo mikhetef havayiit hayemaniyt ad-khetef havayiit hashemaliyt lamizevecha velavayiit al-hamelekhe saviyv

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֣א אֶת־בֶּן־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַיִּתֵּ֤ן עָלָיו֙ אֶת־הַנֵּ֙זֶר֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣עֵד֔וּת וַיַּמְלִ֥כוּ אֹת֖וֹ וַיִּמְשָׁחֻ֑הוּ וַיַּ֨כּוּ־כָ֔ף וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ יְחִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: [Jehoiada] then brought out the king’s son, and placed upon him the crown and the insignia. They anointed him and proclaimed him king; they clapped their hands and shouted, “Long live the king!”
Transliteration: vayyvotsi et-ven-hamelekhe vayiten alayv et-hanezer veet-haedut vayamelikhu otvo vayimeshachuhu vayakhu-khaf vayomeru yechiy hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁמַ֣ע עֲתַלְיָ֔ה אֶת־ק֥וֹל הָרָצִ֖ין הָעָ֑ם וַתָּבֹ֥א אֶל־הָעָ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When Athaliah heard the shouting of the guards [and] the people, she came out to the people in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vatishema ataleyah et-kvol haratsiyn haam vatavo el-haam veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֡רֶא וְהִנֵּ֣ה הַמֶּ֩לֶךְ֩ עֹמֵ֨ד עַֽל־הָעַמּ֜וּד כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט וְהַשָּׂרִ֤ים וְהַחֲצֹֽצְרוֹת֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכׇל־עַ֤ם הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שָׂמֵ֔חַ וְתֹקֵ֖עַ בַּחֲצֹֽצְר֑וֹת וַתִּקְרַ֤ע עֲתַלְיָה֙ אֶת־בְּגָדֶ֔יהָ וַתִּקְרָ֖א קֶ֥שֶׁר קָֽשֶׁר׃
Translated: She looked about and saw the king standing by the pillar, as was the custom, the chiefs with their trumpets beside the king, and all the people of the land rejoicing and blowing trumpets. Athaliah rent her garments and cried out, “Treason, treason!”
Transliteration: vatere vehineh hamelekhe omed al-haamud khamishefat vehashariym vehachatsotservot el-hamelekhe vekhׇl-am haarets shamecha vetokea vachatsotservot vatikera ataleyah et-vegadeyha vatikera kesher kasher

Hebrew: וַיְצַו֩ יְהוֹיָדָ֨ע הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־שָׂרֵ֥י (המאיות) [הַמֵּא֣וֹת ׀] פְּקֻדֵ֣י הַחַ֗יִל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ הוֹצִ֤יאוּ אֹתָהּ֙ אֶל־מִבֵּ֣ית לַשְּׂדֵרֹ֔ת וְהַבָּ֥א אַחֲרֶ֖יהָ הָמֵ֣ת בֶּחָ֑רֶב כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אַל־תּוּמַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then the priest Jehoiada gave the command to the army officers, the chiefs of hundreds, and said to them, “Take her out between the ranks and, if anyone follows her, put him to the sword.” For the priest thought: “Let her not be put to death in the House of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayetsav yehvoyada hakhohen et-sharey (hmyvt) [hamevot ] fekudey hachayiil vayomer aleyhem hvotsiyu otah el-miveyt lashederot vehava achareyha hamet vecharev khiy amar hakhohen al-tumat veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֤מוּ לָהּ֙ יָדַ֔יִם וַתָּב֛וֹא דֶּרֶךְ־מְב֥וֹא הַסּוּסִ֖ים בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַתּוּמַ֖ת שָֽׁם׃ {ס}
Translated: They cleared a passageway for her and she entered the royal palace through the horses’ entrance: there she was put to death.
Transliteration: vayashimu lah yadayiim vatavvo derekhe-mevvo hasusiym veyt hamelekhe vatumat sham {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֨ת יְהוֹיָדָ֜ע אֶֽת־הַבְּרִ֗ית בֵּ֤ין יְהֹוָה֙ וּבֵ֤ין הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וּבֵ֣ין הָעָ֔ם לִהְי֥וֹת לְעָ֖ם לַיהֹוָ֑ה וּבֵ֥ין הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וּבֵ֥ין הָעָֽם׃
Translated: And Jehoiada solemnized the covenant between G<small>OD</small>, on the one hand, and the king and the people, on the other—as well as between the king and the people—that they should be G<small>OD</small>’s people.
Transliteration: vayikherot yehvoyada et-haveriyt veyn yehovah uveyn hamelekhe uveyn haam liheyvot leam layhovah uveyn hamelekhe uveyn haam

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ כׇל־עַם֩ הָאָ֨רֶץ בֵּית־הַבַּ֜עַל וַֽיִּתְּצֻ֗הוּ אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָ֤ו וְאֶת־צְלָמָיו֙ שִׁבְּר֣וּ הֵיטֵ֔ב וְאֵ֗ת מַתָּן֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן הַבַּ֔עַל הָרְג֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י הַֽמִּזְבְּח֑וֹת וַיָּ֧שֶׂם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן פְּקֻדֹּ֖ת עַל־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon all the people of the land went to the temple of Baal. They tore it down and smashed its altars and images to bits, and they slew Mattan, the priest of Baal, in front of the altars. [Jehoiada] the priest then placed guards over the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-am haarets veyt-havaal vayitetsuhu et-mizevechotav veet-tselamayv shiveru heytev veet matan khohen havaal haregu lifeney hamizevechvot vayashem hakhohen fekudot al-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־שָׂרֵ֣י הַ֠מֵּא֠וֹת וְאֶת־הַכָּרִ֨י וְאֶת־הָרָצִ֜ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֗רֶץ וַיֹּרִ֤ידוּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּב֛וֹאוּ דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֥עַר הָרָצִ֖ים בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב עַל־כִּסֵּ֥א הַמְּלָכִֽים׃
Translated: He took the chiefs of hundreds, the Carites, the guards, and all the people of the land, and they escorted the king from the House of G<small>OD</small> into the royal palace by the gate of the guards. And he ascended the royal throne.
Transliteration: vayikach et-sharey hamevot veet-hakhariy veet-haratsiym veet khׇl-am haarets vayoriydu et-hamelekhe miveyt yehovah vayavvou derekhe-shaar haratsiym veyt hamelekhe vayeshev al-khise hamelakhiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמַ֥ח כׇּל־עַם־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהָעִ֣יר שָׁקָ֑טָה וְאֶת־עֲתַלְיָ֛הוּ הֵמִ֥יתוּ בַחֶ֖רֶב בֵּ֥ית (מלך) [הַמֶּֽלֶךְ]׃ {ס}
Translated: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. As for Athaliah, she had been put to the sword in the royal palace.
Transliteration: vayishemach khׇl-am-haarets vehaiyr shakatah veet-ataleyahu hemiytu vacherev veyt (mlkh) [hamelekhe] {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים יְהוֹאָ֥שׁ בְּמׇלְכֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Jehoash was seven years old when he became king.
Transliteration: ven-sheva shaniym yehvoash vemׇlekhvo {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת־שֶׁ֤בַע לְיֵהוּא֙ מָלַ֣ךְ יְהוֹאָ֔שׁ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ צִבְיָ֖ה מִבְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: Jehoash began his reign in the seventh year of Jehu, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years. His mother’s name was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: vishenat-sheva leeihu malakhe yehvoash vearevaiym shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo tsiveyah miveer shava

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ יְהוֹאָ֧שׁ הַיָּשָׁ֛ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה כׇּל־יָמָ֑יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹרָ֔הוּ יְהוֹיָדָ֖ע הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: All his days Jehoash did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>, as the priest Jehoiada instructed him.
Transliteration: vayaash yehvoash hayashar veeyney yehovah khׇl-yamayv asher hvorahu yehvoyada hakhohen

Hebrew: רַ֥ק הַבָּמ֖וֹת לֹא־סָ֑רוּ ע֥וֹד הָעָ֛ם מְזַבְּחִ֥ים וּֽמְקַטְּרִ֖ים בַּבָּמֽוֹת׃
Translated: The shrines, however, were not removed; the people continued to sacrifice and offer at the shrines.
Transliteration: rak havamvot lo-saru vod haam mezavechiym umekateriym vavamvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹאָ֜שׁ אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים כֹּל֩ כֶּ֨סֶף הַקֳּדָשִׁ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־יוּבָ֤א בֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ כֶּ֣סֶף עוֹבֵ֔ר אִ֕ישׁ כֶּ֥סֶף נַפְשׁ֖וֹת עֶרְכּ֑וֹ כׇּל־כֶּ֗סֶף אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַֽעֲלֶה֙ עַ֣ל לֶב־אִ֔ישׁ לְהָבִ֖יא בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoash said to the priests, “All the money, current money, brought into the House of G<small>OD</small> as sacred donations—any money that someone may pay as the money equivalent of persons, or any other money that someone may be minded to bring to the House of G<small>OD</small>—
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoash el-hakhohaniym khol khesef hakodashiym asher-yuva veyt-yehovah khesef vover iysh khesef nafeshvot erekhvo khׇl-khesef asher yaaleh al lev-iysh lehaviy veyt yehovah

Hebrew: יִקְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים אִ֖ישׁ מֵאֵ֣ת מַכָּר֑וֹ וְהֵ֗ם יְחַזְּקוּ֙ אֶת־בֶּ֣דֶק הַבַּ֔יִת לְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִמָּצֵ֥א שָׁ֖ם בָּֽדֶק׃ {פ}
Translated: let the priests receive it, each from his benefactor; they, in turn, shall make repairs on the House, wherever damage may be found.”
Transliteration: yikechu lahem hakhohaniym iysh meet makharvo vehem yechazeku et-vedek havayiit lekhol asher-yimatse sham vadek {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּשְׁנַ֨ת עֶשְׂרִ֧ים וְשָׁלֹ֛שׁ שָׁנָ֖ה לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יְהוֹאָ֑שׁ לֹא־חִזְּק֥וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים אֶת־בֶּ֥דֶק הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: But in the twenty-third year of King Jehoash, [it was found that] the priests had not made the repairs on the House.
Transliteration: vayehiy vishenat esheriym veshalosh shanah lamelekhe yehvoash lo-chizeku hakhohaniym et-vedek havayiit

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ יְהוֹאָ֜שׁ לִיהוֹיָדָ֤ע הַכֹּהֵן֙ וְלַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם מַדּ֛וּעַ אֵינְכֶ֥ם מְחַזְּקִ֖ים אֶת־בֶּ֣דֶק הַבָּ֑יִת וְעַתָּ֗ה אַל־תִּקְחֽוּ־כֶ֙סֶף֙ מֵאֵ֣ת מַכָּרֵיכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־לְבֶ֥דֶק הַבַּ֖יִת תִּתְּנֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: So King Jehoash summoned the priest Jehoiada and the other priests and said to them, “Why have you not kept the House in repair? Now do not accept money from your benefactors anymore, but have it donated for the repair of the House.”
Transliteration: vayikera hamelekhe yehvoash liyhvoyada hakhohen velakhohaniym vayomer alehem madua eynekhem mechazekiym et-vedek havayiit veatah al-tikechu-khesef meet makhareykhem khiy-levedek havayiit titenuhu

Hebrew: וַיֵּאֹ֖תוּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֑ים לְבִלְתִּ֤י קְחַת־כֶּ֙סֶף֙ מֵאֵ֣ת הָעָ֔ם וּלְבִלְתִּ֥י חַזֵּ֖ק אֶת־בֶּ֥דֶק הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The priests agreed that they would neither accept money from the people nor make repairs on the House.
Transliteration: vayeotu hakhohaniym leviletiy kechat-khesef meet haam uleviletiy chazek et-vedek havayiit

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יְהוֹיָדָ֤ע הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֲר֣וֹן אֶחָ֔ד וַיִּקֹּ֥ב חֹ֖ר בְּדַלְתּ֑וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֹתוֹ֩ אֵ֨צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּ֜חַ (בימין) [מִיָּמִ֗ין] בְּבוֹא־אִישׁ֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנָֽתְנוּ־שָׁ֤מָּה הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ שֹׁמְרֵ֣י הַסַּ֔ף אֶת־כׇּל־הַכֶּ֖סֶף הַמּוּבָ֥א בֵית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And the priest Jehoiada took a chest and bored a hole in its lid. He placed it at the right side of the altar as one entered the House of G<small>OD</small>, and the priestly guards of the threshold deposited there all the money that was brought into the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikach yehvoyada hakhohen arvon echad vayikov chor vedaletvo vayiten otvo etsel hamizevecha (vymyn) [miyamiyn] vevvo-iysh veyt yehovah venatenu-shamah hakhohaniym shomerey hasaf et-khׇl-hakhesef hamuva veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּרְאוֹתָ֔ם כִּי־רַ֥ב הַכֶּ֖סֶף בָּאָר֑וֹן וַיַּ֨עַל סֹפֵ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְהַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּד֔וֹל וַיָּצֻ֙רוּ֙ וַיִּמְנ֔וּ אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף הַנִּמְצָ֥א בֵית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Whenever they saw that there was much money in the chest, the royal scribe and the high priest would come up and put the money accumulated in the House of G<small>OD</small> into bags, and they would count it.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevotam khiy-rav hakhesef vaarvon vayaal sofer hamelekhe vehakhohen hagadvol vayatsuru vayimenu et-hakhesef hanimetsa veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וְנָֽתְנוּ֙ אֶת־הַכֶּ֣סֶף הַֽמְתֻכָּ֔ן עַל־[יְדֵי֙] (יד) עֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה (הפקדים) [הַמֻּפְקָדִ֖ים] בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיּוֹצִיאֻ֜הוּ לְחָרָשֵׁ֤י הָעֵץ֙ וְלַבֹּנִ֔ים הָעֹשִׂ֖ים בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then they would deliver the money that was weighed out to the overseers of the work, who were in charge of the House of G<small>OD</small>. These, in turn, used to pay the carpenters and the laborers who worked on the House of G<small>OD</small>,
Transliteration: venatenu et-hakhesef hametukhan al-[yedey] (yd) oshey hamelakhah (hfkdym) [hamufekadiym] veyt yehovah vayyvotsiyuhu lecharashey haets velavoniym haoshiym veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְלַגֹּֽדְרִים֙ וּלְחֹצְבֵ֣י הָאֶ֔בֶן וְלִקְנ֤וֹת עֵצִים֙ וְאַבְנֵ֣י מַחְצֵ֔ב לְחַזֵּ֖ק אֶת־בֶּ֣דֶק בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּלְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵ֥א עַל־הַבַּ֖יִת לְחׇזְקָֽה׃
