Translated: and the masons and the stonecutters. They also paid for wood and for quarried stone with which to make the repairs on the House of G<small>OD</small>, and for every other expenditure that had to be made in repairing the House.
Transliteration: velagoderiym ulechotsevey haeven velikenvot etsiym veaveney machetsev lechazek et-vedek veyt-yehovah ulekhol asher-eitse al-havayiit lechׇzekah

Hebrew: אַךְ֩ לֹ֨א יֵעָשֶׂ֜ה בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֗ה סִפּ֥וֹת כֶּ֙סֶף֙ מְזַמְּר֤וֹת מִזְרָקוֹת֙ חֲצֹ֣צְר֔וֹת כׇּל־כְּלִ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּכְלִי־כָ֑סֶף מִן־הַכֶּ֖סֶף הַמּוּבָ֥א בֵית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: However, no silver bowls and no snuffers, basins, or trumpets—no vessels of gold or silver—were made at the House of G<small>OD</small> from the money brought into the House of G<small>OD</small>;
Transliteration: akhe lo eiasheh veyt yehovah sifvot khesef mezamervot mizerakvot chatsotservot khׇl-kheliy zahav ukheliy-khasef min-hakhesef hamuva veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לְעֹשֵׂ֥י הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה יִתְּנֻ֑הוּ וְחִזְּקוּ־ב֖וֹ אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: this was given only to the overseers of the work for the repair of the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy-leoshey hamelakhah yitenuhu vechizeku-vvo et-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹ֧א יְחַשְּׁב֣וּ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתְּנ֤וּ אֶת־הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ עַל־יָדָ֔ם לָתֵ֖ת לְעֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֑ה כִּ֥י בֶאֱמֻנָ֖ה הֵ֥ם עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: No check was kept on those to whom the money was delivered to pay the workers; for they dealt honestly.
Transliteration: velo yechashevu et-haanashiym asher yitenu et-hakhesef al-yadam latet leoshey hamelakhah khiy veemunah hem oshiym

Hebrew: כֶּ֤סֶף אָשָׁם֙ וְכֶ֣סֶף חַטָּא֔וֹת לֹ֥א יוּבָ֖א בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה לַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים יִהְיֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Money brought as a reparation offering or as a purgation offering was not deposited in the House of G<small>OD</small>; it went to the priests.
Transliteration: khesef asham vekhesef chatavot lo yuva veyt yehovah lakhohaniym yiheyu {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יַעֲלֶ֗ה חֲזָאֵל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם עַל־גַּ֖ת וַֽיִּלְכְּדָ֑הּ וַיָּ֤שֶׂם חֲזָאֵל֙ פָּנָ֔יו לַעֲל֖וֹת עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: At that time, King Hazael of Aram came up and attacked Gath and captured it; and Hazael proceeded to march on Jerusalem.
Transliteration: az yaaleh chazael melekhe aram vayilachem al-gat vayilekhedah vayashem chazael fanayv laalvot al-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יְהוֹאָ֣שׁ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֡ים אֲשֶׁר־הִקְדִּ֣ישׁוּ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט וִיהוֹרָם֩ וַאֲחַזְיָ֨הוּ אֲבֹתָ֜יו מַלְכֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ וְאֶת־קֳדָשָׁ֔יו וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַזָּהָ֗ב הַנִּמְצָ֛א בְּאֹצְר֥וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח לַֽחֲזָאֵל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם וַיַּ֖עַל מֵעַ֥ל יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Thereupon King Joash of Judah took all the objects that had been consecrated by his predecessors, Kings Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, and Ahaziah of Judah, and by himself, and all the gold that there was in the treasuries of the Temple of G<small>OD</small> and in the royal palace, and he sent them to King Hazael of Aram, who then turned back from his march on Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayikach yehvoash melekhe-yehudah et khׇl-hakodashiym asher-hikediyshu yehvoshafat viyhvoram vaachazeyahu avotayv malekhey yehudah veet-kodashayv veet khׇl-hazahav hanimetsa veotservot veyt-yehovah uveyt hamelekhe vayishelach lachazael melekhe aram vayaal meal yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יוֹאָ֖שׁ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Joash’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yvoash vekhׇl-asher ashah halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֥מוּ עֲבָדָ֖יו וַיִּקְשְׁרוּ־קָ֑שֶׁר וַיַּכּוּ֙ אֶת־יוֹאָ֔שׁ בֵּ֥ית מִלֹּ֖א הַיֹּרֵ֥ד סִלָּֽא׃
Translated: His courtiers formed a conspiracy against Joash and assassinated him at Beth-millo that leads down to Silla.
Transliteration: vayakumu avadayv vayikesheru-kasher vayakhu et-yvoash veyt milo hayored sila

Hebrew: וְיוֹזָכָ֣ר בֶּן־שִׁ֠מְעָ֠ת וִיהוֹזָבָ֨ד בֶּן־שֹׁמֵ֤ר ׀ עֲבָדָיו֙ הִכֻּ֣הוּ וַיָּמֹ֔ת וַֽיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲמַצְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: The courtiers who assassinated him were Jozacar son of Shimeath and Jehozabad son of Shomer. He died and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David; and his son Amaziah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: veyvozakhar ven-shimeat viyhvozavad ven-shomer avadayv hikhuhu vayamot vayikeveru otvo im-avotayv veiyr david vayimelokhe amatseyah venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וְשָׁלֹשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְיוֹאָ֥שׁ בֶּן־אֲחַזְיָ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ יְהוֹאָחָ֨ז בֶּן־יֵה֤וּא עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן שְׁבַ֥ע עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: In the twenty-third year of King Joash son of Ahaziah of Judah, Jehoahaz son of Jehu became king over Israel in Samaria—for seventeen years.
Transliteration: vishenat esheriym veshalosh shanah leyvoash ven-achazeyahu melekhe yehudah malakhe yehvoachaz ven-eihu al-yisherael veshomervon sheva eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַ֠יֵּ֠לֶךְ אַחַ֨ר חַטֹּ֜את יָרׇבְעָ֧ם בֶּן־נְבָ֛ט אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱטִ֥יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹא־סָ֥ר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>. He persisted in the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit; he did not depart from them.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah vayelekhe achar chatot yarׇveam ven-nevat asher-hechetiy et-yisherael lo-sar mimenah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֞ם בְּיַ֣ד ׀ חֲזָאֵ֣ל מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֗ם וּבְיַ֛ד בֶּן־הֲדַ֥ד בֶּן־חֲזָאֵ֖ל כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> was angry with Israel and repeatedly delivered them into the hands of King Hazael of Aram and into the hands of Ben-hadad son of Hazael.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael vayitenem veyad chazael melekhe-aram uveyad ven-hadad ven-chazael khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וַיְחַ֥ל יְהוֹאָחָ֖ז אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֤י רָאָה֙ אֶת־לַ֣חַץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּי־לָחַ֥ץ אֹתָ֖ם מֶ֥לֶךְ אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: But Jehoahaz pleaded with G<small>OD</small>; and G<small>OD</small> listened to him, having seen the suffering that the king of Aram inflicted upon Israel.
Transliteration: vayechal yehvoachaz et-feney yehovah vayishema elayv yehovah khiy raah et-lachats yisherael khiy-lachats otam melekhe aram

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֤ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מוֹשִׁ֔יעַ וַיֵּ֣צְא֔וּ מִתַּ֖חַת יַד־אֲרָ֑ם וַיֵּשְׁב֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּאׇהֳלֵיהֶ֖ם כִּתְמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
Translated: So G<small>OD</small> granted Israel a deliverer, and they gained their freedom from Aram; and Israel dwelt in its homes as before.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah leyisherael mvoshiya vayetseu mitachat yad-aram vayeshevu veney-yisherael veׇholeyhem khitemvol shileshvom

Hebrew: אַ֠ךְ לֹא־סָ֜רוּ מֵחַטֹּ֧את בֵּית־יָרׇבְעָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱטִ֥י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּ֣הּ הָלָ֑ךְ וְגַם֙ הָאֲשֵׁרָ֔ה עָמְדָ֖ה בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: However, they did not depart from the sins that the House of Jeroboam had caused Israel to commit; they persisted in them. Even the sacred post stood in Samaria.
Transliteration: akhe lo-saru mechatot veyt-yarׇveam asher-hechetiy et-yisherael vah halakhe vegam haasherah amedah veshomervon

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹא֩ הִשְׁאִ֨יר לִיהוֹאָחָ֜ז עָ֗ם כִּ֣י אִם־חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים פָּֽרָשִׁים֙ וַעֲשָׂ֣רָה רֶ֔כֶב וַעֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִ֖ים רַגְלִ֑י כִּ֤י אִבְּדָם֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם וַיְשִׂמֵ֥ם כֶּעָפָ֖ר לָדֻֽשׁ׃
Translated: In fact, Jehoahaz was left with a force of only fifty riders, ten chariots, and ten thousand foot soldiers; for the king of Aram had decimated them and trampled them like the dust under his feet.
Transliteration: khiy lo hisheiyr liyhvoachaz am khiy im-chamishiym farashiym vaasharah rekhev vaasheret alafiym rageliy khiy ivedam melekhe aram vayeshimem kheafar ladush

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֧י יְהוֹאָחָ֛ז וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה וּגְבוּרָת֑וֹ הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Jehoahaz’s reign, and all his actions and his exploits, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yehvoachaz vekhׇl-asher ashah ugevuratvo halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יְהוֹאָחָז֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֖הוּ בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יוֹאָ֥שׁ בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Jehoahaz rested with his ancestors and he was buried in Samaria; his son Joash succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yehvoachaz im-avotayv vayikeveruhu veshomervon vayimelokhe yvoash venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וָשֶׁ֙בַע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְיוֹאָ֖שׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ יְהוֹאָ֨שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֤ז עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן שֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: In the thirty-seventh year of King Joash of Judah, Jehoash son of Jehoahaz became king of Israel in Samaria—for sixteen years.
Transliteration: vishenat sheloshiym vasheva shanah leyvoash melekhe yehudah malakhe yehvoash ven-yehvoachaz al-yisherael veshomervon shesh eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֣א סָ֠ר מִכׇּל־חַטֹּ֞אות יָרׇבְעָ֧ם בֶּן־נְבָ֛ט אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱטִ֥יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּ֥הּ הָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he did not depart from any of the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit; he persisted in them.
Transliteration: vayaasheh hara veeyney yehovah lo sar mikhׇl-chatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher-hechetiy et-yisherael vah halakhe

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֤י יוֹאָשׁ֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וּגְב֣וּרָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִלְחַ֔ם עִ֖ם אֲמַצְיָ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Joash’s reign, and all his actions, and his exploits in his war with King Amaziah of Judah, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yvoash vekhׇl-asher ashah ugevuratvo asher nilecham im amatseyah melekhe-yehudah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יוֹאָשׁ֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם יָשַׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֑וֹ וַיִּקָּבֵ֤ר יוֹאָשׁ֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן עִ֖ם מַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Joash rested with his ancestors and Jeroboam occupied his throne; Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yvoash im-avotayv veyarׇveam yashav al-khisevo vayikaver yvoash veshomervon im malekhey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וֶֽאֱלִישָׁע֙ חָלָ֣ה אֶת־חׇלְי֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָמ֖וּת בּ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֨רֶד אֵלָ֜יו יוֹאָ֣שׁ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיֵּ֤בְךְּ עַל־פָּנָיו֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אָבִ֣י <small>׀</small> אָבִ֔י רֶ֥כֶב יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וּפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: Elisha had been stricken with the illness of which he was to die, and King Joash of Israel went down to see him. He wept over him and cried, “Father, father! Israel’s chariots and riders!”
Transliteration: veeliysha chalah et-chׇleyvo asher yamut vvo vayered elayv yvoash melekhe-yisherael vayevekhe al-fanayv vayomar aviy <small></small> aviy rekhev yisherael ufarashayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אֱלִישָׁ֔ע קַ֖ח קֶ֣שֶׁת וְחִצִּ֑ים וַיִּקַּ֥ח אֵלָ֖יו קֶ֥שֶׁת וְחִצִּֽים׃
Translated: Elisha said to him, “Get a bow and arrows”; and he brought him a bow and arrows.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo eliysha kach keshet vechitsiym vayikach elayv keshet vechitsiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הַרְכֵּ֤ב יָֽדְךָ֙ עַל־הַקֶּ֔שֶׁת וַיַּרְכֵּ֖ב יָד֑וֹ וַיָּ֧שֶׂם אֱלִישָׁ֛ע יָדָ֖יו עַל־יְדֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then he said to the king of Israel, “Grasp the bow!” And when he had grasped it, Elisha put his hands over the king’s hands.
Transliteration: vayomer lemelekhe yisherael harekhev yadekha al-hakeshet vayarekhev yadvo vayashem eliysha yadayv al-yedey hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר פְּתַ֧ח הַחַלּ֛וֹן קֵ֖דְמָה וַיִּפְתָּ֑ח וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלִישָׁ֤ע יְרֵה֙ וַיּ֔וֹר וַיֹּ֗אמֶר חֵץ־תְּשׁוּעָ֤ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ וְחֵ֣ץ תְּשׁוּעָ֣ה בַאֲרָ֔ם וְהִכִּיתָ֧ אֶת־אֲרָ֛ם בַּאֲפֵ֖ק עַד־כַּלֵּֽה׃
Translated: “Open the window toward the east,” he said; and he opened it. Elisha said, “Shoot!” and he shot. Then he said, “An arrow of victory for G<small>OD</small> ! An arrow of victory over Aram! You shall rout Aram completely at Aphek.”
Transliteration: vayomer fetach hachalvon kedemah vayifetach vayomer eliysha yereh vayyvor vayomer chets-teshuah layhovah vechets teshuah vaaram vehikhiyta et-aram vaafek ad-khaleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר קַ֥ח הַחִצִּ֖ים וַיִּקָּ֑ח וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לְמֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַךְ־אַ֔רְצָה וַיַּ֥ךְ שָׁלֹשׁ־פְּעָמִ֖ים וַֽיַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated: He said, “Now pick up the arrows.” And he picked them up. “Strike the ground!” he said to the king of Israel; and he struck three times and stopped.
Transliteration: vayomer kach hachitsiym vayikach vayomer lemelekhe-yisherael hakhe-aretsah vayakhe shalosh-feamiym vayaamod

Hebrew: וַיִּקְצֹ֨ף עָלָ֜יו אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְהַכּ֨וֹת חָמֵ֤שׁ אוֹ־שֵׁשׁ֙ פְּעָמִ֔ים אָ֛ז הִכִּ֥יתָ אֶת־אֲרָ֖ם עַד־כַּלֵּ֑ה וְעַתָּ֕ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים תַּכֶּ֥ה אֶת־אֲרָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The agent of God was angry with him and said to him, “If only you had struck five or six times! Then you would have annihilated Aram; as it is, you shall defeat Aram only three times.”
Transliteration: vayiketsof alayv iysh haElohim vayomer lehakhvot chamesh vo-shesh feamiym az hikhiyta et-aram ad-khaleh veatah shalosh feamiym takheh et-aram {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥מׇת אֱלִישָׁ֖ע וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֑הוּ וּגְדוּדֵ֥י מוֹאָ֛ב יָבֹ֥אוּ בָאָ֖רֶץ בָּ֥א שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Elisha died and he was buried. Now bands of Moabites used to invade the land at the coming of every year.
Transliteration: vayamׇt eliysha vayikeveruhu ugedudey mvoav yavou vaarets va shanah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י הֵ֣ם ׀ קֹבְרִ֣ים אִ֗ישׁ וְהִנֵּה֙ רָא֣וּ אֶֽת־הַגְּד֔וּד וַיַּשְׁלִ֥יכוּ אֶת־הָאִ֖ישׁ בְּקֶ֣בֶר אֱלִישָׁ֑ע וַיֵּ֜לֶךְ וַיִּגַּ֤ע הָאִישׁ֙ בְּעַצְמ֣וֹת אֱלִישָׁ֔ע וַיְחִ֖י וַיָּ֥קׇם עַל־רַגְלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Once a man was being buried, when the people caught sight of such a band; so they threw the man into Elisha’s grave and made off. When the [dead] man came in contact with Elisha’s bones, he came to life and stood up.
Transliteration: vayehiy hem koveriym iysh vehineh rau et-hagedud vayasheliykhu et-haiysh vekever eliysha vayelekhe vayiga haiysh veatsemvot eliysha vayechiy vayakׇm al-ragelayv {f}

Hebrew: וַֽחֲזָאֵל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם לָחַ֖ץ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י יְהוֹאָחָֽז׃
Translated: King Hazael of Aram had oppressed the Israelites throughout the reign of Jehoahaz.
Transliteration: vachazael melekhe aram lachats et-yisherael khol yemey yehvoachaz

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩חׇן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֹתָ֤ם וַֽיְרַחֲמֵם֙ וַיִּ֣פֶן אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם לְמַ֣עַן בְּרִית֔וֹ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם יִצְחָ֣ק וְיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְלֹ֤א אָבָה֙ הַשְׁחִיתָ֔ם וְלֹא־הִשְׁלִיכָ֥ם מֵעַל־פָּנָ֖יו עַד־עָֽתָּה׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> was gracious and merciful to them, and turned back to them for the sake of the covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. [God] refrained from destroying them, and still did not cast them out from the divine presence.
Transliteration: vayachׇn yehovah otam vayerachamem vayifen aleyhem lemaan veriytvo et-averaham yitsechak veyaakov velo avah hashechiytam velo-hisheliykham meal-fanayv ad-atah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת חֲזָאֵ֣ל מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲרָ֑ם וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ בֶּן־הֲדַ֥ד בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: When King Hazael of Aram died, his son Ben-hadad succeeded him as king;
Transliteration: vayamׇt chazael melekhe-aram vayimelokhe ven-hadad venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜שׇׁב יְהוֹאָ֣שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֗ז וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הֶעָרִים֙ מִיַּד֙ בֶּן־הֲדַ֣ד בֶּן־חֲזָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָקַ֗ח מִיַּ֛ד יְהוֹאָחָ֥ז אָבִ֖יו בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה שָׁלֹ֤שׁ פְּעָמִים֙ הִכָּ֣הוּ יוֹאָ֔שׁ וַיָּ֖שֶׁב אֶת־עָרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: and then Jehoash son of Jehoahaz recovered from Ben-hadad son of Hazael the towns that had been taken from his father Jehoahaz in war. Three times Joash defeated him, and he recovered the towns of Israel.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoash ven-yehvoachaz vayikach et-heariym miyad ven-hadad ven-chazael asher lakach miyad yehvoachaz aviyv vamilechamah shalosh feamiym hikhahu yvoash vayashev et-arey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שְׁתַּ֔יִם לְיוֹאָ֥שׁ בֶּן־יוֹאָחָ֖ז מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מָלַ֛ךְ אֲמַצְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the second year of King Joash son of Joahaz of Israel, Amaziah son of King Joash of Judah became king.
Transliteration: vishenat shetayiim leyvoash ven-yvoachaz melekhe yisherael malakhe amatseyahu ven-yvoash melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָתֵ֙שַׁע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ (יהועדין) [יְהוֹעַדָּ֖ן] מִן־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah hayah vemׇlekhvo veesheriym vatesha shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo (yhvdyn) [yehvoadan] min-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה רַ֕ק לֹ֖א כְּדָוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו כְּכֹ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֛ה יוֹאָ֥שׁ אָבִ֖יו עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>, but not like his forefather David; he did just as his father Joash had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah rak lo khedavid aviyv khekhol asher-ashah yvoash aviyv ashah

Hebrew: רַ֥ק הַבָּמ֖וֹת לֹא־סָ֑רוּ ע֥וֹד הָעָ֛ם מְזַבְּחִ֥ים וּֽמְקַטְּרִ֖ים בַּבָּמֽוֹת׃
Translated: However, the shrines were not removed; the people continued to sacrifice and make offerings at the shrines.
Transliteration: rak havamvot lo-saru vod haam mezavechiym umekateriym vavamvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר חָזְקָ֥ה הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־עֲבָדָ֔יו הַמַּכִּ֖ים אֶת־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Once he had the kingdom firmly in his grasp, he put to death the courtiers who had assassinated his father the king.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher chazekah hamamelakhah veyadvo vayakhe et-avadayv hamakhiym et-hamelekhe aviyv

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י הַמַּכִּ֖ים לֹ֣א הֵמִ֑ית כַּכָּת֣וּב בְּסֵֽפֶר־תּֽוֹרַת־מֹ֠שֶׁ֠ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹא־יוּמְת֨וּ אָב֤וֹת עַל־בָּנִים֙ וּבָנִים֙ לֹא־יוּמְת֣וּ עַל־אָב֔וֹת כִּ֛י אִם־אִ֥ישׁ בְּחֶטְא֖וֹ (ימות) [יוּמָֽת]׃
Translated: But he did not put to death the children of the assassins, in accordance with what is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses, where G<small>OD</small> commanded, “Parents shall not be put to death for children, nor children be put to death for parents; they shall be put to death only for their own crime.”
Transliteration: veet-veney hamakhiym lo hemiyt khakhatuv vesefer-tvorat-mosheh asher-tsivah yehovah lemor lo-yumetu avvot al-vaniym uvaniym lo-yumetu al-avvot khiy im-iysh vechetevo (ymvt) [yumat]

Hebrew: הוּא־הִכָּ֨ה אֶת־אֱד֤וֹם בְּגֵי־[מֶ֙לַח֙] (המלח) עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֔ים וְתָפַ֥שׂ אֶת־הַסֶּ֖לַע בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמָהּ֙ יׇקְתְאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: He defeated ten thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt, and he captured Sela in battle and renamed it Joktheel, as is still the case.
Transliteration: hu-hikhah et-edvom vegey-[melach] (hmlch) asheret alafiym vetafash et-hasela vamilechamah vayikera et-shemah yׇketeel ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז שָׁלַ֤ח אֲמַצְיָה֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־יְהוֹאָ֨שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֧ז בֶּן־יֵה֛וּא מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר לְכָ֖ה נִתְרָאֶ֥ה פָנִֽים׃
Translated: Then Amaziah sent envoys to King Jehoash son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu of Israel, with this message: “Come, let us confront each other.”
Transliteration: az shalach amatseyah maleakhiym el-yehvoash ven-yehvoachaz ven-eihu melekhe yisherael lemor lekhah niteraeh faniym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח יְהוֹאָ֣שׁ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶל־אֲמַצְיָ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ הַח֜וֹחַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּלְּבָנ֗וֹן שָׁ֠לַ֠ח אֶל־הָאֶ֜רֶז אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּלְּבָנוֹן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תְּנָה־אֶת־בִּתְּךָ֥ לִבְנִ֖י לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַֽתַּעֲבֹ֞ר חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּלְּבָנ֔וֹן וַתִּרְמֹ֖ס אֶת־הַחֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: King Jehoash of Israel sent back this message to King Amaziah of Judah: “The thistle in Lebanon sent this message to the cedar in Lebanon, ‘Give your daughter to my son in marriage.’ But a wild beast in Lebanon went by and trampled down the thistle.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehvoash melekhe-yisherael el-amatseyahu melekhe-yehudah lemor hachvocha asher valevanvon shalach el-haerez asher valevanvon lemor tenah-et-vitekha liveniy leishah vataavor chayat hashadeh asher valevanvon vatiremos et-hachvocha

Hebrew: הַכֵּ֤ה הִכִּ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־אֱד֔וֹם וּֽנְשָׂאֲךָ֖ לִבֶּ֑ךָ הִכָּבֵד֙ וְשֵׁ֣ב בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ וְלָ֤מָּה תִתְגָּרֶה֙ בְּרָעָ֔ה וְנָ֣פַלְתָּ֔ה אַתָּ֖ה וִיהוּדָ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Because you have defeated Edom, you have become arrogant. Stay home and enjoy your glory, rather than provoke disaster and fall, dragging Judah down with you.”
Transliteration: hakheh hikhiyta et-edvom uneshaakha livekha hikhaved veshev veveytekha velamah titegareh veraah venafaletah atah viyhudah imakhe

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע אֲמַצְיָ֔הוּ וַיַּ֨עַל יְהוֹאָ֤שׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיִּתְרָא֣וּ פָנִ֔ים ה֖וּא וַאֲמַצְיָ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה בְּבֵ֥ית שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: But Amaziah paid no heed; so King Jehoash of Israel advanced, and he and King Amaziah of Judah confronted each other at Beth-shemesh in Judah.
Transliteration: velo-shama amatseyahu vayaal yehvoash melekhe-yisherael vayiterau faniym hu vaamatseyahu melekhe-yehudah veveyt shemesh asher liyhudah

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֥גֶף יְהוּדָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ אִ֥ישׁ לְאֹהָלָֽו׃
Translated: Judah was routed by Israel, and [the Judahites] fled to their homes.
Transliteration: vayinagef yehudah lifeney yisherael vayanusu iysh leohalav

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ אֲמַצְיָ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה בֶּן־יְהוֹאָ֣שׁ בֶּן־אֲחַזְיָ֗הוּ תָּפַ֛שׂ יְהוֹאָ֥שׁ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּבֵ֣ית שָׁ֑מֶשׁ (ויבאו) [וַיָּבֹא֙] יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיִּפְרֹץ֩ בְּחוֹמַ֨ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם בְּשַׁ֤עַר אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ עַד־שַׁ֣עַר הַפִּנָּ֔ה אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: King Jehoash of Israel captured King Amaziah son of Jehoash son of Ahaziah of Judah at Beth-shemesh. He marched on Jerusalem, and he made a breach of four hundred cubits in the wall of Jerusalem, from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate.
Transliteration: veet amatseyahu melekhe-yehudah ven-yehvoash ven-achazeyahu tafash yehvoash melekhe-yisherael veveyt shamesh (vyvv) [vayavo] yerushala͏im vayiferots vechvomat yerushala͏im veshaar eferayiim ad-shaar hafinah areva mevot amah

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח אֶת־כׇּל־הַזָּֽהָב־וְ֠הַכֶּ֠סֶף וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֜ים הַנִּמְצְאִ֣ים בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וּבְאֹֽצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י הַתַּעֲרֻב֑וֹת וַיָּ֖שׇׁב שֹׁמְרֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: He carried off all the gold and silver and all the vessels that there were in the House of G<small>OD</small> and in the treasuries of the royal palace, as well as hostages; and he returned to Samaria.
Transliteration: velakach et-khׇl-hazahav-vehakhesef veet khׇl-hakheliym hanimetseiym veyt-yehovah uveotservot veyt hamelekhe veet veney hataaruvvot vayashׇv shomervonah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֩תֶר֩ דִּבְרֵ֨י יְהוֹאָ֜שׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ וּגְב֣וּרָת֔וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר נִלְחַ֔ם עִ֖ם אֲמַצְיָ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Jehoash’s reign, and all his actions and exploits, and his war with King Amaziah of Judah, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yehvoash asher ashah ugevuratvo vaasher nilecham im amatseyahu melekhe-yehudah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יְהוֹאָשׁ֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵר֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן עִ֖ם מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יָרׇבְעָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Jehoash rested with his ancestors, and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel; his son Jeroboam succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yehvoash im-avotayv vayikaver veshomervon im malekhey yisherael vayimelokhe yarׇveam venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֨י אֲמַצְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־יוֹאָשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֣י מ֔וֹת יְהוֹאָ֥שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֖ז מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: King Amaziah son of Joash of Judah lived fifteen years after the death of King Jehoash son of Jehoahaz of Israel.
Transliteration: vayechiy amatseyahu ven-yvoash melekhe yehudah acharey mvot yehvoash ven-yehvoachaz melekhe yisherael chamesh eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֖תֶר דִּבְרֵ֣י אֲמַצְיָ֑הוּ הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתֻבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Amaziah’s reign are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey amatseyahu halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשְׁר֨וּ עָלָ֥יו קֶ֛שֶׁר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וַיָּ֣נׇס לָכִ֑ישָׁה וַיִּשְׁלְח֤וּ אַחֲרָיו֙ לָכִ֔ישָׁה וַיְמִתֻ֖הוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: A conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem and he fled to Lachish; but they sent agents after him to Lachish, and they killed him there.
Transliteration: vayikesheru alayv kesher viyrushala͏im vayanׇs lakhiyshah vayishelechu acharayv lakhiyshah vayemituhu sham

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ עַל־הַסּוּסִ֑ים וַיִּקָּבֵ֧ר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֥יר דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: They brought back his body on horses, and he was buried with his ancestors in Jerusalem, in the City of David.
Transliteration: vayisheu otvo al-hasusiym vayikaver viyrushala͏im im-avotayv veiyr david

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ כׇּל־עַ֤ם יְהוּדָה֙ אֶת־עֲזַרְיָ֔ה וְה֕וּא בֶּן־שֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה וַיַּמְלִ֣כוּ אֹת֔וֹ תַּ֖חַת אָבִ֥יו אֲמַצְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: Then all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and proclaimed him king to succeed his father Amaziah.
Transliteration: vayikechu khׇl-am yehudah et-azareyah vehu ven-shesh eshereh shanah vayamelikhu otvo tachat aviyv amatseyahu

Hebrew: ה֚וּא בָּנָ֣ה אֶת־אֵילַ֔ת וַיְשִׁבֶ֖הָ לִֽיהוּדָ֑ה אַחֲרֵ֥י שְׁכַֽב־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עִם־אֲבֹתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: It was he who rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah, after King [Amaziah] rested with his ancestors.
Transliteration: hu vanah et-eylat vayeshiveha liyhudah acharey shekhav-hamelekhe im-avotayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֙ חֲמֵשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לַאֲמַצְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ יָרׇבְעָ֨ם בֶּן־יוֹאָ֤שׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וְאַחַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: In the fifteenth year of King Amaziah son of Joash of Judah, King Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel became king in Samaria—for forty-one years.
Transliteration: vishenat chamesh-eshereh shanah laamatseyahu ven-yvoash melekhe yehudah malakhe yarׇveam ven-yvoash melekhe-yisherael veshomervon arevaiym veachat shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֣א סָ֗ר מִכׇּל־חַטֹּאות֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he did not depart from all the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah lo sar mikhׇl-chatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: ה֗וּא הֵשִׁיב֙ אֶת־גְּב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִלְּב֥וֹא חֲמָ֖ת עַד־יָ֣ם הָעֲרָבָ֑ה כִּדְבַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֗ר בְּיַד־עַבְדּ֞וֹ יוֹנָ֤ה בֶן־אֲמִתַּי֙ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִגַּ֥ת הַחֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: It was he who restored the territory of Israel from Lebo-hamath to the sea of the Arabah, in accordance with the promise that the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, had made through God’s servant, the prophet Jonah son of Amittai from Gath-hepher.
Transliteration: hu heshiyv et-gevul yisherael milevvo chamat ad-yam haaravah khidevar yehovah elohey yisherael asher diver veyad-avedvo yvonah ven-amitay hanaviy asher migat hachefer

Hebrew: כִּי־רָאָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־עֳנִ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֹרֶ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וְאֶ֤פֶס עָצוּר֙ וְאֶ֣פֶס עָז֔וּב וְאֵ֥ין עֹזֵ֖ר לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For G<small>OD</small> saw the very bitter plight of Israel, with neither bond nor free left, and with none to help Israel.
Transliteration: khiy-raah yehovah et-oniy yisherael moreh meod veefes atsur veefes azuv veeyn ozer leyisherael

Hebrew: וְלֹא־דִבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה לִמְחוֹת֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיּ֣וֹשִׁיעֵ֔ם בְּיַ֖ד יָרׇבְעָ֥ם בֶּן־יוֹאָֽשׁ׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> resolved not to blot out the name of Israel from under heaven; and he delivered them through Jeroboam son of Joash.
Transliteration: velo-diver yehovah limechvot et-shem yisherael mitachat hashamayiim vayyvoshiyem veyad yarׇveam ven-yvoash

Hebrew: וְיֶ֩תֶר֩ דִּבְרֵ֨י יָרׇבְעָ֜ם וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ וּגְבוּרָת֣וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נִלְחָ֔ם וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵשִׁ֜יב אֶת־דַּמֶּ֧שֶׂק וְאֶת־חֲמָ֛ת לִיהוּדָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Jeroboam’s reign, and all his actions and exploits, how he fought and recovered Damascus and Hamath for Judah in Israel, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yarׇveam vekhׇl-asher ashah ugevuratvo asher-nilecham vaasher heshiyv et-dameshek veet-chamat liyhudah veyisherael halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יָֽרׇבְעָם֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו עִ֖ם מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ זְכַרְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Jeroboam rested with his ancestors, the kings of Israel, and his son Zechariah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yarׇveam im-avotayv im malekhey yisherael vayimelokhe zekhareyah venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָשֶׁ֙בַע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מָלַ֛ךְ עֲזַרְיָ֥ה בֶן־אֲמַצְיָ֖ה מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the twenty-seventh year of King Jeroboam of Israel, Azariah son of King Amaziah of Judah became king.
Transliteration: vishenat esheriym vasheva shanah leyarׇveam melekhe yisherael malakhe azareyah ven-amatseyah melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־שֵׁ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּשְׁתַּ֙יִם֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ יְכׇלְיָ֖הוּ מִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-shesh eshereh shanah hayah vemׇlekhvo vachamishiym ushetayiim shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo yekhׇleyahu miyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה אֲמַצְיָ֥הוּ אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as his father Amaziah had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah amatseyahu aviyv

Hebrew: רַ֥ק הַבָּמ֖וֹת לֹא־סָ֑רוּ ע֥וֹד הָעָ֛ם מְזַבְּחִ֥ים וּֽמְקַטְּרִ֖ים בַּבָּמֽוֹת׃
Translated: However, the shrines were not removed; the people continued to sacrifice and make offerings at the shrines.
Transliteration: rak havamvot lo-saru vod haam mezavechiym umekateriym vavamvot

Hebrew: וַיְנַגַּ֨ע יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַיְהִ֤י מְצֹרָע֙ עַד־י֣וֹם מֹת֔וֹ וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּבֵ֣ית הַחׇפְשִׁ֑ית וְיוֹתָ֤ם בֶּן־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־הַבַּ֔יִת שֹׁפֵ֖ט אֶת־עַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> struck the king with a plague, and he was a leper until the day of his death; he lived in isolated quarters, while Jotham, the king’s son, was in charge of the palace and governed the people of the land.
Transliteration: vayenaga yehovah et-hamelekhe vayehiy metsora ad-yvom motvo vayeshev veveyt hachׇfeshiyt veyvotam ven-hamelekhe al-havayiit shofet et-am haarets

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י עֲזַרְיָ֖הוּ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Azariah’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey azareyahu vekhׇl-asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב עֲזַרְיָה֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יוֹתָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Azariah rested with his ancestors, and he was buried with his ancestors in the City of David; his son Jotham succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav azareyah im-avotayv vayikeveru otvo im-avotayv veiyr david vayimelokhe yvotam venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּשְׁמֹנֶה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לַעֲזַרְיָ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ זְכַרְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־יָרׇבְעָ֧ם עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּשֹׁמְר֖וֹן שִׁשָּׁ֥ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: In the thirty-eighth year of King Azariah of Judah, Zechariah son of Jeroboam became king over Israel in Samaria—for six months.
Transliteration: vishenat sheloshiym ushemoneh shanah laazareyahu melekhe yehudah malakhe zekhareyahu ven-yarׇveam al-yisherael veshomervon shishah chodashiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשׂ֖וּ אֲבֹתָ֑יו לֹ֣א סָ֗ר מֵֽחַטֹּאות֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, as his predecessors had done; he did not depart from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khaasher ashu avotayv lo sar mechatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשֹׁ֤ר עָלָיו֙ שַׁלֻּ֣ם בֶּן־יָבֵ֔שׁ וַיַּכֵּ֥הוּ קׇֽבׇל־עָ֖ם וַיְמִיתֵ֑הוּ וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Shallum son of Jabesh conspired against him and struck him down before the people and killed him, and succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayikeshor alayv shalum ven-yavesh vayakhehu kׇvׇl-am vayemiytehu vayimelokhe tachetayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֖תֶר דִּבְרֵ֣י זְכַרְיָ֑ה הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Zechariah’s reign are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey zekhareyah hinam khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: ה֣וּא דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר אֶל־יֵהוּא֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בְּנֵ֣י רְבִיעִ֔ים יֵשְׁב֥וּ לְךָ֖ עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: This was in accord with the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken to Jehu: “Four generations of your descendants shall occupy the throne of Israel.” And so it came about.
Transliteration: hu devar-yehovah asher diver el-eihu lemor veney reviyiym eishevu lekha al-khise yisherael vayehiy-khen {f}

Hebrew: שַׁלּ֤וּם בֶּן־יָבֵישׁ֙ מָלַ֔ךְ בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וָתֵ֙שַׁע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְעֻזִּיָּ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ יֶֽרַח־יָמִ֖ים בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: Shallum son of Jabesh became king in the thirty-ninth year of King Uzziah of Judah, and he reigned in Samaria one month.
Transliteration: shalum ven-yaveysh malakhe vishenat sheloshiym vatesha shanah leuziyah melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe yerach-yamiym veshomervon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ מְנַחֵ֨ם בֶּן־גָּדִ֜י מִתִּרְצָ֗ה וַיָּבֹא֙ שֹׁמְר֔וֹן וַיַּ֛ךְ אֶת־שַׁלּ֥וּם בֶּן־יָבֵ֖ישׁ בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן וַיְמִיתֵ֖הוּ וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Then Menahem son of Gadi set out from Tirzah and came to Samaria; he attacked Shallum son of Jabesh in Samaria and killed him, and he succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayaal menachem ven-gadiy mitiretsah vayavo shomervon vayakhe et-shalum ven-yaveysh veshomervon vayemiytehu vayimelokhe tachetayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י שַׁלּ֔וּם וְקִשְׁר֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָשָׁ֑ר הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Shallum’s reign, and the conspiracy that he formed, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey shalum vekishervo asher kashar hinam khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יַכֶּֽה־מְ֠נַחֵ֠ם אֶת־תִּפְסַ֨ח וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤הּ וְאֶת־גְּבוּלֶ֙יהָ֙ מִתִּרְצָ֔ה כִּ֛י לֹ֥א פָתַ֖ח וַיַּ֑ךְ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הֶהָ֥רוֹתֶ֖יהָ בִּקֵּֽעַ׃ {פ}
Translated: At that time, [marching] from Tirzah, Menahem subdued Tiphsah and all who were in it, and its territory; and because it did not surrender, he massacred [its people] and ripped open all its pregnant women.
Transliteration: az yakheh-menachem et-tifesach veet-khׇl-asher-vah veet-gevuleyha mitiretsah khiy lo fatach vayakhe et khׇl-heharvoteyha vikea {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וָתֵ֙שַׁע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לַעֲזַרְיָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ מְנַחֵ֨ם בֶּן־גָּדִ֧י עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עֶ֥שֶׂר שָׁנִ֖ים בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: In the thirty-ninth year of King Azariah of Judah, Menahem son of Gadi became king over Israel in Samaria—for ten years.
Transliteration: vishenat sheloshiym vatesha shanah laazareyah melekhe yehudah malakhe menachem ven-gadiy al-yisherael esher shaniym veshomervon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֣א סָ֠ר מֵעַ֨ל חַטֹּ֜אות יָרׇבְעָ֧ם בֶּן־נְבָ֛ט אֲשֶׁר־הֶחֱטִ֥יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כׇּל־יָמָֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; throughout his days he did not depart from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah lo sar meal chatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher-hechetiy et-yisherael khׇl-yamayv

Hebrew: בָּ֣א פ֤וּל מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיִּתֵּ֤ן מְנַחֵם֙ לְפ֔וּל אֶ֖לֶף כִּכַּר־כָּ֑סֶף לִהְי֤וֹת יָדָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ לְהַחֲזִ֥יק הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: King Pul of Assyria invaded the land, and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver that he might support him and strengthen his hold on the kingdom.
Transliteration: va ful melekhe-ashur al-haarets vayiten menachem leful elef khikhar-khasef liheyvot yadayv itvo lehachaziyk hamamelakhah veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּצֵא֩ מְנַחֵ֨ם אֶת־הַכֶּ֜סֶף עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל עַ֚ל כׇּל־גִּבּוֹרֵ֣י הַחַ֔יִל לָתֵת֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר חֲמִשִּׁ֧ים שְׁקָלִ֛ים כֶּ֖סֶף לְאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֑ד וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וְלֹא־עָ֥מַד שָׁ֖ם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Menahem exacted the money from Israel: every man of means had to pay fifty shekels of silver for the king of Assyria. The king of Assyria withdrew and did not remain in the land.
Transliteration: vayotse menachem et-hakhesef al-yisherael al khׇl-givvorey hachayiil latet lemelekhe ashur chamishiym shekaliym khesef leiysh echad vayashׇv melekhe ashur velo-amad sham vaarets

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י מְנַחֵ֖ם וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Menahem’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey menachem vekhׇl-asher ashah halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב מְנַחֵ֖ם עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ פְּקַחְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Menahem rested with his ancestors, and his son Pekahiah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav menachem im-avotayv vayimelokhe fekacheyah venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה לַעֲזַרְיָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ פְּקַֽחְיָ֨ה בֶן־מְנַחֵ֧ם עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּשֹׁמְר֖וֹן שְׁנָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: In the fiftieth year of King Azariah of Judah, Pekahiah son of Menahem became king over Israel in Samaria—for two years.
Transliteration: vishenat chamishiym shanah laazareyah melekhe yehudah malakhe fekacheyah ven-menachem al-yisherael veshomervon shenatayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֣א סָ֗ר מֵֽחַטֹּאות֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he did not depart from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah lo sar mechatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשֹׁ֣ר עָלָיו֩ פֶּ֨קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֜הוּ שָׁלִישׁ֗וֹ וַיַּכֵּ֨הוּ בְשֹׁמְר֜וֹן בְּאַרְמ֤וֹן בֵּית־[הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙] (מלך) אֶת־אַרְגֹּ֣ב וְאֶת־הָאַרְיֵ֔ה וְעִמּ֛וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֣י גִלְעָדִ֑ים וַיְמִתֵ֖הוּ וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: His aide, Pekah son of Remaliah, conspired against him and struck him down in the royal palace in Samaria; with him were fifty Gileadites, with men from Argob and Arieh; and he killed him and succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayikeshor alayv fekach ven-remaleyahu shaliyshvo vayakhehu veshomervon vearemvon veyt-[hamelekhe] (mlkh) et-aregov veet-haareeih veimvo chamishiym iysh miveney gileadiym vayemitehu vayimelokhe tachetayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י פְקַחְיָ֖ה וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The other events of Pekahiah’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey fekacheyah vekhׇl-asher ashah hinam khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּשְׁתַּ֙יִם֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לַעֲזַרְיָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ פֶּ֣קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֧הוּ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּשֹׁמְר֖וֹן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: In the fifty-second year of King Azariah of Judah, Pekah son of Remaliah became king over Israel and Samaria—for twenty years.
Transliteration: vishenat chamishiym ushetayiim shanah laazareyah melekhe yehudah malakhe fekach ven-remaleyahu al-yisherael veshomervon esheriym shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֣א סָ֗ר מִן־חַטֹּאות֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he did not depart from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah lo sar min-chatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: בִּימֵ֞י פֶּ֣קַח מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל בָּא֮ תִּגְלַ֣ת פִּלְאֶ֘סֶר֮ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁוּר֒ וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־עִיּ֡וֹן וְאֶת־אָבֵ֣ל בֵּֽית־מַעֲכָ֡ה וְאֶת־יָ֠נ֠וֹחַ וְאֶת־קֶ֨דֶשׁ וְאֶת־חָצ֤וֹר וְאֶת־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְאֶת־הַגָּלִ֔ילָה כֹּ֖ל אֶ֣רֶץ נַפְתָּלִ֑י וַיַּגְלֵ֖ם אַשּֽׁוּרָה׃
Translated: In the days of King Pekah of Israel, King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria came and captured Ijon, Abel-beth-maacah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor—Gilead, Galilee, the entire region of Naphtali; and he deported the inhabitants to Assyria.
Transliteration: viymey fekach melekhe-yisherael va tigelat fileeser melekhe ashur vayikach et-iyyvon veet-avel veyt-maakhah veet-yanvocha veet-kedesh veet-chatsvor veet-hagilead veet-hagaliylah khol erets nafetaliy vayagelem ashurah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשׇׁר־קֶ֜שֶׁר הוֹשֵׁ֣עַ בֶּן־אֵלָ֗ה עַל־פֶּ֙קַח֙ בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֔הוּ וַיַּכֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיְמִיתֵ֔הוּ וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ תַּחְתָּ֑יו בִּשְׁנַ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים לְיוֹתָ֖ם בֶּן־עֻזִּיָּֽה׃
Translated: Hoshea son of Elah conspired against Pekah son of Remaliah, attacked him, and killed him. He succeeded him as king in the twentieth year of Jotham son of Uzziah.
Transliteration: vayikeshׇr-kesher hvoshea ven-elah al-fekach ven-remaleyahu vayakhehu vayemiytehu vayimelokhe tachetayv vishenat esheriym leyvotam ven-uziyah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֥תֶר דִּבְרֵי־פֶ֖קַח וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The other events of Pekah’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey-fekach vekhׇl-asher ashah hinam khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שְׁתַּ֔יִם לְפֶ֥קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מָלַ֛ךְ יוֹתָ֥ם בֶּן־עֻזִּיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the second year of King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel, Jotham son of King Uzziah of Judah became king.
Transliteration: vishenat shetayiim lefekach ven-remaleyahu melekhe yisherael malakhe yvotam ven-uziyahu melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְשֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ יְרוּשָׁ֖א בַּת־צָדֽוֹק׃
Translated: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Jerusha daughter of Zadok.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah hayah vemׇlekhvo veshesh-eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo yerusha vat-tsadvok

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֛ה עֻזִּיָּ֥הוּ אָבִ֖יו עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as his father Uzziah had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah uziyahu aviyv ashah

Hebrew: רַ֤ק הַבָּמוֹת֙ לֹ֣א סָ֔רוּ ע֗וֹד הָעָ֛ם מְזַבְּחִ֥ים וּֽמְקַטְּרִ֖ים בַּבָּמ֑וֹת ה֗וּא בָּנָ֛ה אֶת־שַׁ֥עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה הָעֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated: However, the shrines were not removed; the people continued to sacrifice and make offerings at the shrines. It was he who built the Upper Gate of the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: rak havamvot lo saru vod haam mezavechiym umekateriym vavamvot hu vanah et-shaar veyt-yehovah haeleyvon

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יוֹתָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Jotham’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yvotam asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם הֵחֵ֣ל יְהֹוָ֗ה לְהַשְׁלִ֙יחַ֙ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה רְצִ֖ין מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֑ם וְאֵ֖ת פֶּ֥קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: In those days, G<small>OD</small> began to incite King Rezin of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah against Judah.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem hechel yehovah lehasheliycha viyhudah retsiyn melekhe aram veet fekach ven-remaleyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יוֹתָם֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵר֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו בְּעִ֖יר דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אָחָ֥ז בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Jotham rested with his ancestors, and he was buried with his ancestors in the city of his forefather David; his son Ahaz succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yvotam im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr david aviyv vayimelokhe achaz venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁבַֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לְפֶ֖קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֑הוּ מָלַ֛ךְ אָחָ֥ז בֶּן־יוֹתָ֖ם מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the seventeenth year of Pekah son of Remaliah, Ahaz son of King Jotham of Judah became king.
Transliteration: vishenat sheva-eshereh shanah lefekach ven-remaleyahu malakhe achaz ven-yvotam melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ אָחָ֣ז בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְשֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְלֹא־עָשָׂ֣ה הַיָּשָׁ֗ר בְּעֵינֵ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָ֖יו כְּדָוִ֥ד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what was pleasing to the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God, as his forefather David had done,
Transliteration: ven-esheriym shanah achaz vemׇlekhvo veshesh-eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im velo-ashah hayashar veeyney yehovah elohayv khedavid aviyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ בְּדֶ֖רֶךְ מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְגַ֤ם אֶת־בְּנוֹ֙ הֶעֱבִ֣יר בָּאֵ֔שׁ כְּתֹֽעֲבוֹת֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹרִ֤ישׁ יְהֹוָה֙ אֹתָ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: but followed the ways of the kings of Israel. He even consigned his son to the fire, in the abhorrent fashion of the nations that G<small>OD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vederekhe malekhey yisherael vegam et-venvo heeviyr vaesh khetoavvot hagvoyim asher hvoriysh yehovah otam mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְזַבֵּ֧חַ וַיְקַטֵּ֛ר בַּבָּמ֖וֹת וְעַל־הַגְּבָע֑וֹת וְתַ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated: He sacrificed and made offerings at the shrines, on the hills, and under every leafy tree.
Transliteration: vayezavecha vayekater vavamvot veal-hagevavot vetachat khׇl-ets raanan

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יַעֲלֶ֣ה רְצִ֣ין מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲ֠רָ֠ם וּפֶ֨קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֧הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיָּצֻ֙רוּ֙ עַל־אָחָ֔ז וְלֹ֥א יָכְל֖וּ לְהִלָּחֵֽם׃
Translated: Then King Rezin of Aram and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel advanced on Jerusalem for battle. They besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome [him].
Transliteration: az yaaleh retsiyn melekhe-aram ufekach ven-remaleyahu melekhe-yisherael yerushala͏im lamilechamah vayatsuru al-achaz velo yakhelu lehilachem

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא הֵ֠שִׁ֠יב רְצִ֨ין מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲרָ֤ם אֶת־אֵילַת֙ לַֽאֲרָ֔ם וַיְנַשֵּׁ֥ל אֶת־הַיְּהוּדִ֖ים מֵֽאֵיל֑וֹת (וארמים) [וַֽאֲדֹמִים֙] בָּ֣אוּ אֵילַ֔ת וַיֵּ֣שְׁבוּ שָׁ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: At that time King Rezin of Aram recovered Elath for Aram; he drove out the Judahites from Elath, and Edomites came to Elath and settled there, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy heshiyv retsiyn melekhe-aram et-eylat laaram vayenashel et-hayehudiym meeylvot (vrmym) [vaadomiym] vau eylat vayeshevu sham ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אָחָ֜ז מַלְאָכִ֗ים אֶל־תִּ֠גְלַ֠ת פְּלֶ֤סֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר עַבְדְּךָ֥ וּבִנְךָ֖ אָ֑נִי עֲלֵ֨ה וְהוֹשִׁעֵ֜נִי מִכַּ֣ף מֶֽלֶךְ־אֲרָ֗ם וּמִכַּף֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַקּוֹמִ֖ים עָלָֽי׃
Translated: Ahaz sent messengers to King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria to say, “I am your servant and your son; come and deliver me from the hands of the king of Aram and from the hands of the king of Israel, who are attacking me.”
Transliteration: vayishelach achaz maleakhiym el-tigelat feleser melekhe-ashur lemor avedekha uvinekha aniy aleh vehvoshieniy mikhaf melekhe-aram umikhaf melekhe yisherael hakvomiym alay

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אָחָ֜ז אֶת־הַכֶּ֣סֶף וְאֶת־הַזָּהָ֗ב הַנִּמְצָא֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וּבְאֹֽצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח לְמֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר שֹֽׁחַד׃
Translated: Ahaz took the gold and silver that were on hand in the House of G<small>OD</small> and in the treasuries of the royal palace and sent them as a gift to the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: vayikach achaz et-hakhesef veet-hazahav hanimetsa veyt yehovah uveotservot veyt hamelekhe vayishelach lemelekhe-ashur shochad

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אֵלָיו֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וַיַּ֩עַל֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ אַשּׁ֤וּר אֶל־דַּמֶּ֙שֶׂק֙ וַֽיִּתְפְּשֶׂ֔הָ וַיַּגְלֶ֖הָ קִ֑ירָה וְאֶת־רְצִ֖ין הֵמִֽית׃
Translated: The king of Assyria responded to his request; the king of Assyria marched against Damascus and captured it. He deported its inhabitants to Kir and put Rezin to death.
Transliteration: vayishema elayv melekhe ashur vayaal melekhe ashur el-dameshek vayitefesheha vayageleha kiyrah veet-retsiyn hemiyt

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָחָ֡ז לִ֠קְרַ֠את תִּגְלַ֨ת פִּלְאֶ֤סֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ דּוּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּדַמָּ֑שֶׂק וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אָחָ֜ז אֶל־אוּרִיָּ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֶת־דְּמ֧וּת הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ וְאֶת־תַּבְנִית֖וֹ לְכׇֽל־מַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃
Translated: When King Ahaz went to Damascus to greet King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria, he saw the altar in Damascus. King Ahaz sent the priest Uriah a sketch of the altar and a detailed plan of its construction.
Transliteration: vayelekhe hamelekhe achaz likerat tigelat fileeser melekhe-ashur dumeshek vayare et-hamizevecha asher vedamashek vayishelach hamelekhe achaz el-uriyah hakhohen et-demut hamizevecha veet-taveniytvo lekhׇl-maashehu

Hebrew: וַיִּ֛בֶן אוּרִיָּ֥ה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַח֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אָחָ֜ז מִדַּמֶּ֗שֶׂק כֵּ֤ן עָשָׂה֙ אוּרִיָּ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֔ן עַד־בּ֥וֹא הַמֶּֽלֶךְ־אָחָ֖ז מִדַּמָּֽשֶׂק׃
Translated: The priest Uriah did just as King Ahaz had instructed him from Damascus; the priest Uriah built the altar before King Ahaz returned from Damascus.
Transliteration: vayiven uriyah hakhohen et-hamizevecha khekhol asher-shalach hamelekhe achaz midameshek khen ashah uriyah hakhohen ad-vvo hamelekhe-achaz midamashek

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ מִדַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וַיַּ֥רְא הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּקְרַ֥ב הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ וַיַּ֥עַל עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: When the king returned from Damascus, and when the king saw the altar, the king drew near the altar, ascended it,
Transliteration: vayavo hamelekhe midameshek vayare hamelekhe et-hamizevecha vayikerav hamelekhe al-hamizevecha vayaal alayv

Hebrew: וַיַּקְטֵ֤ר אֶת־עֹֽלָתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־מִנְחָת֔וֹ וַיַּסֵּ֖ךְ אֶת־נִסְכּ֑וֹ וַיִּזְרֹ֛ק אֶת־דַּֽם־הַשְּׁלָמִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: and offered his burnt offering and grain offering; he poured his libation, and he dashed the blood of his offering of well-being against the altar.
Transliteration: vayaketer et-olatvo veet-minechatvo vayasekhe et-nisekhvo vayizerok et-dam-hashelamiym asher-lvo al-hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת הַמִּזְבַּ֣ח הַנְּחֹ֘שֶׁת֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ וַיַּקְרֵ֗ב מֵאֵת֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַבַּ֔יִת מִבֵּין֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וּמִבֵּ֖ין בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹת֛וֹ עַל־יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ צָפֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: As for the bronze altar that had been before G<small>OD</small>, he moved it from its place in front of the temple, between the [new] altar and the House of G<small>OD</small>, and placed it on the north side of the [new] altar.
Transliteration: veet hamizevach hanechoshet asher lifeney yehovah vayakerev meet feney havayiit miveyn hamizevecha umiveyn veyt yehovah vayiten otvo al-yerekhe hamizevecha tsafvonah

Hebrew: (ויצוהו) [וַיְצַוֶּ֣ה] הַמֶּֽלֶךְ־אָ֠חָ֠ז אֶת־אוּרִיָּ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן לֵאמֹ֗ר עַ֣ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֣חַ הַגָּד֡וֹל הַקְטֵ֣ר אֶת־עֹֽלַת־הַבֹּ֩קֶר֩ וְאֶת־מִנְחַ֨ת הָעֶ֜רֶב וְֽאֶת־עֹלַ֧ת הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ וְאֶת־מִנְחָת֗וֹ וְ֠אֵ֠ת עֹלַ֞ת כׇּל־עַ֤ם הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֔ם וְכׇל־דַּ֥ם עֹלָ֛ה וְכׇל־דַּם־זֶ֖בַח עָלָ֣יו תִּזְרֹ֑ק וּמִזְבַּ֧ח הַנְּחֹ֛שֶׁת יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֖י לְבַקֵּֽר׃
Translated: And King Ahaz commanded the priest Uriah: “On the great altar you shall offer the morning burnt offering and the evening grain offering and the king’s burnt offering and his grain offering, with the burnt offerings of all the people of the land, their grain offerings and their libations. And against it you shall dash the blood of all the burnt offerings and all the blood of the sacrifices. And I will decide about the bronze altar.”
Transliteration: (vytsvhv) [vayetsaveh] hamelekhe-achaz et-uriyah hakhohen lemor al hamizevecha hagadvol haketer et-olat-havoker veet-minechat haerev veet-olat hamelekhe veet-minechatvo veet olat khׇl-am haarets uminechatam venisekheyhem vekhׇl-dam olah vekhׇl-dam-zevach alayv tizerok umizevach hanechoshet yiheyeh-liy levaker

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אוּרִיָּ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֑ן כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אָחָֽז׃
Translated: Uriah did just as King Ahaz commanded.
Transliteration: vayaash uriyah hakhohen khekhol asher-tsivah hamelekhe achaz

Hebrew: וַיְקַצֵּץ֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אָחָ֜ז אֶת־הַמִּסְגְּר֣וֹת הַמְּכוֹנֹ֗ת וַיָּ֤סַר מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶם֙ (ואת) [אֶת־]הַכִּיֹּ֔ר וְאֶת־הַיָּ֣ם הוֹרִ֔ד מֵעַ֛ל הַבָּקָ֥ר הַנְּחֹ֖שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ל מַרְצֶ֥פֶת אֲבָנִֽים׃
Translated: King Ahaz cut off the insets—the laver stands—and removed the lavers from them. He also removed the tank from the bronze oxen that supported it and set it on a stone pavement—
Transliteration: vayekatsets hamelekhe achaz et-hamisegervot hamekhvonot vayasar mealeyhem (vt) [et-]hakhiyor veet-hayam hvorid meal havakar hanechoshet asher tacheteyha vayiten otvo al maretsefet avaniym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־[מוּסַ֨ךְ] (מיסך) הַשַּׁבָּ֜ת אֲשֶׁר־בָּנ֣וּ בַבַּ֗יִת וְאֶת־מְב֤וֹא הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַֽחִיצ֔וֹנָה הֵסֵ֖ב בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה מִפְּנֵ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: on account of the king of Assyria. He also extended to the House of G<small>OD</small> the sabbath passage that had been built in the palace and the king’s outer entrance.
Transliteration: veet-[musakhe] (myskh) hashavat asher-vanu vavayiit veet-mevvo hamelekhe hachiytsvonah hesev veyt yehovah mifeney melekhe ashur

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י אָחָ֖ז אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Ahaz’s reign, and his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey achaz asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב אָחָז֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ חִזְקִיָּ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Ahaz rested with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David; his son Hezekiah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav achaz im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr david vayimelokhe chizekiyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה לְאָחָ֖ז מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ הוֹשֵׁ֨עַ בֶּן־אֵלָ֧ה בְשֹׁמְר֛וֹן עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תֵּ֥שַׁע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: In the twelfth year of King Ahaz of Judah, Hoshea son of Elah became king over Israel in Samaria—for nine years.
Transliteration: vishenat sheteym eshereh leachaz melekhe yehudah malakhe hvoshea ven-elah veshomervon al-yisherael tesha shaniym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה רַ֗ק לֹ֚א כְּמַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, though not as much as the kings of Israel who preceded him.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah rak lo khemalekhey yisherael asher hayu lefanayv

Hebrew: עָלָ֣יו עָלָ֔ה שַׁלְמַנְאֶ֖סֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ הוֹשֵׁ֙עַ֙ עֶ֔בֶד וַיָּ֥שֶׁב ל֖וֹ מִנְחָֽה׃
Translated: King Shalmaneser marched against him, and Hoshea became his vassal and paid him tribute.
Transliteration: alayv alah shalemaneeser melekhe ashur vayehiy-lvo hvoshea eved vayashev lvo minechah

Hebrew: וַיִּמְצָא֩ מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֨וּר בְּהוֹשֵׁ֜עַ קֶ֗שֶׁר אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכִים֙ אֶל־ס֣וֹא מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם וְלֹא־הֶעֱלָ֥ה מִנְחָ֛ה לְמֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּׁ֖וּר כְּשָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֑ה וַֽיַּעְצְרֵ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וַיַּאַסְרֵ֖הוּ בֵּ֥ית כֶּֽלֶא׃
Translated: But the king of Assyria caught Hoshea in an act of treachery: he had sent envoys to King So of Egypt, and he had not paid the tribute to the king of Assyria, as in previous years. And the king of Assyria arrested him and put him in prison.
Transliteration: vayimetsa melekhe-ashur vehvoshea kesher asher shalach maleakhiym el-svo melekhe-mitserayiim velo-heelah minechah lemelekhe ashur kheshanah veshanah vayaetserehu melekhe ashur vayaaserehu veyt khele

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר בְּכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיַּ֙עַל֙ שֹׁמְר֔וֹן וַיָּ֥צַר עָלֶ֖יהָ שָׁלֹ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Then the king of Assyria marched against the whole land; he came to Samaria and besieged it for three years.
Transliteration: vayaal melekhe-ashur vekhׇl-haarets vayaal shomervon vayatsar aleyha shalosh shaniym

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת הַתְּשִׁעִ֜ית לְהוֹשֵׁ֗עַ לָכַ֤ד מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ אֶת־שֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וַיֶּ֥גֶל אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אַשּׁ֑וּרָה וַיֹּ֨שֶׁב אוֹתָ֜ם בַּחְלַ֧ח וּבְחָב֛וֹר נְהַ֥ר גּוֹזָ֖ן וְעָרֵ֥י מָדָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria captured Samaria. He deported the Israelites to Assyria and settled them in Halah, at the [River] Habor, at the River Gozan, and in the towns of Media.
Transliteration: vishenat hateshiiyt lehvoshea lakhad melekhe-ashur et-shomervon vayegel et-yisherael ashurah vayoshev votam vachelach uvechavvor nehar gvozan vearey maday {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּֽי־חָטְא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם הַמַּעֲלֶ֤ה אֹתָם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִתַּ֕חַת יַ֖ד פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּֽירְא֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: This happened because the Israelites sinned against the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God, who had freed them from the land of Egypt, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt. They worshiped other gods
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-chateu veney-yisherael layhovah eloheyhem hamaaleh otam meerets mitserayiim mitachat yad fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim vayiyreu Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ בְּחֻקּ֣וֹת הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הוֹרִ֣ישׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: and followed the customs of the nations that G<small>OD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites and the customs that the kings of Israel had practiced.
Transliteration: vayelekhu vechukvot hagvoyim asher hvoriysh yehovah mifeney veney yisherael umalekhey yisherael asher ashu

Hebrew: וַיְחַפְּא֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל דְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־כֵ֔ן עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּבְנ֨וּ לָהֶ֤ם בָּמוֹת֙ בְּכׇל־עָ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם מִמִּגְדַּ֥ל נוֹצְרִ֖ים עַד־עִ֥יר מִבְצָֽר׃
Translated: The Israelites committed against the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God acts that were not right: They built for themselves shrines in all their settlements, from watchtowers to fortified cities;
Transliteration: vayechafeu veney-yisherael devariym asher lo-khen al-yehovah eloheyhem vayivenu lahem vamvot vekhׇl-areyhem mimigedal nvotseriym ad-iyr mivetsar

Hebrew: וַיַּצִּ֧בוּ לָהֶ֛ם מַצֵּב֖וֹת וַאֲשֵׁרִ֑ים עַ֚ל כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֣ה גְבֹהָ֔ה וְתַ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated: they set up pillars and sacred posts for themselves on every lofty hill and under every leafy tree;
Transliteration: vayatsivu lahem matsevvot vaasheriym al khׇl-giveah gevohah vetachat khׇl-ets raanan

Hebrew: וַיְקַטְּרוּ־שָׁם֙ בְּכׇל־בָּמ֔וֹת כַּגּוֹיִ֕ם אֲשֶׁר־הֶגְלָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ דְּבָרִ֣ים רָעִ֔ים לְהַכְעִ֖יס אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and they offered sacrifices there, at all the shrines, like the nations whom G<small>OD</small> had driven into exile before them. They committed wicked acts to provoke G<small>OD</small>’s anger,
Transliteration: vayekateru-sham vekhׇl-vamvot khagvoyim asher-hegelah yehovah mifeneyhem vayaashu devariym raiym lehakheiys et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעַבְד֖וּ הַגִּלֻּלִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: and they worshiped fetishes concerning which G<small>OD</small> had said to them, “You must not do this thing.”
Transliteration: vayaavedu hagiluliym asher amar yehovah lahem lo taashu et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣עַד יְהֹוָ֡ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וּבִיהוּדָ֡ה בְּיַד֩ כׇּל־[נְבִיאֵ֨י] (נביאו) כׇל־חֹזֶ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר שֻׁ֜֠בוּ מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֤ם הָֽרָעִים֙ וְשִׁמְרוּ֙ מִצְוֺתַ֣י חֻקּוֹתַ֔י כְּכׇ֨ל־הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶת־אֲבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם וַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ שָׁלַ֣חְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם בְּיַ֖ד עֲבָדַ֥י הַנְּבִיאִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> warned Israel and Judah by every prophet [and] every seer, saying: “Turn back from your wicked ways, and observe My commandments and My laws, according to all the Teaching that I commanded your ancestors and that I transmitted to you through My servants the prophets.”
Transliteration: vayaad yehovah veyisherael uviyhudah veyad khׇl-[neviyey] (nvyv) khׇl-chozeh lemor shuvu midarekheykhem haraiym veshimeru mitsevotay chukvotay khekhׇl-hatvorah asher tsiviytiy et-avoteykhem vaasher shalachetiy aleykhem veyad avaday haneviyiym

Hebrew: וְלֹ֖א שָׁמֵ֑עוּ וַיַּקְשׁ֤וּ אֶת־עׇרְפָּם֙ כְּעֹ֣רֶף אֲבוֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א הֶאֱמִ֔ינוּ בַּֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But they did not obey; they stiffened their necks, like their ancestors who did not have faith in the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God;
Transliteration: velo shameu vayakeshu et-ׇrefam kheoref avvotam asher lo heemiynu vayhovah eloheyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּמְאֲס֣וּ אֶת־חֻקָּ֗יו וְאֶת־בְּרִיתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּרַ֣ת אֶת־אֲבוֹתָ֔ם וְאֵת֙ עֵֽדְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵעִ֖יד בָּ֑ם וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ אַחֲרֵ֤י הַהֶ֙בֶל֙ וַיֶּהְבָּ֔לוּ וְאַחֲרֵ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבִֽיבֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֹתָ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֖י עֲשׂ֥וֹת כָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: they spurned God’s laws and the covenant that had been made with their ancestors, and the warnings they had been given. They went after delusion and were deluded; [they imitated] the nations that were about them, which G<small>OD</small> had forbidden them to emulate.
Transliteration: vayimeasu et-chukayv veet-veriytvo asher kharat et-avvotam veet edevotayv asher heiyd vam vayelekhu acharey hahevel vayehevalu veacharey hagvoyim asher seviyvotam asher tsivah yehovah otam leviletiy ashvot khahem

Hebrew: וַיַּעַזְב֗וּ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם מַסֵּכָ֖ה (שנים) [שְׁנֵ֣י] עֲגָלִ֑ים וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ אֲשֵׁירָ֗ה וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲווּ֙ לְכׇל־צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיַּעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־הַבָּֽעַל׃
Translated: They rejected all the commandments of the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God; they made molten idols for themselves—two calves—and they made a sacred post and they bowed down to all the host of heaven, and they worshiped Baal.
Transliteration: vayaazevu et-khׇl-mitsevot yehovah eloheyhem vayaashu lahem masekhah (shnym) [sheney] agaliym vayaashu asheyrah vayishetachavu lekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim vayaavedu et-havaal

Hebrew: וַֽ֠יַּעֲבִ֠ירוּ אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֤ם וְאֶת־בְּנֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּקְסְמ֥וּ קְסָמִ֖ים וַיְנַחֵ֑שׁוּ וַיִּֽתְמַכְּר֗וּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהַכְעִיסֽוֹ׃
Translated: They consigned their sons and daughters to the fire; they practiced augury and divination, and gave themselves over to what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>—and provoked anger.
Transliteration: vayaaviyru et-veneyhem veet-venvoteyhem vaesh vayikesemu kesamiym vayenacheshu vayitemakheru laashvot hara veeyney yehovah lehakheiysvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְאַנַּ֨ף יְהֹוָ֤ה מְאֹד֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְסִרֵ֖ם מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑יו לֹ֣א נִשְׁאַ֔ר רַ֛ק שֵׁ֥בֶט יְהוּדָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> was incensed at Israel and banished them from the divine presence; none was left but the tribe of Judah alone.
Transliteration: vayiteanaf yehovah meod veyisherael vayesirem meal fanayv lo nishear rak shevet yehudah levadvo

Hebrew: גַּם־יְהוּדָ֕ה לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔ר אֶת־מִצְוֺ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ בְּחֻקּ֥וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: Nor did Judah keep the commandments of the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God; they followed the customs that Israel had practiced.
Transliteration: gam-yehudah lo shamar et-mitsevot yehovah eloheyhem vayelekhu vechukvot yisherael asher ashu

Hebrew: וַיִּמְאַ֨ס יְהֹוָ֜ה בְּכׇל־זֶ֤רַע יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיְעַנֵּ֔ם וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם בְּיַד־שֹׁסִ֑ים עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁלִיכָ֖ם מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: So G<small>OD</small> spurned all the offspring of Israel, and afflicted them and delivered them into the hands of plunderers, and finally cast them out from the divine presence.
Transliteration: vayimeas yehovah vekhׇl-zera yisherael vayeanem vayitenem veyad-shosiym ad asher hisheliykham mifanayv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קָרַ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵעַל֙ בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֔ד וַיַּמְלִ֖יכוּ אֶת־יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֑ט (וידא) [וַיַּדַּ֨ח] יָרׇבְעָ֤ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהֶחֱטִיאָ֖ם חֲטָאָ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: For Israel broke away from the House of David, and they made Jeroboam son of Nebat king. Jeroboam caused Israel to stray from G<small>OD</small> and to commit great sin,
Transliteration: khiy-kara yisherael meal veyt david vayameliykhu et-yarׇveam ven-nevat (vyd) [vayadach] yarׇveam et-yisherael meacharey yehovah vehechetiyam chataah gedvolah

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּכׇל־חַטֹּ֥אות יָרׇבְעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה לֹא־סָ֖רוּ מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: and the Israelites persisted in all the sins that Jeroboam had committed; they did not depart from them.
Transliteration: vayelekhu veney yisherael vekhׇl-chatovt yarׇveam asher ashah lo-saru mimenah

Hebrew: עַ֠ד אֲשֶׁר־הֵסִ֨יר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֔יו כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַ֖ד כׇּל־עֲבָדָ֣יו הַנְּבִיאִ֑ים וַיִּ֨גֶל יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל מֵעַ֤ל אַדְמָתוֹ֙ אַשּׁ֔וּרָה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: In the end, G<small>OD</small> removed Israel from the divine presence, as they had been warned through all God’s servants the prophets. So the Israelites were deported from their land to Assyria, as is still the case.
Transliteration: ad asher-hesiyr yehovah et-yisherael meal fanayv khaasher diver veyad khׇl-avadayv haneviyiym vayigel yisherael meal adematvo ashurah ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֣א מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֡וּר מִבָּבֶ֡ל וּ֠מִכּ֠וּתָה וּמֵעַוָּ֤א וּמֵֽחֲמָת֙ וּסְפַרְוַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֙שֶׁב֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י שֹֽׁמְר֔וֹן תַּ֖חַת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּֽרְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־שֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וַיֵּֽשְׁב֖וּ בְּעָרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: The king of Assyria brought [people] from Babylon, Cuthah, Avva, Hamath, and Sepharvaim, and he settled them in the towns of Samaria in place of the Israelites; they took possession of Samaria and dwelt in its towns.
Transliteration: vayave melekhe-ashur mivavel umikhutah umeava umechamat usefarevayiim vayoshev vearey shomervon tachat veney yisherael vayireshu et-shomervon vayeshevu veareyha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּתְחִלַּת֙ שִׁבְתָּ֣ם שָׁ֔ם לֹ֥א יָרְא֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְשַׁלַּ֨ח יְהֹוָ֤ה בָּהֶם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲרָי֔וֹת וַיִּֽהְי֥וּ הֹרְגִ֖ים בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: When they first settled there, they did not worship G<small>OD</small>; so G<small>OD</small> sent lions against them that killed some of them.
Transliteration: vayehiy vitechilat shivetam sham lo yareu et-yehovah vayeshalach yehovah vahem et-haarayvot vayiheyu horegiym vahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁוּר֮ לֵאמֹר֒ הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִגְלִ֙יתָ֙ וַתּ֙וֹשֶׁב֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י שֹׁמְר֔וֹן לֹ֣א יָֽדְע֔וּ אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֖ט אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיְשַׁלַּח־בָּ֣ם אֶת־הָאֲרָי֗וֹת וְהִנָּם֙ מְמִיתִ֣ים אוֹתָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁר֙ אֵינָ֣ם יֹדְעִ֔ים אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֖ט אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: They said to the king of Assyria: “The nations that you deported and resettled in the towns of Samaria do not know the rules of the God of the land; therefore [that God] has let lions loose against them that are killing them—for they do not know the rules of the God of the land.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lemelekhe ashur lemor hagvoyim asher higeliyta vatvoshev vearey shomervon lo yadeu et-mishefat elohey haarets vayeshalach-vam et-haarayvot vehinam memiytiym votam khaasher eynam yodeiym et-mishefat elohey haarets

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ו מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֜וּר לֵאמֹ֗ר הֹלִ֤יכוּ שָׁ֙מָּה֙ אֶחָ֤ד מֵהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִגְלִיתֶ֣ם מִשָּׁ֔ם וְיֵלְכ֖וּ וְיֵ֣שְׁבוּ שָׁ֑ם וְיֹרֵ֕ם אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֖ט אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: The king of Assyria gave an order: “Send there one of the priests whom you have deported; let him go and dwell there, and let him teach them the practices of the God of the land.”
Transliteration: vayetsav melekhe-ashur lemor holiykhu shamah echad mehakhohaniym asher higeliytem misham veeilekhu veeishevu sham veyorem et-mishefat elohey haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א אֶחָ֣ד מֵהַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִגְלוּ֙ מִשֹּׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֑ל וַֽיְהִי֙ מוֹרֶ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם אֵ֖יךְ יִֽירְא֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So one of the priests whom they had exiled from Samaria came and settled in Bethel; he taught them how to worship G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayavo echad mehakhohaniym asher higelu mishomervon vayeshev veveyt-el vayehiy mvoreh otam eykhe yiyreu et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ עֹשִׂ֔ים גּ֥וֹי גּ֖וֹי אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַיַּנִּ֣יחוּ ׀ בְּבֵ֣ית הַבָּמ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ הַשֹּׁ֣מְרֹנִ֔ים גּ֥וֹי גּוֹי֙ בְּעָ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם יֹשְׁבִ֖ים שָֽׁם׃
Translated: However, each nation continued to make its own gods and to set them up in the cult places that had been made by the people of Samaria; each nation [set them up] in the towns in which it lived.
Transliteration: vayiheyu oshiym gvoy gvoy elohayv vayaniychu veveyt havamvot asher ashu hashomeroniym gvoy gvoy veareyhem asher hem yosheviym sham

Hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י בָבֶ֗ל עָשׂוּ֙ אֶת־סֻכּ֣וֹת בְּנ֔וֹת וְאַ֨נְשֵׁי־כ֔וּת עָשׂ֖וּ אֶת־נֵֽרְגַ֑ל וְאַנְשֵׁ֥י חֲמָ֖ת עָשׂ֥וּ אֶת־אֲשִׁימָֽא׃
Translated: Inhabitants from Babylon made Succoth-benoth, and inhabitants from Cuth made Nergal, and inhabitants from Hamath made Ashima,
Transliteration: veaneshey vavel ashu et-sukhvot venvot veaneshey-khut ashu et-neregal veaneshey chamat ashu et-ashiyma

Hebrew: וְהָעַוִּ֛ים עָשׂ֥וּ נִבְחַ֖ז וְאֶת־תַּרְתָּ֑ק וְהַסְפַרְוִ֗ים שֹׂרְפִ֤ים אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶם֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ לְאַדְרַמֶּ֥לֶךְ וַֽעֲנַמֶּ֖לֶךְ (אלה) [אֱלֹהֵ֥י] (ספרים) [סְפַרְוָֽיִם]׃
Translated: and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak; and the Sepharvites burned their children [as offerings] to Adrammelech and Anamelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.
Transliteration: vehaaviym ashu nivechaz veet-taretak vehasefareviym shorefiym et-veneyhem vaesh leaderamelekhe vaanamelekhe (lh) [elohey] (sfrym) [sefarevayiim]

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ יְרֵאִ֖ים אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ לָהֶ֤ם מִקְצוֹתָם֙ כֹּהֲנֵ֣י בָמ֔וֹת וַיִּהְי֛וּ עֹשִׂ֥ים לָהֶ֖ם בְּבֵ֥ית הַבָּמֽוֹת׃
Translated: They worshiped G<small>OD</small>, but they also appointed from their own ranks priests of the shrines, who officiated for them in the cult places.
Transliteration: vayiheyu yereiym et-yehovah vayaashu lahem miketsvotam khohaney vamvot vayiheyu oshiym lahem veveyt havamvot

Hebrew: אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה הָי֣וּ יְרֵאִ֑ים וְאֶת־אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶם֙ הָי֣וּ עֹֽבְדִ֔ים כְּמִשְׁפַּט֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הִגְל֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: They worshiped G<small>OD</small>, while serving their own gods according to the practices of the nations from which they had been deported.
Transliteration: et-yehovah hayu yereiym veet-eloheyhem hayu ovediym khemishefat hagvoyim asher-higelu otam misham

Hebrew: עַ֣ד הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ הֵ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים כַּמִּשְׁפָּטִ֖ים הָרִֽאשֹׁנִ֑ים אֵינָ֤ם יְרֵאִים֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֵינָ֣ם עֹשִׂ֗ים כְּחֻקֹּתָם֙ וּכְמִשְׁפָּטָ֔ם וְכַתּוֹרָ֣ה וְכַמִּצְוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֥ם שְׁמ֖וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: To this day, they follow their former practices. They do not worship G<small>OD</small> [properly]. They do not follow the laws and practices, the Teaching and Instruction that G<small>OD</small> enjoined upon the descendants of Jacob—who was given the name Israel—
Transliteration: ad hayyvom hazeh hem oshiym khamishefatiym harishoniym eynam yereiym et-yehovah veeynam oshiym khechukotam ukhemishefatam vekhatvorah vekhamitsevah asher tsivah yehovah et-veney yaakov asher-sham shemvo yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֨ת יְהֹוָ֤ה אִתָּם֙ בְּרִ֔ית וַיְצַוֵּ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תִֽירְא֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְלֹא־תִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֣א תַעַבְד֔וּם וְלֹ֥א תִזְבְּח֖וּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: having made a covenant with them and commanding them: “You shall worship no other gods; you shall not bow down to them nor serve them nor sacrifice to them.
Transliteration: vayikherot yehovah itam veriyt vayetsavem lemor lo tiyreu Elohim acheriym velo-tishetachavu lahem velo taavedum velo tizevechu lahem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִֽם־אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֩ הֶעֱלָ֨ה אֶתְכֶ֜ם מֵאֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֛יִם בְּכֹ֧חַ גָּד֛וֹל וּבִזְר֥וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֖ה אֹת֣וֹ תִירָ֑אוּ וְל֥וֹ תִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ וְל֥וֹ תִזְבָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: You must worship only the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt with great might and with an outstretched arm: to whom alone shall you bow down and to whom alone shall you sacrifice.
Transliteration: khiy im-et-yehovah asher heelah etekhem meerets mitserayiim vekhocha gadvol uvizervoa netuyah otvo tiyrau velvo tishetachavu velvo tizevachu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֻקִּ֨ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֜ים וְהַתּוֹרָ֤ה וְהַמִּצְוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּתַ֣ב לָכֶ֔ם תִּשְׁמְר֥וּן לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֑ים וְלֹ֥א תִֽירְא֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: You shall observe faithfully, all your days, the laws and the practices; the Teaching and Instruction that I wrote down for you; do not worship other gods.
Transliteration: veet-hachukiym veet-hamishefatiym vehatvorah vehamitsevah asher khatav lakhem tishemerun laashvot khׇl-hayamiym velo tiyreu Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: וְהַבְּרִ֛ית אֲשֶׁר־כָּרַ֥תִּי אִתְּכֶ֖ם לֹ֣א תִשְׁכָּ֑חוּ וְלֹ֥א תִֽירְא֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: Do not forget the covenant that I made with you; do not worship other gods.
Transliteration: vehaveriyt asher-kharatiy itekhem lo tishekhachu velo tiyreu Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: כִּ֛י אִֽם־אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם תִּירָ֑אוּ וְהוּא֙ יַצִּ֣יל אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִיַּ֖ד כׇּל־אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Worship only the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, and you will be saved from the hands of all your enemies.”
Transliteration: khiy im-et-yehovah eloheykhem tiyrau vehu yatsiyl etekhem miyad khׇl-oyeveykhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֖א שָׁמֵ֑עוּ כִּ֛י אִֽם־כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֥ם הָֽרִאשׁ֖וֹן הֵ֥ם עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: But they did not obey; they continued their former practices.
Transliteration: velo shameu khiy im-khemishefatam harishvon hem oshiym

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ ׀ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֗לֶּה יְרֵאִים֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֶת־פְּסִֽילֵיהֶ֖ם הָי֣וּ עֹֽבְדִ֑ים גַּם־בְּנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ וּבְנֵ֣י בְנֵיהֶ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֤וּ אֲבֹתָם֙ הֵ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Those nations worshiped G<small>OD</small>, but they also served their idols. To this day their children and their children’s children do as their ancestors did.
Transliteration: vayiheyu hagvoyim haeleh yereiym et-yehovah veet-fesiyleyhem hayu ovediym gam-veneyhem uveney veneyhem khaasher ashu avotam hem oshiym ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שָׁלֹ֔שׁ לְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בֶּן־אֵלָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מָלַ֛ךְ חִזְקִיָּ֥ה בֶן־אָחָ֖ז מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the third year of King Hoshea son of Elah of Israel, Hezekiah son of King Ahaz of Judah became king.
Transliteration: vayehiy vishenat shalosh lehvoshea ven-elah melekhe yisherael malakhe chizekiyah ven-achaz melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָתֵ֙שַׁע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ אֲבִ֖י בַּת־זְכַרְיָֽה׃
Translated: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years; his mother’s name was Abi daughter of Zechariah.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah hayah vemׇlekhvo veesheriym vatesha shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo aviy vat-zekhareyah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה דָּוִ֥ד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as his forefather David had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah david aviyv

Hebrew: ה֣וּא ׀ הֵסִ֣יר אֶת־הַבָּמ֗וֹת וְשִׁבַּר֙ אֶת־הַמַּצֵּבֹ֔ת וְכָרַ֖ת אֶת־הָֽאֲשֵׁרָ֑ה וְכִתַּת֩ נְחַ֨שׁ הַנְּחֹ֜שֶׁת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֗ה כִּ֣י עַד־הַיָּמִ֤ים הָהֵ֙מָּה֙ הָי֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מְקַטְּרִ֣ים ל֔וֹ וַיִּקְרָא־ל֖וֹ נְחֻשְׁתָּֽן׃
Translated: He abolished the shrines and smashed the pillars and cut down the sacred post. He also broke into pieces the bronze serpent that Moses had made, for until that time the Israelites had been offering sacrifices to it; it was called Nehushtan.
Transliteration: hu hesiyr et-havamvot veshivar et-hamatsevot vekharat et-haasherah vekhitat nechash hanechoshet asher-ashah mosheh khiy ad-hayamiym hahemah hayu veney-yisherael mekateriym lvo vayikera-lvo nechushetan

Hebrew: בַּיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּטָ֑ח וְאַחֲרָ֞יו לֹא־הָיָ֣ה כָמֹ֗הוּ בְּכֹל֙ מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: He trusted only in the E<small>TERNAL</small> the God of Israel; there was none like him among all the kings of Judah after him, nor among those before him.
Transliteration: vayhovah elohey-yisherael vatach veacharayv lo-hayah khamohu vekhol malekhey yehudah vaasher hayu lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיִּדְבַּק֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה לֹא־סָ֖ר מֵאַֽחֲרָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁמֹר֙ מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: He clung to G<small>OD</small>; he did not hesitate to be directed, but kept the commandments that G<small>OD</small> had given to Moses.
Transliteration: vayidevak vayhovah lo-sar meacharayv vayishemor mitsevotayv asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ עִמּ֔וֹ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵ֖א יַשְׂכִּ֑יל וַיִּמְרֹ֥ד בְּמֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר וְלֹ֥א עֲבָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> was always with him; he was successful wherever he turned. He rebelled against the king of Assyria and would not serve him.
Transliteration: vehayah yehovah imvo vekhol asher-eitse yashekhiyl vayimerod vemelekhe-ashur velo avadvo

Hebrew: הֽוּא־הִכָּ֧ה אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֛ים עַד־עַזָּ֖ה וְאֶת־גְּבוּלֶ֑יהָ מִמִּגְדַּ֥ל נוֹצְרִ֖ים עַד־עִ֥יר מִבְצָֽר׃ {פ}
