Translated: He overran Philistia as far as Gaza and its border areas, from watchtower to fortified town.
Transliteration: hu-hikhah et-felishetiym ad-azah veet-gevuleyha mimigedal nvotseriym ad-iyr mivetsar {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּשָּׁנָ֤ה הָֽרְבִיעִית֙ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ הִ֚יא הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔ית לְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בֶּן־אֵלָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עָלָ֞ה שַׁלְמַנְאֶ֧סֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֛וּר עַל־שֹׁמְר֖וֹן וַיָּ֥צַר עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: In the fourth year of King Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of King Hoshea son of Elah of Israel, King Shalmaneser of Assyria marched against Samaria and besieged it,
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hareviyiyt lamelekhe chizekiyahu hiy hashanah hasheviyiyt lehvoshea ven-elah melekhe yisherael alah shalemaneeser melekhe-ashur al-shomervon vayatsar aleyha

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּדֻ֗הָ מִקְצֵה֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים בִּשְׁנַת־שֵׁ֖שׁ לְחִזְקִיָּ֑ה הִ֣יא שְׁנַת־תֵּ֗שַׁע לְהוֹשֵׁ֙עַ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נִלְכְּדָ֖ה שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: and he captured it at the end of three years. In the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of King Hoshea of Israel, Samaria was captured;
Transliteration: vayilekheduha miketseh shalosh shaniym vishenat-shesh lechizekiyah hiy shenat-tesha lehvoshea melekhe yisherael nilekhedah shomervon

Hebrew: וַיֶּ֧גֶל מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֛וּר אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אַשּׁ֑וּרָה וַיַּנְחֵ֞ם בַּחְלַ֧ח וּבְחָב֛וֹר נְהַ֥ר גּוֹזָ֖ן וְעָרֵ֥י מָדָֽי׃
Translated: and the king of Assyria deported the Israelites to Assyria. He settled them in Halah, along the Habor [and] the River Gozan, and in the towns of Media.
Transliteration: vayegel melekhe-ashur et-yisherael ashurah vayanechem vachelach uvechavvor nehar gvozan vearey maday

Hebrew: עַ֣ל ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־שָׁמְע֗וּ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּעַבְרוּ֙ אֶת־בְּרִית֔וֹ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ וְלֹ֥א עָשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: [This happened] because they did not obey the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God; they transgressed God’s covenant—all that Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> had commanded. They did not obey and they did not fulfill it.
Transliteration: al asher lo-shameu vekvol yehovah eloheyhem vayaaveru et-veriytvo et khׇl-asher tsivah mosheh eved yehovah velo shameu velo ashu {f}

Hebrew: וּבְאַרְבַּע֩ עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה שָׁנָ֜ה לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֗ה עָלָ֞ה סַנְחֵרִ֤יב מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ עַ֣ל כׇּל־עָרֵ֧י יְהוּדָ֛ה הַבְּצֻר֖וֹת וַֽיִּתְפְּשֵֽׂם׃
Translated: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched against all the fortified towns of Judah and seized them.
Transliteration: uveareva eshereh shanah lamelekhe chizekiyah alah sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur al khׇl-arey yehudah havetsurvot vayitefeshem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח חִזְקִיָּ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֣ה אֶל־מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֩ <small>׀</small> לָכִ֨ישָׁה <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֤ר <small>׀</small> חָטָ֙אתִי֙ שׁ֣וּב מֵֽעָלַ֔י אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּתֵּ֥ן עָלַ֖י אֶשָּׂ֑א וַיָּ֨שֶׂם מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֜וּר עַל־חִזְקִיָּ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה שְׁלֹ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ כִּכַּר־כֶּ֔סֶף וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים כִּכַּ֥ר זָהָֽב׃
Translated: King Hezekiah sent this message to the king of Assyria at Lachish: “I have done wrong; withdraw from me; and I shall bear whatever you impose on me.” So the king of Assyria imposed upon King Hezekiah of Judah a payment of three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
Transliteration: vayishelach chizekiyah melekhe-yehudah el-melekhe-ashur <small></small> lakhiyshah <small></small> lemor <small></small> chatatiy shuv mealay et asher-titen alay esha vayashem melekhe-ashur al-chizekiyah melekhe-yehudah shelosh mevot khikhar-khesef usheloshiym khikhar zahav

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֙ חִזְקִיָּ֔ה אֶת־כׇּל־הַכֶּ֖סֶף הַנִּמְצָ֣א בֵית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּבְאֹצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was on hand in the House of G<small>OD</small> and in the treasuries of the palace.
Transliteration: vayiten chizekiyah et-khׇl-hakhesef hanimetsa veyt-yehovah uveotservot veyt hamelekhe

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא קִצַּ֨ץ חִזְקִיָּ֜ה אֶת־דַּלְת֨וֹת הֵיכַ֤ל יְהֹוָה֙ וְאֶת־הָאֹ֣מְנ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִפָּ֔ה חִזְקִיָּ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם לְמֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃ {פ}
Translated: At that time Hezekiah cut down the doors and the doorposts of the Temple of G<small>OD</small>, which King Hezekiah had overlaid [with gold], and gave them to the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy kitsats chizekiyah et-daletvot heykhal yehovah veet-haomenvot asher tsifah chizekiyah melekhe yehudah vayitenem lemelekhe ashur {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֡וּר אֶת־תַּרְתָּ֣ן וְאֶת־רַב־סָרִ֣יס ׀ וְאֶת־רַבְשָׁקֵ֨ה מִן־לָכִ֜ישׁ אֶל־הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֛הוּ בְּחֵ֥יל כָּבֵ֖ד יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיַּעֲל֣וּ וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ בִּתְעָלַת֙ הַבְּרֵכָ֣ה הָעֶלְיוֹנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֕ר בִּמְסִלַּ֖ת שְׂדֵ֥ה כֹבֵֽס׃
Translated: But the king of Assyria sent the Tartan, the Rabsaris, and the Rabshakeh from Lachish with a large force to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem. They marched up to Jerusalem; and when they arrived, they took up a position near the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field.
Transliteration: vayishelach melekhe-ashur et-taretan veet-rav-sariys veet-raveshakeh min-lakhiysh el-hamelekhe chizekiyahu vecheyl khaved yerushala͏im vayaalu vayavou yerushala͏im vayaalu vayavou vayaamedu vitealat haverekhah haeleyvonah asher vimesilat shedeh khoves

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְאוּ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיֵּצֵ֧א אֲלֵהֶ֛ם אֶלְיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּ֖הוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַבָּ֑יִת וְשֶׁבְנָה֙ הַסֹּפֵ֔ר וְיוֹאָ֥ח בֶּן־אָסָ֖ף הַמַּזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: They summoned the king; and Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to them.
Transliteration: vayikereu el-hamelekhe vayetse alehem eleyakiym ven-chilekiyahu asher al-havayiit veshevenah hasofer veyvoach ven-asaf hamazekhiyr

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ רַבְשָׁקֵ֔ה אִמְרוּ־נָ֖א אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ הַגָּדוֹל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר מָ֧ה הַבִּטָּח֛וֹן הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּטָֽחְתָּ׃
Translated: The Rabshakeh said to them, “You tell Hezekiah: Thus said the Great King, the King of Assyria: What makes you so confident?
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem raveshakeh imeru-na el-chizekiyahu khoh-amar hamelekhe hagadvol melekhe ashur mah havitachvon hazeh asher vatacheta

Hebrew: אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ אַךְ־דְּבַר־שְׂפָתַ֔יִם עֵצָ֥ה וּגְבוּרָ֖ה לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה עַתָּה֙ עַל־מִ֣י בָטַ֔חְתָּ כִּ֥י מָרַ֖דְתָּ בִּֽי׃
Translated: You must think that mere talk is counsel and valor for war! Look, on whom are you relying, that you have rebelled against me?
Transliteration: amareta akhe-devar-shefatayiim etsah ugevurah lamilechamah atah al-miy vatacheta khiy maradeta viy

Hebrew: עַתָּ֡ה הִנֵּ֣ה בָטַ֣חְתָּ לְּךָ֡ עַל־מִשְׁעֶ֩נֶת֩ הַקָּנֶ֨ה הָרָצ֤וּץ הַזֶּה֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִסָּמֵ֥ךְ אִישׁ֙ עָלָ֔יו וּבָ֥א בְכַפּ֖וֹ וּנְקָבָ֑הּ כֵּ֚ן פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם לְכׇֽל־הַבֹּטְחִ֖ים עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: You rely, of all things, on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which enters and punctures the palm of anyone who leans on it! That’s what Pharaoh king of Egypt is like to all who rely on him.
Transliteration: atah hineh vatacheta lekha al-misheenet hakaneh haratsuts hazeh al-mitserayiim asher yisamekhe iysh alayv uva vekhafvo unekavah khen fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim lekhׇl-havotechiym alayv

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תֹאמְר֣וּן אֵלַ֔י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ בָּטָ֑חְנוּ הֲלוֹא־ה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵסִ֤יר חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶת־בָּמֹתָ֣יו וְאֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָ֔יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לִֽיהוּדָה֙ וְלִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לִפְנֵי֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֣חַ הַזֶּ֔ה תִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: And if you tell me that you are relying on the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God: is this not the very one whose shrines and altars Hezekiah did away with, telling Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship only at this altar in Jerusalem’?
Transliteration: vekhiy-tomerun elay el-yehovah eloheynu vatachenu halvo-hu asher hesiyr chizekiyahu et-vamotayv veet-mizevechotayv vayomer liyhudah veliyrushala͏im lifeney hamizevecha hazeh tishetachavu viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הִתְעָ֣רֶב נָ֔א אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֖י אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וְאֶתְּנָ֤ה לְךָ֙ אַלְפַּ֣יִם סוּסִ֔ים אִם־תּוּכַ֕ל לָ֥תֶת לְךָ֖ רֹכְבִ֥ים עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Come now, make this wager with my master, the king of Assyria: I’ll give you two thousand horses if you can produce riders to mount them.
Transliteration: veatah hitearev na et-adoniy et-melekhe ashur veetenah lekha alefayiim susiym im-tukhal latet lekha rokheviym aleyhem

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣יךְ תָּשִׁ֗יב אֵ֠ת פְּנֵ֨י פַחַ֥ת אַחַ֛ד עַבְדֵ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י הַקְּטַנִּ֑ים וַתִּבְטַ֤ח לְךָ֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם לְרֶ֖כֶב וּלְפָרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: So how could you refuse anything even to the deputy of one of my master’s lesser servants, relying on Egypt for chariots and riders?
Transliteration: veeykhe tashiyv et feney fachat achad avedey adoniy haketaniym vativetach lekha al-mitserayiim lerekhev ulefarashiym

Hebrew: עַתָּה֙ הֲמִבַּלְעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עָלִ֛יתִי עַל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לְהַשְׁחִת֑וֹ יְהֹוָה֙ אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י עֲלֵ֛ה עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את וְהַשְׁחִיתָֽהּ׃
Translated: And do you think I have marched against this land to destroy it without G<small>OD</small> ? It was G<small>OD</small> who told me: Go up against that land and destroy it.”
Transliteration: atah hamivaleadey yehovah aliytiy al-hamakvom hazeh lehashechitvo yehovah amar elay aleh al-haarets hazot vehashechiytah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶלְיָקִ֣ים בֶּן־חִ֠לְקִיָּ֠הוּ וְשֶׁבְנָ֨ה וְיוֹאָ֜ח אֶל־רַבְשָׁקֵ֗ה דַּבֶּר־נָ֤א אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲרָמִ֔ית כִּ֥י שֹׁמְעִ֖ים אֲנָ֑חְנוּ וְאַל־תְּדַבֵּ֤ר עִמָּ֙נוּ֙ יְהוּדִ֔ית בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַחֹמָֽה׃
Translated: Eliakim son of Hilkiah, Shebna, and Joah replied to the Rabshakeh, “Please, speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it; do not speak to us in Judean in the hearing of the people on the wall.”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyakiym ven-chilekiyahu veshevenah veyvoach el-raveshakeh daver-na el-avadeykha aramiyt khiy shomeiym anachenu veal-tedaver imanu yehudiyt veׇzeney haam asher al-hachomah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם רַבְשָׁקֵ֗ה הַעַ֨ל אֲדֹנֶ֤יךָ וְאֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲדֹנִ֔י לְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲלֹ֣א עַל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ עַל־הַ֣חֹמָ֔ה לֶאֱכֹ֣ל אֶת־[צוֹאָתָ֗ם] (חריהם) וְלִשְׁתּ֛וֹת אֶת־[מֵימֵ֥י רַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם] (שניהם) עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: But the Rabshakeh answered them, “Was it to your master and to you that my master sent me to speak those words? It was precisely to the men who are sitting on the wall—who will have to eat their dung and drink their urine with you.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem raveshakeh haal adoneykha veeleykha shelachaniy adoniy ledaver et-hadevariym haeleh halo al-haanashiym hayosheviym al-hachomah leekhol et-[tsvoatam] (chryhm) velishetvot et-[meymey rageleyhem] (shnyhm) imakhem

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ רַבְשָׁקֵ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֥א בְקוֹל־גָּד֖וֹל יְהוּדִ֑ית וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר וַיֹּ֔אמֶר שִׁמְע֛וּ דְּבַר־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ הַגָּד֖וֹל מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: And the Rabshakeh stood and called out in a loud voice in Judean: “Hear the words of the Great King, the King of Assyria.
Transliteration: vayaamod raveshakeh vayikera vekvol-gadvol yehudiyt vayedaver vayomer shimeu devar-hamelekhe hagadvol melekhe ashur

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אַל־יַשִּׁ֥א לָכֶ֖ם חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ כִּי־לֹ֣א יוּכַ֔ל לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיָּדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thus said the king: Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you from my hands.
Transliteration: khoh amar hamelekhe al-yashi lakhem chizekiyahu khiy-lo yukhal lehatsiyl etekhem miyadvo

Hebrew: וְאַל־יַבְטַ֨ח אֶתְכֶ֤ם חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר הַצֵּ֥ל יַצִּילֵ֖נוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א תִנָּתֵן֙ אֶת־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את בְּיַ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Don’t let Hezekiah make you rely on G<small>OD</small>, saying: G<small>OD</small> will surely save us: this city will not fall into the hands of the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: veal-yavetach etekhem chizekiyahu el-yehovah lemor hatsel yatsiylenu yehovah velo tinaten et-haiyr hazot veyad melekhe ashur

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּשְׁמְע֖וּ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֗וּר עֲשֽׂוּ־אִתִּ֤י בְרָכָה֙ וּצְא֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וְאִכְל֤וּ אִישׁ־גַּפְנוֹ֙ וְאִ֣ישׁ תְּאֵנָת֔וֹ וּשְׁת֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ מֵי־בֹרֽוֹ׃
Translated: Don’t listen to Hezekiah. For thus said the king of Assyria: Make your peace with me and come out to me, so that you may all eat from your vines and your fig trees and drink water from your cisterns,
Transliteration: al-tishemeu el-chizekiyahu khiy khoh amar melekhe ashur ashu-itiy verakhah utseu elay veikhelu iysh-gafenvo veiysh teenatvo ushetu iysh mey-vorvo

Hebrew: עַד־בֹּאִי֩ וְלָקַחְתִּ֨י אֶתְכֶ֜ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּאַרְצְכֶ֗ם אֶ֩רֶץ֩ דָּגָ֨ן וְתִיר֜וֹשׁ אֶ֧רֶץ לֶ֣חֶם וּכְרָמִ֗ים אֶ֣רֶץ זֵ֤ית יִצְהָר֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ וִֽחְי֖וּ וְלֹ֣א תָמֻ֑תוּ וְאַֽל־תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ כִּֽי־יַסִּ֤ית אֶתְכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָ֖ה יַצִּילֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: until I come and take you away to a land like your own, a land of grain [fields] and vineyards, of bread and wine, of olive oil and honey, so that you may live and not die. Don’t listen to Hezekiah, who misleads you by saying, ‘G<small>OD</small> will save us.’
Transliteration: ad-voiy velakachetiy etekhem el-erets khearetsekhem erets dagan vetiyrvosh erets lechem ukheramiym erets zeyt yitsehar udevash vicheyu velo tamutu veal-tishemeu el-chizekiyahu khiy-yasiyt etekhem lemor yehovah yatsiylenu

Hebrew: הַהַצֵּ֥ל הִצִּ֛ילוּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ מִיַּ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Did any of the gods of other nations save their land from the king of Assyria?
Transliteration: hahatsel hitsiylu elohey hagvoyim iysh et-aretsvo miyad melekhe ashur

Hebrew: אַיֵּה֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י חֲמָ֜ת וְאַרְפָּ֗ד אַיֵּ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י סְפַרְוַ֖יִם הֵנַ֣ע וְעִוָּ֑ה כִּי־הִצִּ֥ילוּ אֶת־שֹׁמְר֖וֹן מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Where were the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where were the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah? [And] did they save Samaria from me?
Transliteration: ayeh elohey chamat vearefad ayeh elohey sefarevayiim hena veivah khiy-hitsiylu et-shomervon miyadiy

Hebrew: מִ֚י בְּכׇל־אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־הִצִּ֥ילוּ אֶת־אַרְצָ֖ם מִיָּדִ֑י כִּֽי־יַצִּ֧יל יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Which among all the gods of [those] countries saved their countries from me, that G<small>OD</small> should save Jerusalem from me?”
Transliteration: miy vekhׇl-elohey haaratsvot asher-hitsiylu et-aretsam miyadiy khiy-yatsiyl yehovah et-yerushala͏im miyadiy

Hebrew: וְהֶחֱרִ֣ישׁוּ הָעָ֔ם וְלֹא־עָנ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ דָּבָ֑ר כִּֽי־מִצְוַ֨ת הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ הִ֛יא לֵאמֹ֖ר לֹ֥א תַעֲנֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: But the people were silent and did not say a word in reply; for the king’s order was: “Do not answer him.”
Transliteration: vehecheriyshu haam velo-anu otvo davar khiy-mitsevat hamelekhe hiy lemor lo taanuhu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א אֶלְיָקִ֣ים בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַ֠בַּ֠יִת וְשֶׁבְנָ֨א הַסֹּפֵ֜ר וְיוֹאָ֨ח בֶּן־אָסָ֧ף הַמַּזְכִּ֛יר אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ קְרוּעֵ֣י בְגָדִ֑ים וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ ל֔וֹ דִּבְרֵ֖י רַבְשָׁקֵֽה׃
Translated: And so Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder came to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and they reported to him what the Rabshakeh had said.
Transliteration: vayavo eleyakiym ven-chilekiyah asher-al-havayiit veshevena hasofer veyvoach ven-asaf hamazekhiyr el-chizekiyahu keruey vegadiym vayagidu lvo diverey raveshakeh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ וַיִּקְרַ֖ע אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יו וַיִּתְכַּ֣ס בַּשָּׂ֔ק וַיָּבֹ֖א בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When King Hezekiah heard this, he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa hamelekhe chizekiyahu vayikera et-vegadayv vayitekhas vashak vayavo veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח אֶת־אֶלְיָקִ֨ים אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַבַּ֜יִת וְשֶׁבְנָ֣א הַסֹּפֵ֗ר וְאֵת֙ זִקְנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים מִתְכַּסִּ֖ים בַּשַּׂקִּ֑ים אֶל־יְשַׁעְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא בֶּן־אָמֽוֹץ׃
Translated: He also sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and the senior priests, covered with sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
Transliteration: vayishelach et-eleyakiym asher-al-havayiit veshevena hasofer veet zikeney hakhohaniym mitekhasiym vashakiym el-yeshaeyahu hanaviy ven-amvots

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ יוֹם־צָרָ֧ה וְתוֹכֵחָ֛ה וּנְאָצָ֖ה הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י בָ֤אוּ בָנִים֙ עַד־מַשְׁבֵּ֔ר וְכֹ֥חַ אַ֖יִן לְלֵדָֽה׃
Translated: They said to him, “Thus said Hezekiah: This day is a day of distress, of chastisement, and of disgrace. The babes have reached the birthstool, but the strength to give birth is lacking.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv khoh amar chizekiyahu yvom-tsarah vetvokhechah uneatsah hayyvom hazeh khiy vau vaniym ad-mashever vekhocha ayiin leledah

Hebrew: אוּלַ֡י יִשְׁמַע֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י רַבְשָׁקֵ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֩ שְׁלָח֨וֹ מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֤וּר ׀ אֲדֹנָיו֙ לְחָרֵף֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חַ֔י וְהוֹכִ֙יחַ֙ בַּדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖ע יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְנָשָׂ֣אתָ תְפִלָּ֔ה בְּעַ֥ד הַשְּׁאֵרִ֖ית הַנִּמְצָאָֽה׃
Translated: Perhaps the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God will take note of all the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to blaspheme the living God, and will mete out judgment for the words that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has heard—if you will offer up prayer for the surviving remnant.”
Transliteration: ulay yishema yehovah eloheykha et khׇl-diverey raveshakeh asher shelachvo melekhe-ashur adonayv lecharef Elohim chay vehvokhiycha vadevariym asher shama yehovah eloheykha venashata tefilah vead hasheeriyt hanimetsaah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ עַבְדֵ֛י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ אֶֽל־יְשַׁעְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: When King Hezekiah’s ministers came to Isaiah,
Transliteration: vayavou avedey hamelekhe chizekiyahu el-yeshaeyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יְשַֽׁעְיָ֔הוּ כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְר֖וּן אֶל־אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֑ם כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אַל־תִּירָא֙ מִפְּנֵ֤י הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ אֲשֶׁ֧ר גִּדְּפ֛וּ נַעֲרֵ֥י מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר אֹתִֽי׃
Translated: Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master as follows: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Do not be frightened by the words of blasphemy against Me that you have heard from the minions of the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: vayomer lahem yeshaeyahu khoh tomerun el-adoneykhem khoh amar yehovah al-tiyra mifeney hadevariym asher shamaeta asher gidefu naarey melekhe-ashur otiy

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י נֹתֵ֥ן בּוֹ֙ ר֔וּחַ וְשָׁמַ֥ע שְׁמוּעָ֖ה וְשָׁ֣ב לְאַרְצ֑וֹ וְהִפַּלְתִּ֥יו בַּחֶ֖רֶב בְּאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: I will delude him; he will hear a rumor and return to his land, and I will make him fall by the sword in his land.”
Transliteration: hineniy noten vvo rucha veshama shemuah veshav learetsvo vehifaletiyv vacherev vearetsvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ רַבְשָׁקֵ֔ה וַיִּמְצָא֙ אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר נִלְחָ֖ם עַל־לִבְנָ֑ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע כִּ֥י נָסַ֖ע מִלָּכִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The Rabshakeh, meanwhile, heard that [the king] had left Lachish; he turned back and found the king of Assyria attacking Libnah.
Transliteration: vayashׇv raveshakeh vayimetsa et-melekhe ashur nilecham al-livenah khiy shama khiy nasa milakhiysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע אֶל־תִּרְהָ֤קָה מֶֽלֶךְ־כּוּשׁ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֥ה יָצָ֖א לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם אִתָּ֑ךְ וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But [the king of Assyria] learned that King Tirhakah of Cush had come out to fight him; so he again sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
Transliteration: vayishema el-tirehakah melekhe-khush lemor hineh yatsa lehilachem itakhe vayashׇv vayishelach maleakhiym el-chizekiyahu lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה תֹאמְר֗וּן אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֤הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַל־יַשִּׁאֲךָ֣ אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה בֹּטֵ֥חַ בּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹ֤א תִנָּתֵן֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בְּיַ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: “Tell this to King Hezekiah of Judah: Do not let your God, on whom you are relying, mislead you into thinking that Jerusalem will not be delivered into the hands of the king of Assyria.
Transliteration: khoh tomerun el-chizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah lemor al-yashiakha eloheykha asher atah votecha vvo lemor lo tinaten yerushala͏im veyad melekhe ashur

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ אַתָּ֣ה שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֜וּ מַלְכֵ֥י אַשּׁ֛וּר לְכׇל־הָאֲרָצ֖וֹת לְהַחֲרִימָ֑ם וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּנָּצֵֽל׃
Translated: You yourself have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands, how they have annihilated them; and can you escape?
Transliteration: hineh atah shamaeta et asher ashu malekhey ashur lekhׇl-haaratsvot lehachariymam veatah tinatsel

Hebrew: הַהִצִּ֨ילוּ אֹתָ֜ם אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שִׁחֲת֣וּ אֲבוֹתַ֔י אֶת־גּוֹזָ֖ן וְאֶת־חָרָ֑ן וְרֶ֥צֶף וּבְנֵי־עֶ֖דֶן אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּתְלַאשָּֽׂר׃
Translated: Were the nations that my predecessors destroyed—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the Beth-edenites in Telassar—saved by their gods?
Transliteration: hahitsiylu otam elohey hagvoyim asher shichatu avvotay et-gvozan veet-charan veretsef uveney-eden asher vitelashar

Hebrew: אַיּ֤וֹ מֶֽלֶךְ־חֲמָת֙ וּמֶ֣לֶךְ אַרְפָּ֔ד וּמֶ֖לֶךְ לָעִ֣יר סְפַרְוָ֑יִם הֵנַ֖ע וְעִוָּֽה׃
Translated: Where is the king of Hamath? And the king of Arpad? And the kings of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?”
Transliteration: ayyvo melekhe-chamat umelekhe arefad umelekhe laiyr sefarevayiim hena veivah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חִזְקִיָּ֧הוּ אֶת־הַסְּפָרִ֛ים מִיַּ֥ד הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים וַיִּקְרָאֵ֑ם וַיַּ֙עַל֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּפְרְשֵׂ֥הוּ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Hezekiah took the letter from the messengers and read it. Hezekiah then went up to the House of G<small>OD</small> and spread it out before G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikach chizekiyahu et-hasefariym miyad hamaleakhiym vayikeraem vayaal veyt yehovah vayifereshehu chizekiyahu lifeney yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֨ל חִזְקִיָּ֜הוּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים אַתָּה־ה֤וּא הָאֱלֹהִים֙ לְבַדְּךָ֔ לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ אַתָּ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתָ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And Hezekiah prayed to the E<small>TERNAL</small> and said, “O G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, Enthroned on the Cherubim! You alone are God of all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the heavens and the earth.
Transliteration: vayitefalel chizekiyahu lifeney yehovah vayomar yehovah elohey yisherael yoshev hakheruviym atah-hu haElohim levadekha lekhol mamelekhvot haarets atah ashiyta et-hashamayiim veet-haarets

Hebrew: הַטֵּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> אׇזְנְךָ֙ וּֽשְׁמָ֔ע פְּקַ֧ח יְהֹוָ֛ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ וּרְאֵ֑ה וּשְׁמַ֗ע אֵ֚ת דִּבְרֵ֣י סַנְחֵרִ֔יב אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁלָח֔וֹ לְחָרֵ֖ף אֱלֹהִ֥ים חָֽי׃
Translated: O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, incline Your ear and hear; open Your eyes and see. Hear the words that Sennacherib has sent to blaspheme the living God!
Transliteration: hateh yehovah <small></small> ׇzenekha ushema fekach yehovah eyneykha ureeh ushema et diverey sanecheriyv asher shelachvo lecharef Elohim chay

Hebrew: אׇמְנָ֖ם יְהֹוָ֑ה הֶחֱרִ֜יבוּ מַלְכֵ֥י אַשּׁ֛וּר אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם וְאֶת־אַרְצָֽם׃
Translated: True, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, the kings of Assyria have annihilated the nations and their lands,
Transliteration: ׇmenam yehovah hecheriyvu malekhey ashur et-hagvoyim veet-aretsam

Hebrew: וְנָתְנ֥וּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם בָּאֵ֑שׁ כִּי֩ לֹ֨א אֱלֹהִ֜ים הֵ֗מָּה כִּ֣י אִם־מַעֲשֵׂ֧ה יְדֵי־אָדָ֛ם עֵ֥ץ וָאֶ֖בֶן וַֽיְאַבְּדֽוּם׃
Translated: and have committed their gods to the flames and have destroyed them; for they are not gods, but the handiwork of mere mortals, wood and stone.
Transliteration: venatenu et-eloheyhem vaesh khiy lo Elohim hemah khiy im-maasheh yedey-adam ets vaeven vayeavedum

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נוּ נָ֖א מִיָּד֑וֹ וְיֵֽדְעוּ֙ כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י אַתָּ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: But now, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One our God, deliver us from his hands, and let all the kingdoms of the earth know that You alone, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, are God.”
Transliteration: veatah yehovah eloheynu hvoshiyenu na miyadvo veeideu khׇl-mamelekhvot haarets khiy atah yehovah Elohim levadekha {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ יְשַׁעְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־אָמ֔וֹץ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִתְפַּלַּ֧לְתָּ אֵלַ֛י אֶל־סַנְחֵרִ֥ב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent this message to Hezekiah: “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I have heard the prayer you have offered to Me concerning King Sennacherib of Assyria.
Transliteration: vayishelach yeshaeyahu ven-amvots el-chizekiyahu lemor khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael asher hitefalaleta elay el-sanecheriv melekhe-ashur shamaetiy

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו בָּזָ֨ה לְךָ֜ לָעֲגָ֣ה לְךָ֗ בְּתוּלַת֙ בַּת־צִיּ֔וֹן אַחֲרֶ֙יךָ֙ רֹ֣אשׁ הֵנִ֔יעָה בַּ֖ת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
This is the word that GOD has spoken concerning him:
“Fair Maiden Zion despises you,
She mocks at you;
Fair Jerusalem shakes
Her head at you.
Transliteration: zeh hadavar asher-diver yehovah alayv vazah lekha laagah lekha vetulat vat-tsiyyvon achareykha rosh heniyah vat yerushala͏im

Hebrew: אֶת־מִ֤י חֵרַ֙פְתָּ֙ וְגִדַּ֔פְתָּ וְעַל־מִ֖י הֲרִימ֣וֹתָ קּ֑וֹל וַתִּשָּׂ֥א מָר֛וֹם עֵינֶ֖יךָ עַל־קְד֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Whom have you blasphemed and reviled?
Against whom made loud your voice
And haughtily raised your eyes?
Against the Holy One of Israel!
Transliteration: et-miy cherafeta vegidafeta veal-miy hariymvota kvol vatisha marvom eyneykha al-kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: בְּיַ֣ד מַלְאָכֶ֘יךָ֮ חֵרַ֣פְתָּ ׀ אֲדֹנָי֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר (ברכב) [בְּרֹ֥ב] רִכְבִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י עָלִ֛יתִי מְר֥וֹם הָרִ֖ים יַרְכְּתֵ֣י לְבָנ֑וֹן וְאֶכְרֹ֞ת קוֹמַ֤ת אֲרָזָיו֙ מִבְח֣וֹר בְּרֹשָׁ֔יו וְאָב֙וֹאָה֙ מְל֣וֹן קִצֹּ֔ה יַ֖עַר כַּרְמִלּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Through your envoys you have blasphemed my Sovereign.
Because you thought,
‘Thanks to my vast chariotry,
It is I who have climbed the highest mountains,
To the remotest parts of the Lebanon,
And have cut down its loftiest cedars,
Its choicest cypresses,
And have reached its remotest lodge,
Its densest forest.
Transliteration: veyad maleakheykha cherafeta adonay vatomer (vrkhv) [verov] rikheviy aniy aliytiy mervom hariym yarekhetey levanvon veekherot kvomat arazayv mivechvor veroshayv veavvoah melvon kitsoh yaar kharemilvo

Hebrew: אֲנִ֣י קַ֔רְתִּי וְשָׁתִ֖יתִי מַ֣יִם זָרִ֑ים וְאַחְרִב֙ בְּכַף־פְּעָמַ֔י כֹּ֖ל יְאֹרֵ֥י מָצֽוֹר׃
Translated:
It is I who have drawn and drunk the waters of strangers;
I have dried up with the soles of my feet
All the streams of Egypt.’
Transliteration: aniy karetiy veshatiytiy mayiim zariym veacheriv vekhaf-feamay khol yeorey matsvor

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־שָׁמַ֤עְתָּ לְמֵֽרָחוֹק֙ אֹתָ֣הּ עָשִׂ֔יתִי לְמִ֥ימֵי קֶ֖דֶם וִיצַרְתִּ֑יהָ עַתָּ֣ה הֲבֵיאתִ֔יהָ וּתְהִ֗י לַהְשׁ֛וֹת גַּלִּ֥ים נִצִּ֖ים עָרִ֥ים בְּצֻרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Have you not heard? Of old
I planned that very thing,
I designed it long ago,
And now have fulfilled it.
And it has come to pass,
Laying waste fortified towns
In desolate heaps.
Transliteration: halo-shamaeta lemerachvok otah ashiytiy lemiymey kedem viytsaretiyha atah haveytiyha utehiy laheshvot galiym nitsiym ariym vetsurvot

Hebrew: וְיֹֽשְׁבֵיהֶן֙ קִצְרֵי־יָ֔ד חַ֖תּוּ וַיֵּבֹ֑שׁוּ הָי֞וּ עֵ֤שֶׂב שָׂדֶה֙ וִ֣ירַק דֶּ֔שֶׁא חֲצִ֣יר גַּגּ֔וֹת וּשְׁדֵפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י קָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Their inhabitants are helpless,
Dismayed and shamed.
They were but grass of the field
And green herbage,
Grass of the roofs that is blasted
Before the standing grain.
Transliteration: veyosheveyhen kitserey-yad chatu vayevoshu hayu eshev shadeh viyrak deshe chatsiyr gagvot ushedefah lifeney kamah

Hebrew: וְשִׁבְתְּךָ֛ וְצֵאתְךָ֥ וּבֹאֲךָ֖ יָדָ֑עְתִּי וְאֵ֖ת הִֽתְרַגֶּזְךָ֥ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
I know your stayings
And your goings and comings,
And how you have raged against Me.
Transliteration: veshivetekha vetsetekha uvoakha yadaetiy veet hiteragezekha elay

Hebrew: יַ֚עַן הִתְרַגֶּזְךָ֣ אֵלַ֔י וְשַׁאֲנַנְךָ֖ עָלָ֣ה בְאׇזְנָ֑י וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י חַחִ֜י בְּאַפֶּ֗ךָ וּמִתְגִּי֙ בִּשְׂפָתֶ֔יךָ וַהֲשִׁ֣בֹתִ֔יךָ בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אתָ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Because you have raged against Me,
And your tumult has reached My ears,
I will place My hook in your nose
And My bit between your jaws;
And I will make you go back by the road
By which you came.
Transliteration: yaan hiteragezekha elay veshaananekha alah veׇzenay veshametiy chachiy veafekha umitegiy vishefateykha vahashivotiykha vaderekhe asher-vata vah

Hebrew: וְזֶה־לְּךָ֣ הָא֔וֹת אָכ֤וֹל הַשָּׁנָה֙ סָפִ֔יחַ וּבַשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית סָחִ֑ישׁ וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗ית זִרְע֧וּ וְקִצְר֛וּ וְנִטְע֥וּ כְרָמִ֖ים וְאִכְל֥וּ פִרְיָֽם׃
Translated: “And this is the sign for you: This year you eat what grows of itself, and the next year what springs from that; and in the third year, sow and reap, and plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
Transliteration: vezeh-lekha havot akhvol hashanah safiycha uvashanah hasheniyt sachiysh uvashanah hasheliyshiyt zireu vekitseru veniteu kheramiym veikhelu fireyam

Hebrew: וְיָ֨סְפָ֜ה פְּלֵיטַ֧ת בֵּית־יְהוּדָ֛ה הַנִּשְׁאָרָ֖ה שֹׁ֣רֶשׁ לְמָ֑טָּה וְעָשָׂ֥ה פְרִ֖י לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: And the survivors of the House of Judah that have escaped shall regenerate its stock below and produce boughs above.
Transliteration: veyasefah feleytat veyt-yehudah hanishearah shoresh lematah veashah feriy lemaelah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ תֵּצֵ֣א שְׁאֵרִ֔ית וּפְלֵיטָ֖ה מֵהַ֣ר צִיּ֑וֹן קִנְאַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה [צְבָא֖וֹת] תַּעֲשֶׂה־זֹּֽאת׃ {ס}
Translated:
For a remnant shall come forth from Jerusalem,
Survivors from Mount Zion.
The zeal of GOD of Hosts
Shall bring this to pass.
Transliteration: khiy miyrushala͏im tetse sheeriyt ufeleytah mehar tsiyyvon kineat yehovah [tsevavot] taasheh-zot {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר לֹ֤א יָבֹא֙ אֶל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְלֹא־יוֹרֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם חֵ֑ץ וְלֹא־יְקַדְּמֶ֣נָּה מָגֵ֔ן וְלֹא־יִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ עָלֶ֖יהָ סֹלְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said GOD concerning the king of Assyria:
He shall not enter this city:
He shall not shoot an arrow at it,
Or advance upon it with a shield,
Or pile up a siege mound against it.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah el-melekhe ashur lo yavo el-haiyr hazot velo-yvoreh sham chets velo-yekademenah magen velo-yishefokhe aleyha solelah

Hebrew: בַּדֶּ֥רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־יָבֹ֖א בָּ֣הּ יָשׁ֑וּב וְאֶל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֛את לֹ֥א יָבֹ֖א נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He shall go back
By the way he came;
He shall not enter this city
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: vaderekhe asher-yavo vah yashuv veel-haiyr hazot lo yavo neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְגַנּוֹתִ֛י אֶל־הָעִ֥יר הַזֹּ֖את לְהוֹשִׁיעָ֑הּ לְמַֽעֲנִ֔י וּלְמַ֖עַן דָּוִ֥ד עַבְדִּֽי׃
Translated:
I will protect and save this city for My sake,
And for the sake of My servant David.”
Transliteration: veganvotiy el-haiyr hazot lehvoshiyah lemaaniy ulemaan david avediy

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֮ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַהוּא֒ וַיֵּצֵ֣א ׀ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיַּךְ֙ בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה אַשּׁ֔וּר מֵאָ֛ה שְׁמוֹנִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אָ֑לֶף וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּ֥ה כֻלָּ֖ם פְּגָרִ֥ים מֵתִֽים׃
Translated: That night an angel of G<small>OD</small> went out and struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp, and the following morning they were all dead corpses.
Transliteration: vayehiy valayelah hahu vayetse maleakhe yehovah vayakhe vemachaneh ashur meah shemvoniym vachamishah alef vayashekhiymu vavoker vehineh khulam fegariym metiym

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֣ע וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ וַיָּ֖שׇׁב סַנְחֵרִ֣יב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּנִֽינְוֵֽה׃
Translated: So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp and retreated, and stayed in Nineveh.
Transliteration: vayisa vayelekhe vayashׇv sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur vayeshev veniyneveh

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ ה֨וּא מִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֜ה בֵּ֣ית ׀ נִסְרֹ֣ךְ אֱלֹהָ֗יו וְֽאַדְרַמֶּ֨לֶךְ וְשַׂרְאֶ֤צֶר [בָּנָיו֙] הִכֻּ֣הוּ בַחֶ֔רֶב וְהֵ֥מָּה נִמְלְט֖וּ אֶ֣רֶץ אֲרָרָ֑ט וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֵסַר־חַדֹּ֥ן בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: While he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sarezer struck him down with the sword. They fled to the land of Ararat, and his son Esarhaddon succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayehiy hu mishetachaveh veyt niserokhe elohayv veaderamelekhe veshareetser [vanayv] hikhuhu vacherev vehemah nimeletu erets ararat vayimelokhe esar-chadon venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם חָלָ֥ה חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ לָמ֑וּת וַיָּבֹ֣א אֵ֠לָ֠יו יְשַׁעְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־אָמ֜וֹץ הַנָּבִ֗יא וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ צַ֣ו לְבֵיתֶ֔ךָ כִּ֛י מֵ֥ת אַתָּ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: In those days Hezekiah fell dangerously ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came and said to him, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Set your affairs in order, for you are going to die; you will not get well.”
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem chalah chizekiyahu lamut vayavo elayv yeshaeyahu ven-amvots hanaviy vayomer elayv khoh-amar yehovah tsav leveytekha khiy met atah velo ticheyeh

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֥ב אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו אֶל־הַקִּ֑יר וַיִּ֨תְפַּלֵּ֔ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Thereupon Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to G<small>OD</small>. He said,
Transliteration: vayasev et-fanayv el-hakiyr vayitefalel el-yehovah lemor

Hebrew: אָנָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה זְכׇר־נָ֞א אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִתְהַלַּ֣כְתִּי לְפָנֶ֗יךָ בֶּאֱמֶת֙ וּבְלֵבָ֣ב שָׁלֵ֔ם וְהַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ עָשִׂ֑יתִי וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּכִ֥י גָדֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated: “Please, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, remember how I have walked before You sincerely and wholeheartedly, and have done what is pleasing to You.” And Hezekiah wept profusely.
Transliteration: anah yehovah zekhׇr-na et asher hitehalakhetiy lefaneykha veemet uvelevav shalem vehatvov veeyneykha ashiytiy vayevekhe chizekiyahu vekhiy gadvol {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י יְשַֽׁעְיָ֔הוּ לֹ֣א יָצָ֔א (העיר) [חָצֵ֖ר] הַתִּיכֹנָ֑ה וּ֨דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה הָיָ֥ה אֵלָ֖יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Before Isaiah had gone out of the middle court, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to him:
Transliteration: vayehiy yeshaeyahu lo yatsa (hyr) [chatser] hatiykhonah udevar-yehovah hayah elayv lemor

Hebrew: שׁ֣וּב וְאָמַרְתָּ֞ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ נְגִיד־עַמִּ֗י כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔יךָ שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־תְּפִלָּתֶ֔ךָ רָאִ֖יתִי אֶת־דִּמְעָתֶ֑ךָ הִנְנִי֙ רֹ֣פֶא לָ֔ךְ בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י תַּעֲלֶ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “Go back and say to Hezekiah, the ruler of My people: Thus said G<small>OD</small>, the God of your forefather David: I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears. I am going to heal you; on the third day you shall go up to the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: shuv veamareta el-chizekiyahu negiyd-amiy khoh-amar yehovah elohey david aviykha shamaetiy et-tefilatekha raiytiy et-dimeatekha hineniy rofe lakhe vayyvom hasheliyshiy taaleh veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְהֹסַפְתִּ֣י עַל־יָמֶ֗יךָ חֲמֵ֤שׁ עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּמִכַּ֤ף מֶֽלֶךְ־אַשּׁוּר֙ אַצִּ֣ילְךָ֔ וְאֵ֖ת הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את וְגַנּוֹתִי֙ עַל־הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את לְמַֽעֲנִ֔י וּלְמַ֖עַן דָּוִ֥ד עַבְדִּֽי׃
Translated: And I will add fifteen years to your life. I will also rescue you and this city from the hands of the king of Assyria. I will protect this city for My sake and for the sake of My servant David.”—
Transliteration: vehosafetiy al-yameykha chamesh eshereh shanah umikhaf melekhe-ashur atsiylekha veet haiyr hazot veganvotiy al-haiyr hazot lemaaniy ulemaan david avediy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְשַׁעְיָ֔הוּ קְח֖וּ דְּבֶ֣לֶת תְּאֵנִ֑ים וַיִּקְח֛וּ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ עַֽל־הַשְּׁחִ֖ין וַיֶּֽחִי׃
Translated: Then Isaiah said, “Get a cake of figs.” And they got one, and they applied it to the rash, and he recovered.—
Transliteration: vayomer yeshaeyahu kechu develet teeniym vayikechu vayashiymu al-hashechiyn vayechiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶֽל־יְשַׁעְיָ֔הוּ מָ֣ה א֔וֹת כִּֽי־יִרְפָּ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה לִ֑י וְעָלִ֛יתִי בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖י בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Hezekiah asked Isaiah, “What is the sign that G<small>OD</small> will heal me and that I shall go up to the House of G<small>OD</small> on the third day?”
Transliteration: vayomer chizekiyahu el-yeshaeyahu mah vot khiy-yirefa yehovah liy vealiytiy vayyvom hasheliyshiy veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְשַׁעְיָ֗הוּ זֶה־לְּךָ֤ הָאוֹת֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֚י יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר הָלַ֤ךְ הַצֵּל֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר מַעֲל֔וֹת אִם־יָשׁ֖וּב עֶ֥שֶׂר מַעֲלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Isaiah replied, “This is the sign for you from G<small>OD</small> that G<small>OD</small> will do the thing that was promised: Shall the shadow advance ten steps or recede ten steps?”
Transliteration: vayomer yeshaeyahu zeh-lekha havot meet yehovah khiy yaasheh yehovah et-hadavar asher diver halakhe hatsel esher maalvot im-yashuv esher maalvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְחִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ נָקֵ֣ל לַצֵּ֔ל לִנְט֖וֹת עֶ֣שֶׂר מַעֲל֑וֹת לֹ֣א כִ֔י יָשׁ֥וּב הַצֵּ֛ל אֲחֹרַנִּ֖ית עֶ֥שֶׂר מַעֲלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Hezekiah said, “It is easy for the shadow to lengthen ten steps, but not for the shadow to recede ten steps.”
Transliteration: vayomer yechizekiyahu nakel latsel linetvot esher maalvot lo khiy yashuv hatsel achoraniyt esher maalvot

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א יְשַׁעְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּ֣שֶׁב אֶת־הַצֵּ֗ל בַּֽ֠מַּעֲל֠וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרְדָ֜ה בְּמַעֲל֥וֹת אָחָ֛ז אֲחֹרַנִּ֖ית עֶ֥שֶׂר מַעֲלֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: So the prophet Isaiah called to G<small>OD</small>, and the shadow that had descended on the dial of Ahaz was made to recede ten steps.
Transliteration: vayikera yeshaeyahu hanaviy el-yehovah vayashev et-hatsel vamaalvot asher yaredah vemaalvot achaz achoraniyt esher maalvot {f}

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֡יא שָׁלַ֡ח בְּרֹאדַ֣ךְ בַּ֠לְאֲדָ֠ן בֶּֽן־בַּלְאֲדָ֧ן מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל סְפָרִ֥ים וּמִנְחָ֖ה אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע כִּ֥י חָלָ֖ה חִזְקִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: At that time, King Berodach -baladan son of Baladan of Babylon sent [envoys with] a letter and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard about Hezekiah’s illness.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy shalach verodakhe valeadan ven-valeadan melekhe-vavel sefariym uminechah el-chizekiyahu khiy shama khiy chalah chizekiyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע עֲלֵיהֶם֮ חִזְקִיָּ֒הוּ֒ וַיַּרְאֵ֣ם אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית נְכֹתֹ֡ה אֶת־הַכֶּ֩סֶף֩ וְאֶת־הַזָּהָ֨ב וְאֶת־הַבְּשָׂמִ֜ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַטּ֗וֹב וְאֵת֙ בֵּ֣ית כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִמְצָ֖א בְּאוֹצְרֹתָ֑יו לֹא־הָיָ֣ה דָבָ֗ר אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־הֶרְאָ֧ם חִזְקִיָּ֛הוּ בְּבֵית֖וֹ וּבְכׇל־מֶמְשַׁלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Hezekiah heard about them and he showed them all his treasure-house—the silver, the gold, the spices, and the fragrant oil—and his armory, and everything that was to be found in his storehouses. There was nothing in his palace or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.
Transliteration: vayishema aleyhem chizekiyahu vayareem et-khׇl-veyt nekhotoh et-hakhesef veet-hazahav veet-haveshamiym veet shemen hatvov veet veyt khelayv veet khׇl-asher nimetsa vevotserotayv lo-hayah davar asher lo-heream chizekiyahu veveytvo uvekhׇl-memeshaletvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ יְשַׁעְיָ֣הוּ הַנָּבִ֔יא אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו מָ֥ה אָמְר֣וּ ׀ הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה וּמֵאַ֙יִן֙ יָבֹ֣אוּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ מֵאֶ֧רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֛ה בָּ֖אוּ מִבָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah. “What,” he demanded of him, “did those men say to you? Where have they come to you from?” “They have come,” Hezekiah replied, “from a far country, from Babylon.”
Transliteration: vayavo yeshaeyahu hanaviy el-hamelekhe chizekiyahu vayomer elayv mah ameru haanashiym haeleh umeayiin yavou eleykha vayomer chizekiyahu meerets rechvokah vau mivavel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מָ֥ה רָא֖וּ בְּבֵיתֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּבֵיתִי֙ רָא֔וּ לֹא־הָיָ֥ה דָבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הִרְאִיתִ֖ם בְּאֹצְרֹתָֽי׃
Translated: Next he asked, “What have they seen in your palace?” And Hezekiah replied, “They have seen everything that is in my palace. There was nothing in my storehouses that I did not show them.”
Transliteration: vayomer mah rau veveytekha vayomer chizekiyahu et khׇl-asher veveytiy rau lo-hayah davar asher lo-hireiytim veotserotay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְשַׁעְיָ֖הוּ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֑הוּ שְׁמַ֖ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: vayomer yeshaeyahu el-chizekiyahu shema devar-yehovah

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֮ יָמִ֣ים בָּאִים֒ וְנִשָּׂ֣א ׀ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּבֵיתֶ֗ךָ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר אָצְר֧וּ אֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה בָּבֶ֑לָה לֹא־יִוָּתֵ֥ר דָּבָ֖ר אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: A time is coming when everything in your palace that your ancestors have stored up to this day will be carried off to Babylon; nothing will remain behind, said G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym venisha khׇl-asher veveytekha vaasher atseru avoteykha ad-hayyvom hazeh vavelah lo-yivater davar amar yehovah

Hebrew: וּמִבָּנֶ֜יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵצְא֧וּ מִמְּךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תּוֹלִ֖יד (יקח) [יִקָּ֑חוּ] וְהָיוּ֙ סָרִיסִ֔ים בְּהֵיכַ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: And some of your sons, your own issue, whom you will have fathered, will be taken to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
Transliteration: umivaneykha asher eitseu mimekha asher tvoliyd (ykch) [yikachu] vehayu sariysiym veheykhal melekhe vavel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶֽל־יְשַׁעְיָ֔הוּ ט֥וֹב דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֑רְתָּ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הֲל֛וֹא אִם־שָׁל֥וֹם וֶאֱמֶ֖ת יִהְיֶ֥ה בְיָמָֽי׃
Translated: Hezekiah declared to Isaiah, “The word of G<small>OD</small> that you have spoken is good.” For he thought, “It means that safety is assured for my time.”
Transliteration: vayomer chizekiyahu el-yeshaeyahu tvov devar-yehovah asher divareta vayomer halvo im-shalvom veemet yiheyeh veyamay

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֤י חִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ וְכׇל־גְּב֣וּרָת֔וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה אֶת־הַבְּרֵכָה֙ וְאֶת־הַתְּעָלָ֔ה וַיָּבֵ֥א אֶת־הַמַּ֖יִם הָעִ֑ירָה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Hezekiah’s reign, and all his exploits, and how he made the pool and the conduit and brought the water into the city, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey chizekiyahu vekhׇl-gevuratvo vaasher ashah et-haverekhah veet-hatealah vayave et-hamayiim haiyrah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב חִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Hezekiah rested with his ancestors, and his son Manasseh succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav chizekiyahu im-avotayv vayimelokhe menasheh venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁתֵּ֨ים עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וְחָמֵשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֥ם אִמּ֖וֹ חֶפְצִי־בָֽהּ׃
Translated: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Hephzibah.
Transliteration: ven-sheteym eshereh shanah menasheh vemׇlekhvo vachamishiym vechamesh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo chefetsiy-vah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּתֽוֹעֲבֹת֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הוֹרִ֣ישׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, following the abhorrent practices of the nations that G<small>OD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khetvoavot hagvoyim asher hvoriysh yehovah mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּ֗שׇׁב וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־הַבָּמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִבַּ֖ד חִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ אָבִ֑יו וַיָּ֨קֶם מִזְבְּחֹ֜ת לַבַּ֗עַל וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אֲשֵׁרָה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה אַחְאָב֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ לְכׇל־צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ד אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: He rebuilt the shrines that his father Hezekiah had destroyed; he erected altars for Baal and made a sacred post, as King Ahab of Israel had done. He bowed down to all the host of heaven and worshiped them,
Transliteration: vayashׇv vayiven et-havamvot asher ivad chizekiyahu aviyv vayakem mizevechot lavaal vayaash asherah khaasher ashah acheav melekhe yisherael vayishetachu lekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim vayaavod otam

Hebrew: וּבָנָ֥ה מִזְבְּחֹ֖ת בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אָשִׂ֥ים אֶת־שְׁמִֽי׃
Translated: and he built altars for them in the House of G<small>OD</small>, of which G<small>OD</small> had said, “I will establish My name in Jerusalem.”
Transliteration: uvanah mizevechot veveyt yehovah asher amar yehovah viyrushala͏im ashiym et-shemiy

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבְּח֖וֹת לְכׇל־צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בִּשְׁתֵּ֖י חַצְר֥וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayiven mizevechvot lekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim vishetey chatservot veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱבִ֤יר אֶת־בְּנוֹ֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ וְעוֹנֵ֣ן וְנִחֵ֔שׁ וְעָ֥שָׂה א֖וֹב וְיִדְּעֹנִ֑ים הִרְבָּ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהַכְעִֽיס׃
Translated: He consigned his son to the fire; he practiced soothsaying and divination, and consulted ghosts and familiar spirits; he did much that was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>—and provoked anger.
Transliteration: veheeviyr et-venvo vaesh vevonen venichesh veashah vov veyideoniym hirevah laashvot hara veeyney yehovah lehakheiys

Hebrew: וַיָּ֕שֶׂם אֶת־פֶּ֥סֶל הָאֲשֵׁרָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה בַּבַּ֗יִת אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־דָּוִד֙ וְאֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנ֔וֹ בַּבַּ֨יִת הַזֶּ֜ה וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּחַ֙רְתִּי֙ מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אָשִׂ֥ים אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: The sculptured image of Asherah that he made he placed in the House concerning which G<small>OD</small> had said to David and to his son Solomon, “In this House and in Jerusalem, which I chose out of all the tribes of Israel, I will establish My name forever.
Transliteration: vayashem et-fesel haasherah asher ashah vavayiit asher amar yehovah el-david veel-shelomoh venvo vavayiit hazeh uviyrushala͏im asher vacharetiy mikhol shivetey yisherael ashiym et-shemiy levolam

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א אֹסִ֗יף לְהָנִיד֙ רֶ֣גֶל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לַאֲבוֹתָ֑ם רַ֣ק ׀ אִם־יִשְׁמְר֣וּ לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת כְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ים וּלְכׇ֨ל־הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם עַבְדִּ֥י מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: And I will not again cause the feet of Israel to wander from the land that I gave to their ancestors, if they will but faithfully observe all that I have commanded them—all the Teachings with which My servant Moses charged them.”
Transliteration: velo osiyf lehaniyd regel yisherael min-haadamah asher natatiy laavvotam rak im-yishemeru laashvot khekhol asher tsiviytiym ulekhׇl-hatvorah asher-tsivah otam avediy mosheh

Hebrew: וְלֹ֖א שָׁמֵ֑עוּ וַיַּתְעֵ֤ם מְנַשֶּׁה֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אֶת־הָרָ֔ע מִ֨ן־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הִשְׁמִ֣יד יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But they did not obey, and Manasseh led them astray to do greater evil than the nations that G<small>OD</small> had destroyed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: velo shameu vayateem menasheh laashvot et-hara min-hagvoyim asher hishemiyd yehovah mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֥יו הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Therefore G<small>OD</small> spoke through the prophets—God’s servants:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah veyad-avadayv haneviyiym lemor

Hebrew: יַ֩עַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה מְנַשֶּׁ֤ה מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ הַתֹּעֵב֣וֹת הָאֵ֔לֶּה הֵרַ֕ע מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֥וּ הָאֱמֹרִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְפָנָ֑יו וַיַּחֲטִ֥א גַֽם־אֶת־יְהוּדָ֖ה בְּגִלּוּלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: “Because King Manasseh of Judah has done these abhorrent things—he has outdone in wickedness all that the Amorites did before his time—and because he led Judah to sin with his fetishes,
Transliteration: yaan asher ashah menasheh melekhe-yehudah hatoevvot haeleh hera mikhol asher-ashu haemoriy asher lefanayv vayachati gam-et-yehudah vegilulayv {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנְנִי֙ מֵבִ֣יא רָעָ֔ה עַל־יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וִֽיהוּדָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ כׇּל־[שֹׁ֣מְעָ֔הּ] (שמעיו) תִּצַּ֖לְנָה שְׁתֵּ֥י אׇזְנָֽיו׃
Translated: assuredly, thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I am going to bring such a disaster on Jerusalem and Judah that both ears of everyone who hears about it will tingle.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael hineniy meviy raah al-yerushala͏im viyhudah asher khׇl-[shomeah] (shmyv) titsalenah shetey ׇzenayv

Hebrew: וְנָטִ֣יתִי עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֵ֚ת קָ֣ו שֹׁמְר֔וֹן וְאֶת־מִשְׁקֹ֖לֶת בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב וּמָחִ֨יתִי אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם כַּאֲשֶׁר־יִמְחֶ֤ה אֶת־הַצַּלַּ֙חַת֙ מָחָ֔ה וְהָפַ֖ךְ עַל־פָּנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: I will apply to Jerusalem the measuring line of Samaria and the weights of the House of Ahab; I will wipe Jerusalem clean as one wipes a dish and turns it upside down.
Transliteration: venatiytiy al-yerushala͏im et kav shomervon veet-mishekolet veyt acheav umachiytiy et-yerushala͏im khaasher-yimecheh et-hatsalachat machah vehafakhe al-faneyha

Hebrew: וְנָטַשְׁתִּ֗י אֵ֚ת שְׁאֵרִ֣ית נַחֲלָתִ֔י וּנְתַתִּ֖ים בְּיַ֣ד אֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָי֥וּ לְבַ֛ז וְלִמְשִׁסָּ֖ה לְכׇל־אֹיְבֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And I will cast off the remnant of My own people and deliver them into the hands of their enemies. They shall be plunder and prey to all their enemies
Transliteration: venatashetiy et sheeriyt nachalatiy unetatiym veyad oyeveyhem vehayu levaz velimeshisah lekhׇl-oyeveyhem

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֤וּ אֶת־הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י וַיִּהְי֥וּ מַכְעִסִ֖ים אֹתִ֑י מִן־הַיּ֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצְא֤וּ אֲבוֹתָם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וְעַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: because they have done what is displeasing to Me and have been provoking My anger from the day that their ancestors came out of Egypt to this day.”
Transliteration: yaan asher ashu et-hara veeynay vayiheyu makheisiym otiy min-hayyvom asher yatseu avvotam mimitserayiim vead hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְגַם֩ דָּ֨ם נָקִ֜י שָׁפַ֤ךְ מְנַשֶּׁה֙ הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֔ד עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־מִלֵּ֥א אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם פֶּ֣ה לָפֶ֑ה לְבַ֤ד מֵֽחַטָּאתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶחֱטִ֣יא אֶת־יְהוּדָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Moreover, Manasseh put so many innocent persons to death that he filled Jerusalem [with blood] from end to end—besides the sin he committed in causing Judah to do what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vegam dam nakiy shafakhe menasheh hareveh meod ad asher-mile et-yerushala͏im feh lafeh levad mechatatvo asher hechetiy et-yehudah laashvot hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֤י מְנַשֶּׁה֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וְחַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֑א הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Manasseh’s reign, and all his actions, and the sins he committed, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey menasheh vekhׇl-asher ashah vechatatvo asher chata halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב מְנַשֶּׁה֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר בְּגַן־בֵּית֖וֹ בְּגַן־עֻזָּ֑א וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אָמ֥וֹן בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Manasseh rested with his ancestors and was buried in the garden of his palace, in the garden of Uzza; and his son Amon succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav menasheh im-avotayv vayikaver vegan-veytvo vegan-uza vayimelokhe amvon venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וּשְׁתַּ֤יִם שָׁנָה֙ אָמ֣וֹן בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וּשְׁתַּ֣יִם שָׁנִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ מְשֻׁלֶּ֥מֶת בַּת־חָר֖וּץ מִן־יׇטְבָֽה׃
Translated: Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Meshullemeth daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym ushetayiim shanah amvon vemׇlekhvo ushetayiim shaniym malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo meshulemet vat-charuts min-yׇtevah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, as his father Manasseh had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khaasher ashah menasheh aviyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ בְּכׇל־הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֣ךְ אָבִ֑יו וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֗ד אֶת־הַגִּלֻּלִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָבַ֣ד אָבִ֔יו וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: He walked in all the ways of his father, worshiping the fetishes that his father had worshiped and bowing down to them.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vekhׇl-haderekhe asher-halakhe aviyv vayaavod et-hagiluliym asher avad aviyv vayishetachu lahem

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲזֹ֕ב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א הָלַ֖ךְ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He forsook the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of his ancestors, and did not follow the way of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaazov et-yehovah elohey avotayv velo halakhe vederekhe yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשְׁר֥וּ עַבְדֵי־אָמ֖וֹן עָלָ֑יו וַיָּמִ֥יתוּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Amon’s courtiers conspired against him; and they killed the king in his palace.
Transliteration: vayikesheru avedey-amvon alayv vayamiytu et-hamelekhe veveytvo

Hebrew: וַיַּךְ֙ עַם־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַקֹּשְׁרִ֖ים עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָמ֑וֹן וַיַּמְלִ֧יכוּ עַם־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֶת־יֹאשִׁיָּ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: But the people of the land put to death all who had conspired against King Amon, and the people of the land made his son Josiah king in his stead.
Transliteration: vayakhe am-haarets et khׇl-hakosheriym al-hamelekhe amvon vayameliykhu am-haarets et-yoshiyahu venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י אָמ֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Amon’s reign [and] his actions are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey amvon asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֥ר אֹת֛וֹ בִּקְבֻרָת֖וֹ בְּגַן־עֻזָּ֑א וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יֹאשִׁיָּ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: He was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza; and his son Josiah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayikevor otvo vikevuratvo vegan-uza vayimelokhe yoshiyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וְאַחַת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ יְדִידָ֥ה בַת־עֲדָיָ֖ה מִבָּֽצְקַֽת׃
Translated: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jedidah daughter of Adaiah of Bozkath.
Transliteration: ven-shemoneh shanah yoshiyahu vemׇlekhvo usheloshiym veachat shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo yediydah vat-adayah mivatsekat

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּכׇל־דֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔יו וְלֹא־סָ֖ר יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃ {פ}
Translated: He did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small> and he followed all the ways of his forefather David; he did not deviate to the right or to the left.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah vayelekhe vekhׇl-derekhe david aviyv velo-sar yamiyn ushemovl {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּשְׁמֹנֶ֤ה עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ שָׁלַ֣ח הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ אֶת־שָׁפָ֨ן בֶּן־אֲצַלְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־מְשֻׁלָּם֙ הַסֹּפֵ֔ר בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the eighteenth year of King Josiah, the king sent the scribe Shaphan son of Azaliah son of Meshullam to the House of G<small>OD</small>, saying,
Transliteration: vayehiy vishemoneh eshereh shanah lamelekhe yoshiyahu shalach hamelekhe et-shafan ven-atsaleyahu ven-meshulam hasofer veyt yehovah lemor

Hebrew: עֲלֵ֗ה אֶל־חִלְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּד֔וֹל וְיַתֵּ֣ם אֶת־הַכֶּ֔סֶף הַמּוּבָ֖א בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָסְפ֛וּ שֹׁמְרֵ֥י הַסַּ֖ף מֵאֵ֥ת הָעָֽם׃
Translated: “Go to the high priest Hilkiah and let him weigh the silver that has been deposited in the House of G<small>OD</small>, which the guards of the threshold have collected from the people.
Transliteration: aleh el-chilekiyahu hakhohen hagadvol veyatem et-hakhesef hamuva veyt yehovah asher asefu shomerey hasaf meet haam

Hebrew: (ויתנה) [וְיִתְּנוּ֗הוּ] עַל־יַד֙ עֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה הַמֻּפְקָדִ֖ים (בבית) [בֵּ֣ית] יְהֹוָ֑ה וְיִתְּנ֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ לְעֹשֵׂ֤י הַמְּלָאכָה֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה לְחַזֵּ֖ק בֶּ֥דֶק הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: And let it be delivered to the overseers of the work who are in charge at the House of G<small>OD</small>, that they in turn may pay it out to the workers that are in the House of G<small>OD</small>, for the repair of the House:
Transliteration: (vytnh) [veyitenuhu] al-yad oshey hamelakhah hamufekadiym (vvyt) [veyt] yehovah veyitenu otvo leoshey hamelakhah asher veveyt yehovah lechazek vedek havayiit

Hebrew: לֶחָ֣רָשִׁ֔ים וְלַבֹּנִ֖ים וְלַגֹּֽדְרִ֑ים וְלִקְנ֤וֹת עֵצִים֙ וְאַבְנֵ֣י מַחְצֵ֔ב לְחַזֵּ֖ק אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: to the carpenters, the laborers, and the masons, and for the purchase of wood and quarried stones for repairing the House.
Transliteration: lecharashiym velavoniym velagoderiym velikenvot etsiym veaveney machetsev lechazek et-havayiit

Hebrew: אַ֚ךְ לֹא־יֵחָשֵׁ֣ב אִתָּ֔ם הַכֶּ֖סֶף הַנִּתָּ֣ן עַל־יָדָ֑ם כִּ֥י בֶאֱמוּנָ֖ה הֵ֥ם עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: However, no check is to be kept on them for the silver that is delivered to them, for they deal honestly.”
Transliteration: akhe lo-eichashev itam hakhesef hanitan al-yadam khiy veemunah hem oshiym

Hebrew: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר חִלְקִיָּ֜הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֤ן הַגָּדוֹל֙ עַל־שָׁפָ֣ן הַסֹּפֵ֔ר סֵ֧פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֛ה מָצָ֖אתִי בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֨ן חִלְקִיָּ֧ה אֶת־הַסֵּ֛פֶר אֶל־שָׁפָ֖ן וַיִּקְרָאֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: Then the high priest Hilkiah said to the scribe Shaphan, “I have found a scroll of the Teaching in the House of G<small>OD</small>.” And Hilkiah gave the scroll to Shaphan, who read it.
Transliteration: vayomer chilekiyahu hakhohen hagadvol al-shafan hasofer sefer hatvorah matsatiy veveyt yehovah vayiten chilekiyah et-hasefer el-shafan vayikeraehu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א שָׁפָ֤ן הַסֹּפֵר֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיָּ֥שֶׁב אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ דָּבָ֑ר וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִתִּ֤יכוּ עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ הַנִּמְצָ֣א בַבַּ֔יִת וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֗הוּ עַל־יַד֙ עֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה הַמֻּפְקָדִ֖ים בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The scribe Shaphan then went to the king and reported to the king: “Your servants have melted down the silver that was deposited in the House, and they have delivered it to the overseers of the work who are in charge at the House of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayavo shafan hasofer el-hamelekhe vayashev et-hamelekhe davar vayomer hitiykhu avadeykha et-hakhesef hanimetsa vavayiit vayitenuhu al-yad oshey hamelakhah hamufekadiym veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֞ד שָׁפָ֤ן הַסֹּפֵר֙ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֔ר סֵ֚פֶר נָ֣תַן לִ֔י חִלְקִיָּ֖ה הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וַיִּקְרָאֵ֥הוּ שָׁפָ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The scribe Shaphan also told the king, “The high priest Hilkiah has given me a scroll”; and Shaphan read it to the king.
Transliteration: vayaged shafan hasofer lamelekhe lemor sefer natan liy chilekiyah hakhohen vayikeraehu shafan lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י סֵ֣פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֑ה וַיִּקְרַ֖ע אֶת־בְּגָדָֽיו׃
Translated: When the king heard the words of the scroll of the Teaching, he rent his clothes.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa hamelekhe et-diverey sefer hatvorah vayikera et-vegadayv

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ אֶת־חִלְקִיָּ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֡ן וְאֶת־אֲחִיקָ֣ם בֶּן־שָׁ֠פָ֠ן וְאֶת־עַכְבּ֨וֹר בֶּן־מִיכָיָ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שָׁפָ֣ן הַסֹּפֵ֗ר וְאֵ֛ת עֲשָׂיָ֥ה עֶֽבֶד־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And the king gave orders to the priest Hilkiah, and to Ahikam son of Shaphan, Achbor son of Michaiah, the scribe Shaphan, and Asaiah the king’s minister:
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe et-chilekiyah hakhohen veet-achiykam ven-shafan veet-akhevvor ven-miykhayah veet shafan hasofer veet ashayah eved-hamelekhe lemor

Hebrew: לְכוּ֩ דִרְשׁ֨וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֜ה בַּעֲדִ֣י וּבְעַד־הָעָ֗ם וּבְעַד֙ כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֔ה עַל־דִּבְרֵ֛י הַסֵּ֥פֶר הַנִּמְצָ֖א הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־גְדוֹלָ֞ה חֲמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר־הִיא֙ נִצְּתָ֣ה בָ֔נוּ עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־שָׁמְע֜וּ אֲבֹתֵ֗ינוּ עַל־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת כְּכׇל־הַכָּת֥וּב עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “Go, inquire of G<small>OD</small> on my behalf, and on behalf of the people, and on behalf of all Judah, concerning the words of this scroll that has been found. For great indeed must be G<small>OD</small>’s wrath that has been kindled against us, because our ancestors did not obey the words of this scroll to do all that has been prescribed for us.”
Transliteration: lekhu direshu et-yehovah vaadiy uvead-haam uvead khׇl-yehudah al-diverey hasefer hanimetsa hazeh khiy-gedvolah chamat yehovah asher-hiy nitsetah vanu al asher lo-shameu avoteynu al-diverey hasefer hazeh laashvot khekhׇl-hakhatuv aleynu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ חִלְקִיָּ֣הוּ הַ֠כֹּהֵ֠ן וַאֲחִיקָ֨ם וְעַכְבּ֜וֹר וְשָׁפָ֣ן וַעֲשָׂיָ֗ה אֶל־חֻלְדָּ֨ה הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה אֵ֣שֶׁת ׀ שַׁלֻּ֣ם בֶּן־תִּקְוָ֗ה בֶּן־חַרְחַס֙ שֹׁמֵ֣ר הַבְּגָדִ֔ים וְהִ֛יא יֹשֶׁ֥בֶת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בַּמִּשְׁנֶ֑ה וַֽיְדַבְּר֖וּ אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: So the priest Hilkiah, and Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asaiah went to the prophetess Huldah—the wife of Shallum son of Tikvah son of Harhas, the keeper of the wardrobe—who was living in Jerusalem in the Mishneh, and they spoke to her.
Transliteration: vayelekhe chilekiyahu hakhohen vaachiykam veakhevvor veshafan vaashayah el-chuledah haneviyah eshet shalum ven-tikevah ven-charechas shomer havegadiym vehiy yoshevet viyrushala͏im vamisheneh vayedaveru eleyha

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִמְר֣וּ לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: She responded: “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: Say to the one who sent you to me:
Transliteration: vatomer aleyhem khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael imeru laiysh asher-shalach etekhem elay

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֥יא רָעָ֛ה אֶל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה וְעַל־יֹֽשְׁבָ֑יו אֵ֚ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י הַסֵּ֔פֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר קָרָ֖א מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to bring disaster upon this place and its inhabitants, in accordance with all the words of the scroll that the king of Judah has read.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineniy meviy raah el-hamakvom hazeh veal-yoshevayv et khׇl-diverey hasefer asher kara melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲזָב֗וּנִי וַֽיְקַטְּרוּ֙ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְמַ֙עַן֙ הַכְעִיסֵ֔נִי בְּכֹ֖ל מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יְדֵיהֶ֑ם וְנִצְּתָ֧ה חֲמָתִ֛י בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה׃
Translated: Because they have forsaken Me and have made offerings to other gods and provoked My anger with all their deeds, My wrath is kindled against this place and it shall not be quenched.
Transliteration: tachat asher azavuniy vayekateru lelohiym acheriym lemaan hakheiyseniy vekhol maasheh yedeyhem venitsetah chamatiy vamakvom hazeh velo tikheveh

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה הַשֹּׁלֵ֤חַ אֶתְכֶם֙ לִדְרֹ֣שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְר֖וּ אֵלָ֑יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: But say this to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of G<small>OD</small>: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: As for the words that you have heard—
Transliteration: veel-melekhe yehudah hasholecha etekhem liderosh et-yehovah khoh tomeru elayv khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael hadevariym asher shamaeta

Hebrew: יַ֠עַן רַךְ־לְבָ֨בְךָ֜ וַתִּכָּנַ֣ע ׀ מִפְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּֽשׇׁמְעֲךָ֡ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֩רְתִּי֩ עַל־הַמָּק֨וֹם הַזֶּ֜ה וְעַל־יֹשְׁבָ֗יו לִֽהְי֤וֹת לְשַׁמָּה֙ וְלִקְלָלָ֔ה וַתִּקְרַע֙ אֶת־בְּגָדֶ֔יךָ וַתִּבְכֶּ֖ה לְפָנָ֑י וְגַ֧ם אָנֹכִ֛י שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: because your heart was softened and you humbled yourself before G<small>OD</small> when you heard what I decreed against this place and its inhabitants—that it will become a desolation and a curse—and because you rent your clothes and wept before Me, I for My part have listened—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: yaan rakhe-levavekha vatikhana mifeney yehovah veshׇmeakha asher divaretiy al-hamakvom hazeh veal-yoshevayv liheyvot leshamah velikelalah vatikera et-vegadeykha vativekheh lefanay vegam anokhiy shamaetiy neum-yehovah

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ הִנְנִ֨י אֹסִפְךָ֜ עַל־אֲבֹתֶ֗יךָ וְנֶאֱסַפְתָּ֣ אֶל־קִבְרֹתֶ֘יךָ֮ בְּשָׁלוֹם֒ וְלֹא־תִרְאֶ֣ינָה עֵינֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹל֙ הָרָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י מֵבִ֖יא עַל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיָּשִׁ֥בוּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: Assuredly, I will gather you to your ancestors and you will be laid in your tomb in peace. Your eyes shall not see all the disaster that I will bring upon this place.” So they brought back the reply to the king.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy osifekha al-avoteykha veneesafeta el-kiveroteykha veshalvom velo-tireeynah eyneykha vekhol haraah asher-aniy meviy al-hamakvom hazeh vayashivu et-hamelekhe davar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיַּאַסְפ֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: At the king’s summons, all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem assembled before him.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe vayaasefu elayv khׇl-zikeney yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֡ה וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָה֩ וְכׇל־יֹשְׁבֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם אִתּ֗וֹ וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַנְּבִיאִ֔ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם לְמִקָּטֹ֣ן וְעַד־גָּד֑וֹל וַיִּקְרָ֣א בְאׇזְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵי֙ סֵ֣פֶר הַבְּרִ֔ית הַנִּמְצָ֖א בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The king went up to the House of G<small>OD</small>, together with the entire citizenry of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the priests and prophets—all the people, young and old. And he read to them the entire text of the covenant scroll that had been found in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaal hamelekhe veyt-yehovah vekhׇl-iysh yehudah vekhׇl-yoshevey yerushala͏im itvo vehakhohaniym vehaneviyiym vekhׇl-haam lemikaton vead-gadvol vayikera veׇzeneyhem et-khׇl-diverey sefer haveriyt hanimetsa veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ עַֽל־הָ֨עַמּ֜וּד וַיִּכְרֹ֥ת אֶֽת־הַבְּרִ֣ית ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה לָלֶ֜כֶת אַחַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ וְלִשְׁמֹ֨ר מִצְוֺתָ֜יו וְאֶת־עֵדְוֺתָ֤יו וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתָיו֙ בְּכׇל־לֵ֣ב וּבְכׇל־נֶ֔פֶשׁ לְהָקִ֗ים אֶת־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את הַכְּתֻבִ֖ים עַל־הַסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם בַּבְּרִֽית׃
Translated: The king stood by the pillar and solemnized the covenant before G<small>OD</small>: that they would follow G<small>OD</small> and observe God’s commandments, injunctions, and laws with all their heart and soul; that they would fulfill all the terms of this covenant as inscribed upon the scroll. And all the people entered into the covenant.
Transliteration: vayaamod hamelekhe al-haamud vayikherot et-haveriyt lifeney yehovah lalekhet achar yehovah velishemor mitsevotayv veet-edevotayv veet-chukotayv vekhׇl-lev uvekhׇl-nefesh lehakiym et-diverey haveriyt hazot hakhetuviym al-hasefer hazeh vayaamod khׇl-haam vaveriyt

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ אֶת־חִלְקִיָּ֩הוּ֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן הַגָּד֜וֹל וְאֶת־כֹּהֲנֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁנֶה֮ וְאֶת־שֹׁמְרֵ֣י הַסַּף֒ לְהוֹצִיא֙ מֵהֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֗ים הָֽעֲשׂוּיִם֙ לַבַּ֣עַל וְלָאֲשֵׁרָ֔ה וּלְכֹ֖ל צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַֽיִּשְׂרְפֵ֞ם מִח֤וּץ לִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ בְּשַׁדְמ֣וֹת קִדְר֔וֹן וְנָשָׂ֥א אֶת־עֲפָרָ֖ם בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: Then the king ordered the high priest Hilkiah, the priests of the second rank, and the guards of the threshold to bring out of the Temple of G<small>OD</small> all the objects made for Baal and Asherah and all the host of heaven. He burned them outside Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and he removed the ashes to Bethel.
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe et-chilekiyahu hakhohen hagadvol veet-khohaney hamisheneh veet-shomerey hasaf lehvotsiy meheykhal yehovah et khׇl-hakheliym haashuyim lavaal velaasherah ulekhol tseva hashamayiim vayisherefem michuts liyrushala͏im veshademvot kidervon venasha et-afaram veyt-el

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבִּ֣ית אֶת־הַכְּמָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽתְנוּ֙ מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיְקַטֵּ֤ר בַּבָּמוֹת֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וּמְסִבֵּ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְאֶת־הַֽמְקַטְּרִ֣ים לַבַּ֗עַל לַשֶּׁ֤מֶשׁ וְלַיָּרֵ֙חַ֙ וְלַמַּזָּל֔וֹת וּלְכֹ֖ל צְבָ֥א הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: He suppressed the idolatrous priests whom the kings of Judah had appointed to make offerings at the shrines in the towns of Judah and in the environs of Jerusalem, and those who made offerings to Baal, to the sun and moon and constellations—all the host of heaven.
Transliteration: vehisheviyt et-hakhemariym asher natenu malekhey yehudah vayekater vavamvot vearey yehudah umesivey yerushala͏im veet-hamekateriym lavaal lashemesh velayarecha velamazalvot ulekhol tseva hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּצֵ֣א אֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרָה֩ מִבֵּ֨ית יְהֹוָ֜ה מִח֤וּץ לִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אֶל־נַ֣חַל קִדְר֔וֹן וַיִּשְׂרֹ֥ף אֹתָ֛הּ בְּנַ֥חַל קִדְר֖וֹן וַיָּ֣דֶק לְעָפָ֑ר וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙ אֶת־עֲפָרָ֔הּ עַל־קֶ֖בֶר בְּנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He brought out the [image of] Asherah from the House of G<small>OD</small> to the Kidron Valley outside Jerusalem, and burned it in the Kidron Valley; he beat it to dust and scattered its dust over the burial ground of the common people.
Transliteration: vayotse et-haasherah miveyt yehovah michuts liyrushala͏im el-nachal kidervon vayisherof otah venachal kidervon vayadek leafar vayashelekhe et-afarah al-kever veney haam

Hebrew: וַיִּתֹּץ֙ אֶת־בָּתֵּ֣י הַקְּדֵשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הַנָּשִׁ֗ים אֹרְג֥וֹת שָׁ֛ם בָּתִּ֖ים לָאֲשֵׁרָֽה׃
Translated: He tore down the cubicles of the consecrated workers in the House of G<small>OD</small>, at the place where the women wove coverings for Asherah.
Transliteration: vayitots et-vatey hakedeshiym asher veveyt yehovah asher hanashiym oregvot sham vatiym laasherah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א אֶת־כׇּל־הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ מֵעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיְטַמֵּ֣א אֶת־הַבָּמ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר קִטְּרֽוּ־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים מִגֶּ֖בַע עַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וְנָתַ֞ץ אֶת־בָּמ֣וֹת הַשְּׁעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֜תַח שַׁ֤עַר יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ שַׂר־הָעִ֔יר אֲשֶֽׁר־עַל־שְׂמֹ֥אול אִ֖ישׁ בְּשַׁ֥עַר הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: He brought all the priests from the towns of Judah [to Jerusalem] and defiled the shrines where the priests had been making offerings—from Geba to Beer-sheba. He also demolished the shrines of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua, the city prefect—which were on the left as one [entered] the city gate.
Transliteration: vayave et-khׇl-hakhohaniym mearey yehudah vayetame et-havamvot asher kiteru-shamah hakhohaniym migeva ad-veer shava venatats et-vamvot hasheariym asher-fetach shaar yehvoshua shar-haiyr asher-al-shemovl iysh veshaar haiyr

Hebrew: אַ֗ךְ לֹ֤א יַעֲלוּ֙ כֹּהֲנֵ֣י הַבָּמ֔וֹת אֶל־מִזְבַּ֥ח יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּ֛י אִם־אָכְל֥וּ מַצּ֖וֹת בְּת֥וֹךְ אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The priests of the shrines, however, did not ascend the altar of G<small>OD</small> in Jerusalem, but they ate unleavened bread along with their kinsmen.
Transliteration: akhe lo yaalu khohaney havamvot el-mizevach yehovah viyrushala͏im khiy im-akhelu matsvot vetvokhe acheyhem

Hebrew: וְטִמֵּ֣א אֶת־הַתֹּ֔פֶת אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּגֵ֣י (בני) [בֶן־]הִנֹּ֑ם לְבִלְתִּ֗י לְהַעֲבִ֨יר אִ֜ישׁ אֶת־בְּנ֧וֹ וְאֶת־בִּתּ֛וֹ בָּאֵ֖שׁ לַמֹּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: He also defiled Topheth, which is in the Valley of Ben-hinnom, so that no one might consign their son or daughter to the fire of Molech.
Transliteration: vetime et-hatofet asher vegey (vny) [ven-]hinom leviletiy lehaaviyr iysh et-venvo veet-vitvo vaesh lamolekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁבֵּ֣ת אֶת־הַסּוּסִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתְנוּ֩ מַלְכֵ֨י יְהוּדָ֤ה לַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ מִבֹּ֣א בֵית־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־לִשְׁכַּת֙ נְתַן־מֶ֣לֶךְ הַסָּרִ֔יס אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּפַּרְוָרִ֑ים וְאֶת־מַרְכְּב֥וֹת הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ שָׂרַ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: He did away with the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun, at the entrance of the House of G<small>OD</small>, near the chamber of the eunuch Nathan-melech, which was in the precincts. He burned the chariots of the sun.
Transliteration: vayashevet et-hasusiym asher natenu malekhey yehudah lashemesh mivo veyt-yehovah el-lishekhat netan-melekhe hasariys asher vafarevariym veet-marekhevvot hashemesh sharaf vaesh

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֡וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַגָּג֩ עֲלִיַּ֨ת אָחָ֜ז אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֣וּ ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה וְאֶת־הַֽמִּזְבְּחוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה בִּשְׁתֵּ֛י חַצְר֥וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה נָתַ֣ץ הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיָּ֣רׇץ מִשָּׁ֔ם וְהִשְׁלִ֥יךְ אֶת־עֲפָרָ֖ם אֶל־נַ֥חַל קִדְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: And the king tore down the altars made by the kings of Judah on the roof by the upper chamber of Ahaz, and the altars made by Manasseh in the two courts of the House of G<small>OD</small>. He removed them quickly from there and scattered their rubble in the Kidron Valley.
Transliteration: veet-hamizevechvot asher al-hagag aliyat achaz asher-ashu malekhey yehudah veet-hamizevechvot asher-ashah menasheh vishetey chatservot veyt-yehovah natats hamelekhe vayarׇts misham vehisheliykhe et-afaram el-nachal kidervon

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַבָּמ֞וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֲשֶׁר֮ מִימִ֣ין לְהַר־הַמַּשְׁחִית֒ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּ֠נָ֠ה שְׁלֹמֹ֨ה מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל לְעַשְׁתֹּ֣רֶת ׀ שִׁקֻּ֣ץ צִידֹנִ֗ים וְלִכְמוֹשׁ֙ שִׁקֻּ֣ץ מוֹאָ֔ב וּלְמִלְכֹּ֖ם תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֑וֹן טִמֵּ֖א הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The king also defiled the shrines facing Jerusalem, to the south of the Mount of the Destroyer, which King Solomon of Israel had built for Ashtoreth, the abomination of the Sidonians, for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, and for Milcom, the detestable thing of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: veet-havamvot asher al-feney yerushala͏im asher miymiyn lehar-hamashechiyt asher vanah shelomoh melekhe-yisherael leashetoret shikuts tsiydoniym velikhemvosh shikuts mvoav ulemilekhom tvoavat veney-amvon time hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְשִׁבַּר֙ אֶת־הַמַּצֵּב֔וֹת וַיִּכְרֹ֖ת אֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרִ֑ים וַיְמַלֵּ֥א אֶת־מְקוֹמָ֖ם עַצְמ֥וֹת אָדָֽם׃
Translated: He shattered their pillars and cut down their sacred posts and covered their sites with human bones.
Transliteration: veshivar et-hamatsevvot vayikherot et-haasheriym vayemale et-mekvomam atsemvot adam

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֜חַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֗ל הַבָּמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה יָרׇבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־נְבָט֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶחֱטִ֣יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֧חַ הַה֛וּא וְאֶת־הַבָּמָ֖ה נָתָ֑ץ וַיִּשְׂרֹ֧ף אֶת־הַבָּמָ֛ה הֵדַ֥ק לְעָפָ֖ר וְשָׂרַ֥ף אֲשֵׁרָֽה׃
Translated: As for the altar in Bethel [and] the shrine made by Jeroboam son of Nebat who caused Israel to sin—that altar, too, and the shrine as well, he tore down. He burned down the shrine and beat it to dust, and he burned the sacred post.
Transliteration: vegam et-hamizevecha asher veveyt-el havamah asher ashah yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael gam et-hamizevecha hahu veet-havamah natats vayisherof et-havamah hedak leafar vesharaf asherah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣פֶן יֹאשִׁיָּ֗הוּ וַיַּ֨רְא אֶת־הַקְּבָרִ֤ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁם֙ בָּהָ֔ר וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הָֽעֲצָמוֹת֙ מִן־הַקְּבָרִ֔ים וַיִּשְׂרֹ֥ף עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ וַֽיְטַמְּאֵ֑הוּ כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר קָרָא֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָרָ֔א אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Josiah turned and saw the graves that were there on the hill; and he had the bones taken out of the graves and burned on the altar. Thus he defiled it, in fulfillment of the word of G<small>OD</small> foretold by the agent of God who foretold these happenings.
Transliteration: vayifen yoshiyahu vayare et-hakevariym asher-sham vahar vayishelach vayikach et-haatsamvot min-hakevariym vayisherof al-hamizevecha vayetameehu khidevar yehovah asher kara iysh haElohim asher kara et-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מָ֚ה הַצִּיּ֣וּן הַלָּ֔ז אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲנִ֣י רֹאֶ֑ה וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֜יו אַנְשֵׁ֣י הָעִ֗יר הַקֶּ֤בֶר אִישׁ־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א מִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתָ עַ֖ל הַמִּזְבַּ֥ח בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: He asked, “What is the marker I see there?” And the townspeople replied, “That is the grave of the agent of God who came from Judah and foretold these things that you have done to the altar of Bethel.”
Transliteration: vayomer mah hatsiyyun halaz asher aniy roeh vayomeru elayv aneshey haiyr hakever iysh-haElohim asher-va miyhudah vayikera et-hadevariym haeleh asher ashiyta al hamizevach veyt-el

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַנִּ֣יחוּ ל֔וֹ אִ֖ישׁ אַל־יָנַ֣ע עַצְמוֹתָ֑יו וַֽיְמַלְּטוּ֙ עַצְמוֹתָ֔יו אֵ֚ת עַצְמ֣וֹת הַנָּבִ֔יא אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֖א מִשֹּׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: “Let him be,” he said. “Absolutely no one must disturb his bones.” So they left his bones undisturbed together with the bones of the prophet who came from Samaria.
Transliteration: vayomer haniychu lvo iysh al-yana atsemvotayv vayemaletu atsemvotayv et atsemvot hanaviy asher-va mishomervon

Hebrew: וְגַם֩ אֶת־כׇּל־בָּתֵּ֨י הַבָּמ֜וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ בְּעָרֵ֣י שֹׁמְר֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשׂ֜וּ מַלְכֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְהַכְעִ֔יס הֵסִ֖יר יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לָהֶ֔ם כְּכׇל־הַֽמַּעֲשִׂ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בְּבֵֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: Josiah also abolished all the cult places that the kings of Israel had built in the towns of Samaria, vexing [G<small>OD</small>]. He dealt with them just as he had done to Bethel:
Transliteration: vegam et-khׇl-vatey havamvot asher vearey shomervon asher ashu malekhey yisherael lehakheiys hesiyr yoshiyahu vayaash lahem khekhׇl-hamaashiym asher ashah veveyt-el

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּזְבַּ֠ח אֶת־כׇּל־כֹּהֲנֵ֨י הַבָּמ֤וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁם֙ עַל־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֔וֹת וַיִּשְׂרֹ֛ף אֶת־עַצְמ֥וֹת אָדָ֖ם עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּ֖שׇׁב יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He slew on the altars all the priests of the shrines who were there, and he burned human bones on them. Then he returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayizevach et-khׇl-khohaney havamvot asher-sham al-hamizevechvot vayisherof et-atsemvot adam aleyhem vayashׇv yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר עֲשׂ֣וּ פֶ֔סַח לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם כַּכָּת֕וּב עַ֛ל סֵ֥פֶר הַבְּרִ֖ית הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The king commanded all the people, “Offer the passover sacrifice to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God as prescribed in this scroll of the covenant.”
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe et-khׇl-haam lemor ashu fesach layhovah eloheykhem khakhatuv al sefer haveriyt hazeh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א נַֽעֲשָׂה֙ כַּפֶּ֣סַח הַזֶּ֔ה מִימֵי֙ הַשֹּׁ֣פְטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁפְט֖וּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכֹ֗ל יְמֵ֛י מַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וּמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Now the passover sacrifice had not been offered in that manner in the days of the chieftains who ruled Israel, or during the days of the kings of Israel and the kings of Judah.
Transliteration: khiy lo naashah khafesach hazeh miymey hashofetiym asher shafetu et-yisherael vekhol yemey malekhey yisherael umalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: כִּ֗י אִם־בִּשְׁמֹנֶ֤ה עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ נַעֲשָׂ֞ה הַפֶּ֧סַח הַזֶּ֛ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Only in the eighteenth year of King Josiah was such a passover sacrifice offered in that manner to G<small>OD</small> in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy im-vishemoneh eshereh shanah lamelekhe yoshiyahu naashah hafesach hazeh layhovah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אֶת־הָאֹב֣וֹת וְאֶת־הַ֠יִּדְּעֹנִ֠ים וְאֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֨ים וְאֶת־הַגִּלֻּלִ֜ים וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַשִּׁקֻּצִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִרְאוּ֙ בְּאֶ֤רֶץ יְהוּדָה֙ וּבִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בִּעֵ֖ר יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ לְ֠מַ֠עַן הָקִ֞ים אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֤י הַתּוֹרָה֙ הַכְּתֻבִ֣ים עַל־הַסֵּ֔פֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָצָ֛א חִלְקִיָּ֥הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Josiah also did away with the necromancers and the mediums, the oracle idols and the fetishes—all the detestable things that were to be seen in the land of Judah and Jerusalem. Thus he fulfilled the terms of the Teaching recorded in the scroll that the priest Hilkiah had found in the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vegam et-haovvot veet-hayideoniym veet-haterafiym veet-hagiluliym veet khׇl-hashikutsiym asher nireu veerets yehudah uviyrushala͏im vier yoshiyahu lemaan hakiym et-diverey hatvorah hakhetuviym al-hasefer asher matsa chilekiyahu hakhohen veyt yehovah
