Hebrew: וְכָמֹ֩הוּ֩ לֹא־הָיָ֨ה לְפָנָ֜יו מֶ֗לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֤ב אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּכׇל־לְבָב֤וֹ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשׁוֹ֙ וּבְכׇל־מְאֹד֔וֹ כְּכֹ֖ל תּוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְאַחֲרָ֖יו לֹא־קָ֥ם כָּמֹֽהוּ׃
Translated: There was no king like him before who turned back to G<small>OD</small> with all his heart and soul and might, in full accord with the Teaching of Moses; nor did any like him arise after him.
Transliteration: vekhamohu lo-hayah lefanayv melekhe asher-shav el-yehovah vekhׇl-levavvo uvekhׇl-nafeshvo uvekhׇl-meodvo khekhol tvorat mosheh veacharayv lo-kam khamohu

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ ׀ לֹא־שָׁ֣ב יְהֹוָ֗ה מֵחֲר֤וֹן אַפּוֹ֙ הַגָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־חָרָ֥ה אַפּ֖וֹ בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה עַ֚ל כׇּל־הַכְּעָסִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִכְעִיס֖וֹ מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: However, G<small>OD</small> did not turn away from the awesome wrath that had blazed up against Judah because of all the things Manasseh did to provoke God’s anger.
Transliteration: akhe lo-shav yehovah mecharvon afvo hagadvol asher-charah afvo viyhudah al khׇl-hakheasiym asher hikheiysvo menasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה גַּ֤ם אֶת־יְהוּדָה֙ אָסִיר֙ מֵעַ֣ל פָּנַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲסִרֹ֖תִי אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּ֠מָאַסְתִּ֠י אֶת־הָעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֤את אֲשֶׁר־בָּחַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶת־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְאֶ֨ת־הַבַּ֔יִת אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְתִּי יִֽהְיֶ֥ה שְׁמִ֖י שָֽׁם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said, “I will also banish Judah from My presence as I banished Israel; and I will reject the city of Jerusalem that I chose and the House where I said My name would abide.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah gam et-yehudah asiyr meal fanay khaasher hasirotiy et-yisherael umaasetiy et-haiyr hazot asher-vacharetiy et-yerushala͏im veet-havayiit asher amaretiy yiheyeh shemiy sham

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Josiah’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yoshiyahu vekhׇl-asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: בְּיָמָ֡יו עָלָה֩ פַרְעֹ֨ה נְכֹ֧ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֛יִם עַל־מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּׁ֖וּר עַל־נְהַר־פְּרָ֑ת וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּ֙הוּ֙ לִקְרָאת֔וֹ וַיְמִיתֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּמְגִדּ֔וֹ כִּרְאֹת֖וֹ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: In his days, Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, marched against the king of Assyria to the River Euphrates; King Josiah marched toward him, but when he confronted him at Megiddo, [Pharaoh Neco] slew him.
Transliteration: veyamayv alah fareoh nekhoh melekhe-mitserayiim al-melekhe ashur al-nehar-ferat vayelekhe hamelekhe yoshiyahu likeratvo vayemiytehu vimegidvo khireotvo otvo

Hebrew: וַיַּרְכִּבֻ֨הוּ עֲבָדָ֥יו מֵת֙ מִמְּגִדּ֔וֹ וַיְבִאֻ֙הוּ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֖הוּ בִּקְבֻרָת֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח עַם־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־יְהֽוֹאָחָז֙ בֶּן־יֹ֣אשִׁיָּ֔הוּ וַיִּמְשְׁח֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ וַיַּמְלִ֥יכוּ אֹת֖וֹ תַּ֥חַת אָבִֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: His servants conveyed his body in a chariot from Megiddo to Jerusalem, and they buried him in his tomb. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz; they anointed him and made him king in place of his father.
Transliteration: vayarekhivuhu avadayv met mimegidvo vayeviuhu yerushala͏im vayikeveruhu vikevuratvo vayikach am-haarets et-yehvoachaz ven-yoshiyahu vayimeshechu otvo vayameliykhu otvo tachat aviyv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְשָׁלֹ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ יְהוֹאָחָ֣ז בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירֽוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ חֲמוּטַ֥ל בַּֽת־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מִלִּבְנָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym veshalosh shanah yehvoachaz vemׇlekhvo usheloshah chodashiym malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo chamutal vat-yiremeyahu milivenah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֖וּ אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as his predecessors had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashu avotayv

Hebrew: וַיַּאַסְרֵ֩הוּ֩ פַרְעֹ֨ה נְכֹ֤ה בְרִבְלָה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֲמָ֔ת (במלך) [מִמְּלֹ֖ךְ] בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיִּתֶּן־עֹ֙נֶשׁ֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵאָ֥ה כִכַּר־כֶּ֖סֶף וְכִכַּ֥ר זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Pharaoh Neco imprisoned him in Riblah in the region of Hamath, to keep him from reigning in Jerusalem. And he imposed on the land an indemnity of one hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
Transliteration: vayaaserehu fareoh nekhoh verivelah veerets chamat (vmlkh) [mimelokhe] viyrushala͏im vayiten-onesh al-haarets meah khikhar-khesef vekhikhar zahav

Hebrew: וַיַּמְלֵךְ֩ פַּרְעֹ֨ה נְכֹ֜ה אֶת־אֶלְיָקִ֣ים בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֗הוּ תַּ֚חַת יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ אָבִ֔יו וַיַּסֵּ֥ב אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוֹיָקִ֑ים וְאֶת־יְהוֹאָחָ֣ז לָקַ֔ח וַיָּבֹ֥א מִצְרַ֖יִם וַיָּ֥מׇת שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Then Pharaoh Neco appointed Eliakim son of Josiah king in place of his father Josiah, changing his name to Jehoiakim. He took Jehoahaz and brought him to Egypt, where he died.
Transliteration: vayamelekhe fareoh nekhoh et-eleyakiym ven-yoshiyahu tachat yoshiyahu aviyv vayasev et-shemvo yehvoyakiym veet-yehvoachaz lakach vayavo mitserayiim vayamׇt sham

Hebrew: וְהַכֶּ֣סֶף וְהַזָּהָ֗ב נָתַ֤ן יְהֽוֹיָקִים֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה אַ֚ךְ הֶעֱרִ֣יךְ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ לָתֵ֥ת אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף עַל־פִּ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה אִ֣ישׁ כְּעֶרְכּ֗וֹ נָגַ֞שׂ אֶת־הַכֶּ֤סֶף וְאֶת־הַזָּהָב֙ אֶת־עַ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ לָתֵ֖ת לְפַרְעֹ֥ה נְכֹֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Jehoiakim gave Pharaoh the silver and the gold, and he made an assessment on the land to pay the money demanded by Pharaoh. He exacted from the people of the land the silver and gold to be paid Pharaoh Neco, each [holding] according to its assessment.
Transliteration: vehakhesef vehazahav natan yehvoyakiym lefareoh akhe heeriykhe et-haarets latet et-hakhesef al-fiy fareoh iysh kheerekhvo nagash et-hakhesef veet-hazahav et-am haarets latet lefareoh nekhoh {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ יְהוֹיָקִ֣ים בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ (זבידה) [זְבוּדָּ֥ה] בַת־פְּדָיָ֖ה מִן־רוּמָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Zebudah daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah yehvoyakiym vemׇlekhvo veachat eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo (zvydh) [zevudah] vat-fedayah min-rumah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֖וּ אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as his ancestors had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashu avotayv

Hebrew: בְּיָמָ֣יו עָלָ֔ה נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֖ר מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל וַיְהִי־ל֨וֹ יְהוֹיָקִ֥ים עֶ֙בֶד֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וַיָּ֖שׇׁב וַיִּמְרׇד־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: In his days, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his vassal for three years. Then he turned and rebelled against him.
Transliteration: veyamayv alah nevukhadenetsar melekhe vavel vayehiy-lvo yehvoyakiym eved shalosh shaniym vayashׇv vayimerׇd-vvo

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ בּ֡וֹ אֶת־גְּדוּדֵ֣י כַשְׂדִּים֩ וְאֶת־גְּדוּדֵ֨י אֲרָ֜ם וְאֵ֣ת ׀ גְּדוּדֵ֣י מוֹאָ֗ב וְאֵת֙ גְּדוּדֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֔וֹן וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֥ם בִּיהוּדָ֖ה לְהַאֲבִיד֑וֹ כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַ֖ד עֲבָדָ֥יו הַנְּבִיאִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> let loose against him the raiding bands of the Chaldeans, Arameans, Moabites, and Ammonites—letting them loose against Judah to destroy it, in accordance with the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken through the prophets—God’s servants.
Transliteration: vayeshalach yehovah vvo et-gedudey khashediym veet-gedudey aram veet gedudey mvoav veet gedudey veney-amvon vayeshalechem viyhudah lehaaviydvo khidevar yehovah asher diver veyad avadayv haneviyiym

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ ׀ עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה הָֽיְתָה֙ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה לְהָסִ֖יר מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑יו בְּחַטֹּ֣את מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: All this befell Judah at the command of G<small>OD</small>, who banished [them] from the divine presence because of all the sins that Manasseh had committed,
Transliteration: akhe al-fiy yehovah hayetah viyhudah lehasiyr meal fanayv vechatot menasheh khekhol asher ashah

Hebrew: וְגַ֤ם דַּֽם־הַנָּקִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁפָ֔ךְ וַיְמַלֵּ֥א אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם דָּ֣ם נָקִ֑י וְלֹא־אָבָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לִסְלֹֽחַ׃
Translated: and also because of the blood of the innocent that he shed. For he filled Jerusalem with the blood of the innocent, and G<small>OD</small> would not forgive.
Transliteration: vegam dam-hanakiy asher shafakhe vayemale et-yerushala͏im dam nakiy velo-avah yehovah liselocha

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהוֹיָקִ֖ים וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Jehoiakim’s reign, and all of his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yehvoyakiym vekhׇl-asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב יְהוֹיָקִ֖ים עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹיָכִ֥ין בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Jehoiakim rested with his ancestors, and his son Jehoiachin succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yehvoyakiym im-avotayv vayimelokhe yehvoyakhiyn venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הֹסִ֥יף עוֹד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לָצֵ֖את מֵֽאַרְצ֑וֹ כִּֽי־לָקַ֞ח מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֗ל מִנַּ֤חַל מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ עַד־נְהַר־פְּרָ֔ת כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיְתָ֖ה לְמֶ֥לֶךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: The king of Egypt did not venture out of his country again, for the king of Babylon had seized all the land that had belonged to the king of Egypt, from the Wadi of Egypt to the River Euphrates.
Transliteration: velo-hosiyf vod melekhe mitserayiim latset mearetsvo khiy-lakach melekhe vavel minachal mitserayiim ad-nehar-ferat khol asher hayetah lemelekhe mitserayiim {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁמֹנֶ֨ה עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ יְהוֹיָכִ֣ין בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירֽוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ נְחֻשְׁתָּ֥א בַת־אֶלְנָתָ֖ן מִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Nehushta daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-shemoneh eshereh shanah yehvoyakhiyn vemׇlekhvo usheloshah chodashiym malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo nechusheta vat-elenatan miyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as his father had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah aviyv

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא (עלה) [עָל֗וּ] עַבְדֵ֛י נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַתָּבֹ֥א הָעִ֖יר בַּמָּצֽוֹר׃
Translated: At that time, the troops of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched against Jerusalem, and the city came under siege.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy (lh) [alu] avedey nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel yerushala͏im vatavo haiyr vamatsvor

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֛א נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל עַל־הָעִ֑יר וַעֲבָדָ֖יו צָרִ֥ים עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon advanced against the city while his troops were besieging it.
Transliteration: vayavo nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel al-haiyr vaavadayv tsariym aleyha

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֞א יְהוֹיָכִ֤ין מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֙ עַל־מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל ה֣וּא וְאִמּ֔וֹ וַעֲבָדָ֖יו וְשָׂרָ֣יו וְסָרִיסָ֑יו וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל בִּשְׁנַ֥ת שְׁמֹנֶ֖ה לְמׇלְכֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thereupon King Jehoiachin of Judah, along with his mother, and his courtiers, commanders, and officers, surrendered to the king of Babylon. The king of Babylon took him captive in the eighth year of his reign.
Transliteration: vayetse yehvoyakhiyn melekhe-yehudah al-melekhe vavel hu veimvo vaavadayv vesharayv vesariysayv vayikach otvo melekhe vavel vishenat shemoneh lemׇlekhvo

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֣א מִשָּׁ֗ם אֶת־כׇּל־אֽוֹצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאוֹצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיְקַצֵּ֞ץ אֶת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּהֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He carried off from Jerusalem all the treasures of the House of G<small>OD</small> and the treasures of the royal palace; he stripped off all the golden decorations in the Temple of G<small>OD</small>—which King Solomon of Israel had made—as G<small>OD</small> had warned.
Transliteration: vayyvotse misham et-khׇl-votservot veyt yehovah vevotservot veyt hamelekhe vayekatsets et-khׇl-kheley hazahav asher ashah shelomoh melekhe-yisherael veheykhal yehovah khaasher diver yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִגְלָ֣ה אֶת־כׇּל־יְ֠רוּשָׁלַ֠͏ִם וְֽאֶת־כׇּל־הַשָּׂרִ֞ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־גִּבּוֹרֵ֣י הַחַ֗יִל (עשרה) [עֲשֶׂ֤רֶת] אֲלָפִים֙ גּוֹלֶ֔ה וְכׇל־הֶחָרָ֖שׁ וְהַמַּסְגֵּ֑ר לֹ֣א נִשְׁאַ֔ר זוּלַ֖ת דַּלַּ֥ת עַם־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: He exiled all of Jerusalem: all the commanders and all the warriors—ten thousand exiles—as well as all the artisans and smiths; only the poorest people in the land were left.
Transliteration: vehigelah et-khׇl-yerushala͏im veet-khׇl-hashariym veet khׇl-givvorey hachayiil (shrh) [asheret] alafiym gvoleh vekhׇl-hecharash vehamaseger lo nishear zulat dalat am-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֶּ֥גֶל אֶת־יְהוֹיָכִ֖ין בָּבֶ֑לָה וְאֶת־אֵ֣ם הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וְאֶת־סָרִיסָ֗יו וְאֵת֙ (אולי) [אֵילֵ֣י] הָאָ֔רֶץ הוֹלִ֛יךְ גּוֹלָ֥ה מִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: He deported Jehoiachin to Babylon; and the king’s mother and wives and officers and the notables of the land were brought as exiles from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Transliteration: vayegel et-yehvoyakhiyn vavelah veet-em hamelekhe veet-neshey hamelekhe veet-sariysayv veet (vly) [eyley] haarets hvoliykhe gvolah miyrushala͏im vavelah

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י הַחַ֜יִל שִׁבְעַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֗ים וְהֶחָרָ֤שׁ וְהַמַּסְגֵּר֙ אֶ֔לֶף הַכֹּ֕ל גִּבּוֹרִ֖ים עֹשֵׂ֣י מִלְחָמָ֑ה וַיְבִיאֵ֧ם מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל גּוֹלָ֖ה בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: All the able men, to the number of seven thousand—all of them warriors, trained for battle—and a thousand artisans and smiths were brought to Babylon as exiles by the king of Babylon.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-aneshey hachayiil shiveat alafiym vehecharash vehamaseger elef hakhol givvoriym oshey milechamah vayeviyem melekhe-vavel gvolah vavelah

Hebrew: וַיַּמְלֵ֧ךְ מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל אֶת־מַתַּנְיָ֥ה דֹד֖וֹ תַּחְתָּ֑יו וַיַּסֵּ֥ב אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ צִדְקִיָּֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: And the king of Babylon appointed Mattaniah, Jehoiachin’s uncle, king in his place, changing his name to Zedekiah.
Transliteration: vayamelekhe melekhe-vavel et-mataneyah dodvo tachetayv vayasev et-shemvo tsidekiyahu {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְאַחַ֤ת שָׁנָה֙ צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ (חמיטל) [חֲמוּטַ֥ל] בַּֽת־יִרְמְיָ֖הוּ מִלִּבְנָֽה׃
Translated: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym veachat shanah tsidekiyahu vemׇlekhvo veachat eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo (chmytl) [chamutal] vat-yiremeyahu milivenah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה יְהוֹיָקִֽים׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, just as Jehoiakim had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah yehvoyakiym

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ עַל־אַ֣ף יְהֹוָ֗ה הָיְתָ֤ה בִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וּבִ֣יהוּדָ֔ה עַד־הִשְׁלִכ֥וֹ אֹתָ֖ם מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑יו וַיִּמְרֹ֥ד צִדְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּמֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Indeed, Jerusalem and Judah were a cause of anger for GOD, so that they were cast out of the divine presence.
Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
Transliteration: khiy al-af yehovah hayetah viyrushala͏im uviyhudah ad-hishelikhvo otam meal fanayv vayimerod tsidekiyahu vemelekhe vavel {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בִשְׁנַ֨ת הַתְּשִׁיעִ֜ית לְמׇלְכ֗וֹ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי֮ בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹ֒דֶשׁ֒ בָּ֠א נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֨ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֜ל ה֧וּא וְכׇל־חֵיל֛וֹ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וַיִּ֣חַן עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּבְנ֥וּ עָלֶ֛יהָ דָּיֵ֖ק סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: And in the ninth year of his reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar moved against Jerusalem with his whole army. He besieged it; and they built towers against it all around.
Transliteration: vayehiy vishenat hateshiyiyt lemׇlekhvo vachodesh haashiyriy veashvor lachodesh va nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel hu vekhׇl-cheylvo al-yerushala͏im vayichan aleyha vayivenu aleyha daeik saviyv

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֥א הָעִ֖יר בַּמָּצ֑וֹר עַ֚ד עַשְׁתֵּ֣י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ צִדְקִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: The city continued in a state of siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
Transliteration: vatavo haiyr vamatsvor ad ashetey eshereh shanah lamelekhe tsidekiyahu

Hebrew: בְּתִשְׁעָ֣ה לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ וַיֶּחֱזַ֥ק הָרָעָ֖ב בָּעִ֑יר וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה לֶ֖חֶם לְעַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: By the ninth day [of the fourth month] the famine had become acute in the city; there was no food left for the common people.
Transliteration: vetisheah lachodesh vayechezak haraav vaiyr velo-hayah lechem leam haarets

Hebrew: וַתִּבָּקַ֣ע הָעִ֗יר וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י הַמִּלְחָמָ֤ה ׀ הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ דֶּ֜רֶךְ שַׁ֣עַר ׀ בֵּ֣ין הַחֹמֹתַ֗יִם אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־גַּ֣ן הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכַשְׂדִּ֥ים עַל־הָעִ֖יר סָבִ֑יב וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ דֶּ֥רֶךְ הָעֲרָבָֽה׃
Translated: Then [the wall of] the city was breached. All the soldiers [left the city] by night through the gate between the double walls, which is near the king’s garden—the Chaldeans were all around the city; and [the king] set out for the Arabah.
Transliteration: vativaka haiyr vekhׇl-aneshey hamilechamah halayelah derekhe shaar veyn hachomotayiim asher al-gan hamelekhe vekhashediym al-haiyr saviyv vayelekhe derekhe haaravah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֤וּ חֵיל־כַּשְׂדִּים֙ אַחַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיַּשִּׂ֥גוּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּעַֽרְב֣וֹת יְרֵח֑וֹ וְכׇ֨ל־חֵיל֔וֹ נָפֹ֖צוּ מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: But the Chaldean troops pursued the king, and they overtook him in the steppes of Jericho as his entire force left him and scattered.
Transliteration: vayiredefu cheyl-khashediym achar hamelekhe vayashigu otvo vearevvot yerechvo vekhׇl-cheylvo nafotsu mealayv

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְפְּשׂוּ֙ אֶת־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיַּעֲל֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל רִבְלָ֑תָה וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אִתּ֖וֹ מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: They captured the king and brought him before the king of Babylon at Riblah; and they put him on trial.
Transliteration: vayitefeshu et-hamelekhe vayaalu otvo el-melekhe vavel rivelatah vayedaveru itvo mishefat

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּנֵי֙ צִדְקִיָּ֔הוּ שָׁחֲט֖וּ לְעֵינָ֑יו וְאֶת־עֵינֵ֤י צִדְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ עִוֵּ֔ר וַיַּאַסְרֵ֙הוּ֙ בַּֽנְחֻשְׁתַּ֔יִם וַיְבִאֵ֖הוּ בָּבֶֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: They slaughtered Zedekiah’s sons before his eyes; then Zedekiah’s eyes were put out. He was chained in bronze fetters and he was brought to Babylon.
Transliteration: veet-veney tsidekiyahu shachatu leeynayv veet-eyney tsidekiyahu iver vayaaserehu vanechushetayiim vayeviehu vavel {s}

Hebrew: וּבַחֹ֤דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי֙ בְּשִׁבְעָ֣ה לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ הִ֗יא שְׁנַת֙ תְּשַֽׁע־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּ֣ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֑ל בָּ֞א נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֧ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֛ים עֶ֥בֶד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: On the seventh day of the fifth month—that was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, an officer of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: uvachodesh hachamiyshiy veshiveah lachodesh hiy shenat tesha-eshereh shanah lamelekhe nevukhadenetsar melekhe-vavel va nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym eved melekhe-vavel yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂרֹ֥ף אֶת־בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־בָּתֵּ֧י יְרוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם וְאֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית גָּד֖וֹל שָׂרַ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: He burned the House of G<small>OD</small>, the king’s palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem; he burned down the house of every notable person.
Transliteration: vayisherof et-veyt-yehovah veet-veyt hamelekhe veet khׇl-vatey yerushala͏im veet-khׇl-veyt gadvol sharaf vaesh

Hebrew: וְאֶת־חוֹמֹ֥ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם סָבִ֑יב נָֽתְצוּ֙ כׇּל־חֵ֣יל כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר רַב־טַבָּחִֽים׃
Translated: The entire Chaldean force that was with the chief of the guard tore down the walls of Jerusalem on every side.
Transliteration: veet-chvomot yerushala͏im saviyv natetsu khׇl-cheyl khashediym asher rav-tavachiym

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ יֶ֨תֶר הָעָ֜ם הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּעִ֗יר וְאֶת־הַנֹּֽפְלִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽפְלוּ֙ עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת יֶ֣תֶר הֶהָמ֑וֹן הֶגְלָ֕ה נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֖ן רַב־טַבָּחִֽים׃
Translated: The remnant of the people that was left in the city, the defectors who had gone over to the king of Babylon—and the remnant of the population—were taken into exile by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards.
Transliteration: veet yeter haam hanisheariym vaiyr veet-hanofeliym asher nafelu al-hamelekhe vavel veet yeter hehamvon hegelah nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym

Hebrew: וּמִדַּלַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ הִשְׁאִ֖יר רַב־טַבָּחִ֑ים לְכֹרְמִ֖ים וּלְיֹגְבִֽים׃
Translated: But some of the poorest in the land were left by the chief of the guards, to be vinedressers and field hands.
Transliteration: umidalat haarets hisheiyr rav-tavachiym lekhoremiym uleyogeviym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַמּוּדֵ֨י הַנְּחֹ֜שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֣ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְֽאֶת־הַמְּכֹנ֞וֹת וְאֶת־יָ֧ם הַנְּחֹ֛שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה שִׁבְּר֣וּ כַשְׂדִּ֑ים וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־נְחֻשְׁתָּ֖ם בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: The Chaldeans broke up the bronze columns of the House of G<small>OD</small>, the stands, and the bronze tank that was in the House of G<small>OD</small>; and they carried the bronze away to Babylon.
Transliteration: veet-amudey hanechoshet asher veyt-yehovah veet-hamekhonvot veet-yam hanechoshet asher veveyt-yehovah shiveru khashediym vayisheu et-nechushetam vavelah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַסִּירֹ֨ת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֜ים וְאֶת־הַֽמְזַמְּר֣וֹת וְאֶת־הַכַּפּ֗וֹת וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־כְּלֵ֧י הַנְּחֹ֛שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשָֽׁרְתוּ־בָ֖ם לָקָֽחוּ׃
Translated: They also took all the pails, scrapers, snuffers, ladles, and all the other bronze vessels used in the service.
Transliteration: veet-hasiyrot veet-hayaiym veet-hamezamervot veet-hakhafvot veet khׇl-kheley hanechoshet asher yesharetu-vam lakachu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמַּחְתּוֹת֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָק֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר זָהָב֙ זָהָ֔ב וַאֲשֶׁר־כֶּ֖סֶף כָּ֑סֶף לָקַ֖ח רַב־טַבָּחִֽים׃
Translated: The chief of the guards took whatever was of gold and whatever was of silver: firepans and sprinkling bowls.
Transliteration: veet-hamachetvot veet-hamizerakvot asher zahav zahav vaasher-khesef khasef lakach rav-tavachiym

Hebrew: הָעַמּוּדִ֣ים ׀ שְׁנַ֗יִם הַיָּ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ וְהַמְּכֹנ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹא־הָיָ֣ה מִשְׁקָ֔ל לִנְחֹ֖שֶׁת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: The two columns, the one tank, and the stands that Solomon provided for the House of G<small>OD</small>—all these objects contained bronze beyond weighing.
Transliteration: haamudiym shenayiim hayam haechad vehamekhonvot asher-ashah shelomoh leveyt yehovah lo-hayah mishekal linechoshet khׇl-hakheliym haeleh

Hebrew: שְׁמֹנֶה֩ עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה אַמָּ֜ה קוֹמַ֣ת ׀ הָעַמּ֣וּד הָאֶחָ֗ד וְכֹתֶ֨רֶת עָלָ֥יו ׀ נְחֹ֘שֶׁת֮ וְקוֹמַ֣ת הַכֹּתֶ֘רֶת֮ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ (אמה) [אַמּוֹת֒] וּשְׂבָכָ֨ה וְרִמֹּנִ֧ים עַֽל־הַכֹּתֶ֛רֶת סָבִ֖יב הַכֹּ֣ל נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְכָאֵ֛לֶּה לַעַמּ֥וּד הַשֵּׁנִ֖י עַל־הַשְּׂבָכָֽה׃
Translated: The one column was eighteen cubits high. It had a bronze capital above it; the height of the capital was three cubits, and there was a meshwork [decorated] with pomegranates about the capital, all made of bronze. And the like was true of the other column with its meshwork.
Transliteration: shemoneh eshereh amah kvomat haamud haechad vekhoteret alayv nechoshet vekvomat hakhoteret shalosh (mh) [amvot] ushevakhah verimoniym al-hakhoteret saviyv hakhol nechoshet vekhaeleh laamud hasheniy al-hashevakhah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח רַב־טַבָּחִ֗ים אֶת־שְׂרָיָה֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְאֶת־צְפַנְיָ֖הוּ כֹּהֵ֣ן מִשְׁנֶ֑ה וְאֶת־שְׁלֹ֖שֶׁת שֹׁמְרֵ֥י הַסַּֽף׃
Translated: The chief of the guards also took Seraiah, the chief priest, Zephaniah, the deputy priest, and the three guardians of the threshold.
Transliteration: vayikach rav-tavachiym et-sherayah khohen harosh veet-tsefaneyahu khohen misheneh veet-sheloshet shomerey hasaf

Hebrew: וּמִן־הָעִ֡יר לָקַח֩ סָרִ֨יס אֶחָ֜ד אֲֽשֶׁר־ה֥וּא פָקִ֣יד ׀ עַל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה אֲנָשִׁ֜ים מֵרֹאֵ֤י פְנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִמְצְא֣וּ בָעִ֔יר וְאֵ֗ת הַסֹּפֵר֙ שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֔א הַמַּצְבִּ֖א אֶת־עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים אִישׁ֙ מֵעַ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ הַֽנִּמְצְאִ֖ים בָּעִֽיר׃
Translated: And from the city he took a eunuch who was in command of the soldiers; five of the royal privy councillors who were present in the city; the scribe of the army commander, who was in charge of mustering the people of the land; and sixty of the common people who were inside the city.
Transliteration: umin-haiyr lakach sariys echad asher-hu fakiyd al-aneshey hamilechamah vachamishah anashiym meroey feney-hamelekhe asher nimetseu vaiyr veet hasofer shar hatsava hamatsevi et-am haarets veshishiym iysh meam haarets hanimetseiym vaiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֹתָ֔ם נְבוּזַרְאֲדָ֖ן רַב־טַבָּחִ֑ים וַיֹּ֧לֶךְ אֹתָ֛ם עַל־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל רִבְלָֽתָה׃
Translated: Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
Transliteration: vayikach otam nevuzareadan rav-tavachiym vayolekhe otam al-melekhe vavel rivelatah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ אֹתָם֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ בָּבֶ֧ל וַיְמִיתֵ֛ם בְּרִבְלָ֖ה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֲמָ֑ת וַיִּ֥גֶל יְהוּדָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל אַדְמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The king of Babylon had them struck down and put to death at Riblah, in the region of Hamath.
Thus Judah was exiled from its land.
Transliteration: vayakhe otam melekhe vavel vayemiytem verivelah veerets chamat vayigel yehudah meal adematvo

Hebrew: וְהָעָ֗ם הַנִּשְׁאָר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִשְׁאִ֔יר נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֖ר מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל וַיַּפְקֵ֣ד עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־אֲחִיקָ֥ם בֶּן־שָׁפָֽן׃
Translated: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon put Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan in charge of the people whom he left in the land of Judah.
Transliteration: vehaam hanishear veerets yehudah asher hisheiyr nevukhadenetsar melekhe vavel vayafeked aleyhem et-gedaleyahu ven-achiykam ven-shafan

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְעוּ֩ כׇל־שָׂרֵ֨י הַחֲיָלִ֜ים הֵ֣מָּה וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים כִּֽי־הִפְקִ֤יד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֔הוּ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ הַמִּצְפָּ֑ה וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְתַנְיָ֡ה וְיוֹחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־קָ֠רֵ֠חַ וּשְׂרָיָ֨ה בֶן־תַּנְחֻ֜מֶת הַנְּטֹפָתִ֗י וְיַאֲזַנְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־הַמַּ֣עֲכָתִ֔י הֵ֖מָּה וְאַנְשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When the officers of the troops and their men heard that the king of Babylon had put Gedaliah in charge, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah with Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah son of the Maachite, together with their men.
Transliteration: vayishemeu khׇl-sharey hachayaliym hemah vehaanashiym khiy-hifekiyd melekhe-vavel et-gedaleyahu vayavou el-gedaleyahu hamitsefah veyishemael ven-netaneyah veyvochanan ven-karecha usherayah ven-tanechumet hanetofatiy veyaazaneyahu ven-hamaakhatiy hemah veanesheyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֨ע לָהֶ֤ם גְּדַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ וּלְאַנְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם אַל־תִּֽירְא֖וּ מֵעַבְדֵ֣י הַכַּשְׂדִּ֑ים שְׁב֣וּ בָאָ֗רֶץ וְעִבְד֛וּ אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ בָּבֶ֖ל וְיִטַ֥ב לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Gedaliah reassured them and their men, saying, “Do not be afraid of the servants of the Chaldeans. Stay in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you.”
Transliteration: vayishava lahem gedaleyahu uleanesheyhem vayomer lahem al-tiyreu meavedey hakhashediym shevu vaarets veivedu et-melekhe vavel veyitav lakhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י בָּ֣א יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־נְ֠תַנְיָ֠ה בֶּן־אֱלִ֨ישָׁמָ֜ע מִזֶּ֣רַע הַמְּלוּכָ֗ה וַעֲשָׂרָ֤ה אֲנָשִׁים֙ אִתּ֔וֹ וַיַּכּ֥וּ אֶת־גְּדַלְיָ֖הוּ וַיָּמֹ֑ת וְאֶת־הַיְּהוּדִים֙ וְאֶת־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־הָי֥וּ אִתּ֖וֹ בַּמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: In the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama, who was of royal descent, came with ten men, and they struck down Gedaliah and he died; [they also killed] the Judeans and the Chaldeans who were present with him at Mizpah.
Transliteration: vayehiy vachodesh hasheviyiy va yishemael ven-netaneyah ven-eliyshama mizera hamelukhah vaasharah anashiym itvo vayakhu et-gedaleyahu vayamot veet-hayehudiym veet-hakhashediym asher-hayu itvo vamitsefah

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֨מוּ כׇל־הָעָ֜ם מִקָּטֹ֤ן וְעַד־גָּדוֹל֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י הַחֲיָלִ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּ֥י יָֽרְא֖וּ מִפְּנֵ֥י כַשְׂדִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And all the people, young and old, and the officers of the troops set out and went to Egypt because they were afraid of the Chaldeans.
Transliteration: vayakumu khׇl-haam mikaton vead-gadvol vesharey hachayaliym vayavou mitserayiim khiy yareu mifeney khashediym {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בִשְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים וָשֶׁ֜בַע שָׁנָ֗ה לְגָלוּת֙ יְהוֹיָכִ֣ין מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה בִּשְׁנֵ֤ים עָשָׂר֙ חֹ֔דֶשׁ בְּעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָ֖ה לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ נָשָׂ֡א אֱוִ֣יל מְרֹדַךְ֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ בָּבֶ֜ל בִּשְׁנַ֣ת מׇלְכ֗וֹ אֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ יְהוֹיָכִ֥ין מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה מִבֵּ֥ית כֶּֽלֶא׃
Translated: In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin of Judah, on the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month, King Evil-merodach of Babylon, in the year he became king, took note of King Jehoiachin of Judah and released him from prison.
Transliteration: vayehiy visheloshiym vasheva shanah legalut yehvoyakhiyn melekhe-yehudah visheneym ashar chodesh veesheriym veshiveah lachodesh nasha eviyl merodakhe melekhe vavel vishenat mׇlekhvo et-rosh yehvoyakhiyn melekhe-yehudah miveyt khele

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ טֹב֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־כִּסְא֔וֹ מֵעַ֗ל כִּסֵּ֧א הַמְּלָכִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בְּבָבֶֽל׃
Translated: He spoke kindly to him, and gave him a throne above those of other kings who were with him in Babylon.
Transliteration: vayedaver itvo tovvot vayiten et-khisevo meal khise hamelakhiym asher itvo vevavel

Hebrew: וְשִׁנָּ֕א אֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י כִלְא֑וֹ וְאָכַ֨ל לֶ֧חֶם תָּמִ֛יד לְפָנָ֖יו כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽיו׃
Translated: His prison garments were removed, and [Jehoiachin] received regular rations by his favor for the rest of his life.
Transliteration: veshina et vigedey khilevo veakhal lechem tamiyd lefanayv khׇl-yemey chayayv

Hebrew: וַאֲרֻחָת֗וֹ אֲרֻחַ֨ת תָּמִ֧יד נִתְּנָה־לּ֛וֹ מֵאֵ֥ת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֑וֹ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽו׃
Translated: A regular allotment of food was given him at the king’s behest—an allotment for each day—all the days of his life.
Transliteration: vaaruchatvo aruchat tamiyd nitenah-lvo meet hamelekhe devar-yvom veyvomvo khol yemey chayav
